product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Drumlord29
content: I added another echo device to my collection! I've got every single kind of echo in the market. For obvious reasons, the speaker isn't the best. It is surprisingly smaller than I thought. I use it in my garage for when I close the garage using Alexa. I have the MyQ garage opener which i can open or close with my echo auto in my car. But after I turn off my engine, so does my echo auto. So I have to pull out my phone or manually push the garage opener on the wall. So I plugged it underneath my garage door opener so I can tell Alexa to close or open the garage door from anywhere in my garage without my phone or pushing a button. I don't really intend to use this for playing music. It's really for doing simple Alexa tasks in my garage. It is an echo device that is not meant to look and sound pretty. It's Alexa at its most basic form. Small, no cables, small speaker, and works like any echo device. I believe it's meant for a garage bathroom or hallway if uppity have the night light or motion detector accessory. If you want to play music with it, a bluetooth or wired speaker is highly recommended. Although I had very little expectations with this being that I meant to use it to just open and close my garage, I did notice one negative thing on it. I tried adjusting thre volume from the Alexa app but it switches back to 70% everytime. No idea why. Perhaps there built in speaker is best heard at 70% and if connected to a better speaker, it will allow for a louder volume. I'm going yo have to try that someday. But for now, it's perfect for what I wanted to use it for. If you know what you need it for, don't expect it to be more than that. If you want a better sound, get a dot or something bigger. For simple uses, this will do fine for all your Alexa needs. I may use it for my echo microwave which is currently paired with my echo input connected to a speaker. Don't blame the equipment if you want it to do more than what the hardware can achieve. Be fair to the gadget on what it is capable of doing.
title: Small, not for music, great for basic Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Drumlord29
content: I added another echo device to my collection! I've got every single kind of echo in the market. For obvious reasons, the speaker isn't the best. It is surprisingly smaller than I thought. Don't blame the equipment if you want it to do more than what the hardware can achieve. Be fair to the gadget on what it is capable of doing.
title: Small, not for music, great for basic Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Scott Andrews
content: I bought this to replace my first generation echo do hanging in the outlet in my bathroom. I mainly use this unit for morning news while getting reading in the morning.  The sound quality, in regards to volume, is terrible. With the sound turned all the way up and standing within 2 feet of the Flex, I can barely hear Alexa. I can only imagine how useless the Flex is in a larger room.
title: Sound sucks

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Planet PuertoRico
content: Its very small, alexa sounds like a chipmunk, the attachments are nice but the audio should have been a priority as its the main way of interaction and the first thing you notice, any chance of using the usb port for a better internal speaker attachment? it comes with an aux output for an audio system and bluetooth connectivity for expanded audio options. It's sold as a smart speaker but it just sounds really, really cheep.
title: Small / the audio quality sounds terrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. Newton
content: REVISED TO 5 stars: One of the latest updates established connectivity and functionality, and it now works exactly as expected. It’s a small speaker, and thus won’t provide anything but minimal sound, nor is it designed to. Understand this beforehand and you won’t be disappointed like so many others who didn’t think through what it was designed for. If you need great sound/music quality, then other Echos are designed for that. So far, the Alexa app hasn’t been able to see/recognize/connect to the Flex, no matter what I do. I’ll box it up and wait a couple of months for an update to fix this issue. I have 14 other Alexa units in total, so this was just a purchase out of curiosity, not necessity.
title: Understand the niche for this, and why the speaker is small, and you will be happy.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amazon Customer
content: This is by far the worst echo device I have ever used, and I have four other various models. The Echo Flex consistently drops out of multi room audio groups and has to be unplugged and plugged back in to resync. The built in speaker is terrible and useless if you are more than a few inches away from it. It also has by far the worst microphone and struggles to hear me even when I'm in the same room. The 3rd generation echo dot in the other room reliably hears me better than the flex that is 20 closer.
title: By far the worst echo ever

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Fabriezy
content: In a quiet space the speaker is loud enough to hear but just barely and it sounds terrible.  I get way better sound from my phone so forget using it for anything but giving Alexa commands.  Maybe for a hallway with the nightlight option but even then I think I would rather have a Dot so I could use it elsewhere if I wanted.
title: For most a Dot with a mount is the way to go. Heres why...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Hall
content: I'm so surprised Amazon brought this to market. I have almost every echo device and this one does not live up to the others The sound quality was that of a bad transistor radio. I get the idea of the thing but if it doesn't have good sound quality,  I'm not interested.
title: Save your money!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rafael
content: UPDATE: After having it for almost a year I been having problems where it disconnects often and sometimes won't respond all the time I can tell it to turn off the light but then tell it to do something else like ask the time and it seems confused, won't answer, but then the next day it does. I lked it for the motion thing but just going to get a regular dot for the garage. I have this in my garage and works perfectly when I'm working there and want to turn on lights I have connected to a smart plug. Also if I want to know the weather or if I have a question in general works great. I can play music on it but it's not great for sound, but I don't think that was the intent for this. If your buying it for higher quality sound get a Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa. Or pair it up with a Bluetooth speaker or use the 3.5 mm audio jack and hook it to your stereo. I did the drop in with an echo dot in the house and it worked great. I could hear them clearly and they could hear me, which is nice if someone needs me they can drop in on the garage. I also have a camera in the garage so I can also see and now talk to whoever is there. Overall I'm happy with it. Oh and if the LED is flashing a yellowish color it's the way it notifies you you have a notification. Found that out when The one I have in the house was also flashing indicating I have a notification.
title: UPDATE:..... Nice little Device, works perfectly as intended.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: kreardon
content: I bought four of these so I could communicate with my family throughout the house. The speaker is so terrible everyone keeps repeating "what?" Sending them back
title: Horrible sound

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Valag
content: The Flex is a great option if you don't like having cords dragging across surfaces. It does everything a regular Echo or Echo Dot can do. and It's actually smaller than I expected. Only occupies the lower plug without blocking the top one. Great for kitchen and bathroom, or anywhere that has above-counter-level plugs. Produces enough sound that I can hear it while in the shower, but, the speaker quality leaves a lot to be desired. I wasn't expecting top-notch, Bose-quality sound from this small of a device, but Alexa sounds like she's talking to me through a Solo cup. So I guess this won't replace any of my other Echo devices for playing music, but it's certainly good enough for listening to the news and weather while getting ready for work.
title: The Echo device that won't Flex your wallet.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KT - Six Eight Tall
content: We are here to pump up this review! Amazon Flex? More like Amazon Flabby... Ya! This device is so puny that it must go back to the gym to earn it's name! Here is our loser friend to explain why such a flabby device can only lift one star.... <clears throat> Mmmm k. As avid Amazon smart product users, we purchased the Flex based on it's small design form (in that it would occupy the least amount of space and be a perfect kitchen addition to keep our counters open). On this front it is perfect. Speaking in the kitchen, the Echo Dot Second Generation in our living room was actually picking up our voices better than the Flex which was in the same room. To Echo* what other reviewers have said, the sound on this device is tinny and distracting. Considering most smart phones can generate, the small footprint of the Flex isn't a great excuse in 2020 for skimping on sound to this extent. With commands and recipes is was displeasing but with music it was downright distracting. Imagine an old building doorway intercom speaker as an upgrade to this and you get what I mean. I'm guessing the positive reviews are mainly concerned with the small footprint which again, is excellent but even at a discount we had to return this and the accompanying motion sensor in favor of mounting another Echo speaker in our kitchen. Here's hoping Amazon invests just a tiny bit more on the quality of the speaker and microphone array though for future generations of this product because this first gen Flex was an absolute miss for our household. * puns provided free of charge for this unbiased loser review
title: Did someone say Flex?

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Barbara Black
content: I have an Echo and an Echo Show, both of which are great. I ordered this for my kitchen because you can plug it in and not waste counter space. Unfortunately the sound quality is terrible-sounds like a cheap AM radio
title: Sound quality is terrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amazon Customer
content: This is by far the worst echo device I have ever used, and I have four other various models. The Echo Flex consistently drops out of multi room audio groups and has to be unplugged and plugged back in to resync. The built in speaker is terrible and useless if you are more than a few inches away from it. It also has by far the worst microphone and struggles to hear me even when I'm in the same room. The 3rd generation echo dot in the other room reliably hears me better than the flex that is 20 closer.
title: By far the worst echo ever

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mike
content: So initially I thought this would be a great addition to my garage as a smart speaker. I thought to my self it’s small, doesn’t need a cable or a desk to be displayed on (mounts directly to the  wall vía it’s plug), and it should fill the garage with some smart tech easily, only that wasn’t exactly the case. My main gripe is with the sound quality, it’s awful and basically ruined the product (Especially since it’s all about voice activated features and doesn’t have a screen). Alexa sounds hollow/awful and music sounds even worse. There is limited to no bass and the mids/highs aren’t anywhere (good) to be found either. That being said, there also aren’t enough redeeming qualities to make this a well rated product. Yes I did pay a decent price on it (Amazon had a 50% off sale around the end of 2019) and it has a built in USB port on the bottom. So then you’d think that’s cool it was cheap and there is a port (basically giving you an extra charge outlet for a phone or something) and yeah I’d agree with that thought process, then I noticed the two official add ons for the USB port (a night light and a motion sensor) are half the MSRP of the unit and honestly should have just been built in (with a better speaker). Then, and only then, would this have been a 4 star or better product but instead it’s barely a 3, more like a 2 star product if you paid full price. I’d say wait for gen two or another steep discount before you buy this thing.
title: Half baked “smart” speaker...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: TBS
content: The concept of this is nice but the sound quality is not good at all. I wanted it for my office to listen to music but it's not great for that. Echo Dot has much better sound quality.
title: Nice Concept but Lacks Decent Sound Quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ashley N Ward
content: I was SUPER excited to have an echo I could easily plug into my bathroom wall. I even ordered this a month in advance. However, when they say "mini smart speaker" they really mean MINI smart speaker. Even when you do the "level 11" secret volume, these are still so quiet. I have a regular echo dot (3rd gen) and the volume is perfect. However, I have a vent fan in my bathroom that turns on when I turn on the light and I can barely hear it over the fan. I'd expect that if the volume was at a 5 or 6, but a 10 or 11? The sound quality is even a bit fuzzy despite being so quiet. I don't expect it to be as loud as a normal echo, but it's big enough they could have added better speakers. Very disappointing.
title: Way too quiet

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ashley
content: I think these might be a little expensive for what you’re getting. I mean it’s a nice concept but the sound quality is horrible. I expected it from a small device but at least it’s nice to put in a small space. I put them in the bathroom so I can make announcements that dinner is ready or something like that. I’m planning on playing some Christmas music on it for the bathroom which I think would be nice with the decorations I have in there. Definitely wouldn’t be able to hear the music if you were in the shower tho. If you could, it would be very faint.
title: They’re okay but not necessary.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: capo
content: I have Echo devices of one kind or another in every room and have had others that I’ve decided to let go (original Echo and Echo Auto). They’ve all performed their smarthome duties acceptably well. My biggest complaint across the board is sound quality. Alexa always sounds like she’s talking to you from underneath a pile of pillows. Bass? Sure, on the Echo Show, at least. Treble? Nada. Sure, you can use the app’s “equalizer”... but it’d take an oscilloscope to detect the minuscule difference that makes in the sound quality. I’d given up on getting any more devices... until I saw a review of the Flex on Paul Hibbert’s YouTube channel... he liked it, but said (I think) that it sounded ‘trebly’. Trebly?! That’s a magic word to my ears. I ordered one up and found that it indeed sounds ‘trebly’ (call it tinny of you like) but who cares? Who seriously listens to music on these tiny little devices anyway?! I can understand what Alexa says now - all the plosives are there. I still wonder why Amazon can’t tune the rest of the Alexa enabled devices for better higher frequency clarity.
title: Treble! Hooray, I can understand Alexa now!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Consumer Advocate
content: Compared to Echo Dots, the Echo Flex is a good space-saving idea but the microphone(s) were unreliable and the speaker was a joke so the 1st one I ordered was returned. NOW in 2020 ... I decided to give Echo Flex a 2nd chance. Either they improved the device considerably or the first one was defective because the 2nd one is WORKING LIKE A CHAMP!
title: Nice case design improved microphone & speaker ?

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JC Fazzone
content: As with all Amazon product, it is better to wait for next generation products as with time the products do get better. This item is a disappointment with sound and volume control. While it fits in small spaces, it’s worth while to buy an Echo Dot with mounting bracket. Very disappointed that 14.99 is necessary to purchase the night light. Not recommending this product.☹️
title: Will pay to wait

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jason H.
content: After writing this review and rating it 2 stars, I received a call from Amazon.  They wanted to tell me that the speaker on the Echo Flex is not meant to be the main audio source.  The intent of the design is to use Bluetooth to connect to an external speaker.  This would, of course, resolve my concern with the sound quality, so I increased the rating to 3, or okay.  But in thinking about the Flex alone, I don't think I would rate it as good or great, because it has limited appeal without additional investment. I'm not particularly fond of the idea of adding a speaker just to have this device, because I could buy a Dot instead.  However, I concede that there are niches where this functionality and price savings would be useful.  For example, after thinking about it further, I realized that I could connect it to my Bluetooth enabled treadmill and have Alexa right up front for music or any other questions I might have without having to mount an Echo Dot on the wall.  The Flex plugs in securely to a wall socket and leaves the second outlet open.  It's not heavy and doesn't sag like some two-pronged, heavy transformers do. Installing this was a simple as unpacking it and plugging it in.  It had already been integrated into my account and the WiFi login was automatic. Notifications cause the LED to blink brightly.  It's much harder to ignore it, when you already know what the notification is.  You have to ask, what's my notification, in order to clear it. The sound is like a cell phone's speakerphone, and is hard to listen to.  This device would go best in a garage or out of the house, where you might want access to announcements or activating guards, but not where you want to hear it every day.  (edit:  you are expected to connect to a Bluetooth speaker by design) Giving plenty of space in front of the device helps with communication.  Putting it in a tight space can cause echoes or chirps and clicks that interfere with it.
title: For someplace you won't need to listen to it every day.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sandra Knight
content: I have had this for a year and it works flawlessly.  I use it for alarm time setting when I am cooking, playing music, weather, getting correct time and date, movie listing, etc.  I find it play music loud enough for me.  I have it in my living room, and can hear it in bathroom, bedroom and kitchen.  Of course I live in a 1000 sq ft. apartment and the sound is very good.  When I am talking on phone, the other party on line says they can hear it very plainly so it is loud.  Don't know why the comments say its bad for hearing, must have an extra large house.  Right now its so loud that I have to have Alexa turn it down some.  I also have the night light attachment and it comes on automatically at dark and in the morning I have to tell Alexa to turn off light.  And that works perfectly also. I just love it. You will too.
title: Wonderful Little Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Fabriezy
content: In a quiet space the speaker is loud enough to hear but just barely and it sounds terrible.  I get way better sound from my phone so forget using it for anything but giving Alexa commands.  Maybe for a hallway with the nightlight option but even then I think I would rather have a Dot so I could use it elsewhere if I wanted.
title: For most a Dot with a mount is the way to go. Heres why...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ella Belle
content: I just got my Echo Flex - Plug-in smart speaker with Alexa this morning and I'm already totally in LOVE with it! With it I also bought that "Made for Amazon" THIRDREALITY Smart Night-Light for Echo Flex, and I love it too! I had been wanting to put an Echo Dot in a very tiny bathroom, but I was trying to figure out how, since I have no counter space and didn't want to use up my last outlet. Then, along comes this Echo-Flex thingy, so I decided to give it a try. I've been super delighted with it all morning long! I love how it just plugs right into an outlet and is totally out of my way but still basically does most of what the echo Dots do. I had a regular nightlight in the room that took up an outlet socket, so this new Smart Nigh-Light was a great solution because it plugs right into the bottom of the Echo Flex, so just the Echo-Flex is using that 1 outlet now. It's so cool too because I can ask Alexa to change the lights colors! I've bought 4 of the Echo Dots for my home and I am in love with all of them. This Echo-Flex is just a smaller version that is so perfect for small bathrooms, laundry rooms and basically anywhere else where you just don't have counter or table space for an Echo Dot. I also love how easy it is to set these devices up! Just be sure the little box below the "Add to Cart" and "Buy Now" buttons is checked "Link to my Amazon account to simplify setup"! It really does simplify the set-up wonderfully! Anyway, I am totally loving this new Echo-Flex so much and I already have ideas of getting some more of them for other tiny places around my home that I had not considered before. These things are just so helpful AND so fun! UPDATE 08/16/2020: I've now bought 4 of these echo Flexes with the nightlights. One for the laundry room, one for my Kitchen and 2 for my small bathrooms. I use these every day and they have become indispensable!  Sure, the sound is not super great for music, but the fact that these are not stealing any counter space is paramount for me. I have other Echo's in other rooms for music anyway. I love these things! UPDATE 10/13/2020: I am STILL in love with these cool little Echo Flex gadgets!  I use them many times daily! A great size for small rooms like Bathrooms, laundry rooms, store rooms, mud rooms, garage, even out in our woodshed! I happily got more today on Prime Day! Thank you Amazon!
title: Awesome Alexa Solution For Small Rooms!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Carmchocolate2
content: Nice addition to the Echo family.  Perfect size for the bathroom without having to deal with cords.  You can't expect big sound from this small device, but it serves its purpose.  I am able to set reminders,  timers, alarms,  and add things to my shopping lists while getting ready.
title: Perfect size for small places

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mr Huskey
content: It is very bulky robbing room from other items you might want to plug in.  The speaker quality sucks.  No where near as good as the Echo plus speaker.  Playing music on the Flex's built in speaker sounds like listening to an old transistor pocket radio.  It does pair easily to my blue tooth speakers which sound really good. Motion detection works, but is almost useless until the Amazon Alexa app matures a bit more.  Settings in the app are too cumbersome to want to use at the moment.  Controlling a light seems easy enough, but I wanted it to turn on a Wyze switched outlet.  I had to create a new group... assign the Wyze switch to it... create a routine to turn on the group.  There was no skill that let me just turn on/off the switch without creating the group first.  Seemed like way more hassle than it should have been. The night light seems nice, but I haven't spent much time playing with it yet.  I just picked the first color that was bright enough to fill the room.  Too bad you can't have motion sensing and the night light in one module.  I really only want the night light to turn on when I step out of bed in the middle of the night.
title: A very minimalistic  Echo device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Tech Gospel
content: I wasn't expecting it to be as loud as the Dot 3 or anything... but I was hoping at least as loud as the 2nd gen Dot. It was barely audible plugged next to the bathroom sink standing 2 feet away... even less so in the shower. Although you can plug an external speaker to it, it defeats the purpose of it. It could work if you prefer using an external speaker (3.5mm will support drop-in, bluetooth will not) and just want to plug something in the wall and not worry about cables. But overall, I was disappointed and just swapped it for another Dot.
title: Barely audible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. Coral
content: I set up this cute little Echo Flex + Motion Sensor in the garage.  It was easy to add Routines in the Alexa app to turn On and Off the WeMo light switch for the garage light.  I had this automation ready to go in about 5 minutes.  It’s real nice to have the garage light come on automatically whenever I open the garage door.  I also set it to turn off the light after no motion is detected for 1 hour (choose any time period). You can also have the motion sensor activate an Echo device to speak a custom phrase, give a news flash briefing, traffic report, play music, etc. There is a setting to specify the time when the motion sensor should perform the Routine (anytime, or between a certain time period) and to suppress a repeat of the Routine for a configurable time period so it won’t keep doing the same thing every time there is motion, if you don’t want it to.  For example you can have it give you the traffic report or news briefing when you enter the bathroom in the morning but only if the motion happens between 6-8am. This is super useful — after trying out the first one, I’m going to buy a few more to play with around the house.
title: Motion Sensor is Handy!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Spyder2014
content: If you are looking for a quality speaker to listen to music while you are in the bathroom or kitchen... pay a little extra and get an echo dot. The flex is perfect if you want to add another echo device for the sake of controlling smart home devices, taking advantage of the guardian functionality or for the occasional drop in. You also get the added functionality of either a motion sensor or night light with the available accessories. We replaced our bathroom night light with the flex and it is great! The light accessory gives off more light than our old night light and my wife loves the different colors you can choose due to the built in rgb LEDs. I tested the drop in feature as well and it was loud and clear while talking to my wife in the next room. I highly recommend the flex if you want an additional echo device in a bathroom, kitchen or spare room and don't want the hassle of hiding the cables, or if you want to add motion sensor triggers or a night light to a room.
title: Perfect... for what it is!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Debra T
content: I am in the midst of setting up an Alexa eco-system in my home. I have a Fire TV, first generation Echo, Fire Tablet, Echo Show 5, and several smart plugs. I wanted an Alexa-enabled device in my bedroom to do the "basics" ... respond to my voice commands ... and to turn the smart plugs on my bedroom lamps on and off. So I got an Echo Flex. I set it up in less than a minute, and soon it was turning my lamps on and off, telling me the time, answering my silly questions and telling me jokes! People, this is how technology should work. The world would be a much techno-friendly place if all technology was this easy to set up. I didn't get this for the sound quality of an Echo or for the screen time of an Echo Show. If I had wanted those features in my bedroom, I would have spent more more money to get them. I can never figure out why people buy an entry level product here on Amazon that does "the basics" and then give it a bad review when it doesn't do everything the "cadillac version" does. Sheesh. What I love about this product: --It's a great price. --It does what it's intended to do. --It can be enhanced with a bluetooth speaker, a nightlight or a motion detector. --It's out of the way. --It only takes up one outlet. The other one is still available for use. --You can plug in a USB device to it, like a smartphone, to charge it. What I dislike about this product: --Nothing. Because it does what I bought it to do. In my book, Amazon gets big kudos for giving buyers options for different features and price points of their Alexa product line.
title: Works great for its intended purpose!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amodeus1971
content: Besides the speaker being small and sounding like garbage the Flex has gotten better over time. The motion sensor I have come to like now that I have adapted to it and they have seemed to iron out some of the problems. My main problem now is they limited the use of it because they are only allowing you to own two of these with the motion sensor per Amazon account unless you have a business account. No other explanation besides they tried to get me to sign up for an Amazon business account. I have one in my bathroom and wanted to put two in my kitchen are because there are two entrances and I wanted to make my lights fully motion-controlled in my kitchen. I can do this to a point with Wyze Sense but I don't want any more cameras inside my living space than I need to have, which are the two on my rear windows as the other security cameras are all outside. This imitation severely limits the usefulness of this product.
title: Rewritten review

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael
content: The worst Amazon Echo Product to date. Would never recommend. Really wanted to have this, but sound quality is terrible, microphone is horrible
title: Horrible

product: product
author: author
content: content
title: title

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Moore Family
content: I got the Echo Flex to go along with weatherproof Bluetooth speakers on our covered deck. I Love that there are no external cables, and it's easy to unplug and take inside. The Bluetooth connection has been rock-solid so far. Things stay pretty dry on the deck, but rain does come in from the side during heavy thunderstorms, so I designed and 3D-printed a simple cover for the Echo Flex to keep it dry. So far it has stayed totally dry. If you're interested, search thingiverse dot com for "Echo Flex Splash Guard" and you'll find it. As far as the Echo Flex itself: I'm very happy with it as a way to play music and podcasts over Bluetooth speakers. Previously, I tried using a Google Home Mini (in a zip-lock bag) and it kept disconnecting constantly. While it's great to ask for the news, weather, etc without needing a mobile device, the voice interface can be very awkward for getting certain specific content (podcasts, albums, etc). Most of the time, you end up hearing something similar to, but not quite, what you asked for. For that reason, it's nice that you can cast to the EF from the Amazon music app. Regarding voice recognition:  we do have to yell at it a bit more than the Echo Dots inside the house. This may be due to the rain cover blocking some of the sound and/or sound dispersing more outside than it does inside. Still, not a big issue. We're in a pretty secluded area, so I'm not that worried about security, but I get that this would be an issue for folks in more crowded areas. As is well documented, anyone expecting much out of the internal speaker would be very disappointed. OTOH, it's nice that Amazon chose to release a low-cost/high-function product and still make it easy to connect to external speakers with the 3.5mm or Bluetooth interfaces. Overall, given the price, size, quality and the way I'm using it with external speakers, I'm extremely happy with the Echo Flex.
title: Works great with external Bluetooth speakers. 3D Printed cover makes it more weather resistant.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Average Joe
content: I purchased this product to extend Alexa function with my existing echo dots. I like the dots, but I was attracted to this one because of size, price, and the ability to attach another supporting device such as the motion sensor (which I also purchased). The sound volume is horrible. I was rather impressed with the dot's volume level and sound quality for their size and figured since the echo flex is roughly 60% the size of the dots, then I would have to accept around a 40% loss of volume and sound quality. WRONG!! Try about a 90% loss. Really, the volume from the flex is about the same quality and level as your cell phone is with the volume (of your cell phone) set to 10-15%. Seriously, the echo dot two rooms away can be heard over this echo flex in the same room. Next, the echo flex often loses wifi connection. For example, the two echo dots I have lost wifi connection about 6-8 times last year (collectively). More the half of these instances were for legitimate reasons (power outages mostly). The echo flex has lost internet connection more than twice this week alone (or so sayeth my phone notifications). The echo flex is only about 25 feet away from the router. The echo dots are 18 and 35 feet away from the same router. Why the flex loses wifi connection so often is unknown to me. The motion sensor add on does work. It's just that it stops working now and then. I actually sent the first one back after this happened and got a second one when it did the same thing. It took me a little while to figure out that it would begin working normally after the echo flex was unplugged, then plugged back in. In hindsight, I feel like the motion sensor I returned was not defective and that it is, in fact, the echo flex that is the heart of the issue. The echo flex motion sensor add on combo isn't reliable enough for security purposes. I feel like the echo flex was rushed into production before it could be fully developed. It doesn't have the refinement that the other echo products I have used does. Could a firmware push solve some of these issues? Probably, but I feel like the low volume is inherent to the design and cannot be fixed with software.
title: Low volume, product needs further development

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LiveWithTech
content: I have 3 echo dots in my home along with 1 echo show, 1 echo auto & 1 Alexa in EcoBee thermostat. Also, I do have 4 google home mini. The echo devices have multiple pros compared to google home and is a must in any smart home. I installed this in my guest bathroom. Now when coming from a full-fledged device to this echo flex, definitely there are differences. My 2 cents below: Pros: - Alexa integration to all 3rd party devices works the same as all other echo devices and to set the routine is a cake piece - It Is a modular device with multiple attachments available that can go along with the device, like a clock, motion sensor, night light, etc. All other models miss this modularity - Well built product - Takes only one space on a 2-prong device, I was able to use Air Wick diffuser and Flex on a single board - Very reasonably priced Cons: - Sound is very feeble and meant for small rooms only. Listening to music is not a great experience on this device - Echo flex doesn't have far-field view technology as echo show does so sometimes it fails to trigger the recognition if you face the other side and speak
title: A must have voice assistant device for any smart home !!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: l33tDad
content: First of all, this is our 5th Echo device and have been more than happy with all of them, but as the headline says, it has it's flaws. First of all, don't get this for the sound quality as you will NOT be happy. The speaker is adequate for "general" things like announcements but is very small making music sound about as good as an inexpensive cell phone. However, I have this connected through bluetooth to a small amplifier in a kitchen cabinet which powers a couple of ceiling speakers and for this, it's fantastic. The nice thing about this device is that since it plugs directly into a wall outlet, it takes no table/counter space Why didn't I rate 5 stars? Well, the sensitivity for voice recognition is no where are good as our other devices. It's almost like I need to make it a point to speak loudly and clearly at the device for it to recognize that I'm trying to give it a command while our other Echo's can hear me from across the room looking the other way. If Amazon were able to fix this with maybe a firmware upgrade, it would be 5 stars. Other than that, it works great.
title: Works great, but has it's flaws

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dale Hemphill
content: I bought this echoflex on May 13th 2020. It worked fine until September 4th 2020. For some reason, my Amazon app would not recognize it when I try to change the Wi-Fi on the device. I did everything I new to do, including resetting the flex device itself, resetting my Wi-Fi modem, deleting and reinstalling the Amazon Alexa app, and yet still, it would not recognize the device for whatever reason, considering I had just change the Wi-Fi on it two weeks ago! after several text conversations with support and two phone calls to live support, no one can come up with an answer. The best they could do is offer a trouble ticket and have someone call me after the labor day I bought this device specifically for the labor day holiday to hook with a blue to amp in my backyard! However, now I am not able to accommodate my guests with music in our outdoor affair! I live less than a mile from the Amazon distribution center and I could certainly just go and buy another one for less than $24, but this one I would have thought is still under warranty, or at least I could get a suitable resolve to my problem. However, the best they could offer is that they will put in a trouble ticket and give me a call after the holidays! So, I am not happy with this device, or customer service or the handling of my complaint! I am a blind, Amazon prime participant with more than 18 Amazon or Alexa devices! And yet, I feel very disrespected and really not heard at all with this simple complaint and solution.
title: Sometimes price equals quality!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Anita
content: The device is really convenient. I have it in the bathroom with a nightlight attachment. The sound quality can be compared to a typical smartphone speaker. I mostly use it to listen to NPR (talk radio) or ask about the weather forecast while I'm getting ready and for that the quality is totally fine. It wouldn't be great for listening to music loud enough to hear over running water
title: Perfect for NPR while I get ready in the morning

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: MarkO
content: Two issues with quality. I bought it to mount on an outlet above our kitchen counter (wide open counter area)  between two of my echo devices:  one Dot 20' away - through a open arch and around a corner and an echo plus 18' away in the opposite direction in an open room but behind a wing wall. I can be facing the Flex from 5' away and either of the other echos in the other rooms will respond before the Flex. I bought the flex because sometimes the other echos can't be heard well depending on sound level set for music, and the make mistakes if not elevating my voice when adding items to list, asking for conversions etc. I basically have to really be close to it to have it work or the music playing on the other two will cut out and respond. It's why I freaking bought it. I have to be 6' away facing it directly. Second the speaker sounds just awful. I mean, I don't play any music on it at all, just the response sounds like a toy. I realize it's cheap, but I'm disappointed. I wish I would have bought a Dot 3 or used Dot 2 with a outlet mounted holder like I did for my garage workbench. Try to save a few bucks and you get what you pay for. Lastly, I thought the add on motion sensor was a cool idea until I read how horrible the reviews are for it after I bought the Flex.  At least I saved my money by not buying it as a package. Edit: Apparently my echo flex read my review and decided to be the alpha female on my first floor. Now she will be the responding device if I talk in a normal tone anywhere now on my first floor - even 4' from my other devices when the flex is almost 20' away. Except when I am 5' away from the flex and speaking directly to it, then it ignores me. It has managed to make my wife and I hate it and my two adult children when visiting have told me to get rid of it. Ordered a wall mount for an echo dot 3 that is underutilized on another floor of the house to replace the flex. I'll buy another dot next year on prime day or black Friday. The flex will - I don't know, hide it in the mechanical room in case I want to know what time it is when I change my furnace filter a few times a year.
title: disappointing so far.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Casey
content: So, I am an Echo fanatic.  I have all of them except for the Echo Look (???this product is just weird). That said, I am deeply saddened by this product.  I could only bring myself to provide it a 5 start feedback on Volume Control.  It has the same volume control as any other Echo. Sadly, this is where the usefulness stopped. It is huge, it doesn't really save space over any other product, it just happens to hang on your wall.  What it does do, is look ugly and sound awful.  The speaker on the DOT is infinitely superior to this one.  Even at MAX volume, you can barely hear the responses from this echo even at a couple feet away. I think they halfheartedly  tried to make it NOT useless by adding a USB port to the bottom.  Yes it has an auxiliary port but then why not just get the Amazon Input? (which is about as useful as Amazon Auto (which you don't want to get me started reviewing)). Don't buy it unless you positively have no where to set an Echo Dot.  The DOT is superior in every single way.
title: Yuck...Just Yuck.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Grace
content: I am a bit new to the Alexa scene. I am an apple girl through and through. So I was a bit skeptical that it wouldn't  all connect together like it should. I mean... I want to plug it in.....Basically that's it!!!!  Well that's pretty much what I did. I plugged it in, it then proceeded to tell me what to do. I now have quite a few things connected to Alexa and she is the new queen bitch at my house! I mean Alexa turns on the lights, the tree, the roomba, the music, the lamps, and my husband. She thinks she is freaking amazing!! Get her girls, she will make your like easier :)
title: Works GREAT!! Even for an alexa newbie.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sandy
content: This is awful. I made the mistake of purchasing two. I have complained to Amazon for 3 months now that one of these gets so hot aftet a few minutes of use. All I got was two emails saying someone would be contacting me. Never did. Shame on you Amazon! And I have three other Alexa dots that I got for the purpose of using the everywhere group that never works! Every time I call they say I have to unplug them, remove them from my app and  add them again. I should have listened to my friend and got the Google Home Mini. She loves it! No more Amazon devices for me.
title: Waste of Money!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: K. Gagliano
content: I am thrilled that I can have another layer of safety in my home. Super simple to set up...plug and go pretty much. No wires yay! Speaker is so so but I didn't purchase for listening to music, I have my Echo and Dot for that.  I'm a big fan of the  "Ask my buddy" app. and now god forbid I should fall while in the shower I can call for help. Already tested with my family/neighbors with shower running and worked like a charm. Love the added dawn to dusk nightlight.  So extremely happy to have found this product. Worth every penny!  Tks Alexa lol!!!
title: "Flex" great addition to Echo's!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amazon Customer
content: This is by far the worst echo device I have ever used, and I have four other various models. The Echo Flex consistently drops out of multi room audio groups and has to be unplugged and plugged back in to resync. The built in speaker is terrible and useless if you are more than a few inches away from it. It also has by far the worst microphone and struggles to hear me even when I'm in the same room. The 3rd generation echo dot in the other room reliably hears me better than the flex that is 20 closer.
title: By far the worst echo ever

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Fabriezy
content: In a quiet space the speaker is loud enough to hear but just barely and it sounds terrible.  I get way better sound from my phone so forget using it for anything but giving Alexa commands.  Maybe for a hallway with the nightlight option but even then I think I would rather have a Dot so I could use it elsewhere if I wanted.
title: For most a Dot with a mount is the way to go. Heres why...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Megan Campbell
content: I’m not sure why there are so many negatives regarding sound on this thing. I feel this is a niche product that is meant to be a filler for home automation. I have a small apartment with 2 dots: one in my sons room, another in my main room. Our morning routine has me going to the Alexa app and turning off his alarm and turning on his music and lights for his wake up routine. I’ve wanted a voice activated device that wasn’t a full blown dot to help me automate our morning routine. I already have a nice Yamaha speaker in my room so I wasn’t wanting an echo. Also, I prefer some privacy in my bedroom (my other dots tend to pick up at random times). This will work perfectly for that purpose. I can update this review after I’ve had this for a bit. Yes the sound is smaller and a bit distorted but this isn’t meant to be a true speaker. I see it as an intercom to help automate my household. I plan on testing it bright and early tomorrow.
title: So far so good

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amanda N.
content: I have the echo flex paired with a Sengled Pulse speaker light bulb in a ceiling can light in my bathroom. As soon as I flip on the light switch where the bulb is, the echo flex automatically connects to the speaker bulb. When playing music to the speaker bulb, then turning off the light switch, the echo flex automatically kicks back over to the flex built in speaker and the music is not interrupted, and vice versa. The built in speaker is great to get weather updates, etc at the start of the day while getting ready in the bathroom.
title: Perfect for a bathroom

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: jon
content: It would be a clever addition to the Echo line if the sound wasn't so terrible.  I didn't expect great sound, but I did expect to be able to hear it.  The volume is so inadequate, that I am returning it. The Echo Dot is a far better choice if small size is your driving force. Sure, you can pair it with a Bluetooth speaker, but that kind of negates the small footprint. If you just need something to control lights or other devices, I suppose it's ok.  But if you want to listen to news or the like, it's inadequate.
title: Low volume hurts this Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kit Clayton
content: The sound quality is far inferior to an Echo or even a Dot.  But, guess what?  This is a Flex, not an Echo or Dot!  One of these is plugged in right next to my home’s intercom, with the stereo jack right into the intercom system.  The horrible Flex speaker is moot, since it feeds directly into the home intercom and associated speakers - which all are far superior to even the echo or Bluetooth speakers.  So, even rooms ,utility/workroom, garage, porches, and decks without an Echo devices now have Alexa.  Check it out - since Flex is right next to intercom, can trigger Alexa through the intercom!  Brilliant, right?  True - not as convenient as just talking (and why there are still 4 echo devices in strategic places throughout the home) but in outdoor and other places (such as garage and work room) where it is not a good idea for an echo, a good way to smart home up everything.  And here I thought intercoms were worthless in this day and age.... I got a second Flex just to - well, flex.  Can plug it in anywhere (screened in outdoor gazebo in summer) on the property for instant voice activated Alexa for when I am too lazy to get up and push an intercom button.... Soooo, this is a great device if used for intended - and advertised clearly on product page - purpose.  You want barely passable music, then get an Echo for five bucks more when they are on sale.  you want a easy p,ug in flexible unit (er, hence the device’s name) for voice activating Alexa - or, in my case to Alexify (yes, “Alexify” is a verb in my world) my whole home intercom system, then this device is perfect.  5 stars - clearly, as I bought another one already, is recommended if used for how it was designed.
title: Outstanding Alexa extension!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Somebody
content: I received two Echo Flex devices today. I'd read all the one-star reviews before ordering, so I was prepared to send them back if they were as awful as some folks say. But when I unboxed them and plugged them into outlets, I was glad to see how quickly and automatically they connected to my wifi. Ready to use in about a minute or less. Yes, those who say the audio is tinny are right. Not at all as good as my Echo Dots, Echo Show, or the original Echo tower. But the two locations where I wanted to put the new devices aren't areas where the quality of the audio matters: living room and bathroom. So far, Alexa has had no problem hearing me, nor have I had trouble hearing her. I even tested the living room one to see if Alexa could hear me when the TV is on. I raised my voice only slightly above conversation-level. No problem. I also heard her despite the TV's audio. I noticed that the Flex in my bathroom sounded louder than the one in the living room, so I put the living room one in the bathroom to compare them. No difference. My guess is that the Flex sounds louder in the bathroom because it's a tiny room, while the living room is considerably larger. Also, I'm closer to the Flex in the bathroom (about 15" when standing at my washbowl) than in my living room where I am across the room from it (about 9'). The one glitch my living room flex has is the volume control. The bathroom's volume is set at 100%, but the living room's volume is stuck at 70%. Now, having said that, it sounds just like the 100% volume on the other Flex. I tried repeatedly to boost the volume to 100%, following the directions in the app to do that, but no luck. I have emailed support to see what I can do to get it to 100%, but truthfully it doesn't matter. As just about everyone says, the Flex is not suitable for listening to music -- but I decided to give it a try. I told Alexa to play Taylor Swift's "Look What You Made Me Do". It was far from good, but it was also nowhere near horrible. All in all, I'm pleased that I decided to replace my clunky Dots which were hanging from the outlet in holders (to keep from having to deal with cords). The Echo Flex is *much* better aesthetically, and it meets my needs.
title: Didn't expect much, but happy with the purchase

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: John Silvia
content: I've installed this in my garage - adds intercom capabilities and kills my old clock-radio. Overall the Echo Flexs' performance has been good.  It has limitations - but those are kind of expected given the packaging and price. Mounted at shoulder level over my toolbench, I'm rather happy with its performance so far.  The microphones aren't as sensitive as the ones in my Echo Dot's, so I have to speak a bit louder. The on-board sound output is weak - very low-fidelity. Definitely meant for low-traffic areas, sounds like a walkie-talkie due to it's tiny speaker. The 3.5mm output drives external speakers without trouble. I'm finding that volume 10 is the line-out volume - leaving you with 100% manual volume control on the external speakers.  I'll be trying it with my old Microsoft subwoofer setup later for kicks. Overall this is a great little Alexa, but I would not purchase this in lieu of it's bigger brothers in most cases. It's sound quality and microphone aren't as good as the larger units, but this can make it perfect in some remote low-traffic areas, or maybe hallways or large closets. Add the motion detector for full coverage. The casing is hard-plastic - it has a more appliance-rugged finish - looking very much more like an ultrasonic vermin repeller than an Internet thing.
title: Great "Low-Fi" Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: amazon_shopper
content: I like that it's a simple plug-in that sits there; no adapter, no cable, no hassle.  It does everything I need it to and is functionally no different from any other Echo device when it comes to voice commands and responsiveness.  The sound is a bit lacking, but I never considered it my primary source of audio entertainment either.  It's good enough for listening to the weather, news, or anything else not requiring premium sound.  But honestly, the sound quality is no worse than the stock radio in a 1980s K-car, if you know what that is.  The Flex performs well as an additional listening sensor for glass breakage while in Alexa Guard mode and having more sensors also expands your voice control options throughout the house.
title: Great way to expand the Alexa presence in your house.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: R Mountain
content: We are an Alexa household and she’s slowly taking over the place.  We bought the echo Flex like many of you I suspect to go in the bathroom. Alexa works great like it does in all of our other Amazon products and it’s nice to be able to listen to music, get the weather, and even to use it to drop in and tell a kid to get out of there we are going to be late. The only negative is the sound quality.  Yes I wasn’t expecting much for the price but I wanted it to be just a bit better.  Hopefully a future version will add a slightly better speaker. Overall it’s still a good product that we use daily.
title: Almost perfect.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Wills944
content: To start, I have a few technical grumbles about the platform itself but I do enjoy my "Dots" They [1 in the Living Room, 1 in each of the 2 bedrooms] have operated reasonably well, the only technical hickup with them is the occassional device dis-association from a room group..i.e. walk into a room say "turn on the lights" and it responds 'Can't find a device called Lights". So far its about once a week on one of the Dots.. The Flex's haven't had this happen and they've been unplugged and reinserted a few times.. The Flex's appear to only have 2 mic pinholes. I have had a little bit of a time finding placement for the Flex that allows it to pick up audio better. Our 2BR Apartment has laminate floors with the kitchen on one end, the combined entry/dining room acting as a echo chamber, and the carpeted living room and it's Dot at the other end. The kitchen Flex would pick up from the living room and visa versa.. Others have noted the sound "quality" as bad, but in all fairness it is about the same as the speaker function on a cellphone. It's not bassy like the dots, but I have played music while in the bathroom and it is not a bad/horrible experience. It is great to listen to the news while shaving/cleaning up or just waiting.. Once the shower is on though, external speakers would be required. On the positive notes.. The look of the device is demure enough that it blends in without being too "in your face". Hopefully skins will become available. These Flex's, Dots and Shows are great, but I hope more useful devices are in the mix. Maybe a Kitchen Device that includes a barcode scanner for maintaining a real shopping/pantry inventory, with a extension that could perhaps go over the garbage bin to scan out items. It's nice to to be able to voice add items to a list, or have a fridge that questimates usage, but a easy in/out scanner would be fantastic.. I'd also like to see the Prime Video/Music apps accept Alexa commands. I get the reasons behind branded devices, but it would be just as easy to add subroutines into the apps that intergrate commands from the platform. It would be great to have a the ability to simply have apps that can be put on devices for reading news flashes, then a simple "Alexa show me the news on the living room TV" through my android media box... Apps are easier to get to market on devices that are already global.. So hopefully Amazon expands the line in some real useful ways..
title: Good step in the right direction

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Branson Mom living in Chillicothe
content: There are SO MANY things this little device can do.  Initially I bought them exclusively as intercoms, but because I didn't understand the correct way to use them, I rated them a 3*, now that Amazon Flex expert contacted me and spent nearly an hours educating me to the device WOW, and I mean WOW...!!!! Okay it is like an extension to your Alexa or Echo Dot, but it does things I'm not even sure they can do.  These are amazing, and now instead of 2 I'm probably going to have 2 more for downstairs. Be sure to educate yourself on the differences, they can be subtle so if like me you might miss some big pieces of info. One, you can name each differently, so when you 'drop in' (not any other way as I was doing) you can have a conversation with the persons that are at that Flex.  So yes, an intercom.  You can broadcast announcements to every device, or 'drop in' to just one. I now have so many Ring and Amazon devices my house probably should be seen from outerspace, lol.  And I am far from finished.  I want every bulb to be a smart bulb (you gotta try those, omg), I want every room to have a Flex (okay I have 16 rooms, maybe not every room), I already have a plethora of Ring cameras inside and out, but also am trying a different brand that works with Alexa too, but tons less expensive (and Ring truly is not what it use to be). Point being, its good to have security on your house, convenience in your house, and it all tied to one system - Alexa.
title: Buy Alexa only products, and be sure they can interact interchangably, mine ROCK

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mike
content: So initially I thought this would be a great addition to my garage as a smart speaker. I thought to my self it’s small, doesn’t need a cable or a desk to be displayed on (mounts directly to the  wall vía it’s plug), and it should fill the garage with some smart tech easily, only that wasn’t exactly the case. My main gripe is with the sound quality, it’s awful and basically ruined the product (Especially since it’s all about voice activated features and doesn’t have a screen). Alexa sounds hollow/awful and music sounds even worse. There is limited to no bass and the mids/highs aren’t anywhere (good) to be found either. That being said, there also aren’t enough redeeming qualities to make this a well rated product. Yes I did pay a decent price on it (Amazon had a 50% off sale around the end of 2019) and it has a built in USB port on the bottom. So then you’d think that’s cool it was cheap and there is a port (basically giving you an extra charge outlet for a phone or something) and yeah I’d agree with that thought process, then I noticed the two official add ons for the USB port (a night light and a motion sensor) are half the MSRP of the unit and honestly should have just been built in (with a better speaker). Then, and only then, would this have been a 4 star or better product but instead it’s barely a 3, more like a 2 star product if you paid full price. I’d say wait for gen two or another steep discount before you buy this thing.
title: Half baked “smart” speaker...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: TBS
content: The concept of this is nice but the sound quality is not good at all. I wanted it for my office to listen to music but it's not great for that. Echo Dot has much better sound quality.
title: Nice Concept but Lacks Decent Sound Quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ashley N Ward
content: I was SUPER excited to have an echo I could easily plug into my bathroom wall. I even ordered this a month in advance. However, when they say "mini smart speaker" they really mean MINI smart speaker. Even when you do the "level 11" secret volume, these are still so quiet. I have a regular echo dot (3rd gen) and the volume is perfect. However, I have a vent fan in my bathroom that turns on when I turn on the light and I can barely hear it over the fan. I'd expect that if the volume was at a 5 or 6, but a 10 or 11? The sound quality is even a bit fuzzy despite being so quiet. I don't expect it to be as loud as a normal echo, but it's big enough they could have added better speakers. Very disappointing.
title: Way too quiet

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ashley
content: I think these might be a little expensive for what you’re getting. I mean it’s a nice concept but the sound quality is horrible. I expected it from a small device but at least it’s nice to put in a small space. I put them in the bathroom so I can make announcements that dinner is ready or something like that. I’m planning on playing some Christmas music on it for the bathroom which I think would be nice with the decorations I have in there. Definitely wouldn’t be able to hear the music if you were in the shower tho. If you could, it would be very faint.
title: They’re okay but not necessary.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: capo
content: I have Echo devices of one kind or another in every room and have had others that I’ve decided to let go (original Echo and Echo Auto). They’ve all performed their smarthome duties acceptably well. My biggest complaint across the board is sound quality. Alexa always sounds like she’s talking to you from underneath a pile of pillows. Bass? Sure, on the Echo Show, at least. Treble? Nada. Sure, you can use the app’s “equalizer”... but it’d take an oscilloscope to detect the minuscule difference that makes in the sound quality. I’d given up on getting any more devices... until I saw a review of the Flex on Paul Hibbert’s YouTube channel... he liked it, but said (I think) that it sounded ‘trebly’. Trebly?! That’s a magic word to my ears. I ordered one up and found that it indeed sounds ‘trebly’ (call it tinny of you like) but who cares? Who seriously listens to music on these tiny little devices anyway?! I can understand what Alexa says now - all the plosives are there. I still wonder why Amazon can’t tune the rest of the Alexa enabled devices for better higher frequency clarity.
title: Treble! Hooray, I can understand Alexa now!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Consumer Advocate
content: Compared to Echo Dots, the Echo Flex is a good space-saving idea but the microphone(s) were unreliable and the speaker was a joke so the 1st one I ordered was returned. NOW in 2020 ... I decided to give Echo Flex a 2nd chance. Either they improved the device considerably or the first one was defective because the 2nd one is WORKING LIKE A CHAMP!
title: Nice case design improved microphone & speaker ?

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JC Fazzone
content: As with all Amazon product, it is better to wait for next generation products as with time the products do get better. This item is a disappointment with sound and volume control. While it fits in small spaces, it’s worth while to buy an Echo Dot with mounting bracket. Very disappointed that 14.99 is necessary to purchase the night light. Not recommending this product.☹️
title: Will pay to wait

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jason H.
content: After writing this review and rating it 2 stars, I received a call from Amazon.  They wanted to tell me that the speaker on the Echo Flex is not meant to be the main audio source.  The intent of the design is to use Bluetooth to connect to an external speaker.  This would, of course, resolve my concern with the sound quality, so I increased the rating to 3, or okay.  But in thinking about the Flex alone, I don't think I would rate it as good or great, because it has limited appeal without additional investment. I'm not particularly fond of the idea of adding a speaker just to have this device, because I could buy a Dot instead.  However, I concede that there are niches where this functionality and price savings would be useful.  For example, after thinking about it further, I realized that I could connect it to my Bluetooth enabled treadmill and have Alexa right up front for music or any other questions I might have without having to mount an Echo Dot on the wall.  The Flex plugs in securely to a wall socket and leaves the second outlet open.  It's not heavy and doesn't sag like some two-pronged, heavy transformers do. Installing this was a simple as unpacking it and plugging it in.  It had already been integrated into my account and the WiFi login was automatic. Notifications cause the LED to blink brightly.  It's much harder to ignore it, when you already know what the notification is.  You have to ask, what's my notification, in order to clear it. The sound is like a cell phone's speakerphone, and is hard to listen to.  This device would go best in a garage or out of the house, where you might want access to announcements or activating guards, but not where you want to hear it every day.  (edit:  you are expected to connect to a Bluetooth speaker by design) Giving plenty of space in front of the device helps with communication.  Putting it in a tight space can cause echoes or chirps and clicks that interfere with it.
title: For someplace you won't need to listen to it every day.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sandra Knight
content: I have had this for a year and it works flawlessly.  I use it for alarm time setting when I am cooking, playing music, weather, getting correct time and date, movie listing, etc.  I find it play music loud enough for me.  I have it in my living room, and can hear it in bathroom, bedroom and kitchen.  Of course I live in a 1000 sq ft. apartment and the sound is very good.  When I am talking on phone, the other party on line says they can hear it very plainly so it is loud.  Don't know why the comments say its bad for hearing, must have an extra large house.  Right now its so loud that I have to have Alexa turn it down some.  I also have the night light attachment and it comes on automatically at dark and in the morning I have to tell Alexa to turn off light.  And that works perfectly also. I just love it. You will too.
title: Wonderful Little Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ella Belle
content: I just got my Echo Flex - Plug-in smart speaker with Alexa this morning and I'm already totally in LOVE with it! With it I also bought that "Made for Amazon" THIRDREALITY Smart Night-Light for Echo Flex, and I love it too! I had been wanting to put an Echo Dot in a very tiny bathroom, but I was trying to figure out how, since I have no counter space and didn't want to use up my last outlet. Then, along comes this Echo-Flex thingy, so I decided to give it a try. I've been super delighted with it all morning long! I love how it just plugs right into an outlet and is totally out of my way but still basically does most of what the echo Dots do. I had a regular nightlight in the room that took up an outlet socket, so this new Smart Nigh-Light was a great solution because it plugs right into the bottom of the Echo Flex, so just the Echo-Flex is using that 1 outlet now. It's so cool too because I can ask Alexa to change the lights colors! I've bought 4 of the Echo Dots for my home and I am in love with all of them. This Echo-Flex is just a smaller version that is so perfect for small bathrooms, laundry rooms and basically anywhere else where you just don't have counter or table space for an Echo Dot. I also love how easy it is to set these devices up! Just be sure the little box below the "Add to Cart" and "Buy Now" buttons is checked "Link to my Amazon account to simplify setup"! It really does simplify the set-up wonderfully! Anyway, I am totally loving this new Echo-Flex so much and I already have ideas of getting some more of them for other tiny places around my home that I had not considered before. These things are just so helpful AND so fun! UPDATE 08/16/2020: I've now bought 4 of these echo Flexes with the nightlights. One for the laundry room, one for my Kitchen and 2 for my small bathrooms. I use these every day and they have become indispensable!  Sure, the sound is not super great for music, but the fact that these are not stealing any counter space is paramount for me. I have other Echo's in other rooms for music anyway. I love these things! UPDATE 10/13/2020: I am STILL in love with these cool little Echo Flex gadgets!  I use them many times daily! A great size for small rooms like Bathrooms, laundry rooms, store rooms, mud rooms, garage, even out in our woodshed! I happily got more today on Prime Day! Thank you Amazon!
title: Awesome Alexa Solution For Small Rooms!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Carmchocolate2
content: Nice addition to the Echo family.  Perfect size for the bathroom without having to deal with cords.  You can't expect big sound from this small device, but it serves its purpose.  I am able to set reminders,  timers, alarms,  and add things to my shopping lists while getting ready.
title: Perfect size for small places

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mr Huskey
content: It is very bulky robbing room from other items you might want to plug in.  The speaker quality sucks.  No where near as good as the Echo plus speaker.  Playing music on the Flex's built in speaker sounds like listening to an old transistor pocket radio.  It does pair easily to my blue tooth speakers which sound really good. Motion detection works, but is almost useless until the Amazon Alexa app matures a bit more.  Settings in the app are too cumbersome to want to use at the moment.  Controlling a light seems easy enough, but I wanted it to turn on a Wyze switched outlet.  I had to create a new group... assign the Wyze switch to it... create a routine to turn on the group.  There was no skill that let me just turn on/off the switch without creating the group first.  Seemed like way more hassle than it should have been. The night light seems nice, but I haven't spent much time playing with it yet.  I just picked the first color that was bright enough to fill the room.  Too bad you can't have motion sensing and the night light in one module.  I really only want the night light to turn on when I step out of bed in the middle of the night.
title: A very minimalistic  Echo device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Tech Gospel
content: I wasn't expecting it to be as loud as the Dot 3 or anything... but I was hoping at least as loud as the 2nd gen Dot. It was barely audible plugged next to the bathroom sink standing 2 feet away... even less so in the shower. Although you can plug an external speaker to it, it defeats the purpose of it. It could work if you prefer using an external speaker (3.5mm will support drop-in, bluetooth will not) and just want to plug something in the wall and not worry about cables. But overall, I was disappointed and just swapped it for another Dot.
title: Barely audible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. Coral
content: I set up this cute little Echo Flex + Motion Sensor in the garage.  It was easy to add Routines in the Alexa app to turn On and Off the WeMo light switch for the garage light.  I had this automation ready to go in about 5 minutes.  It’s real nice to have the garage light come on automatically whenever I open the garage door.  I also set it to turn off the light after no motion is detected for 1 hour (choose any time period). You can also have the motion sensor activate an Echo device to speak a custom phrase, give a news flash briefing, traffic report, play music, etc. There is a setting to specify the time when the motion sensor should perform the Routine (anytime, or between a certain time period) and to suppress a repeat of the Routine for a configurable time period so it won’t keep doing the same thing every time there is motion, if you don’t want it to.  For example you can have it give you the traffic report or news briefing when you enter the bathroom in the morning but only if the motion happens between 6-8am. This is super useful — after trying out the first one, I’m going to buy a few more to play with around the house.
title: Motion Sensor is Handy!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Spyder2014
content: If you are looking for a quality speaker to listen to music while you are in the bathroom or kitchen... pay a little extra and get an echo dot. The flex is perfect if you want to add another echo device for the sake of controlling smart home devices, taking advantage of the guardian functionality or for the occasional drop in. You also get the added functionality of either a motion sensor or night light with the available accessories. We replaced our bathroom night light with the flex and it is great! The light accessory gives off more light than our old night light and my wife loves the different colors you can choose due to the built in rgb LEDs. I tested the drop in feature as well and it was loud and clear while talking to my wife in the next room. I highly recommend the flex if you want an additional echo device in a bathroom, kitchen or spare room and don't want the hassle of hiding the cables, or if you want to add motion sensor triggers or a night light to a room.
title: Perfect... for what it is!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Debra T
content: I am in the midst of setting up an Alexa eco-system in my home. I have a Fire TV, first generation Echo, Fire Tablet, Echo Show 5, and several smart plugs. I wanted an Alexa-enabled device in my bedroom to do the "basics" ... respond to my voice commands ... and to turn the smart plugs on my bedroom lamps on and off. So I got an Echo Flex. I set it up in less than a minute, and soon it was turning my lamps on and off, telling me the time, answering my silly questions and telling me jokes! People, this is how technology should work. The world would be a much techno-friendly place if all technology was this easy to set up. I didn't get this for the sound quality of an Echo or for the screen time of an Echo Show. If I had wanted those features in my bedroom, I would have spent more more money to get them. I can never figure out why people buy an entry level product here on Amazon that does "the basics" and then give it a bad review when it doesn't do everything the "cadillac version" does. Sheesh. What I love about this product: --It's a great price. --It does what it's intended to do. --It can be enhanced with a bluetooth speaker, a nightlight or a motion detector. --It's out of the way. --It only takes up one outlet. The other one is still available for use. --You can plug in a USB device to it, like a smartphone, to charge it. What I dislike about this product: --Nothing. Because it does what I bought it to do. In my book, Amazon gets big kudos for giving buyers options for different features and price points of their Alexa product line.
title: Works great for its intended purpose!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amodeus1971
content: Besides the speaker being small and sounding like garbage the Flex has gotten better over time. The motion sensor I have come to like now that I have adapted to it and they have seemed to iron out some of the problems. My main problem now is they limited the use of it because they are only allowing you to own two of these with the motion sensor per Amazon account unless you have a business account. No other explanation besides they tried to get me to sign up for an Amazon business account. I have one in my bathroom and wanted to put two in my kitchen are because there are two entrances and I wanted to make my lights fully motion-controlled in my kitchen. I can do this to a point with Wyze Sense but I don't want any more cameras inside my living space than I need to have, which are the two on my rear windows as the other security cameras are all outside. This imitation severely limits the usefulness of this product.
title: Rewritten review

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael
content: The worst Amazon Echo Product to date. Would never recommend. Really wanted to have this, but sound quality is terrible, microphone is horrible
title: Horrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: thornhillatthemovies.com
content: I'm not thrilled with the Echo Flex. I have an Echo and love that, I have a bunch of plugs connected to it, and control the lights throughout our small apartment with it. I have had some difficulty getting other smart plugs to communicate and connect with Alexa and our Echo. So, when I saw the Echo Flex on Amazon, I initially thought it was a smart plug with Alexa built in. It isn't. And that's my mistake. Our apartment is very small, so I plugged the Echo Flex into the wall (it really looks like a multi-plug you plug into a regular outlet) and connected it. A few days before, I got a wall clock made by Citizen and connected it to the Echo.
