I purchased two of the units, I installed one in my garage and used the 3.5 jack to an older stereo that i have on hand. Now I have the ability to play Pandora on my 1980 garage stereo.  I used the other one in my master bathroom,  We had installed a Bluetooth exhaust fan which you had to connect every time you wanted to use it. not convenient.  The Echo Flex stays connected to the speaker and now no matter how short the visit i can play music, get traffic, time you get the idea. $25 bucks seems a bit steep for what it is but home automation is what it is and Mr. Besos is trying for that Trillionaire status.  His products work great so more power to him... Thumbs up for Echo Flex
title: Easy to add, easy to use, does what I want it to do

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kylar Stern
content: I love the Echo Flex for its affordability and functionality. You get alot of options in a small package.Basically, all of the Alexa integration is there to manage my smart home in a small unobtrusive unit that I can plug anywhere around the house. Set up is a breeze and I enjoy the smart night light and motion sensor attachments that can be purchased seperately for a low price. Great buy, especially when on sale. I am plugging in these in all my outlets around the house! One note, the Echo Flex is not not meant to play high quality music. The speaker is meant for Alexa communication and not hi-fidelity. To that end, the speaker is a good intercom.
title: Great value for money

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: paulus
content: Received as a gift.  Like the compact, clean appearance of the Flex.  Like that it plugs into wall taking up no counter space in my kitchen.  Sounds great with my blue tooth speaker; no problems pairing it up.  LIKELY DEAL BREAKERS:  1.  Microphones seem poorer than Full Size Echo and Echo Dot. I end up shouting at the flex unless the kitchen is  perfectly silent.  2.  Kitchen Timer sound is soft and tinny, even through the blue tooth speaker.  Turning up sound  volume on Echo application helps only marginally.  Will be going back to my full-size echo or a Dot for my kitchen.
title: Cut to the chase review

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kk
content: I like that it turns on and off my light ( when it can recognize it) and I like how it can be used as an intercom (when it can find other devices in my house. ) Anytime we have a power flash. Or internet goes out you have to reset my whole house. Including every light. Which is strange because I can turn on and off light from my echo show and from the light app but the flexs seem to have a problem with getting back on task if Interrupted even slightly. So here I am sitting on the floor resetting it yet again debating on just sending the two I have back and getting dots instead. Super annoying in my opinion.
title: Sometimes works

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: T. Duke
content: I put this echo in my kitchen and my outlets are all horizontal because the counter has the breakfast bar on the other side, so there is about 8 inches of back splash on the kitchen side. The sound and the volume are very muted compared to my old dot (V2). The advantage of the flex is the shape, rectangle, not round and it plug right into the outlet, no USB plug and then cable, which just added clutter. My flex just doesn't really compare sound wise and in volume to the dot, sounds like a tin can. I'll keep it in hopes some updates will improve the sound and voice, but for the location this form factor can't be beat.
title: It fits in the tight place with no cords

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lori S W Dunham
content: Very well-made products they could be Place pretty much anywhere with a plug, has a USB outlet for charging so it's not taking up the plug entirely and seems to work very well when paired with a Bluetooth speaker for music, you can then put the speaker nearly anywhere out of sight to have a near seamless experience, use it for turning on the porch lights and mostly for dropping in upstairs and other than it having a hard time hearing commands when music is on too loud which is to be expected it works pretty flawlessly and is much easier and by far asthetically sleeker to have around the house then a normal Echo Dot, I do wish the two accessories were a slight bit cheaper as I can't get in test them myself but even without them it has boundless potential like all of the rest of them in a far more pleasing form factor, I do however wish that the device had been made with the buttons on the side of the device so there could be a through for an entire proper plug, it would be nice to have it's pretty much like it's not even there and then it could be a smart plug all its own as well which would be absolutely astounding but that's just more personal wishlist feedback otherwise it's beyond functional and I'm delighted with the purchase.
title: A nice enough upgrade over the original to be worth it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kerry Garrett
content: This is the Echo I have been waiting for.  I wanted one in the front hallway but I didn't have a table to set a regular Echo or Dot on.  Now when I walk in the door I can ask Alexa to turn on the lights or when I leave I can ask her the weather so I will know if I need a jacket or not. The sound is not for listening to music.  It is clear and loud enough to hear what Alexa is saying.  If I ever need better sound, it does have a headphone jack on the side that I could plug in a computer speaker. I should be getting my night light attachment in the next day or so.
title: Handy little Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: I. Tremaine
content: I know this might sound like a strange review, but I'm not exactly sure how to use this "flex" Alexa.  Truthfully, I bought it on "Prime Day" because it was priced so low and it was an Alexa product. I felt I couldn't go wrong.  I have several Alexa items and they're fun and functional.  When the Flex arrived, it looked cool, linked to our wifi just fine.  It answers just like my other Alexas.  But other than looking different, I haven't had time to discover what is the real difference between it and other Alexas.  It says that it can work with other devices, but I haven't figured that out yet.
title: An interesting gadget...I think

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sarah Mains
content: I bought on impulse and glad I did. First off it they can have it have a plug on front too, it would be prefect. Sitting on toilet and out of toilet paper, make an announcement to all devices? Yep. Add toilet paper to shopping cart? Yep. Soaking in your tub and only lizzo can make it better? She shuffle songs by lizzo. Don’t get me wrong their are a few quirks, like not to listen and do stuff like play stuff on Alexa in next room. Heck we all like to hand off our jobs at times too. Small and easy to use in kitchen, bedrooms, and of course bathroom.
title: Need an Alexa in your bathroom, heck yes you do!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sam Gray
content: If you're like me, you probably came to the reviews section to see what other's have to say about the Echo Flex. Bottom line is- it works and sounds as would expect a small device to. I read a lot of reviews of people who purchased the Echo Flex and didn't think the sound quality was up to par of other Echo devices (no way! really?! *gasp*) -If you're looking for Bose quality sound to come out of this thing, your expectations are way too high. If you're expecting Echo Dot sound quality to come out of this thing... AGAIN- your expectations are way too high. This thing sounds as I expected, like an intercom speaker, it is all treble and almost no bass at all. HOWEVER- you can connect an external speaker to it via the 3.5mm audio jack. I think this is a great device. If you're looking for to extend Alexa's capabilities and don't need all the extras offered by the Dot, then this is it.
title: Works (and sounds) as Expected

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Marine2Soldier
content: This item has minimal range as it pertains to distance from the router and the primary Alexa device.  Walls and objects like empty boxes easily disrupt it.  Not to mention, when playing music on these devices, the sound level is so low, you are better off playing your Alexa device in one room and while in another location.  The connection gets continuously lost, and you have to re-establish it by bringing it back to the primary Alexa device again.  The initial connection process leaves much to be desired.  The directions are not as straightforward as it can be.  Even the customer service told me to disregard them as they walked me through them.  My advice is if you are going to purchase one of these, purchase one at a time until you see how it works for you.  Please do not do like I did buy four of them, and be stuck all four wall plugs.  I would go with the Echo Dot, the connectivity range is much better, and the sound coverage and quality are much clearer, crisper and further.
title: Very Poor Design and Concept

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: retlod
content: It's an Echo.  It does what Echos do.  Setup was a piece of cake.  Actually, easier than slicing a piece of cake.  But the sound is beyond awful.  The transistor radio I built in high school electronics class had better sound quality.  I moved it to the garage.  I'd rather have an Echo Dot with a bracket.  I predict this product won't last long.
title: Tin Can Sound

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dilmah
content: Together with Echo Buds I consider Echo Flex two most significant Echo devices introduced recently.  Why?  Because they enable you to take Alexa everywhere. If you want Alexa in particular place you might want something else.  Like if you need Alexa in your bedroom, I recommend Echo Show.  Or if you want Alexa in your car I recommend either Garmin Speak or Garmin DriveSmart. But if you want Alexa just everywhere then Echo Flex and Echo Buds are your choice. Particularly Echo Flex is nice to take with you on trips to hotel rooms.  Or it's nice to put in your bathroom or garage or that nook.
title: One of the most significant Echo devices introduced recently

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: GoodEnoughNails
content: I’m so glad to have found these! We have a couple areas in the house that honestly don’t need a full-blown Echo but we prefer to not yell at Alexa. These are perfect for that purpose at a good price. They’re basically a “bark box” for just giving commands. Don’t expect to listen to music or anything that requires good sound quality on them, but that’s not really the point of them anyway. I love not having to scream at Alexa to turn the lights on and off in the back end of the house! It’s also great that you can use the accessory USB connector as a phone charger to save outlet space.
title: Fantastic for Alexa dead spots

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: onlineshopper240
content: Full disclosure: I bought this on sale for half off; and for that price, I am happy with my purchase. This is very handy to have in a location where you want to add smart home functionality with Alexa, but don’t need a smart speaker per se. It works fine for carrying out smart home routines and providing the weather, etc., but I wouldn’t use it to listen to music or anything like that. If you are looking for a smart speaker, spend a little more and go with the Echo Dot. If you are just looking for a smart assistant, this is an affordable option.
title: Assistant- yes; Speaker- no

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Happinessisadd
content: This little speaker is prefect for my growing smart house. I put one in the hallway into my bedroom, just incase I forgot something while heading to bed (I don't keep any speakers in my bedroom). It responds so well and it'll hear me over a good portion of my house. I'm going to pick up a second one for the front hallway and all my areas will be voice accessible (besides bedrooms with doors closed).
title: Speaker for Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Handshoe
content: Super easy setup. Plug it in. Open the app. Find the Echo Flex under devices and it’s ready to use and logged into the network. I didn’t expect great sound from the speaker, so I am not disappointed. The sales page information clearly states it does provide music quality sound. I will say the speaker audio is slightly better than I expected, but I wouldn’t use It for listen to music. The external Audi port allows for output to powered speakers, turning it into a good sounding music player. Great little grear
title: Add Alexa To Any Room With WiFi Access

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Leo
content: So I bought this Echo Flex to install it in my garage. The voice recognition is excellent, it hears me across my double car garage without me having to raise my voice. So far it's work flawlessly and I love that I don't have to repeat myself to it for it to do as I ask. I found several useful commands while I'm working on my garage for example, open garage door, turn on workbench lights, turn on workbench fan, make an announcement, son come to the garage and give a hand. Another thing I like is that it does not seat on top of my workbench taking up space.
title: Great Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: S. Douglas
content: The concept behind this is fantastic the microphones on the smaller echo devices are really top notch the only flaw with this one and to be fair should not be considered a flaw at all is the poor sound quality. If one has a seldom used or non-living space where music play back is not a priority. This is a great and inexpensive way to add an Alexa device. Optimal placement would be in the attic or unfinished basement for Voice commands, or intercom functionality.  Pair it with the added motion sensor module for an element of security near a back door
title: Great way to add Alexa to and non-living space such as an attic, basement, or toolshed

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Adam Hannemann
content: I bought this little guy to provide Alexa music (Bluetooth and Pandora mostly) to my outdoor speakers. I plugged an Aux cable into my stereo receiver inside the house and control it through the app on my phone. It works perfectly for this, and am very happy with the unit. The built in speaker is pretty terrible for music, but in doing some limited testing it got the job done. That said, I didn't buy it intending on ever using the internal speaker, and for my purposes it's perfect. If you wanted Alexa some place with power and you didn't want to listen to music from the built in speaker I think this is a great little unit.
title: Sound is great through Aux Cable

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Terri PhD
content: I bought this to put in my basement, so I can call using Alexa. Cell doesn’t work well in the basement so using the Echo Flex with the Echo Connect is great for calling in case of emergency or if I need to answer the phone. The Flex is smaller than anticipated but that’s even better. Plugged it in, connected to the WiFi and it’s ready to go. Easy. Sounds quality isn’t great, but that’s no surprise given the size  I didn’t buy it to listen to music. If you want a quick and easy way to expand Alexa functionality all over the house, this a great accessory.
title: Great little Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ben Pflieger
content: I really love this product. I got this, plus the motion sensor, for my home office. I have an old home and the room I use as an office has no light switch and the outlets are not near the door in any way, meaning you need to walk through the room to turn on any of the lamps. I already have a Feit Smart Bulb in one lamp and with the Flex and the motion sensor, I was able to easily set a routine for the light to turn on when I enter the room and then turn off after a set amount of time when no motion is detected. Additionally, I can use voice commands on the Flex to change the color, dim, turn it off, etc. At times, the motion sensor works better than others, but overall, it works wonderfully. The sound quality on the Flex is nothing great and I would personally not use it as a speaker to play music. I truly see this device as just being a great way to give voice control to areas in your home where you don't need/want a different Echo device, or to have very affordable motion sensing capabilities.
title: Great Addition to a Smart Home

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Laura Killian
content: I love the mini Alexa! I bought it for my 13 year old son's room as he is alone sometimes when I work late. it is perfect for me to get him to answer when he is too busy on YouTube and he cannot hear the main Alexa in the kitchen. All I had to do was plug it in and it was ready to go I have not played music on it but I have done relaxing sounds like rainfall and it sounded very clear and soothing. I just bought another one for my room as my kids sometimes likes to be in my room so I can get in touch with him when I need to and he's at the house by himself. You can never have too much technology to keep an eye on your kid.
title: Great way to keep in touch with teens and latchkey kids.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jim.Moor
content: Pros: Excellent voice recognition No cord Able to use usb for sensor, etc Sensor unit has 2 level sensitivity Cons: Cheaper sensors available that can point, this combo is more expensive if only sensor is needed. Limited to where you have outlets Not able to prioritize 2nd Alexa in same room, since this is so sensitive it tries to take over whole room. Big & clunky Sensor not aim-able (see pic of card taped to block an area), also note that microphone is disabled. Takeaway: Dot is more versatile, better sound by far. Very few cases where I would use this.
title: Mmmmmmm

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rekopqueen
content: This unit is great for my six year olds room. He can set his school morning alarm, and timers for reading. We added free time to it, and Alexa will say things like ‘okey dokey’ to him and read children’s stories to him.. he loves being able to play his own music in there too.. it Integrated well With our other Alexa products and we love how we can ‘drop In’ all over the house. He loves announcing lunch and dinner through this unit.. the sound is not as robust as the dot or echo show, but it’s perfect for an additional unit and for what he uses it for
title: Great unit!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ScottH61
content: This is NOT made for listening to music.  I suppose that that is not it't intent though.  I bought the nightlight with mine, and that works great.  I have another Echo spot in the same room for listening to music, so I have the Flex speaker turned off.  I just wish I could turn off the red LED, as every time I see it, I think, "Uh oh... something is wrong!" then I remember it's just muted.  I guess you can't have it all.  Other than that, it's nice to have the nightlight be voice controlled.  I got mine at the introductory price, and I don't think I would spend full price on one... Not until sound quality came up a few notches...
title: Sound is terrible.  Very tinny.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Richard K.
content: I bought an Echo Dot for myself and one for my cousins, but still needed something for my back porch and added the Echo Flex to my Prime Days purchases.  It has worked out very well for voice command on the smart plugs I use for my porch entertainment center, lights, and treadmill as well as an extension for my Echo Dot.  Other than its low speaker volume, it meets and in some ways, exceeds, expectations.
title: Perfect surrogate for Echo Dot!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ed
content: You need a plug with nothing around it and probably not close to the floor.. Plug it in to a plug about a foot off the floor with a bookshelf about a foot to the side of it and it worked okay but I have to speak louder for it to hear me.  Works better in the kitchen plug at counter height. For the current price compared to the Echo Dot or Echo Show 5 I would say the Echo Dot or Echo Show 5 is the better deal. However if it were priced at half the price of an Echo Dot then I might be a good buy depending on if you have ideal place to plug it in.
title: Pricey For What It Does

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nicole
content: Works perfect for what I ordered it for. We have Bluetooth rock speakers outside in our yard by the pool. Rather than draining the battery on our cell phones to play the music from the phone through the speaker, I use the Alexa app to play the music from the flex, which I have connected to play out of the rock speakers. The flex is plugged into the outside inside the house closest to the speakers. For this purpose, I have no complaints! We have several Alexa devices in the house that we use for various other things but the flex is used solely for this purpose (and is kept on DND at all times).
title: Purpose for playing music through speakers outside

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kevin Garcia
content: took less then a minute to set up speaker is louder then reviews suggested  when you buy click the box Link to my Amazon account to simplify setup.  30 to 40 sec . set up so easy
title: easy set up

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JHaines
content: Poor. I have this set up in an outlet in our kitches & a dot in our living room. I can ask it to set a timer and the echo dot in the living room will respond. I can stand within 2 feet of this thing and talk and the other echo will still pick it up. the only way i can get it to work on its own is talking very quietly to it about 10 inches away. I will be returning this and getting a 3rd gen dot with an outlet mount. since mounts can now be had for $5.
title: Poor Sound Detection

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nicole/Frederic
content: You definitely don't want to start your Alexa experience with the flex, but it is a good little addition to a small bathroom or kitchen. The sound quality isn't the greatest so having a bluetooth speaker if you want to listen to music is a must, & the mic doesn't seem to pick up very well from very far away. Otherwise this little guy is convenient since it plugs straight into the wall, so no worry about food or water getting to it. I would only recommend buying this if you already have other Alexa devices cuz this is more of a companion than a stand alone, but if it's your first device I'd recommend spending a little bit extra to get the Echo Dot instead.
title: Good for quiet areas...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Reece Fam
content: I have several echo dots and use them all the time.  but I had a couple places flex looked like a better choice (nothing on the table top).  So I tried them.  Not much range of volume.  Full blast is equal to about a 4 on the dot, and a 1 on the flex is like a 2 on the dot.  disappointing.  The next issue was setup.  The phone app works great with the dot but not with the flex.  Took so many tries to get it working that I don't know what I did right to make it work.  With all that...  It works and hangs on the wall, so happy enough.
title: Not as loud as a dot.  Not as easy to set up with phone app.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: B. Cirincione
content: I love this for my office and yes - even the bathroom. It takes up little space. We use our Alexa’s as intercom so a little unit is all we require. The sound is pretty decent but don’t expect great quality. It isn’t made for those of you who want excellent sound. A definite buy in my book (we have two of these). The price is right. You can add a couple other options to it (a night light, motion detector or a clock) but depending on where you place unit, there may be spacing issues. If you want a clock, you can always just ask it what the time is.
title: A great addition to my Alexa system

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Zane Garrison
content: Echo Flex will give you all of Alexa in a small convenient package if you're concerned with space.  It plugs into your power outlet and mounts there.  The sound isn't very good and I can't really control the volume on mine (I don't know if that's a glitch or if it's a problem with all Flex devices) but if you want to have Alexa without taking up much space, then this might be a good option for you.  I use it in my boys' room to be able to drop in on them and to also give them the access to kids features of Alexa.  It works well enough for our needs.
title: Echo Flex is economical but the features aren't as good.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jeanette
content: This is perfect for a tie into all my other Alexa speakers.  I needed something for my small kitchen and feared a dot would get wet or yucky. I can hear my echo speaker fine all downstairs but because of where it's placed I have to shout to get Alexa to hear correctly from the kitchen. With this, Alexa can hear me all downstairs allowing me to set timers, drop in or play music from my speaker without having to yell.  It's a great idea but NOT a speaker you would want to listen to anything aside from a timer.  That's why it is 14.00 less than an echo and worth every penny.
title: Wonderful tie in to all devices when quality of the speaker is not an issue

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Tim Blake
content: The Echo smart speaker is an easy simple way to broaden functionality of Amazon Alexa. Smart speakers are easy to set up and function well. Whether you use it as a bedroom extension for controlling your thermostat or lights, or use it as a garage extension, you can't beat the functionality. In my case I have a two story house with a garage. I added three extension speakers and three smart plugs. Now I have full control without reaching for my phone or the Alexa app. Drop in, calling, and all of the perks you are used to from Alexa are available with your voice. I am pleased with my experience.
title: Whole home control and function

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lee J. Zuckett
content: Exactly what I wanted, I used it as a motion sensor to turn on lights and of course as an additional Alexa in a side room.  The only gotcha I have is its microphone is better than the Echo Show in the main area.  At times when I am asking Alexa a question the Flex answers and not the Show (even though I am much closer to the Show).  I solved this by changing its wake word but it would be great to have this pick issue corrected (same problem upstairs with my other Show and Echo v2 btw). As to sound, I figured it was not the best but I have never expected the units themselves to have "great" speakers so no issue for me there. Maybe could be a bit smaller and have a pass through plug.
title: Spot on, or flex on

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Kanikula
content: This is a great device, if you only want to be able to talk to it and set reminders, alarms, add things to your lists or things like that.  But the speaker on this is not very good.  It is very hard to hear if there is any other noise, and that is with the volume all the way up.  This is great for in a bedroom, or bathroom, but not many other places.
title: Great little device, if you only want it to hear you

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael Lukacs
content: I bought this because it was cheap and compact  and would plug in anywhere. I knew that the sound output would be inferior to the dot but that did not concern me because if I needed better / louder sound I could plug in or blue tooth connect a speaker. What I did not expect was that its WiFi connectivity would be much worse than the dot. It is of limited usefulness because it will not reliably maintain network connectivity on either the 2.5 or 5 GHz bands in many locations where the echo dot 3rd gen works perfectly.
title: networking problems

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jciofalo
content: I am echo user, from my car to my home. I have echo in all the rooms at my house and now the echo flex in my kitchen, it's a cool little device that plugs into one of the wall sockets so no wires or anything to be in the way. It works well I just wish it was a little  louder,  I mean don't get me wrong you can still hear the music but when you are washing dishes or even cooking you sometimes want to hear the music a little better and louder especially when you kids are gaming in the living room. But the good thing is even at 100% volume there is no distortion in the music. So would I suggest to purchase, Yes! because the cool thing is you ca attache this to a bluetooth speaker as well and take it into the bathroom and listen to music while in the shower.
title: Cool little thing, but could be louder.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: John Nicholson
content: Cost effective! It is essentially carries same set of functions as my Echo. My aim was to extend my Echo experience to the common areas of the home without having to really pay as much. This is a cute addition to the house. Quite discreet. Blends in well. The volume is decent. Voice recognition is on par and has really good range (I project 15 feet from it). Has LED signaling to indicate that Alexa has a message. Very easy setup. No issues. I haven’t used ALL the features on it however. I’m tempted to get another in the future
title: Low Cost Compact Home Solution

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ed D.
content: I know the rating and title are confusing, so let me explain. As other reviewers have stated, the internal speaker is really bad, somewhat reminiscent of the old portable transistor radios of the 60s, but if you pair this with a good Bluetooth speaker, you'll be really happy. I bought this as an alternative to the Echo Dot which needs a separate power source. The Flex plugs directly into a socket and I simply pair my Bose speaker using Bluetooth. So now I get Alexa, a USB charging port (if needed), and really decent sound so I can rock out to my old guy classic rock from the 60s & 70s when I'm in the kitchen.
title: Works great, sound is horrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Baron Hutchinson
content: Works as advertised, have it in the kitchen, just ran into one little problem. When I connected my brand new Bluetooth external speaker using the 3 mm cord,  and use the built-in USB-A output port of the Echo to power it, I heard  significant static. Tried using another charger, same result.  Tried using another speaker, static still there. Eventually found a power supply charger that works, but it's one of those early model low power ones. Looks like the high power output ones not quite compatible, at least, with my Echo Flex. Hope you don't run into the same problem with yours.
title: Satisfied, but...................

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Robert edwards
content: i think this is a great way to spead aleax and voice control through the house without spending to much money to complete your home automation needs i recommend this product but one thing to put out there is do not put this anywhere hou might want to listen to music because the speaker is weak for music but it says that on box but the speaker is good for aleax voice i had no problem hearing her response for the weather and stuff like that but it has a 3.5 jack and bluetooth if you wanted to connect to better sounding speakers
title: perfect companion to add with echo devices that you might have already

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
content: I bought one and liked it so much I bought a second Echo Flex. The $9.99 sale price was more than enough reason to try it out. Since the Echo Flex is a simple plug in device, the set up is a breeze. Voice activated, Alexia can answer or assist you in multiple ways. I don't recommend using it to listen to music, but just about anything else is great.
title: Echo Flex ushers you to Alexia's wide world of information!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Miguel Sanchez
content: Unfortunately I do have the rest of the family on echo’s and when I saw the echo flex came to my mind and excellent opportunity to spread my music around home. Connectivity was pretty fast and simple. The down is the speaker. I do understand it is not a speaker like the other ones but the highs on this device is so annoying and you feel you have a very bad and cheaper speaker. Again I do have the other echos and the sound it is much, much better.  I could pay more for a better sound worn then convenient of connectivity
title: Average

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Abrar
content: It's the perfect product to cover additional areas to reach Alexa where an Echo or Echo Dot would have been an overkill or not easy to place. This is a good addition to the Echo Family to use Alexa for your daily chores and Smart Home actions done from remote areas of the house. The speakers are not intended for music lovers but it sounds decent for it's little size and is good enough to communicate clearly with Alexa. The AUX jack and Bluetooth connectivity are good feature if you really want to use it for music. Overall, I love that I can now have these Alexa-minions all over my home to get Smart Home activities done without having to shout out to the main device.
title: Amazing product to extend Alexa reachability

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Patrick
content: My house is 75% operated by Alexa and these are a nice addition. I have 3 Echo Dots, but never liked the look of having one in the kitchen.  However, since my lights, TV, microwave, car audio, etc etc is smart I had one so I didn't have to relay on my phone or yell to reach Alexa in the living room.  I replaced my kitchen Echo Dot with a Flex and couldn't be happier. This is perfect for Alexa based functions and simple weather, traffic, or google type information.  Plugs right into the kitchen wall counter outlet so there is no cords.  I also use mine for a cooking timer.  If you utilize Amazon/Alexa I highly recommend getting at least one.
title: Smart buy. Alexa will thank you.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bruce B
content: I bought this to fill in gaps between echos so I could issue home automation commands as I walked up or down stairs. It’s great for this purpose. The sound quality is pretty poor, but fine for my purposes.  I didn’t by it for two way communications or to play music.  I have other echos, echo dots and Sonos for those purposes.  I intend to purchase a few more to continue to fill gaps to reduce the amount of yelling I need to do to reach echos.  I haven’t tried either the night light or motion detecting options.  I had already purchased several Philips Hue motion detectors for those areas where I needed motion to kick off a smart home action, such as turning lights on.
title: Works fine for my intended purpose

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brian Choi
content: This is basically the Echo Dot with very very bad mic and worse speaker.  Yes you can get bluetooth speaker and pair it but at that point, it's just better to buy the dot for $10 more.  Also the bluetooth speaker keeps getting dropped and have to pair again frequently. Mic is so bad that drop-in calls are like talking into cheap radio.  Doesn't even recognize over few feet away so you have to yell... which defeats the purpose of drop-in.  And when you yell, Echo dot in other rooms actually respond before this thing does. It's really bad that there's no way to adjust mic and speaker volume separately.
title: Bad mic, bad speaker

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: prduquesa
content: I'm very satisfied with this purchase. I have dots and echos all over the house and having this as a plug was great.  I love Amazon devices.  While in the kitchen I have it hidden and assists me controlling my lights and other devices plugged in the smart plugs. Speaker is ok but now I have it connected to another speaker by Bluetooth when I want to listen to music. I love it. Little by little changing everything to be controlled by smart plugs and devices. Next purchase will be echo smart to use with my Ring. :)
title: Small and effective

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stefan
content: I have few Echo dots and shows around the house, even in the garage. Use them primarily to operate smart lights and switches and lock. This little compact thing with no cord and adapter is great for that purpose. There is no volume button or much of a sound from it. But to interact with Alexa is great. If you like to listen to music, this thing isn’t for you, but for $10 this thing well worth every penny.  You can easily move it from one outlet plug to another no wire no adapter. I ordered another one!
title: Well worth the price

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Six20Seven
content: This little device surprised me. It probably has the most sensitive mics out of all of the Alexa enabled devices that I own (there's one in every room). It isn't uncommon for this device to respond from upstairs when I'm speaking in my living room a few feet away from a closer unit. The sound quality on this one isn't great, but it gets the job done for it's intended area. I love how compact it is and the fact that it has the USB port on the bottom for add-ons or for plugging in a cable to charge another device.
title: Perfect Alexa enabled device for bathrooms

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: aroe
content: This is a great extension of Alexa. Now we don't have to yell into the other room to turn lights off/on, add something to a list, set a reminder... I like that this is small and goes right in the outlet so that I don't have to have a dot sitting around taking up space. Certainly, you wouldn't want to listen to music through this, but that's not what it's for. It was SUPER easy to set up too. I plugged it in and, bc we already have the app and other devices, it did everything else to connect on its own.
title: Love that it's out of the way!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: pc
content: I used to have an Echo Auto.  I moved that hot garbage into the trash can and 1-stared it as quick as I could. Then I found this for $10 on prime day.  I plugged this into my car's 120v outlet and wired the audio into the car stereo.  With the hotspot on my phone I can now stream and use Alexa in the car!  It is game changing. My only wish is they made a version that supported bluetooth tethering. Why they didn't built the echo auto to do this in the first place is beyond me...
title: What the garbage Echo auto wished it could be when it grows up!  Think outside the box.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bennett
content: This device operates as a perfect little Alexa unit and it’s small size and adaptability really lets it go anywhere it needs to be the only downfall is the sound quality for music, but you can’t expect it to sound like The Echo. So if you don’t really need it for playing music at a party, you are good to go!!!
title: Small size, BIG value !!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jay
content: I also have an Echo Connect, so that I can use the Amazon Echo to call emergency services. So, I have an Amazon Echo all throughout my home, and I just recently had an incident where I needed an ambulance. It was nice to have an ambulance to my home within 5 minutes, called simply with a smart speaker. However, there was one room that did not have an echo or echo dot in it, so I figured that I should get something to help me in case I need an ambulance again and I if just happen to be in that room. I did not need a full speaker, or even an echo dot, because there is a computer in the room. I just wanted control of my smart home and the ability to make an emergency call. An Echo Flex provides a minimal use speaker in whatever room that you need so you don't have to yell across your house for one of these emergencies. It is a bare bones speaker, that doesn't sound too great, but it is functional and does the job. Great price.
title: handy for topping off your home

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: MavRick
content: This is a sweet little device for the garage. I always needed to talk to my echo device when I was getting ready to ride my motorcycle in the morning. I like the functionality of be able of being able to turn on and off my devices from the garage. The speaker however is terrible, it’s only good for hearing what my device is saying. Don’t even think about listening to music on this tinny little speaker. You will definitely have to purchase a Bluetooth or wired speaker if you want to listen to music.
title: Very handy little device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: tstrike
content: Let me set your expectations. Flex is the perfect device for small places... 1. Garages 2. Bathrooms (Shower resistant) 3. Closets 4. Quiet rooms So easy to install and works as well as any other Echo device. When I bought this I was thinking: Is it portable? YES IT IS. I can unplug it from my bathroom and plug it in my garage (my wifi extends there). It works AMAZINGLY WELL. Worth every freaking nickel. Grab one before they sell out. I am not kidding y'all. If you are in a condo like me, please make sure to close your doors so that your other Amazon echo devices do not get confused.
title: FLEX is the way to go!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Auntie M
content: Easy set up. Plug in and connect to your Alexa Account then your internet, BAM done, Set up Complete... I put this in Our office and now we can ask Alexa anything and everything, Listen to music, make phone calls, It's ENDLESS!!!  Also communicate with my Husband from the Kitchen or TV room... Going to buy more for Our Big house, It's better then the intercom from our Security System, Hands FREE... I will be buying more from this Buyer. Very Happy... Another Satisfied Customer...  : ))
title: FAST Shipping! Great Quality...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ScycoKat
content: When I heard about the echo flex from one of the people I watch on youtube I thought it would be a fantastic addition to my alexa family. I have two echo dots and now two echos flexes. The echo dot are good like for in my kitchen and bedroom especially playing music and asking it to do everyday things. The echo flex's strongpoint is hallways and in bathrooms. I think it is great for places that an echo dot isnt good for. It is small, and the night light attachment is wonderful. I use Alexa as the wake work for my echo dots and Echo as the wake word for both flexes. It helps with only waking one device instead of two. My echo flex can do everything my dot can just with a smaller speaker and such. When I walk to the kitchen I ask my hallway flex to turn on the kitchen smart bulbs, and when I walk out I tell her to turn them off. It is the perfect sidekick to the echo dot to me, and I highly recommend it. It beats having to buy a wallmount for an echo dot to do what the flex can do. As I said definitely recommend this for those inconvenient areas for the echo dot. My house gets smarter every day! Haha
title: Very useful for smaller echo dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Todd Stratton
content: I really like listening to music when I shower and when I saw the Flex thought it would be a much better solution than using my cellphone. The volume is good, but it sounds like the music is being played through a tin can. This is nowhere close to the sound quality of my other Echo devices (I have 4 Echo Dots, an Echo, Echo Flex now in my home and the Echo Auto for the car.) I hope that the sound quality will get better soon and I will hand this Flex down to my older brother. Still a good purchase! Just needs some more work! GREAT for the bathroom! (I have not been compensated in any way for this review, or to answer this question!)
title: This was a great solution for music in my bathroom, but...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: VQT
content: Got this for Xmas from family & here are my thoughts: + Makes a great radio while brushing teeth + Alexa smarts voice commands where you don't want Alexa video (Show) + 3rd reality night light attachment is great smart night light + Got back an AC outlet. - Pricey for what it is esp. with night light attachment. - Mono sound in 21st century?? - Should be smaller Overall, I am fortunate to get this as a gift but I would not pay $40 for both the Flex & Night light even if it saved an outlet. My QoL meter didn't move that much. LOL!
title: Perfect for around the bathroom sink but pricey!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: John
content: Due to the number of mixed reviews, I had low expectations for this product. After receiving item, I was actually impressed with it as the voice recognition and sound quality (while not the best) met my needs in my bathroom. I like how this plugs directly into the wall and doesn’t have cords hanging on my by bathroom counter. Alexa is able to hear my commands when I’m in the shower and I’m able to hear the music clearly. I wouldn’t say it’s worth the $24.99 price tag, but it is frequently on sale for $19.99.
title: Exceeded expectations

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Thomas R Scott
content: Relatively inexpensive.  The audio is nothing to crow about but it is sufficient as long as not listening to music. Voice recognition seems great. Only took 10-15 minutes to unpack and integrate into my existing system with Alexa on another device. It is portable within the structure wherever there is power. So easy to move to another room if I choose to upgrade to an Echo Dot or something in this room.  Thus, no loss of investment if I want something with better sound or some, as yet unknown, additional feature. Very satisfied.
title: Great little addition!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: B. Johnson
content: Basically I wanted to use Alexa in my den and not have a stand alone device.  This just plugs in under my desk and can do the things I need, like add something to shopping list, get my calendar, the weather, and control lights, etc.  Sound quality is a little "tinny" I think, but I didn't expect much from a plug-in device such as this.  Once or twice I received no response after I first set it up, but thus far, it has been ok.  I have had it now for a couple of weeks.  Should something change, I will update.
title: It does what I wanted it to do

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: judyannemt
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I live in a house with 4 bathrooms.  The master bath has a large jacuzzi tub.  It also has some weirdly place outlets.  This is perfect for me.  I have Alexa through the house, but not in the bathrooms.  With the flex, I can listen to music, set timers, ask Alexa silly questions.  The sound is a little tinny, but I can connect it to a bluetooth speaker.
title: Just what I wanted

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jack
content: If they had this unit when I started collecting Alexa devices I would have a lot more of these around the house.  It is a very compact and doesn't take any counter space.  Also it doesn't need any aftermarket device that's big and clumsy to hold it in a wall socket.  I had to ding it one star because of its rather poor sound quality.  But I have it in my walk in closet where I can turn off all the lights inside as I prepare for a good night's sleep. If you are like me and want to be able to control things from anywhere in your home then this is the unit to fill in those out of the way spots like a bath room and/or garage, etc.
title: Convient Compact Device for Wall Plug Mounting

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Chris Williams
content: I bought this on prime day for $10, and for that price I’d say it’s worth it. Honestly, the sound quality on it is pretty terrible compared to even my echo dot. But for what I use it for its great. We have the lights in our house controlled by Alexa, and there are a few places around the house where our Echo is too far away to hear you, so we supplemented with these and it works great.
title: Alexa integration is great, the sound quality is not.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: jcolemanhayes
content: The Echo Flex works just like every other Echo device and there are no complaints about the Alexa functionality but I can only give it 3 stars because the sound quality is bad.  I was not expecting HD sound from such a small device but the Flex's sound is a big downgrade from even an early version of the Echo Dot and as such it is not really great for streaming music.  If you only want to control smart devices or get the weather forecast it's fine but if you have room for buy an Echo Dot and wall mount for it.
title: Good Idea - Bad Sound Quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Adam S
content: I'm setting up my smart home and have temporarily setup this with a Echo Show 5 and Echo Spot in the same room. The Echo Flex seems to do more of the responding of the 3 devices. Stand in the room ask the question and I'd say 7 out of 10 times the Flex is the one responding to the inquiry. Sound quality is a bit lower but of course what can you expect from such a small speaker. This one will most likely end up in the bathroom with a light fixture that includes a Bluetooth speaker. Over all very happy with the results.
title: Seems faster

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. Emery
content: The unit works as expected. I like that it plugs directly into the outlet and doesn't require shelf or table space. Voice recognition works pretty well too. What disappoints me is that the unit produces very little volume. I mean, I have it maxed out and about 6 feet away and I can't hear it. There was a fan nearby, so I turned it to the lowest speed and I still couldn't hear. I turned off the fan and could barely make out what Alexa was saying. Unless this thing is literally next to you, I'd pass on it.
title: It works but has very little volume

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ty B
content: The set up was very easy. If you have other Alexa devices you just plug it in and it should just automatically connect with your network and ready to go. I placed mine in my bathroom and utilize it when I am getting ready for the day. It is a great product. The speaker is wonderful when wanting to hear the weather, traffic, news ect but isnt the best when listening to music but I hardly use it for that and Im sure with future generations of the flex they will improve on this. Over a wonderful Alexa product.
title: An amazing new addition to the Alexa family.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: mofella
content: We have a number of Echo devices around the house and I've always missed it on our deck. Seems I always think of something while out there. This was cheap enough and small enough  to be used out there. Deck is covered so it doesn't have to have any special water proofing. Now I can turn lights on/off in the house, raise/lower the shade I forgot before coming out or find that answer to my burning question. All I ask is just a bit more volume so I can hear it better. Makes relaxing just that much better.
title: Great device for the price

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JnOviedo
content: I use Amazon for my whole home sound system. I wanted a cordless option for my bathrooms. This is not the way to go! The sound quality is horrible! I mean horrible! Not good for music and if you have hearing aids, not good for talking to people, as the sound quality for voice is terrible! I would not recommend this if you want good sound. If you just want a very cheap speaker, this is your baby. Sorry Amazon, but I don't know why you would offer this up as an Amazon branded device. It really is a very bad speaker!
title: Good for talking to, but not for listening.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: budeelee19
content: It works well using the "nightlight" attachment. The unit by itself with nothing plugged in gets warm to the touch. Sound quality is horrible. Works fine in my bathroom where space is at a premium. UPDATE 10/29/2020: Having owned this device for almost 10months, I have this and the plugin bottom/top pointing light, The item rarely processes my questions/requests unless I get within 2 feet and raise my voice, and this is in without ANY background noise. Essentially it is a finicky, overpriced nightlight that works about 10% of the time. The volume level is horrible with no chance of hearing this with a shower running. Sorry, saddest echo/Alexa device I own.
title: Functions work as designed. Nothing fancy.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Johna Carter
content: You have to speak right next to it to be heard clearly. I purchased this to use as an intercom with another Alexa device upstairs belonging to my daughter. Every time I call I have to clarify who I am calling and the phone number or device attached to my daughter, the phone number sne she doesnt even have. Its annoying and this is the only reason I purchased it. The speaker quality is ok, playing music is similar to listening on my phone, not as good but it more practical for the kitchen.
title: Annoying

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: R. Farrow
content: This is a great device to use for all the Alexa functions, BUT it was not designed for sound. That is to say, you wouldn't want to play music on it. The speaker is much too small to use for that function. As I said before, it simply wasn't designed for that. It's a very convenient device for having access to all of Alexa's functions (like smart home device control, asking questions, accessing your calendar, notifications, reminders, timers, etc.) with the convenience of having it simply plug into a wall socket.
title: Great Device for What It Is

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: MADianne
content: I love this thing. I only previously had a dot, but i couldn't ignore this  offer. It's small, plugged into an extension cord under my bed. It connected easily, It wakes up when I want it to and does the things I ask. When I alert it its light reflects off my bedside table so I know it hears me every time. I'm not too bothered about music quality, but it's not as bad as I had expected, and it can be set to a timer so it switches itself off, and doesn't wake me up later in the night. Great product.
title: Does what I want splendidly

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: terric2
content: Weak speaker, not loud enough to hear in the shower without connecting to a speaker. Poor voice recognition, it often doesn't "hear" the wake up word. On the plus side, the set up was super easy, basically just plugged it in and changed the name in the settings. I wouldn't recommend this one for heavy usage or music. It would be ok for occasional things like checking the weather or time or something. I like how small it is and that I don't have to hide the wire. I'm not going to bother sending it back but I wouldn't buy it again.
title: Meh

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sheila
content: I added these to my hallway and bathrooms. They play music wonderfully! Great quality sound for how small they are. Easy to connect. I will be adding more through out my house. They are absolutely perfect for those spots in between your echo devices.... no more yelling across the house! I suggest getting the motion and or the night light that plugs in them. I have one of each. Motion sensor I put on my flex in my hallway which will turn the bathroom and hallway light on when triggered.  After 1 minute (you can set it for as long as you want) it will turn the lights off.
title: Great Quality for its size! No more yelling across the house

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Víctor E. Díaz
content: Es un dispositivo que cubre las necesidades a cabalidad,  una solución practica y rápida a un excelente precio. Ventajas: Integración total con el universo Alexa Practico de instalar y configurar Cero cables eso es maravilloso Posibilidad para adaptaciones por USB (maravilloso, aunque solo hay dos soluciones disponibles al momento de este post Color apropiado y diseño agradable Precio accesible Desventajas: Algunas veces le cuesta activar el modo escucha, por lo que toca repetir varias veces el comando de activación La voz del asistente se escucha encasillada (aceptable, nada de que preocuparse) Resumen Totalmente recomendado 100%
title: Excelente solución a excelente precio

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: G Blackwell
content: update after a few months i can report its actually terrible i have 5 echo dots and an echo input in my car they are working well this Flex it just not good if you turn up the sound it cant hear you anymore and even without music playing you have to use the wake word 2 or more times then once music is playing it never hears you right to change a song so now you have to shout at the stupid thing to shut it up i would not buy this i would get the dots or a Input instead i hoped being able to plug it in and it not be on the counter that it was going to be handy in the bathroom but now i just want to flush it down the toilet
title: not so good

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. FARMER
content: I had been using my phone apps to turn on/off a couple of fans and extra lighting I installed in my garage.  I had often thought using Alexa would be more handy than using the phone in my garage as my hands would sometimes be full, but I was not going to buy a full blown Echo for it.  Then I saw the Echo Flex.  It can hear me from anywhere in the garage to turn these on or off.  While it does not provide full concert sound, it is not too bad for listening to music while working out there as well.
title: Great In My Garage!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: E. Robertson
content: The sound quality is not as bad as I thought it would be based on reviews. We now have one in most rooms and use it for a pleasant whole house soundscape. I use the shopping list feature constantly, wake up every morning to a programmed routine, listen to my audiobooks, and use a third party app to log my food and calories throughout the day. “Play everywhere” and how the echo devices talk to each other is still very buggy. But overall we’re pleasantly surprised by how helpful these echo flex guys are.
title: We love it, it’s made our lives better

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Alan
content: Buggy! I hope it improves. I like the idea of an echo you simply plug in, however the Echo Flex falls short, and I’m not even discussing the terrible speaker it comes with. I knew about that before I purchased it, and the primary use is in the hallway where sound quality doesn’t matter. This device is buggy. It sometimes drops WiFi where none of my other devices drop. I have 6 Echo Dots and 2 Echo Show 5s in addition to my other devices, phones, computers, TVs, etc, all on my WiFi mesh that covers the whole house. It also has issues integrating with my Alexa/Hue smart home configuration. There are specific rooms setup with lights that it will not control. For example, if I say “Alexa, turn off the basement lights” the Flex will respond with “I don’t know that device.” None of my other Echo dots have any issues with this, just the Flex does. You’re better off buying an Echo Dot (any gen), just wait for the many sales throughout the year.
title: Buggy! I hope it improves.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sunshine
content: Imagine soft smoothing music in the restroom!  LOL!  That's one thing that I like about it. I purchased Flex because I need to know the time while showering or doing my hair in the bathroom and it's easer to ask Flex instead of yelling at the top of my lungs to my Echo in the kitchen.  I love being able to hear my alarms much better also.  To me, it's not meant to play the most amazing music...that's what the mama Echo is for.  But added to my speaker group and walking into the restroom and not missing a beat...priceless!
title: I like it!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Computer Dude
content: I knew this thing was going to sound bad even before I set it up, but I was not expecting the voice recognition to also be so bad as it is.... Example: Each of my 3 Echo Show devices and 6 other Echo devices can easily understand the command "PLAY WHYY from TUNE-IN" (i.e. my local NPR Public Radio Station).  This Echo Flex device - ugh!!! - it never gets it right.... it understands the command as "A RADIO PHILLY Y-NOT RADIO".... or "Y FROM TUNE-IN". I'm keeping it in the garage, where it belongs... for now.
title: It's OK...just don't expect much

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Troynnc
content: Great addition to my Echo home system. Have it set up at coffee maker. Added night light. So cool that you can choose and change light color. So now I can check weather and things while getting morning coffee. Have volume set low as to not bother others in the house. Can run my home automation right down to cranking my car and opening garage door and gate. I changed this device to respond to “computer” instead of “Alexa” this way no chance my devices in other rooms can pick up on request.
title: My new coffee command central.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kevin Curtis
content: We put it in an occasionally used office in a detached garage and connected it to a couple of nice quality bookshelf speakers we had via an inexpensive amplifier that we ordered on Amazon.  Nice sound.  Plays assorted music categories and our Amazon music playlists. Works like any other Alexa device.  Intercom feature to call between the Echo Dot in our house and the Echo Flex in the office is cool. Also, turns on the lights and does everything that our Echo Dot was already set up to do.
title: Great Addition to the Alexa Family

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mlspirit
content: So much sound out of such a small device. Is about 1/2 as loud as echo dot. But works for what I wanted. If you wanted to use in bathroom it may work but was not loud enough for this. I was debating buying a second for that but when I tested it there was too quite. We have a wireless Walmart small speaker we use and I was hoping to get something like this for the bathroom. We use upstairs for my kids rooms to reach them easily. Which is what I bought this for. Like a intercom.
title: Great intercom and extras. Will not be loud enough for bathroom. 1/2 sound as echo dot

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: magmag
content: We bought two to expand range of the kitchen Alexa: master bath and master bedroom.  Alexa hears and responds loudly enough that if either of us were alone and fell in the shower I think she'd hear us yelling to call someone (can't call 911). We have called our kids to test her use of our contact list.  Our friend fell in her bedroom, broke 3 bones, and lay on floor for 4 hours till found. That's why we bought this.  You can ask Alexa the usual stuff from these plugin units. Very simple.
title: Good adjunct to main Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Noah
content: I just started using echo devices for about a month now and I must say I love them a lot they are very useful for things like turning lights on and off, Playing music, etc My first echo device was the dot and the audio quality on that was pretty good so when I saw the flex and the line on the product page saying that its not optimized for music I wasn't expecting much for music I just wanted to be able to have one to use in the bathroom when I wake up in the morning, However when I did play music on it, it worked pretty good, now it wasn't nearly as good as the sound on a plus or dot but its still good! I would say the audio quality is about the same as a modern smartphone speaker now as far as voice recognition goes its a bit lacking, When I'm talking to my Plus or dots they normally hear me pretty well and respond right away when I say "Alexa" However with the flex I find myself shouting at it to hear me when other people are in the same room talking, overall I'd say its a great value for the money if you don't have anywhere to set a dot and want to spend a little less
title: The sound quality is actually pretty decent despite what other reviews say

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: TheBigIke
content: I have Echo's all over the house and wanted to use the Flex in the kitchen because of its nice design.  Unfortunately the Flex doesn't hear or pickup our voice when more than 4 feet away and instead the Dot in the living room responds. There's also an issue when connected to Bluetooth and someone tries to "drop-in" to the Flex. It annoyingly constantly disconnects and connects to Bluetooth for a few minutes after someone tries to drop in. The Flex is good to fill spots in the house that are rarely used but isn't good for areas that'll have high usage such as the kitchen - unless you're always planing to stand right in front of the device when activating it.
title: Great design, poor voice recognition

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DanC
content: The Echo Flex is really a perfect device for adding to your system. Small areas where you need to access Alexa make this item a must have. We have put them in the bathroom with the add on light module for emergency purposes, in the upstairs room so you don't have to yell downstairs, you get the idea. We listen to the news and music on them and they do the job. For the price you should not expect audiophile sound anyway and it has more than met the expectations we had for how useful the Flex would be.
title: Perfect for area's where Alexa access is needed.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jean
content: I loved the idea of the quick plug-in Flex and looked forward to having access to Alexa, especially music, weather and news, back in my master bathroom. I do like the simplicity and convenience,  but the sound quality is so hollow an flat sounding that I quickly get annoyed and have to turn it off. If the sound quality were greatly improved, I'd add a  Flex to every room in the house, plus the deck!
title: Flex sound quality falls short

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stephen L. Riggs II
content: Great for Bathrooms or Kitchens where counter space is at a premium. Use the USB to charge a phone, or use the attachments to add an RGB smart light to your room, or the motion sensor to automatically trigger lights or routines you setup in the Alexa app. Sound is hi on treble but in a bathroom that’s what you want to hear over running water. But it has Bluetooth and an 8mm headphone jack so you can easily add a better speaker if needed for your space. This little guy is a great addition to the ecosystem and exceeded my expectations In every way.  Well played Amazon.
title: Exceeded my expectations on every level.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: wanloo
content: When I saw this extra small "Alexa", I knew I had to have it. I already have the Echo in the master bath for listening to music (absolutely love it). I didn't have one in the bedroom because I didn't have the space for it. This tiny little Flex serves the purpose. I specifically use it to turn on/off bedroom light and to get the weather forecast. You can still use it for music, but it doesn't compare to the Echo or the Echo Show - so I don't use it for that. It is small and doesn't take up much space on the plug - you can still access the other outlet (but only of of the two USB ports). It also has an USB port on the top which makes up for loosing one of the ports on the outlet. I highly recommend it.
title: Perfect Place to Hide Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nick
content: Excellent device for small spaces or places where it's more convenient to just plug into a receptical and not have all that extra cable to deal with. I use mine inside of a bathroom vanity cabinet and it's a neat solution. The only downside is that you sacrafice almost all of your audio quality. This device is very quiet and makes streaming music sound tinny. I would buy this only if the form factor makes sense to you and you don't care so much about audio quality (or place to have it stream to another speaker).
title: Great form factor, poor audio

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Vicki
content: We have Amazon Echo devices in every room of our house. I wanted one in the garage so that when I hear my husband go into the garage from the house, I could use the Echo in the family room as an intercom to ask him to bring me something out of the garage freezer, but the Echo Dots have fabric on them which would get dirty if left out there full time. When I discovered the Echo Flex, I knew it was perfect for my garage since it does not have fabric on it. However, when we workout in the garage, we take the Echo (3rd Gen) Smart Speaker from the Sewing room to listen to our favorite radio stations. The music sound quality is so much better than the Echo Dot and Echo Flex.
title: Great for the garage

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Penelope Penworthy
content: Flex, is just as easy as Echo, to install and use.  It takes up very little space and with an extension cord, you are able to move is around the room.  Great for older homes that were built before electricity was installed... afterwards being wired with too few outlets.  The Alexa, voice is loud and clear.  I would like it to be made possible to change the voice yet, I know of no way to do so.  When it goes on sale for $15 or less, grab a few and spread then though out your dwelling.
title: Buying the Flex, device is your money Well Spent.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Becky
content: This thing is garbage. The sound is so weak that it can't be heard over any ambient sound, even at top volume. I've tried to pair three different speakers to it to extend its usability, and it didn't recognize any of them. So I tried a direct connection using a chore and the sound is still terrible. May be marginally useful to send commands to smart devices but don't expect to be able to hear any responses to your questions. It's a total waste of money, even worse than the auto echo.
title: Hot garbage

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D
content: I got this in order to utilize motion sensors and have extra alexa inputs.  The sound in this device is terrible, and I was ok with that as a cheaper device that provided "flexibility" with a light or motion sensor.  Unfortunately, the motion sensor doesn't work reliably, and really the motion sensor and light should have been one device to plug in, and not 2 separate devices that you have to choose from.  A terrible sounding alexa paired with a semi-functional motion detector equals a waste of money for me.  I would have been better off just buying a echo dot and more smartthings sensors.
title: Might be useful if any of the plugin devices were useful.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jonathan Blackwell
content: Everything is 5 star except the audio and that is not a knock on this product. It isn't meant for music but it does play music and if you have this and need great sound, it can be wired to a speaker or paired via BT. That said, it is super convenient and I have used these with both the light and motion sensor to great effect. Simply stated, they are awesome. I put them in all of the areas of the house where an Echo does not make sense. Hallway, bathrooms, etc. I now have access to Alexa literally everywhere in my 3k SF home.
title: Very helpful in my Alexa smart home

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jason K.
content: Everything works great, except you absolutely cannot hear it unless you're in a quiet environment. Here's the best example I could think of:  If you're in a car, doing 70 on the interstate, and the window is cracked by 2 inches or so, with the radio turned up about 25%.........if this thing was in the passenger seat, you wouldn't be able to hear it at all.  Turn the radio off and you could hear that it was saying something, but you wouldn't be able to understand what was said. Hope that helps.
title: You REALLY can't hear it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Martin S
content: The sound quality was just not there. In order to use this you will have to plug in a speaker, which means if you don't have a great quality speaker, you are getting horrible sound. Also, the Alexa app is totally different for this. It WILL NOT allow you to play a specific song unless you subscribe AND PAY FOR the Amazon Music Unlimited service. This is pretty much a worthless item. If I hadn't gotten it and saved it to give for a Christmas gift it would be returned, but as it is, I am past the return window. GARBAGE!!
title: Wow...just, wow...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Vitus Yuen
content: If you want to have access to Alexa, but are tight on counter space then the Echo Flex is your goto item. All you need is an electric socket (suggest about 4' above the ground) and it's slim enough that it will not cover the second outlet. I have mind in our laundry room where counter space is a commodity; Echo Flex sits on the wall and out of the way. The sound quality is not great for music, but the list of available attachments from motion sensor, USB charging port, etc and everything Alexa, makes up for it. I'm very happy with the Echo Flex and would recommend it to anyone who want's access to Alexa but don't have the space for the standard Echo.
title: Don't have the space.. there's a Echo for that.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: L Smith
content: So far so good. This thing is the size of earlier smart wall plugs/switches or a wifi extender. It seems to be very accurate and there are no problems that I have noted. The speaker is not really good for music, no bass. But it does have a connection for an external speaker if that is the route you want to go.
title: Echo Flex is Small!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: MD
content: Wasn’t exactly sure about it, but then I paired it with a Bluetooth speaker .... love it.  It’s Alexa Unleashed.  I’ve plugged the Echo Flex in my walkout basement and then can take my portable speaker into the back yard.  A great, and incredibly reasonable solution.  Went out and bought a second one.
title: It’s Alexa Unleashed ... pair with Bluetooth speaker.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: M. F. A.
content: This is not the best device for sound quality, but it is a cost-effective device for small spaces where you want to control smart devices, use it as an intercom, and have it answer questions, listen to podcasts, or provide news and other information.  I wouldn't use it for a high-quality music experience, but I routinely take it with me when I travel.  the fact that it has a usb port and options for add-ons (like a night light) are a definite plus. Perfect for a guest bedroom.
title: Great little device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Cory
content: I have one of these in my kitchen, as there's not really room to place a full-sized Alexa. It is perfect for setting timers, controlling home automation devices, and even calling into other rooms. Music quality, however, is lacking severely. I often find myself using the speakers in my living room at a higher volume, as the audio on this sounds worse than an Echo Dot. This was a small compromise, as the ability to set timers in the kitchen and not have alarms going off in other rooms made the Flex worth it.
title: Great for small spaces, audio needs improvement

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stephanie K.
content: We were looking for (something) that would help with our son's bedtime routine as sneaking out of his room after being put to bed was obviously more exciting than actually going to sleep at a decent hour... We opted away from the Dot/Kids Dot as we didn't want the unit within reach for even more distraction (out of sight out of mind mentality) and the Flex direct plug was able to be perfectly hidden in a corner plug behind the bed. For the most part, the voice recognition works just as well as our other devices ... besides the times our son is using his silly voice so totally his fault. As some other reviews mentioned, the speaker isn't as great as other devices, but also wouldn't expect it to be. We do play sleep stories/sounds at a low volume as part of our bedtime routine and haven't had any issues with the sound. Would recommend for small spaces (or in areas you don't want the unit out in the open) Connected devices within the room: Smart Plug (controlling lamp) and Echo Glow
title: Great for Small Kids Room

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Andrea Hunter-McIntosh
content: I purchased both of my echo flex’s on prime day as my little gift to the house and I love it. I have one in the half bath and in my (small) kitchen.
