content: Just like previous reviews, Amazon didn't put much effort into the speaker.  It sounds like old school Bluetooth speakers from back in the day, but not good to listen to music.  Other than the poor quality speaker, everything else works well (integration and voice response).  Perhaps I should have waited for new generations to come out before purchasing.
title: Works well, but speaker quality is terrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kirsten T. Hechler
content: I like that is small and love the night light, especially that it can change colors. My only dislike is the sound quality. It is terrible. It is not good for playing music. I’m sure I’m expecting too much for this compact flex. Still worth owning though. I use it for alarm and to read me the news.
title: Sound quality lacking

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Roxy1268
content: Great item but purchase a small speaker to pair with it. I got a small shower speaker ( $16) it has a suction cup and can be placed anywhere in the bathroom( mines on my mirror) it makes the volume so much louder and better.. you won’t be able to hear the music in the shower without a small speaker attached to it. I love it and it’s so perfect for the bathroom
title: Great little device but....

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: David Esq.
content: I use this in my boy’s bathroom. He likes to play a song while he brushes his teeth or takes a bath. The nightlight is great because he doesn’t have to turn on the lights to use the bathroom in the middle of the night. The sound quality is fine. It isn’t quite as pure sounding as the Dot, but it gets the job done for the time we need it.
title: Nice Alexa extension for a small room.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael B
content: It's purpose is a cheap Alexa satellite and it does OK at best. I have one set up to control an Amazon Smart Outlet, and I have to shouts and constantly repeat myself to get the flex to recognize my commands properly. If I get down on the floor next to it I can use it normally. It seems like the flex are missing the far-field microphone technology.
title: Not very responsive, but does work.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: an
content: I haven’t bought a new Alexa voice product recently, so I was really surprised at how easily this was set up. It was almost just plug and play. I wish both this and the Dot could go higher with the volume. I listen to books or music while in the bath- not loud enough to hear in the shower. It was a great deal for a smart little piece of technology.
title: Sooo much easier

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Cu Mor Glas
content: At 15 dollars this was a steal.  At 20 an ok deal.  It is what it claims to be.  An echo that hangs in an outlet directly and has mediocre sound.  It it perfect for my kitchen where I would not be listening to music anyway.  It does just fine at what I need it to do in the kitchen.  Which is set timers, convert measurements, and control the lights.
title: Perfect kitchen Alexa.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ken
content: The very small plug-in is a great way to add the power of Alexa quickly to a space. We also really like the small nightlight that we plugged into the device. The one downside to the size is noticeable on a “drop-in” call — the microphones are not as good at picking up the speaker’s voice as on the echo dot or it’s other bigger speakers.  It is definitely worth the price, though and very easy to setup and use.
title: Easy way to add Alexa to smaller rooms.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: GMD of Yorkshire, UK
content: This little device is perfect for my kitchen outlet and kitchen use: setting timers for cooking, creating reminders and grocery lists, listening to morning news, traffic, and weather etc. I have Amazon devices throughout my home but didn’t want cords in the kitchen. Also ordered the nightlight attachment which you can change to 12 different colors. If you are an Alexa junky-like me- you need this little gadget and nightlight add-on in your life!
title: Perfect for Kitchen!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Robert G. Summers
content: I really like the ease of setup here on this new Echo Flex, and it's as handy as heck, just right there, nice little shelf and charger for your phone. I bought it for my wife's new home office and she loves it. Able to add reminders, and get notifications all at an arm's length away. The speaker is not that great, though it is audible and for reading weather, and calendar it's perfect. If I need better quality it does have a jack to plug speakers into if I remember right.
title: Handy Dandy Alexa at your fingertips

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Taylor Bevins
content: I got the Alexa Flex for my bedroom. The use was to turn things on/off in my bedroom (such as lights, TV, and fans) and occasionally ask Alexa the time or weather. The sound quality in the Alexa Flex is very low. At times I can't even hear her. There has also been several times the voice recognition hasn't even acknowledged my voice. I have asked Alexa a few times in a roll (close up to the device) before with no response. I would eventually give up and login onto my app to do what I am asking her to do. Overall I am not satisfied. I would highly recommend just getting a Alexa Dot. I have the Alexa Dot for my living room and it is overall a great product. I will be purchasing another one soon to replace the Alexa Flex in my room. I hope this advice helps someone.
title: Sound quality is very low and the voice recognition doesn't pick up at times.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nelson T.
content: I’m very disappoint in the unit, not worth the money due to the sound quality is horrible. I read the reviews and thought the sound could t be to bad for the bathroom sink area to listen to weather and news as brushing teeth. Restocking fee and returning was only available for a fee at Amazon locker, not the UPS store. So the unit sits in my drawer
title: Rey poor sound quality not work it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: CDRMBung
content: The speaker in it is equivalent to something you'd hear in like a 50's era radio... but the speaker isn't the reason to get this. The best reason for getting this is for the USB addons, either the night light or, in my case, the motion sensor. I mounted it in my garage on our freezer using a old hard drive magnet, an extension cord, and a few twist ties. Now Alexa automatically turns on the garage light when I open the door to go in there(and after 15 mins of no motion it turns it off in case I forget to ask it to turn it off myself). So far so good, and If I want any other motion sensors, this is probably the easiest solution for a house that's already bought in to working with Alexa.
title: Buy this for either the motion sensor or nightlight. Buy a Dot if you want a decent speaker.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Garland William Whitlow
content: I bought this to put in the upstairs hall. I wanted Alexa to make announcements for me to the kids for things like "Dinner is ready" or "come pick up the stuff you left by the door". It works great and does what I expected it to. I did not by the night light that can be used with it but having USB power is a great idea, just not sure how we will use it. Im sure I'll find a phone in the floor charging at some point in time though :)
title: nice little addition

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Felipe R Frisoli
content: I basically set that whenever I get into my kitchen, it'll turn on the lights for a few minutes. The motion sensor is good, but be aware that its motion arc doesn't have 180º, so it won't work if you simply show up to its side. The echo flex works really well. You "can" use it to listen to music, although it's just a basic speaker. The echo is just so you can "talk" to Alexa somewhere outside the range of your Echo Dot / Echo Show or your "main base".
title: I got lazy

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ARG
content: We put an Echo Flex in our kids room and one in our bathroom. For the most part, The sound quality is pretty good and gets the job done! Our bathroom is on the smaller side (6x9 give or take) and the sound bounces off the walls well. We have to put it at Volume 10 to hear it clearly with the shower running but it’s not bad! The kids room we use it as a noise machine at night and the kids like to play music during the day while they are playing. The only down side is that the voice recognition isn’t the best. Our Echo Dot clearly understands my voice as well as my 5 and 2 year olds voices. The flex doesn’t quite recognize their voices yet. Other than that, it does exactly what I need it to do!
title: Decent little version of Alexa!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Seattle Darren
content: I have echo dots in every room in my house but I purchased this specifically for the nightlight add on feature for my grandchildren’s nap time. I was able to set up a routine called “nap time” that turns on the night light and also turns on white noise. Then I created a routine called “nap finished” that turns off the light and the sound. Works perfect!
title: Great for nap time!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Damon H.
content: This thing is hot garbage. I've also have both the 2nd gen and 3rd gen Echo Dots and they work flawlessly. With the Echo Flex, I find myself having to repeat the trigger word and commands multiple times even when standing less than 5 feet from the device. By comparison, I can speak at normal volume and my Dots can hear me from across the room without issue. A few times, though the Flex right next to me wouldn't hear my command, I would be answered by one of my Dots in an adjacent room. The two pinhole mics on the Flex just can't pick up your voice as well as the multiple mics on the Dots. The Flex would also lose its connection to my bluetooth speaker periodically, which my Dots never did. Spend a few bucks more for the Dot and save yourself the frustration.
title: Hard pass. Just get the Echo Dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bluegoose53
content: Met my expectations on sound quality. It replaced an original Echo (full-size) that had failed - did get a trade-in value for that failed device.. Hooked up a small Bluetooth to the Flex - now much better. Probably one of the easiest installs of an Alexa device that I've ever done. Really like the USB power outlet. Wish it came in black or grey.
title: Handy and unobtrusive

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: RJackson
content: Plug it in and you're 90% done. Look, it's a mini speaker. It's not for music or high volume. pair with a BT speaker and it's as good as any echo if you want it for music .  I have it on the patio which is very handy if I"m leaving and forget the lights or open/close the garage door. Can't beat the price. I'm ordering another one for the garage.
title: What can you say? It's an Alexa Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Fan
content: I love that you can tell Alexa something in a random spot.  (Half the time I want to walking up the stairs which is where this is).  I got the add on night light.  I wish you have it turn in and off with motion rather than just always be on when it gets dark.  Other that that it is exactly what it says it is!  Great addition to the product line!
title: It’s exactly what it says it is - no more

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Calculon
content: Horrible microphone, had to raise my voice so much that a second gen echo dot a room away picked it up, but the flex still didn’t. The only thing I like is the motion sensor which seems to work great. I mainly got it to use in the kitchen cause someone in the comments mentioned that the mic is great, but that turned out to be the absolute worst part of it. Maybe I got a bad one...
title: Horrible mic

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Larry Shockley
content: Purchased 1 so far.  It fits nicely in the master bathroom.  Got the smart light to go with it and as you might guess makes a great night light.  I like the Cyan color.  We have an older house so electrical outlets in the right locations for the Echo Flex are few.  Thinking of adding one to our travel trailer, tethered to my cell phone hot spot.
title: Nice addition to my Alexa enable house

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: M. A. Ruggles
content: Easy and super fast to set up, and easy to use since it doesn’t hog plug in space like some electronics.  Actually, I think this one responds better than our other two Echo devices.  Makes it easier to control the whole home without taking up much space. I love having it in the kitchen so I can have multiple timers running, and the add-on nightlight is great.
title: More smart home functionality in a little bitty space

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Christian Bateman
content: Alexa doesn’t work the same with this device as it does with our other devices. We love using Amazon story time, and we were in a bind when we went to stay with family over the holidays, so I purchased one of these hoping it would work as well as our dots back home. It works alright, but it would go through cycles of repeating the same thing over and over again, or acknowledging a command and then not doing anything with it. Anyways, a little frustrating, but for $12, it still seems like a deal, just not sure if we’ll be using it unless we have to like when we’re traveling for example.
title: Alexa not the same on this device :(

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mark Hargrove
content: The speaker on this device is tiny and not at all useful for anything beyond basic voice feedback from the unit.  With that in mind, it's a very convenient form-factor if you're using Alexa for home automation tasks.  It nicely fills in 'gaps' in voice recognition coverage in places where it's just not convenient to use other Echo form-factors.
title: Nice Module -- As Long as You Don't Care About Sound Quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: a2thdoc
content: The Echo Flex is a great addition to the Echo products. We have two of them which give us an almost-stereo effect in the family room and living room when paired with an Echo Show and Echo Dot. Easy to set up and they sync themselves. Could also be used to plug in a woofer if desired. The Flex supports all of the usual Alexa commands.
title: Great addition to the Alexa family

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Do-rite
content: When I first heard about the Flex, I wanted one. For the price and after reading so many bad reviews, I backed off. With my health, and knowning people who have died or gotten sick with this covid, I gave it more thought. I have one Dot in the front room and one in the bedroom. Paying just $9.99, I now have the Echo Flex in the bathroom. The first thing I did was play music. At its highest volume, I was able to hear he music in the bedroom. It may not have been the crispest of sounds, but I grew up dancing in the yard to the sounds of a transistor radio. The reason for purchase was to have a light above the toilet, but more importantly, to be able to make a phone call if I was to fall and couldn't get up, or in case of other medical emergencies. I have in my contacts the local 10-digit emergency number.
title: Could be a lifesaver!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: RL100
content: I bought this on a Prime Day special and it was at a very reasonable price.  I like the idea of having access to Alexa in another room.  The sound quality is just okay and on occasion Alexa doesn't know in which room to respond to me. I bought it for about $10 so for that price it is worth it but if you want something with better sound I would not recommend the Echo-Flex.
title: Sound quality is just OK/fair

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Wild Explorations
content: A lot more convenient than going to the other end of the house to get my spouse to come down to dinner, or using the phone. It was plug and play, very little effort required to set it up. It's been very useful so far, I like it a lot. I can 'drop in' to the home office from my phone even if I'm not home, or from the kitchen using my Echo Show. Quite handy.
title: Super convenient

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LINDA
content: I love the device but it has started playing music on it's own, and not the type I would EVER listen to, a couple of times. My echo dot understands it is me, when I am speaking, but my flex does not always know it is me when I request to call my phone and suggest different names for phone to call. Other than that, it performs well and the USB port is great!
title: Helpful

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: L. Stern
content: I bought these for my Dad and the speaker on the flex is very quiet with no ability to adjust the volume.  We did connect it to a bluetooth speaker, but that speaker does not connect when receiving a call on the flex. Works for announcements and using alexa, but not for receiving calls on the flex.  Otherwise great little device.  Just bought 2 more to use as intercoms in my kids' rooms.
title: Speaker very low

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michele T.
content: This unit is a nice complement to other units in the house. This one is in the basement to provide some controls and Alexa access in that area. I wasn’t looking for high fidelity and this speaker doesn’t provide it. It offers clean clear communication and is responsive across the room. If you plan to play music, this is not your choice. For what I wanted, it was perfect.
title: Exactly what I wanted.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bob Kohrs
content: I purchased two of these because they were inexpensive and I wanted to listen to music in the bathroom and garage.  The speaker quality isn't the best, but for the price, I'm happy!!!
title: For the price, you can't beat it!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: miguel smith
content: This is a great little device, its not expensive and it gives most if not all of Alexa functions. In some instances I even found the echo flex to be more responsive in answering my call for Alexa. Its super easy to use and u can charge other device with the USB port or just add a motion sensor or night light to it...just plug in the wall and ur good to go
title: Great

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brandon K Boone
content: I like that this product integrates with my other Alexa products easy. The nightlight attachment is perfect for my daughters room. The speaker on this thing is only good for Alexa responses, music sounds terrible. We are keeping a smart speaker in her room because of this. I would only buy this product if you want to give voice commands in a particular room.
title: Good integration, terrible speaker

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: VB
content: It is a good addition to the family of Echo devices - compact, convenient, inexpensive, and does what I expect it to do - mostly to control one of our Samsung smart TVs. Also reports weather, and some news. To play music we use Echo Show 5. Echo Flex occasionally showed blinking light for no reason, but still accepted commands. I had to unplug it, and plug in again - to restore its quiet sleeping state.
title: Good to control TV, compact, inexpensive

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: That Guy
content: Oh Alexa how I love thee! It’s a welcome addition to product line. It can fit into places that might not be so convenient for the bulkier Alexa models. The small size combined with that low price tag has got me putting them everywhere in my house. It has all the functionality that you’ve come to expect from Alexa devices. The only con is the small sound. It just doesn’t have the volume of the other devices. I think it’s to be expected for its size. It does have a 3mm port to plug in a auxiliary cord to connect it to other devices as well as Bluetooth support. What I think is neat is that you can purchase two add on accessories to enable this device to have a night light and a motion sensor. All in all I think it’s a great product for the price and the size. It’s a must have. Buy it today!
title: I love it!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Old reader
content: I love my Flex because it saves me from walking all over the house to announce meal times.
title: Easy to use

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: OpenTrackRacer
content: I have a whole mess of third generation Echo Dots plus an Echo Input.  They're great but I needed to add another in a room where I didn't really have place for a Dot (even with a outlet mount) and where sound quality wasn't an issue.  Enter the Echo Flex.  It's WAY smaller than I expected and works great,  Highly recommended for hard to fit locations.
title: Small and convenient

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Steven Davis
content: The speaker is so small you can hardly hear Alexa. I bought an external speaker to plug into it. (Defeating the purpose of it plugging in outlet and staying off the counter in my kitchen)  she is also hard of hearing. I have to yell to get her attention most of the time. I should have bought the dot instead. I will not make the same mistake.
title: Just get the dot

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Hzam
content: I already had an echo show and needed something in the bedroom just to control the smart home devices. This does the job and is easily hidden behind a dresser and can still hear us and do the job. The sound quality is ok for my use case but you can't listen and enjoy songs on it. For the price if your usage is similar to mine I'd highly recommend.
title: Good for smart home device control.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Semmie Neely
content: This product was introduced to the public without completing its testing phase.  There are numerous connectivity and sync issues that could have been resolved before getting customers to pay and give feedback for issues you could have easily resolved.  Yes, this device is a fun toy at this point; however, could be much more functional.  I've purchase three out of curiosity and should have purchased only one since this device does not have a surround sound capability. I'm keeping an eye out and wishing you success.
title: Good idea but need improvements.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lori Utoft
content: I have 3 stories in my house (including finished basement) and I really didn't want to have multiple Echo dots, so I purchased this along with a smart plug.  Set up was so easy - basically plugged it in and opened up the app on my phone and it was ready to go.  Same thing with the smart plug.  Now, no matter what floor I'm on doing something, I can ask Alexa a question or have her turn on a light when I'm coming into a room or add something to my shopping list instead of having to wait until I'm within range of my Echo.  Sound quality is better than I was expecting for playing music (other reviews weren't so great on this part, but I think it's just fine)  I highly recommend this device.
title: Absolutely love this option

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Cat1fl914
content: I’m happy with the flex. I also bought the nightlight and put the set in my bathroom. I live in a one bedroom apartment and have an echo dot 3rd gen in the living room, which I love. However, when I’m in the bedroom, I have to raise my voice to turn off the lights. Now I don’t have to :). And, I love all the colors of the nightlight.I got the flex on sale. Now I wish I bought a few more to give to family members, who have the echo dot, as gifts. Hopefully, they go on sale soon. If you want a little extra “boost” for your echo dot or plus, it definitely will do the job. One caveat - the speaker is tinny. Def not for music....
title: It’s great for my needs

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: crb42
content: I had an Echo Dot in my bathroom to listen to the news when I shaved in the morning.  The problem was it took up counter space and was prone to getting splashed.  The Echo Flex plugs directly into the outlet so is off the counter and out of harm's way.  The audio quality is a bit low for music due to the size of the unit, but for my purposes, its fine.
title: Perfect for my purposes

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Chris Caudill
content: This is a great little Echo device and for $20 it's hard to be too critical, but I would love it if the speaker got a little louder (it's a bit hard to hear from across the room) and the voice recognition doesn't seem to be as good as the new echo dots. I would also love it if the device was *slightly* narrower (it almost blocks the light switch next to it) but I really like that I don't have 2 feet of extra power cable sitting on the kitchen counter and the USB port on the bottom is great as well.
title: Almost Perfect

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Trish
content: I thought it would be great to add a speaker to Alexa in different parts of the house.  Unfortunately this speaker must be plugged into an outlet less than 10 feet from Alexa.  And doesn't really work if you're 6-10 feet away and there's a wall between the two items.  Also even within 10 feet of Alexa, you'd think having stereo with multiple speakers, well this little twit has terrible tinny sound, and tiny sound. So simply detracts from the sound of Alexa.  I'd return them but I bought them few months ago and put them back in the box but then forgot about them.  Trying to save you the trouble now.
title: This product has little to no value

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ZoomFROG
content: I guess I should have expected less for my $20. The sound quality is horrible, the max volume is still too low to be heard from a distance. Considering this thing plugs into a wall outlet, placement location is limited. Many home outlets are located behind furniture, TVs, bookcases, desks, etc.  I like the concept but it just isn't as useful as I had expected.  Perhaps the kitchen counter outlets are the best use for this device. Forget about listening to music on the Echo Flex. The sound quality just isn't good enough.
title: Sound quality is disappointing.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Penfield
content: Bought this for my daughter who wanted an Alexa connected device in her downstairs area.  She didn't want additional cords on the floor as her dogs entangle them when playing. Just plug it in, use the, app, and it is up and running. Will buy a couple for my home.  Recommended if you don't need music but need to access Alexa devices.
title: Very Nice and Easy to Use

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Shawn M.
content: I pondered on wether to buy the Echo Flex since I have so many Alexa gadgets already but I thought what’s another one...I have this hooked up in the facing the front door for now. You can set it up to alert you via text message and you can customize the name, and what it says to alert you. You can also have it trigger a light to turn on or off via smart outlet or smart light bulb or anything else in your smart home set up. I have another Echo Flex with the night light attachment in the bathroom.
title: Met my needs

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Eric G.
content: This thing is so ugly my wife made me remove it from the bathroom upon first glance. I probably could have sold her on the ability to play spotify in the bathroom but the sound quality is worse than an iphone. What happened? All the other echo devices are wonderfully designed, this thing looks like a 90’s smoke detector stuck to the wall.
title: Crap sound, ugly looking.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Richard Zeni
content: I use this in my Bathroom to give Alexa instructions in what was formally a dead zone for my other Echo devices. I have the night light attachment which is a great feature for a bathroom. When I am getting ready for work I can listen to the radio, get news and weather while taking my shower, or brushing my teeth. The speaker is really very basic, so if want to listen is music with this device - choose another one. For what I use it for - it is a perfect fit.
title: Good for certain areas of the house

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jules
content: I like that it just plugs right into outlet, no cords , and doesn't take up the whole dbl. outlet so you still have access to other.  As always, Alexa integration works great.  Speaker works great for everything with exception of music.  Quality for  isn't great, very tinny sounding.  I have in bathroom and like that it can give me news, podcasts etc while getting ready in a.m.
title: perfect for what it is

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Roger K
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. It’s a small device that comfortably fits at any wall outlet. It’s ideal for hallways and in places you want to be able to access Alexa and not have to have something big and bulky protruding from the wall. Now I will warn you the sound quality is not like the Echo Dot. It resembles the sound quality of the new iPhone in my opinion. I have mines placed in the garage and I love it there because I’m able to tell Alexa that I’m home so she turns on the lights before I even enter the front door.
title: It’s a great device!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lori Miller
content: I set this up in my garage so I could give a command and turn on lights in the house hands free with a voice command (Welcome home). It has never worked. It either doesn't hear me, even if I'm standing beside it, or it thanks me for welcoming it. :-| I think I'll be returning it and figuring out how to mount a dot instead. At least they listen.
title: Wanted to love it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ShadeTree Mechanic
content: I like the compactness of it hanging on the wall outlet but the sound is a little "tinny" compared to Echo and Cube.  You may prefer an Echo instead -- unless you are budget constrained or short on counter top space.  On the other hand, Flex has the ability to attach a motion sensor.  In the end, it just depends on which functions you need.
title: Works well -- sound quality is a little lacking compared to Echo and Cube

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: HELEN M.
content: Speaker is terrible
title: The sound is terrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LD
content: We have an Echo Dot in most rooms but just wanted something smaller for the kitchen. We hoped to use this to set timers and turn lights on and off. Unfortunately the microphones don't work nearly as well in these. You have to repeat what you are saying multiple times and sometimes it still doesn't understand. Often times the Echo Dots in adjacent rooms will understand before this does even though we are in the kitchen.
title: Microphones not as sensitive as they should be.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stephanie Setley
content: This solved the problem of not having an Alexa near the washer and dryer! We have an unfinished basement, and often while doing laundry down there I would think of something - a shopping list item, etc. - or I needed to ask a question about laundry of someone in the house. Now I can access all the commands, listen to music, and drop-in whenever needed.
title: Great function for a garage or basement!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Anderson
content: As the headline says, that's my first experience using an Alexa.. and I'm loving it! I'm still learning the skills that she's capable of doing. The Echo Flex has a really good microphone that can hear me even from another room. Although the speaker is not perfect, mainly due to its smaller size, the quality can be a bit low to hear music. Nevertheless, I really enjoy listening to podcasts on it. Great for its price!
title: My first Alexa device.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Skimbleshanks
content: I like the convenience of having this plug in so there’s no dot and wires. It doesn’t have a good speaker so I paired it with my BT speaker and it sounds great  through that. Responds easily to commands. Just like any other Alexa device if you don’t like wires around. I bought it on a deal so it was easy to try it. Glad I did.
title: Great!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: jeremiahgavila
content: So, for the price, this product works great in an area where you don’t have a lot of counterspace. As expected the sound quality is not as good as the regular devices but that’s to be expected. The biggest downfall though, I think it should have an adapter that can plug into the bottom to make it still have a power outlet. That would be my best recommendation
title: Good value

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Deana R. Guardado
content: I have three of these - one in each bathroom with a night light, and one in the hallway with a motion sensor. I love both. The night light turns off when not needed. The motion sensor triggers other actions in my smart home, and is very dependable. While I wouldn't want these to be my only speakers, they're great for where they're being used.
title: Perfect!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Cathie
content: I tested it for my friends use.  She has macular degeneration and has found that the original Echo devices I gave her worked well for phone calls and knowing the time in the middle of the night.  I hoped this would work for her in her kitchen.  She is very independent and plans to live alone in her house as long as she can.  The voice is so tinny that I am not sure she can hear it as this is the frequency range that most often deteriorates first.  I actually find it annoying as I have very good hearing.  I will update this review when I have her try it.
title: Not sure sound will work for older friend

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Azucena Fisher
content: I didn’t want to put up the money for another Echo Dot and was waiting for it to go on sale... UNTIL I SAW THIS LIL BEAUTY! I questioned it at first but thought, “I can definitely afford $35 for two and if it sucks, at least I didn’t spend a lot.” This thing is great and exactly what I needed! It’s smaller than I anticipated which only adds to the beauty of it. I love how small it is and it’s still able to do everything I want/need. I’m not using it for music which is why I was okay with purchasing this and not another Dot.
title: GREATEST LITTLE THING EVER

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: The Mighty Truck
content: This is a nice option to have an Alexa in areas where you would normally not have the Alexa resource. I wouldn't recommend playing music on it because the sound is tinny like a transitor radio. It can be bluetoothed to larger speakers for better sound quality. It is easily mobile to move around because of a no chord set up. I had to try it and it provides the information just like an echo dot or echo. I would wait for the sale to save some dollars
title: Great product

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: T Simoneaux
content: This is such a cool little Alexa product! We have an Echo Show and a Dot and wanted to have another Alexa in our bathroom. It works well but the sound isn’t quite as loud as I would like- especially when you are in the shower. Overall I really like the Echo Flex and love how it plugs right into the wall and doesn’t take up any counter space.
title: Great little product!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Todd
content: I eas kind of leary about this device when I ordered, but I have found that it's turned out to be one of my favorite devices aside from my Echo Show 8.  Very responsive to your voice, acts quickly to commands, portable, and is nicely designed.  Only thing that isn't top notch is the speaker, but I don't think it was meant to be for playing or streaming music.  If you are looking for something to stream music with I would suggest something else, but it is loud. I even have a second one for my bathroom
title: Great device for the price

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Tim Bearden
content: Wanted one for the bathroom and this one is perfect since its a plug. You can add a night light or motion sensor to it which I wish was on my main echo. The only thing thats bad is the speaker, but its tiny so its to be expected. I have a Bluetooth speaker near the tub I turn on when I want to listen to music and it synchs seamlessly since being paired.
title: Its great for a small room.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Midwest
content: Works perfectly fine, but I wish the speaker was louder.  You know that cheap old radio you kept in your bathroom so you could blare NPR with the shower on?  I was hopeful that this would do that, but it just isn't loud enough.  It would be great as a home office radio but probably not a garage radio unless you could stay close to it.
title: Decent but quiet

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: sue
content: I love this. I can plug it into any room, hands free to get answers to questions, music of my choice, and keep in touch with current events. The adaptability of this product is wonderful.
title: Practical

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Robert Muhlhausen
content: I thought the flex was a great addition. It let us set up smart plugs for the bedroom lights and not have to yell out into the living room. It integrated itself with our other Echo devices automatically after plugging in, and has been easy to use. Sound quality isn't the same as the Echo Dot or others, but it's fine, and we can link it to a Bluetooth speaker for great sound quality.
title: Good addition to a smart home

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Tyson
content: I didn't need the full sound of an echo dot in the bathroom and I moved it to home office area.  I saw the Echo Flex on Prime Day and bought it for the bathroom. Sound quality is okay for what I need to do to turn on/off devices, news, and weather. Overall it works great and have paired it to a Bluetooth speaker if I need full sound.
title: Compact Alexa Device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jake
content: Just what i wanted. Cheaper than buying an echo Dot for each area. Don't buy this then complain because the speaker is no good. It's not meant to listen to music through. The only 2 reasons there is a speaker is for the audio beep confirmation after sending a request for your home automation, and/or to hear a spoken reply from Alexa if you ask a question.
title: perfect

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Thomas LaRue
content: I have 2 of these one in the Garage and one by front door..Have some routines to turn on some lamps when coming home at night thru the motion sensor. I use Flex for routines in garage to turn on and turn off my elevator simulators and other gadgets using smart plugs. Since Alexa Echo and Show are in the house and can’t hear me in Garage. This device is great to extend your ability to ask Alexa something but don’t expect it to play you music as good as Echo, Show or Dot.
title: Awesome addition to my home automation

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JL
content: In the few days I've owned it, I haven't tested it very deeply. I've been happy with the fast response after giving the Wake word-- faster than any other Alexa devices I own. It operates a little differently than my Echo.Dot devices when giving a command to play music or perform an action on my Fire TV. I'll have some learning to do.
title: A well priced device to add Alexa to the kitchen and bathroom.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Neal Kinney
content: Such a clever idea that I bought two of them even before I actually saw one in the store. I was NOT disappointed. These make perfect bathroom night lights (when you order the night-light attachment). Nice to listen to the news while brushing my teeth. Alexa is sounding a bit tinny in this configuration but that's the only drawback.
title: A Neat Solution for extending Alexa almost anywhere.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sal. S
content: Well... since Amazon got rid of the Echo Input, I got this and I like it. I had these old Logitech speakers that still had great sound(Logitech Z313 Speaker System, these but like 10-12 years older, yet still soooo great)and I wanted them to make them a lil more usable. I really should've bought the Echo Input wayyyy back when it was still available, but this is a second-best with the audio jack I can connect the Logitech speakers to the Flex and it works the same way. Smart Bluetooth speakers with a powerful subwoofer. Love it!
title: Love this!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Andrew
content: This is a great little device for conversational tones, such as telling Alexa to turn on or off a device, use as an intercom or even streaming NPR, but it's not a very high quality speaker for music. It's not terrible, much a small transistor radio from back in the day, but it won't fill the room with sound. Set up was a breeze and it works just like the rest of our echo devices.
title: Great for function, but not sound

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: GeorgeH
content: I use it with external speakers.  That function mostly works well.  However, it frequently does not work properly with the announce function that I use as an intercom.  Also, it sometimes loses wi-fi connection even though it is only a couple of feet from an access point.  Restart usually gets it working again.  i will replace it with an echo dot that works reliably.
title: Sometime works, sometimes doesn"t

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jared
content: I love the form factor! Get rid of the cables and have Alexa just THERE. Now, we moved our Echo Input to another room to clean up the kitchen counter of cables and devices... That was a bad call. The Input can hear you from across the room, now my wife and I have to get right up on the Flex and yell at it before she even wakes up.
title: You have to yell at her...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ladydee72
content: The echo flex does everything your dot does.  I bought it to have in my bathroom for music.  However, the sound is terrible.  It sounds like a tinker toy.  When I run the shower I can barely hear the music (and I have it at level 10).  So when buying this, if you're looking to use for music, this is not a must have.  But if u want to just use it for commands, it does the trick.l
title: Use for commands only

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kim
content: I have two Echo Flex(s?) feeding bluetooth speakers. They are responsive as long as the speakers aren't blasting too loudly or background noise level isn't overwhelming. You definitely wouldn't listen to music through the micro speaker in the Flex--it's like a buzzing bee. Easy connectivity and compact enough to leave the upper outlet available.
title: Alexa...plugged in!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: SavageGram
content: I love this in my bathroom! I can listen to Audible or the morning News or Music.. it's not an Echo Show speaker but it is perfect for listening while getting myself ready for the day. Picks up my voice without hesitation and the nightlight is a MUST HAVE. I like this so much, I bought another! I highly recommend this Echo Flex.
title: Great things come in Small packages!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: CBG
content: What I liked best about this unit is very easy to install, just plug and give it about 5 minutes and it set itself up to internet. Ive got several alexa and google and this is by far the easiest. For someone not tech/internet set up wise. T;his is the unit for you. However sound is hard to hear unless you are close, clear but low ever at height setting.
title: Easy install

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Snowizard
content: I did not expect an amazing speaker out of this but anyone that’s hard of hearing might want to pass on this device. It’s max volume is fairly quiet compared to the echo dot which I have two of and love. The night light attachment on the other hand is awesome. It’s the perfect amount of light for a kitchen at night. Over all it does the job but if your house is more than 1000 sq feet or you have hearing issues you might want to pass and get the dot instead.
title: Not the loudest

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jonathan
content: Pros: very easy to set up, nice and compact, i like the USB charging port. I have it connected to an external speaker via bluetooth. Good price. Cons: speaker is way too quiet. An external speaker is almost essential unless you are in a quiet area. My bluetooth speaker is rechargeable and you really need a permanently  plugged in speaker.
title: Good device but speaker too quiet.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Gordon F.
content: The best feature is that it doesn't take up any counter space. We needed one in the kitchen but there was just no place to put it. Problem solved. Yeah the sound is pretty bad, but it's good enough for getting an answer to a question or setting a timer. You can always bluetooth to a good speaker if you want music. I would say it's a good value for the price.
title: Good Space Saver

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Fran Bo Fo
content: I love this Echo Flex smart speaker! I will purchase a few more for a whole house sound experience. Remember those wall modules we used to have on the wall in every room of the home? Those are long gone now. These are great and provide superior sound and functionality with Alexa. Easy to install and use. Technology at its best!
title: Echo Flex smart speaker has great sound!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Shinealightt03
content: I am glad I bought this product as we needed something toward the back of the house. It's very useful. I will say the sound quality when playing music is ok but not great.. And when I speak to it I need to be close and speak clearly and precisely. But it does what I need it to. It hooked up very easily. Again.. Glad I bought it!
title: Worth buying

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ali Tart
content: Have one in the kitchen and the other in the master bathroom. When other sounds are goin, cant hear too well. Make sure that speaker is not in line with another Alexa speaker otherwise it will pick up on other ones. I have the light with the 2 I purchased. I placed one in the bath and have the light dimmed low for late night potty visits.
title: Speaker not as loud, love the light

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kathy D. Rial
content: My whole house was a smart home except the bathroom.  Oh thank you for this little gem!  I also have the attachable night light on it.  I love going in at night and not having to have glaring light on me to awaken me.  The sound is great for such a tiny thing.  I love playing my favorite tunes or getting weather updates in my bathroom while I am preoccupied with other things, haha It's also so small and discreet my husband hasn't even noticed it is in the bathroom
title: Tiny speaker, big on sound.  Small and discreet

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amber G.
content: People are right - the sound coming out of it is sub par at best.  Also it doesnt always hear me.  In fact last time instead of turning the fan on it said something about my whispering.  I had to repeat the command but it worked.  I would use this for function only - like plugging in a lamp.  Also wait for a sale price on it.
title: It works but not the best

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Antuan Robinson
content: The flex is perfect for the kitchen... It's an echo in a very flexible form factor... Along with a motion detector and good placement it's a great addition to your home security.I plan to have more strategically placed around the house for security and communication.With it's price point this is a very cheap and welcome addition to your automated home.
title: Incredible value...20$ gets you endless uses

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rich from Idaho
content: Very convenient for hallways, work bench, kitchen, or anywhere you want an echo type device. The speaker is small but clear sounding. I did pair my workbench one with a Bluetooth speaker in my garage and that greatly improved the sound quality. I recently purchased the motion sensor accessory and am getting familiar with it.
title: Great for hallways, kitchen, workbench, etc.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mark
content: As a supplement to the echo or the dot, it works great.  You can hide it away in the hallway, foyer or an exceptionally large room that may already have an existing Alexa device.  It allows me to speak commands in a natural voice through out the house as opposed to yelling commands that may or may not be heard from my current Alexa devices.  I like the fact it plugs directly into the wall without taking up counter space. The speaker quality is not that great.  Therefore, I only use the Flex devices in parts of the house for home automation.  If I want to hear information from Alexa, I will use my other Alexa devices (echo, dot, cube or Sonos One).
title: Great supplement for your existing Alexa devices.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dennis W
content: I read the information before I purchased this and it works as advertised.  Moreover, the voice recognition is fast and responsive.  This device as advertised is not for playing music.  I use this in addition to my echo dot on the opposite end of my home.  I'm extremely ☺  For ten bucks it's a perfect addition to my echo dot.
title: As advertised!  Fast response.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bergera1200
content: Was so excited to receive this, and then ended up just getting a normal echo. I wanted to set this up in the bathroom and you need a normal Echo to set it up. Mines less then 7 feet away and it won’t connect for setup. I don’t want to unplug My echo then have to re connect my echo after and then get the white light.... so the flex just sits in a drawer....
title: Just get another Dot

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Steven Cheever-Perry
content: I absolutely love the Echo Flex. The Echo Flex hears better than the Echo Dots. I have the motion sensor connected and I have a few different routines set which is awesome. It is not optimized for music however when you are playing music you can go into the Alexa app and adjust the sound settings for the music and it doesn't sound bad. I plan on buying a couple more Echo Flex with the motion sensor.
title: Excellent Device w/Motion Sensor

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Austin Marcus
content: My wife wanted a night light in the bath room so I took the opportunity to buy this for her along with the night light. The light works perfectly and she loves it. I mounted mine upside down so my wife could still easily plug in her blow dryer beneath it. It works flawlessly and it’s nice to get weather updates while I am getting ready.
title: Perfect for a bathroom.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: scaner60
content: I have 3 of these and use them primarily in my bathrooms with the nightlight attachment. They work great if hooked up to an external speaker. One of the three doesn’t work with the speaker because the audio output from the flex doesn’t work so I have to use it with the internal speaker which sucks but at least it’s something.
title: 2 of 3 work great

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: solidrock
content: I thought these seemed like a genius idea to fill in the gaps where Alexa never seems to hear me.  Instead my Echo voices never seem to know who I am talking to and always respond in the wrong room since adding these.  The sound isn't as bad as other reviews say but ever since buying two of these Alexa has been nothing but an epic failure to the point my family doesn't even really use it as much.
title: Don't buy too many of these

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: George McIntyre
content: This is great for small spaces, like hallways or even when I'm away from home and in my dorm room!  I may get a second one of these! Pros: Compact, can put pretty much anywhere.  Motion detector module is great at seeing if someone is wandering around in a room nobody should be in.  Night light module is great for showing different colors for different statuses, and even as a path light in the hallway. Cons: To be honest, I wish there were physical volume control buttons, and better audio quality, but there really is nothing wrong with this device!
title: Perfect for small spaces, flexible as the name suggests.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Eric Wiley
content: You practically MUST have it paired with a bluetooth speaker to get any kind of decent sound which is still going to require a physical powering on and the mic WILL NOT hear you if there is music playing but I still find this product somewhat useful for quick news and weather updates while I'm doing my morning business in the bathroom. To be honest though, a Dot on a wall mount would be much more effective.
title: Bad mic and speaker but still useful

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: John C. Hendrickson
content: I already am using two of these plugs. One for a fan in a hard to reach location and the other for a light. I added one more for another light. What is nice is that I can turn them on from any Alex in any room.  So, before I walk down the steps to a dark room, I can turn on the light (and the fan).  It was easy to set up.
title: Great way to control hard to reach or frequently used appliances.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. FOXX
content: I jumped on these when they came out but now I'm scratching my head.  I thought it would be great to have an echo device that could plug straight into the wall for hard to get places like a bathroom.  In my head I was thinking added music to my shower would be nice. But sadly the speaker in these is just so poor it is unusable.
title: Not sure I get the point

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Zesty & Fresh
content: Old folks that get scared at night or can't get out of bed or maybe they fell ---- their voice can easily trigger this to call for help and to turn on a light. Somebody's confined to their bed or wheel chair? Voice activation is amazing. This device hears EVERYTHING, so you may want to use the mute button when getting frisky.
title: Great gifts for Grandma and Grandpa who have Alexa!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: M. Ryder
content: This Echo is a perfect addition to our kitchen - I didn't want to have to deal with cables which all the other Echoes have. Adding it to our existing group of Echos was easy - in less than a minute it added itself. Then we added the nightlight feature and it was automatically recognized. This is exactly how it should be!
title: Setup is SO EASY

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Scifigrrl
content: I love this little plug-in speaker and will definitely buy more. The speaker quality was a lot better than I figured it would be so I am very impressed. It's been working flawlessly for about a month and I use it all the time. Obviously there are better speakers out there but for convenience and no wires, this can't be beat.
title: A Lot Better Than Expected

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KID333
content: It works okay, as long as background noise is basically non-existent. Fan noise(like an oscillating fan) can/will cause error messages when giving demands. Volume level is very low, even at max volume. Yes, the audio quality is bad but I already knew this, before purchasing it. Do yourself a favor and buy the Echo Dot 3rd gen. Which can be bought for basically the same price, elsewhere(place starts with an E).
title: Frequent Error Messages

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: jsw
content: I bought the flex for our bathroom to replace the Dot that was there because it is very unobtrusive. The sound is really tinny, like an old AM transistor radio but we have an external speaker in the shower so it doesn’t matter. As long as the speaker is on the sound is great. I’m not sure how anyone could listen to the flex without an external speaker.
title: Compact and Unobtrusive

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Gabe W. Pennington
content: I really enjoy this product, its good for putting somewhere like a bathroom or maybe a porch (provided it wont get wet) it's pretty small, and it works awesome for the price, only downside is its quiet and the sound is low quality, but honestly I expected that since its so small and very cheap. Voice recognition is also very robust, definitely better than my Fire TV cube which can be frustrating to try and talk to. I tell this to set timers all the way from my kitchen all the time. Very well thought out product with a pretty great value from amazon.
title: Very good for the price, but the speakers are very weak.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: RockSV
content: Terribly bad ! Got for my garage and it does not understand instructions like 'Play news' or Play my favorite music' DO NOT BUY !!! Better get Amazon Echo or upper model. Stopped working in 3 weeks. BEWARE !!!
title: DO NOT BUY !!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Thomas Vosseler
content: Love this little unit. Put it in the kitchen and it picks up commands that my echo sometimes misses. Only negative is a small speaker so it's not good for playing music. Overall I'm very happy with this purchase. Also, it doesn't take up any counter space, you just plug it in to any open wall outlet and you're good to go.
title: Responds to commands very quickly.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: HLH
content: These are not as robust, loud and clear as the echo dot...however, they are perfect in places you do not have room for a dot.  I purchased 2 for my bathrooms...works great to set alarms, add items to a list or for whatever you would use the regular dot for.  As far as playing music, it is pretty decent but the dot excels.
title: New Favorite Alexa Item

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael H. Charles
content: I wasn’t sure this would be very useful when I ordered it for the upstairs bathroom.  Now I find I use it everyday.  It’s a great way to get time and temp when you get up in the middle of the night without bothering others.  For the price,  you can’t beat this.  I have Echos in most rooms of my house as well, so this is a great addition.
title: Surprisingly useful

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael Bruchas
content: Bought it for my basement but switched it to my main bathroom. Perfect timer, weather advisor, and reminder unit. It only has some linkage to my Echo Dot though. It is not an intercom, nor can it link to share broadcasts. Very few functions of it will sync with the Dot. Will I buy another 1 or 2? Yes! If on sale again!
title: Love it! But not for music...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LT Brown
content: I don't understand other reviews complaining about the sound quality. Mine sounds perfectly fine. It's smaller than the dot and is not as loud but the sound quality is clear and crisp. Sets up easy. I have it in my bedroom and use it to listen to the weather in the morning and to control the lights and coffee in the other places in my apartment. A great buy!
title: A great addition

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lew Morgante
content: These are great for rooms as they don’t take up room on any flat surfaces. It’s convenient for rooms away from other main Alexa devices so you don’t have to yell across the house. The USB port is convenient for charging devices and the available attachments like the nightlight are greats additions if you are using them in other rooms. The ability to use these as intercom devices makes it convenient for the house. Pairing it with a bluetooth-speaker makes it easy to have entertainment through Alexa connected apps like Spotify, amazon music, podcasts and tune in radio.
title: Great for setting up a smart home.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Proftom
content: This echo flex is really great. Good value for the money. Nice for small places like the bathroom. Sound is good for voice and OK for music. But nobody should expect a Hi-Fidelity music from a 0.6 speaker. If you want better music, then get an echo with a larger speaker or get an expensive  external speaker. - - - Happy Customer
title: All the Alexa capabilities in a small and convenient package. Good buy. I may buy more.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Madeline D
content: We wanted to integrate Alexa into a room that doesn't have a need to listen to music much but so that we could drop in and ask questions or call children to dinner. My kids don't mind the speaker quality for music but it doesn't compare to the larger Echos. It works well and I appreciate that it just plugs into the wall.
title: The perfect small Alexa.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Alfred Beavers
content: Bought this to listen to talk radio while I'm in the shower. With volume set at 100%, it still wasn't loud enough to be heard with the water running. For the reason I bought it, it's worthless.
title: Not loud enough

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Scubadriver
content: I'm not sure why anyone would buy a Ring Doorbell Chime instead of this, considering this is cheaper and more capable, especially when connected to other Ring Devices.  This works as a doorbell chime and announce all of your other Ring sensor notifications for you too.  Have one on each floor and in the garage so I will always hear the doorbell.
title: Perfect for Ring Doorbell Chime

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ann Seeber
content: The Echo Flex plugs right into your outlet with no wire. Good where you're short on space or furniture to place a device like an Echo Dot. The speaker is admittedly lame so I deleted it from the speakers covered when I tell Alexa to play a song "everywhere" but it follows commands readily and is handy in small spaces.
title: SPACE SAVING DEVICE

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Caribulou
content: I bought this in a whim but have come to like it very much. I have it in my garage with the motion sensor. When I enter the garage it turns on the lights. I also have it connected to my garage Bluetooth speaker. I use this to play music when I am working in the garage. So far I have had no problems with it at all.
title: Works well in the garage

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: First tram
content: I placed this in my matter bedroom.  Turn lights on before I go upstairs.  Laying in bed I can turn lights off with no actual effort. I can now turn lights on and off downstairs.  Sometimes I  leave the back porch light on.  Just tell Alexa to turn it off. Placing these around the house is great.
title: Love the added coverage.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jeanne
content: Added this to a bathroom outlet, do great to have while getting ready. Debating the nightlight option, but for now I have my smartwatch charger plugged in to it and working well. While the speaker is okay, not really for listening to music. I paired it with a small Bluetooth speaker and it picks it up every time. Great option.
title: Nice addition to Alexa family

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: AmazonCustomer
content: The concept seemed like a good idea, but it's a really poor echo device. You have to either be facing the device or yelling for it to hear you. I knew the speaker would be too low quality for music, but I still expected it to be louder than it is. I think coupled with the motion detector it would have some good uses, but as a stand alone device it'll probably just frustrate you.
title: Alexa's half-deaf Grandma

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: BSG
content: Works great, Amazon shopping pre order setup, a lil spooky (& invasive). Was not crazy about the deceptive image of a nightlight (sold separately), appearing as if part of the unit. Sound playback is bearable, listening range incredible (from bathroom) 20+ ft. Overall a decent device for a prime day deal.
title: Does the job, Great Prime Day Deal !

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Cathy S.
content: Wanted to be able to check on my granddaughters when they here and playing/sleeping in the bedroom set up for them. This was it and all I had to do was plug it in! Saves me from running up and down the steps and we don’t interrupt cousin time. BTW all of them know the sound Alexa makes when you drop in so they have a bit of warning lol
title: Easy peezy

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: TimK
content: I wanted this product with the motion sensor to turn on a light and say something when I walked by. It did indeed do it once, but then it waited a lot of time to reset before it would work again. Example: If I walked by a second time within a few seconds of the first time, it wouldn't say anything. I need it to say something every time it detects me. No place does it mention this restriction.
title: Very basic device with major restrictions

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DAZ
content: I bought his and read all reviews. See my wife and child kept stealing my echo dot for their LEGO room in the basement and I need her for keeping a timer in my kitchen. I don’t use her for music as I listen to podcasts. I love it. It’s perfect for my needs and I got it on sale! The echo dot is now in the LEGO room and I bought a kid one for my child’s room. Love having Alexa around she is always helpful.
title: Just get it, unless you want music

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Manuel Torres
content: This is a great way to add Alexa to parts of your home where you don’t really need the sound quality of the Echo Dot or Show.  They are great for the garage or basement, especially for use as an intercom.  The USB port in the bottom opens up the device to some interesting possibilities for accessories. The price is good, also!  The only down side is that the sound quality is a little tinny and the volume is low.  That’s no big deal, however, as it’s not really meant for hi-fidelity playback.  Put them in those out of the way spots for Alexa coverage...
title: A very handy device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Boris B.
content: It's ok. Definitely not for music fans, although it's not bad on a kids room or just in the kitchen or bathroom for light entertaining. I see but drawbacks in it's ability to listen to me, delays in delivering, and more delays in responding. I wouldn't buy one again because of the, what I believe, are major drawbacks.
title: First version should be ignored

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Shay
content: I really like the device, it is very responsive to voice commands and was easy to set up. The only downfall for me is the volume levels when Alexa is responding. I tried to raise the volume in the app and also through voice command but it seems the volume can only be raised when playing music..which is disappointing. Good otherwise.
title: Good device but low volume

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Pavel
content: In principle, this is a normal budget device to fill your home with points of link with Alexa. However, the device hears much worse than, for example, an echo dot. Therefore, be prepared to speak louder and more distinctly. The problem for me, it seems to me, is the presence of only two microphones, and not of the best quality, due to price. I also observe similar problems in the echo show 5, which also has 2 microphones. If you want to use the device to listen to music - just forget, the built-in speaker is not designed for high-quality reproduction of anything other than voice. It is also worth considering the low maximum volume in comparison with the echo dot.
title: normal budget device to fill your home with Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amzn Customer
content: We plugged this into an outlet under our kitchen cabinets because our Echo Dot by the dining & living rooms sometimes had trouble picking up our voices while we were cooking in the kitchen. The Echo Flex worked out pretty good so far and hasn't had too much trouble picking up our commands. Definitely an improvement.
title: Niche use. Helps in noisey kitchen.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brad Stone
content: Gets the job done for voice commands but frustrating to use as the mics in these things are pretty awful. sound quality is horrible as you might expect but I doubt they were made for music anyways. these things will do what i think they were made for and that's just take commands to voice control your home automations but you must be close and speak very precise for them to work properly.
title: Get what you pay for

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Krista Clark
content: I thought this would be a great addition to our home. My daughter has an outlet next to her bed. I thought this would be a way for her to keep her nightlight and listen to sleep stories. Unfortunately, the sound is terrible. Alexa's voice is so soft, you really have to struggle to hear anything. I tried a variety of apps and got the same result.
title: Disappointed

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Virginia Jackson
content: Echo Flex was easy to set up and works like my other echo devices. I am using it to control lights and plugs and not for music. The audio is not the same as my other echo devices, but I didn't purchase it for that purpose. I'm very satisfied with the echo flex and it helps me use Alexa to control lights and plugs in the room I put it in.
title: Useful addition to my Alexa and echo devices

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Long
content: I love how small it is and how it sits well into a wall plug. We use it in our kitchen and it connects to Alexa Wall Clock for timer-at-a-glance. The speaker could be better but I understand if I wanted something that sounds good, I can buy Echo Dot. For my use case in the kitchen, I wish Flex can be louder amidst the ding of a busy kitchen.
title: Fits well in a wall plug. Wish the speaker can be louder.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Eric E
content: So this Alexa always picks up commands when we really expected another Alexa to do so.  If I figure how i would reduce the mic volume or have it only respond if the other Alexa don’t hear a command at all. Sound quality is not good but that is not what this one is for any way. I like the form factor for the hall.
title: Big ears

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DoctorG
content: I bought the Flex because of its low price and the ability tyo easily add a night light or motion detector using its USB port. I got the nightlight, and it works great in the hallway to our bedrooms. The light is very bright but can be dimmed and has color options - neat! Set up was simple - just plug it in, and it connects to previously installed Alexa devices automatically.
title: Inexpensive way to add Alexa flexibility

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: L. S. Brodsky
content: This fills a nice niche for when a smaller echo device is needed and you do not really care about sound quality. Although it is about 12 ft direct sight from the main router, I am dropping the connection occasionally, which is not true of any of my 9 other echo devices or other wireless devices. So, I am not sure about it.
title: Nice footprint, but may not be as reliable as other devices

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: L. J. Jessee
content: I bought this device as a more aesthetically pleasing replacement for an Echo Dot I have mounted in a plug bracket.  This seemed like a perfect solution....it is not.  The audio is so bad I can't even understand what it is saying unless my ear is within 2 feet of the unit.  The microphone also seems to be more sensitive than the one on my Dot as this one keeps picking up commands meant for other rooms.  I like to use the "turn lights on" feature and when this unit picks up the audio, it turns on the lights in the wrong room.  I would not recommend this unit to anyone, as I believe it has very limited use.
title: Terrible Device, not worth of the Echo name

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: CodonAUG
content: Terrible voice recognition.  Everything else is fine.  For the price and size the sound quality and volume is what you would expect but the voice recognition is really bad.  It has a lot of trouble hearing the wake phrase. The echo flex is at least half as bad as the original Echo at voice recognition.
title: Terrible voice recognition.  Everything else is fine.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: David I.
content: I needed Alexa in my hallway without hooking up a full size Echo Dot and the Echo Flex was perfect for the task.  It is small and has no problem with voice commands.  Not recommended for playing music.  There is a 3.5mm jack for an external speaker if you desire better sound. Very happy with my new Echo product!
title: Small and perfect for hallways!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Arlen Kyle Forsstrom
content: Have a high mounted electrical box in a bathroom or kitchen and want to use Alexa? Look no further. Sure it sounds like a vintage radio when playing music (though its kinda nice, and does not distort at max volume), but this is great for light music in the morning when making food or listening to NPR. The audio quality is just fine and does well when paired with other echo devices in a room, the flex just adds a little bit more sound reach and treble in small rooms when needed. Its also great so you dont have to shout across the room to set a kitchen timer or the like. Works great with the optional clock module to show current timers.
title: Does the Job (great supplement kitchen speaker)

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Saimei Kinjo
content: I really want to like it as much as my other Alexa devices, however, this particular Alexa enabled device wont stay connected. I am constantly having to unplug and replug it in to get it to work. Happens on average twice a day. A shame too because it otherwise would be a great addition to my morning routines as well as operating a bathroom night light.
title: Almost on par

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LH
content: It operates just like a normal Alexa and seems to detect my voice at the same range and reliability as an echo dot. This is useful for places with an outlet but not a table/area for a dedicated Echo (such as a foyer area). I also appreciate the ability to integrate with motion sensors to trigger Alexa routines (the night light is far less useful).
title: Great, cheap way to add Alexa in tight place

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: BeckyL
content: I actually really like the Echo flex. It was easy to get started and plug into the wall and use in my kitchen. kept updated on time, weather, news. Played some of my favorite 90's music. I quickly discovered that the sound on the device is high and very whiny. Still, I like the device and find it fun and useful.
title: Sounds Whiny

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Momma2aldoboys
content: I got this for each of my sons’ rooms so that I could communicate with them without yelling from the kitchen or my room or having to stop what I’m doing to go find them and get them to come to me. They like it bc they can listen to our Amazon Prime music through the speaker. The audio quality is not as rich for music but works fine for them.
title: Great when used as an intercom

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bdiddy
content: I bought this knowing the sound quality was not great after reading several other reviews. That being said, I think it is very convenient and a great way to get Alexa in different parts of your house. I bought three and will keep them.
