I might just need to buy a dot to put in the common area we listen to music.
title: Like other reviews said the sound is not their

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: L. Patrick
content: On the whole this is a great little cabinet.  I would have given 5stars if it was not for the instructions.  They were so small and difficult to read. I had to enlarge them on my printer. Even then they were not clear. I ended up guessing which way the pins went in and how the hinges worked.  Drawings only and no descriptions which would have helped.
title: Nice cabinet

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: storman75
content: This is the missing product, in my opinion, that Amazon needed in terms of the Echo devices.  I have a show, dot or spot in every room of the house and in some rooms, I had to use the adapters that allow you to hold the adapter and device near the socket.  These can be bulky and unsightly.  You definitely won't be hearing great music on this device but that's not the intention.  I put this device in my garage and will put it in a few bathrooms to have a smaller device than the current dots.  The nightlight and other attachments were a nice addition as well.
title: Excellent Device Depending On Need

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: The Hens
content: These are great to put in the bathroom (I.e. no cord hanging around) though I want to see how well they hold up to the steam from showers. Al for one I did get a battery powered bluetooth speaker that’s water resistant so I can listen to the Music in the shower. Over all pleased and okay to play music if you’re wanting background music but not necessarily for be loud for full sounding
title: I like it but....

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Shane
content: It plays music about almost as loud as a cell phone. Absolutely no louder than that. You also have to yell Alexa vs the other Alexa products, if you're playing music. Would be a better product if the speaker was better but I guess it would be an echo dot if that were the case. Overall, not a bad item for the price
title: Overall, not bad for the price.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: katie
content: I placed this in my bedroom and changed her name from “Alexa “ to “Echo.” I love it! It has a USB port so I use that to charge my phone. I’ve enjoyed falling asleep to music or an audible book.
title: Recommended!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ThePrincessIsHere
content: I have two echo dots but not in my bedroom. I needed this to use with my Alexa smart plug for my bedside fan. I did not buy it for the speaker. I read the reviews and knew the speaker was not good. I can verify that that is true. The echo dots speaker is amazing. The echo flex is not. Do not buy it for music.
title: Great, needed for my Alexa plug in my bedroom

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Alvin Marshall
content: I have dots, echos, and pluses from 1st to 3rd gen and none of them have to be unplugged and plugged back in like the flex does. I have two, one in a bathroom and one in our laundry room. Both have the motion sensor attachment on them. I don't have as many issues with the one in the laundry room, but at least twice a week the one in our bathroom has to be unplugged and plugged back in to get it to start working again.
title: Has to be reset often

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: The Verminator
content: This is a great device and perfect for a small space like a laundry room or bathroom, maybe a play room.  Takes about 3 minutes to set up.  It is super responsive to light actions from the Alexa app as well as voice commands.  Colors for the night light are accurate and again very responsive to commands.  It is not as loud as an Echo Dot but I wouldn't expect it to be.  In a large master bath I can hear it over both the bathroom exhaust fan and the sink running water without issue!
title: Great addition to Echo family!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Richard C. Zielinski
content: Voice recognition excellent talking in garage 15 feet away from Flex.  Wifi connection works with mesh wifi through metal shield on garage door.  Sound quality ok.
title: Flex works in shielded garage.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bigdog
content: At last, a solution for places where there is no shelf space or location to conceal the device. Perfect for the bathroom or kitchen. Sound is clear, but on the "treble" side due to the small size. In my case, I'm using it to give Alexa voice commands, and receive information. Just don't expect to use it for music listening. As long as it's used appropriately, it performs well.
title: Finally! An inobtrusive Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Andrea Womack
content: The echo flex is just what I needed for a small kitchen. I didn't want another thing to sit on the counter and the flex gives me the ability to use ALexa for my shopping list and not loose space. I own 2 other echo devices and the flex is a great addition. The sound is not excellent, but for a small device it is fine. I am very happy with my purchase.
title: Great for my shopping list.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michelle S.
content: It is great for my small out of the way room that did not need a full on echo set up.  I use Echo Flex up in my office with a motion sensor and my light on a smart plug.  As I am in and out of my office all day,  I have it set on a timer so if there is no motion for 30 minutes, it shuts off the light.  In addition, it is very handy for me to add things to my list or set reminders, as I think of them when working.  I don't use it as a speaker for music.
title: Excellent Addition To My Echo Family

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sydney Tokunaga
content: Great product for it expands the voice range to access Alexa around our home with the combination of the digital smart clock. Only 2 star review would be the sound but what can you expect from something that small. I wasn't even expecting sound to come out from it and was surprised when it played music from my pandora, I am impressed! Overall great product I'd highly recommend this to anyone who wants the option to expand Alexa voice recognition and utilizing smart clock or motion sensor to voice activate your smart plug and listen to music while getting ready in the bathroom, awesome product I'm glad I purchased at least 2 during prime day sale. 👍
title: Amazon flex

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Wardell
content: Brought this to communicate with other echo device for drop in and alerts so I plugged in kitchen. No volume control so does not sound or as clear as echo device but for the money you can talk to other devices and use as inter com. Also music is not the quality of over echo devices.  Sorry. Hope this helps.
title: Great for were you need plug out the way.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: N. Solberg
content: It was a gift I got for Christmas. Since I already have the latest Echo Dot, that's what I'm comparing it to. The Flex is super easy to set up and does all the basics of an Echo, but it's sound is terrible -- not surprising given it's price and size. I certainly would choose a different Alexa device it I wanted better sound.
title: Easy setup, but basic

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: runner
content: Just what was missing from Amazon, no cords,can place just about anywhere. Sound is not good good for music but that’s not what it’s for..with the accessories for motion and night light this is a must for the kitchen,bathroom or Garage. I just turned off the speaker and use the motion for turning on lights.
title: Great addition to the Echo lineup

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: John M
content: I love the portability. I have every Alexa device, and I use this for hotel travel. One complaint is not related to this product but Alexa in general. The sound variances in each flash news briefing is bad. Your catching up on the news late at night. Most stories are at the level you want; them all of a sudden one comes on and the sound is jacked up high enough to wake the dead.
title: Great for Traveling Alexa Lovers!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stangman517
content: Echo Flex works very well. I'm actually impressed with it ability to hear my voice even around corners at times. Small and compact and doesn't look gaudy plugged into the outlet.  I bought two and like them very much. However,  if you want better sound you'll be forced to buy a Bluetooth speaker or use a 3.5m audio cable. The sound is, and I hate to say, horribly low like the cheapest piezo speaker ever made.  Cosmetically it's very nice.
title: Works well, cosmetically attractive, sound not good. Buy a seconardy sound (bluetooth speaker)

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Fritz kuhlman
content: I love the flex. I put it in my kitchen. I'm sorry to to only give it 3 stars for sound, but you have to keep in mind how small it is. This isn't made to listen to music, and you shouldn't expect to do that with the flex. If you want an out of the way echo that doesn't take up counter space, this is a great device.
title: Small and out of the way.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Raghallch
content: I have one in my garage and one in my laundry room, giving me access to music, time, weather and ordering at hand.  They plug directly into an outlet, which keeps them off of useful flat surfaces and are much more compact than the Dot and the Dot hangars.  They do the job when I don't have much space to work with.
title: good for small spaces

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: David
content: A very good way to extend Alexa voice activation to areas of the house you might not need an echo dot like the garage, bathroom, or a garage. You can still pair it with a better bluetooth speaker for that premium sound if you like. I have not tried the extensions you plug in. I am a bit disappointed that does not double as a smart plug. I feel that was a wasted opportunity. Maybe on the next iteration.
title: Wish it was also a smart plug.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jennifer De La Rosa
content: These are pretty cool. It’s an effective intercom system for my house. I bought these to talk to people upstairs vs shouting in the house. You can set an alarm for one flex and another for the other. I only have one alexa and this was a cost effective way for me to expand alexa. The plugs also play music.
title: Great alexa expansion

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JLW in WBL
content: The Flex is great for conveniently extending Alexa around the home, especially for “smart home” functions.  It’s nice to just plug into an outlet without needing a space to sit on.  Not so good for listening to things... anything.  Amazon should come out with a better speaker that plugs into the USB jack.
title: Good for extending Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Hagarpun
content: I love this small form Alexa. I integrated it as a glass break sensor for our Ring Alarm system. I also added the Night Light adapter, which is also awesome. But, just to let anyone reading this know, this is not an Alexa to buy if you’re buying it to listen to music, unless you’re adding a speaker to it. But it does have good sound quality for Alexa to talk though.
title: I Love This Echo!!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bryon D Coombs
content: Yep, that's right her voice box sucks besides that she works, and another thing, why cant she sound a timer alarm through all echo's, that be nice or through the app chose which ones that can remind you that dinner is burning in the oven cuz your in your basement and cant hear the kitchen timer going off?
title: teeny weeny speaker :(

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: just me
content: Bought this for the bathroom. Works great for what we needed. We have 3 different lighted areas on 1 switch. This allows us to leave a nightlight on and turn shower & main lights on (smart bulbs) only when needed. Of course the speaker quality is less than other devices, but it's adequate for the job. + Fits neatly into outlet. No shelf space required. + Doesn't block other outlet on double outlet. + Functions just like other Alexa devices + Can even play some shower music
title: Nice, compact device. Works great.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Christy P.
content: Considering the price, I am okay with the fact that the speaker sound isn't great/loud. If I would have wanted better, I knew we should have purchased another echo dot. It does control all of the smart home devices I have hooked up through Alexa, so I am very pleased with its functionality for the price.
title: Surprised by how well it works

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: William Kramer
content: The microphone quality does not work nearly as well as the Echo Dots. I have this in a room, against a wall in a floor outlet (the outlet is in the baseboard) and the microphones only work in very quiet settings. The Flex also has lost connection to my UniFi access points more than once, requiring a restart. None of my other Echo Dots or Echo Spots (all 7 of them) ever loose a signal. I think this is a great concept but it is obviously a generation 1 product. It might work well if you plan to use it at counter height but I still suggest waiting for generation 2.
title: Not good if used on a ground outlet

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Hector M Lopez
content: I made my TV sound bar an Alexa speaker for multi room music. The device itself has low quality sound so I gave it 3 stars but it is great when you pair it, via bluetooth, with a good sound system.  I purchased a second one to connect my small amp receiver I use for a sound system connected to my bedroom TV using a 3.5mm cable.
title: Purchased for Alexa connectivity.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Carmie1050
content: Everyone who says the sound is tinny is correct; it does sound like a 70's clock radio.  That being said, I really like the concept & having a small Alexa handy to give me the weather & even play me a favorite tune.  I think amazon could possibly do a little better with the speaker/sound - even with the small size.  I hope for the next version the sound will be a bit better.
title: The sound isn't great, but I love having it in my bathroom

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: K M
content: I put this in my kitchen and really like it there. My Echo Dot was in another room and I had to raise my voice to get it to hear me, hence, the Echo Flex. It's great for timers, weather, recipes, lights, etc.
title: Love this little gadget!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kris Randolph
content: I bought two and put these in my bathroom. Its nice to have something that gives you music,  the news, your calendar items in that space and using another device would not have worked.  I didn't even know it had motion detection. So that just makes this a better buy. My husband wanted more in more rooms.
title: I bought two

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: April M. Sandoval
content: The sounds quality and range make this product a not so good but. I would not recommend nor works I purchase this product again. I placed it on the other side of my bed but need to move closer to hear what Alexa is saying. Also, I need to roll over to the other side of the bed for her to hear my commands.
title: Would not buy again

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Darling Nikki
content: I have a full size echo and 2 dots so I was excited to try this one.  It works just as well as the regular ones, but much smaller.  The sound quality isn't as good,  but that was to be expected in such a small device.  I also appreciate that it has a usb port on the bottom.  This way it doesn't completely block off the outlet.
title: It's as good as the original

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: W. Williams
content: We plugged this into a kitchen outlet, and it's been ideal. Takes up no space. We use it as a timer and for entertainment (usually streaming music or answering random questions one ponders while washing dishes). The sound quality is tinny (a stark contrast from the wonderful sound you get with Echo Show or Echo Dot). If you like to stream 70s music, like we do, it will bring back happy memories of listening to tunes on your transistor radio. :) I understand there is a Bluetooth option to stream to better quality speaker. I haven't tried it, nor feel the need to as the Flex serves its purpose as-is.
title: A convenient option for small spaces

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Alex
content: A great way to have voice input in an area with the added bonus of a night light or motion detector. The sound output is very basic, sounds like a cellphone, but for what it's engineered to do it's great.  We use two of them for an audio zone, one in the bathroom to hear commands, and the other in the audio rack plugged into a signal sensing amplifier that turns itself on.  Now, we can just ask for a Pandora station, an amazon station or FM station to play  in this area and it does! Plug in the night light and you can have nice back light on a display, in a cabinet or in a closet with a glass door for a cool look.  The motion detector also has potential for automation.
title: Value piece for control or nightlight/motion sense.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rocuba
content: I picked one of these up to put in my guest room instead of spending some extra money on a dot.  I got it for half off as a special and it does what I need it to - which is turn on a lamp that I have on a smart plug in the room without having to yell down the hall to one of my other Echos.  It's pretty straight forward - not an amazing speaker - but I wasn't expecting that.  Gives me the access that I need without breaking the bank.
title: Another valuable product

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: RFearns
content: Perfect for the bathroom! As a older person, falls are frightening occurrences and most falls happen in the home. With this  conveniently off the counter, I can call for help no matter where I am.
title: My new best friend!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Phillip Woon
content: We have Echoes all over the house.  The places where we didn't were our 4 bathrooms.  So when this came out, I jump on it.  I also purchased the night lights for them.  Now we can play music when on the throne, or have our books read to us, listen to news, etc.  I purchased 4 of them, and we love the night light feature with the different colors.
title: Love this thing

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jeffrey R. Gresko
content: As stated in the description this version of Amazon’s smart speaker is not good for music and the volume is not adequate for hearing even news well over the sound of a shower or ceiling fan when used in a bathroom. I set mine up with a small Bluetooth speaker mounted on the wall of my bathroom just above the Flex. Problem solved.
title: Cute, but needs Bluetooth speaker for volume.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: arrrrrrrrrr
content: As long as your not expecting great audio this is a great device for Alexa integration in rooms where you already have other good speakers you can connect this to or somewhere you only need it for home automation commands or podcast/news like programs. I also have the motion sensor for it and it makes the device even better. it have it set to turn my lights in the room on when it detects motion and to turn them off when no motion is detected for 5 mins. It works perfectly.
title: A great device at a good price by only sacrificing audio quality...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Wesley
content: I got this device to put in the hallway because it plugs into the wall rather than have to sit on a table. It is the perfect device to monitor the entrance into the house and manage Ring. I also got it to support a night light. So far, I'm a little disappointed in how much I can control that light. That said, I'd buy another Flex without qualms. It's worth the price.
title: A Good alternative to the Echo Dot in tight locations

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KCarlile
content: I love the echo dot original, but it was always in the way with a cord and just sitting on the counter.  This echo flex is much more compact to me as it sits in its plug and does everything an original echo dot does and more.  I also bought the nightlight and really love it.  The nightlight can go from 0 to 100% bright and be any color you want.  It comes on and goes off automatically depending on the light in the room.
title: More than just a speaker

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: pat mcphail
content: I use Alexa for many functions around the house. We have an Echo in one room and a Dot in another. I wanted to use these as an input device so we didn't have to speak so loud to get things to work. If you ask for music, it does not come out of the Ecoh but the Echo flex. I was looking for an easier way to do this so I guess I will have to speak louder.
title: Wanted to use it as a Alexa input device not a speaker system

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Pedro J.
content: I had A terrible customer experience this item was delivered to the wrong address and I had to go out of my way to track it down myself that’s why I’m giving this a 1 star but here is my review: It features a low quality speaker my iPhone has better sound quality and it’s louder. Other than that it works like it should!
title: Delivered to the wrong address!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: MrsH
content: I got this so I can listen to music upstairs. The volume does not go very high even at max volume.  I do think it will work great to play sleep sounds when my grandchildren visit so I will put them into the spare bedrooms. I did see that I can play it through a Bluetooth speaker so I may still be able to use it for music.
title: Not very loud

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jared Blanford
content: First, I would like to say, Thank you. These little devices have made my life simpler. I no longer need to get up to turn on the lights. I no longer burn my food because Alexa is always right there to set a timer. All I can say is, "It is AMAZING." I recently purchased 7 of the flexes, 2 echo dots, some Alexa light bulbs, and some Alexa plugs; as well as, a coffee maker. I tell Alexa to remind me to do homework, "She does!" If I am at the grocery store; sometimes, I need to contact my wife. I use the Alexa app to drop in on the flex or other devices. "BOOM!" I am in the house. My wife does not have to get out of the shower to grab the phone. She only has to yell. These devices are a game-changer.
title: This is a game changer.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: SecretShopper
content: I purchased this to put in my bathroom. I wanted an echo near by to add things to my to do/shopping list while I was in the shower and it was on my mind. I don’t think this echo would be good for anything else. The speakers is absolutely terrible. Lowest qualify I’ve experienced with the echo device. I wouldn’t use anywhere else in the house or for any other tasks. Simply just a quick way to set reminders and add things to lists. Speaker isn’t good enough to listen to music. Can barely understand response from device.
title: Poor quality speaker

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kat3y
content: I think I'm addicted to all things Alexa... she's everywhere in our home! This little gadget is great.. saves me a trip to the kids room..its fall season some nights get a bit chilly, I have a space heater plugged into it.. and can turn it off or on for them from my room or anywhere Alexa is enabled!
title: Nifty gadget...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: TLV
content: Exactly what I expected and wanted--basic Alexa functionality without all the bells and whistles for an area of our house not used as much. Will give us the ability to control smart devices and, because it doesn't have the same speaker capabilities, it's much less expensive than an Echo or Echo Dot.
title: Essential Functions at Low Price

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: mab_710
content: I bought this for my 10yr old son for his 11th birthday, for his room. He really only wanted it to listen to music on his room and ask random questions. I know the speaker quality isn’t great for music. But I thought it would be ok for him. Not so sure. Maybe I should’ve just waited until the Alexa went on sale again and got it.
title: Not bad for an additional Alexa or for a child.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stephan M.
content: Bought it to turn our outdoor speaker into a smart speaker. At first it seemed great. It connected via Bluetooth and all was great. Too bad it almost never wakes when I say “Alexa” or “Echo” (I tried changing the wake word). I’m 26 and have an amazon powered smart home, the issue isn’t me. Also the Bluetooth drops and disconnects often.
title: Good idea, bad execution

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: C Corbi
content: It's very small, so of course the sound quality is not great.  That said, if you have a purpose for it, it will serve it.  I use mine plugged in by the front door of my home to voice activate ADT e.g. Alex, ARM AWAY .. Alexa DISARM (it asks for your code).  VERY handy and no need for a larger unit.
title: Great if you have a PURPOSE for it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Christina D.
content: The Echo Flex is not ideal for music. Amazon tells you that right off the bat. But if you're looking for reminders, news, alarms, and smart home control... This is perfect. I got this for my elderly father as a safety measure. It's in his bedroom in the event he needs to use Alexa to call a family member for assistance, control the lights, or get medication reminders. He also likes to listen to soft music at bedtime and the news before getting up. It is working great. I plan to get another for my own home to add to our smart home control.
title: Works great for small spaces

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lou Platform
content: This item is Great!!! Will definitely recommend. Extra charging plug on top is a plus as You will not loose that receptacle. Have it in bath and it works perfectly for morning and night schedule. Sound it’s a bit strange but for bath it’s ok. You can add a speaker if you want. Overall great item great price. Thanks
title: Extra charging plug on top is a plus!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Gan Y.
content: This is my first echo so I don't know if other echo works better, but I often need to speak twice for it to pick up my voice. And my friend laugh at us saying Siri does a much better job. Speaker is OK to me since I don't expect to use it a lot for music. The best thing is the cordless design.
title: Does not pick up voice well

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: stormfrontproject
content: Overall I like the product,I was kind of questioning that when I bought it. Actually works pretty good for a bathroom. Haven't tried it in a larger room. If you're looking for better sound quality and a louder volume go with one of their other products. But for a bathroom works pretty good for me.
title: Kind of has a sound of a old portable pocket radio

product: product
author: author
content: content
title: title

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Drumlord29
content: I added another echo device to my collection! I've got every single kind of echo in the market. For obvious reasons, the speaker isn't the best. It is surprisingly smaller than I thought. I use it in my garage for when I close the garage using Alexa. I have the MyQ garage opener which i can open or close with my echo auto in my car. But after I turn off my engine, so does my echo auto. So I have to pull out my phone or manually push the garage opener on the wall. So I plugged it underneath my garage door opener so I can tell Alexa to close or open the garage door from anywhere in my garage without my phone or pushing a button. I don't really intend to use this for playing music. It's really for doing simple Alexa tasks in my garage. It is an echo device that is not meant to look and sound pretty. It's Alexa at its most basic form. Small, no cables, small speaker, and works like any echo device. I believe it's meant for a garage bathroom or hallway if uppity have the night light or motion detector accessory. If you want to play music with it, a bluetooth or wired speaker is highly recommended. Although I had very little expectations with this being that I meant to use it to just open and close my garage, I did notice one negative thing on it. I tried adjusting thre volume from the Alexa app but it switches back to 70% everytime. No idea why. Perhaps there built in speaker is best heard at 70% and if connected to a better speaker, it will allow for a louder volume. I'm going yo have to try that someday. But for now, it's perfect for what I wanted to use it for. If you know what you need it for, don't expect it to be more than that. If you want a better sound, get a dot or something bigger. For simple uses, this will do fine for all your Alexa needs. I may use it for my echo microwave which is currently paired with my echo input connected to a speaker. Don't blame the equipment if you want it to do more than what the hardware can achieve. Be fair to the gadget on what it is capable of doing.
title: Small, not for music, great for basic Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Scott Andrews
content: I bought this to replace my first generation echo do hanging in the outlet in my bathroom. I mainly use this unit for morning news while getting reading in the morning.  The sound quality, in regards to volume, is terrible. With the sound turned all the way up and standing within 2 feet of the Flex, I can barely hear Alexa. I can only imagine how useless the Flex is in a larger room.
title: Sound sucks

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Planet PuertoRico
content: Its very small, alexa sounds like a chipmunk, the attachments are nice but the audio should have been a priority as its the main way of interaction and the first thing you notice, any chance of using the usb port for a better internal speaker attachment? it comes with an aux output for an audio system and bluetooth connectivity for expanded audio options. It's sold as a smart speaker but it just sounds really, really cheep.
title: Small / the audio quality sounds terrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. Newton
content: REVISED TO 5 stars: One of the latest updates established connectivity and functionality, and it now works exactly as expected. It’s a small speaker, and thus won’t provide anything but minimal sound, nor is it designed to. Understand this beforehand and you won’t be disappointed like so many others who didn’t think through what it was designed for. If you need great sound/music quality, then other Echos are designed for that. So far, the Alexa app hasn’t been able to see/recognize/connect to the Flex, no matter what I do. I’ll box it up and wait a couple of months for an update to fix this issue. I have 14 other Alexa units in total, so this was just a purchase out of curiosity, not necessity.
title: Understand the niche for this, and why the speaker is small, and you will be happy.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Hall
content: I'm so surprised Amazon brought this to market. I have almost every echo device and this one does not live up to the others The sound quality was that of a bad transistor radio. I get the idea of the thing but if it doesn't have good sound quality,  I'm not interested.
title: Save your money!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rafael
content: UPDATE: After having it for almost a year I been having problems where it disconnects often and sometimes won't respond all the time I can tell it to turn off the light but then tell it to do something else like ask the time and it seems confused, won't answer, but then the next day it does. I lked it for the motion thing but just going to get a regular dot for the garage. I have this in my garage and works perfectly when I'm working there and want to turn on lights I have connected to a smart plug. Also if I want to know the weather or if I have a question in general works great. I can play music on it but it's not great for sound, but I don't think that was the intent for this. If your buying it for higher quality sound get a Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa. Or pair it up with a Bluetooth speaker or use the 3.5 mm audio jack and hook it to your stereo. I did the drop in with an echo dot in the house and it worked great. I could hear them clearly and they could hear me, which is nice if someone needs me they can drop in on the garage. I also have a camera in the garage so I can also see and now talk to whoever is there. Overall I'm happy with it. Oh and if the LED is flashing a yellowish color it's the way it notifies you you have a notification. Found that out when The one I have in the house was also flashing indicating I have a notification.
title: UPDATE:..... Nice little Device, works perfectly as intended.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: kreardon
content: I bought four of these so I could communicate with my family throughout the house. The speaker is so terrible everyone keeps repeating "what?" Sending them back
title: Horrible sound

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Valag
content: The Flex is a great option if you don't like having cords dragging across surfaces. It does everything a regular Echo or Echo Dot can do. and It's actually smaller than I expected. Only occupies the lower plug without blocking the top one. Great for kitchen and bathroom, or anywhere that has above-counter-level plugs. Produces enough sound that I can hear it while in the shower, but, the speaker quality leaves a lot to be desired. I wasn't expecting top-notch, Bose-quality sound from this small of a device, but Alexa sounds like she's talking to me through a Solo cup. So I guess this won't replace any of my other Echo devices for playing music, but it's certainly good enough for listening to the news and weather while getting ready for work.
title: The Echo device that won't Flex your wallet.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KT - Six Eight Tall
content: We are here to pump up this review! Amazon Flex? More like Amazon Flabby... Ya! This device is so puny that it must go back to the gym to earn it's name! Here is our loser friend to explain why such a flabby device can only lift one star.... <clears throat> Mmmm k. As avid Amazon smart product users, we purchased the Flex based on it's small design form (in that it would occupy the least amount of space and be a perfect kitchen addition to keep our counters open). On this front it is perfect. Speaking in the kitchen, the Echo Dot Second Generation in our living room was actually picking up our voices better than the Flex which was in the same room. To Echo* what other reviewers have said, the sound on this device is tinny and distracting. Considering most smart phones can generate, the small footprint of the Flex isn't a great excuse in 2020 for skimping on sound to this extent. With commands and recipes is was displeasing but with music it was downright distracting. Imagine an old building doorway intercom speaker as an upgrade to this and you get what I mean. I'm guessing the positive reviews are mainly concerned with the small footprint which again, is excellent but even at a discount we had to return this and the accompanying motion sensor in favor of mounting another Echo speaker in our kitchen. Here's hoping Amazon invests just a tiny bit more on the quality of the speaker and microphone array though for future generations of this product because this first gen Flex was an absolute miss for our household. * puns provided free of charge for this unbiased loser review
title: Did someone say Flex?

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Barbara Black
content: I have an Echo and an Echo Show, both of which are great. I ordered this for my kitchen because you can plug it in and not waste counter space. Unfortunately the sound quality is terrible-sounds like a cheap AM radio
title: Sound quality is terrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Moore Family
content: I got the Echo Flex to go along with weatherproof Bluetooth speakers on our covered deck. I Love that there are no external cables, and it's easy to unplug and take inside. The Bluetooth connection has been rock-solid so far. Things stay pretty dry on the deck, but rain does come in from the side during heavy thunderstorms, so I designed and 3D-printed a simple cover for the Echo Flex to keep it dry. So far it has stayed totally dry. If you're interested, search thingiverse dot com for "Echo Flex Splash Guard" and you'll find it. As far as the Echo Flex itself: I'm very happy with it as a way to play music and podcasts over Bluetooth speakers. Previously, I tried using a Google Home Mini (in a zip-lock bag) and it kept disconnecting constantly. While it's great to ask for the news, weather, etc without needing a mobile device, the voice interface can be very awkward for getting certain specific content (podcasts, albums, etc). Most of the time, you end up hearing something similar to, but not quite, what you asked for. For that reason, it's nice that you can cast to the EF from the Amazon music app. Regarding voice recognition:  we do have to yell at it a bit more than the Echo Dots inside the house. This may be due to the rain cover blocking some of the sound and/or sound dispersing more outside than it does inside. Still, not a big issue. We're in a pretty secluded area, so I'm not that worried about security, but I get that this would be an issue for folks in more crowded areas. As is well documented, anyone expecting much out of the internal speaker would be very disappointed. OTOH, it's nice that Amazon chose to release a low-cost/high-function product and still make it easy to connect to external speakers with the 3.5mm or Bluetooth interfaces. Overall, given the price, size, quality and the way I'm using it with external speakers, I'm extremely happy with the Echo Flex.
title: Works great with external Bluetooth speakers. 3D Printed cover makes it more weather resistant.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: TexasDude
content: This shouldn’t be an issue but it actually is and is why I took away a star. These pick up voice and respond much faster than my normal echos and echo dots (latest generations). This is a problem because I bought these for the times when I’m not really close enough to the main echos and wanted to not have to yell (What I call “filler” echos). BUT when I’m trying to talk to a closer Regular echo these pick me up too fast and from far away so they sometimes get what I’m saying wrong or they are not the specific device I was trying to control (for like music etc) USB port is pretty sweet. I have one in my bathroom that I use for a phone charge. One in the hallway that I have the motion hooked up to. And one in another hallway with the light on it for a night light and notification light. The accessory attachments respond quite fast and consistently. People comment on music sounding bad... well duh! The product specifically says these are not meant for music. I’ve actually found them useful in hallways when I have multi room music going and then the flex has low volume for vocals while passing through hallways to the next room. It’s quite pleasant.
title: It’s actually a problem that these can hear and respond better than normal echos

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: BD
content: I love the idea of the echo flex! We have Sonos throughout our house, and don't need to play music on our echo devices. So the echo dot has worked very nicely. However it was bulky and unattractive plugged in to the walls. The flex seemed like the perfect solution, so I bought one... and was disappointed. The size was great! Exactly what I thought it would be. But then I tried using it... It is very quiet! I have 4 small children at home and so there's always some noise happening... This echo would not work well in any kind of main room in my house because of how quiet it is. So, I moved it to the baby's room, but was still disappointed... I can be sitting right next to it and it won't wake to Alexa... I'll have to repeat to get it to respond. I'll bet they make some improvements and the next generation will be better.
title: Meh... Wait for the next generation

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amazon Customer
content: This is by far the worst echo device I have ever used, and I have four other various models. The Echo Flex consistently drops out of multi room audio groups and has to be unplugged and plugged back in to resync. The built in speaker is terrible and useless if you are more than a few inches away from it. It also has by far the worst microphone and struggles to hear me even when I'm in the same room. The 3rd generation echo dot in the other room reliably hears me better than the flex that is 20 closer.
title: By far the worst echo ever

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Fabriezy
content: In a quiet space the speaker is loud enough to hear but just barely and it sounds terrible.  I get way better sound from my phone so forget using it for anything but giving Alexa commands.  Maybe for a hallway with the nightlight option but even then I think I would rather have a Dot so I could use it elsewhere if I wanted.
title: For most a Dot with a mount is the way to go. Heres why...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Megan Campbell
content: I’m not sure why there are so many negatives regarding sound on this thing. I feel this is a niche product that is meant to be a filler for home automation. I have a small apartment with 2 dots: one in my sons room, another in my main room. Our morning routine has me going to the Alexa app and turning off his alarm and turning on his music and lights for his wake up routine. I’ve wanted a voice activated device that wasn’t a full blown dot to help me automate our morning routine. I already have a nice Yamaha speaker in my room so I wasn’t wanting an echo. Also, I prefer some privacy in my bedroom (my other dots tend to pick up at random times). This will work perfectly for that purpose. I can update this review after I’ve had this for a bit. Yes the sound is smaller and a bit distorted but this isn’t meant to be a true speaker. I see it as an intercom to help automate my household. I plan on testing it bright and early tomorrow.
title: So far so good

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Average Joe
content: I purchased this product to extend Alexa function with my existing echo dots. I like the dots, but I was attracted to this one because of size, price, and the ability to attach another supporting device such as the motion sensor (which I also purchased). The sound volume is horrible. I was rather impressed with the dot's volume level and sound quality for their size and figured since the echo flex is roughly 60% the size of the dots, then I would have to accept around a 40% loss of volume and sound quality. WRONG!! Try about a 90% loss. Really, the volume from the flex is about the same quality and level as your cell phone is with the volume (of your cell phone) set to 10-15%. Seriously, the echo dot two rooms away can be heard over this echo flex in the same room. Next, the echo flex often loses wifi connection. For example, the two echo dots I have lost wifi connection about 6-8 times last year (collectively). More the half of these instances were for legitimate reasons (power outages mostly). The echo flex has lost internet connection more than twice this week alone (or so sayeth my phone notifications). The echo flex is only about 25 feet away from the router. The echo dots are 18 and 35 feet away from the same router. Why the flex loses wifi connection so often is unknown to me. The motion sensor add on does work. It's just that it stops working now and then. I actually sent the first one back after this happened and got a second one when it did the same thing. It took me a little while to figure out that it would begin working normally after the echo flex was unplugged, then plugged back in. In hindsight, I feel like the motion sensor I returned was not defective and that it is, in fact, the echo flex that is the heart of the issue. The echo flex motion sensor add on combo isn't reliable enough for security purposes. I feel like the echo flex was rushed into production before it could be fully developed. It doesn't have the refinement that the other echo products I have used does. Could a firmware push solve some of these issues? Probably, but I feel like the low volume is inherent to the design and cannot be fixed with software.
title: Low volume, product needs further development

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LiveWithTech
content: I have 3 echo dots in my home along with 1 echo show, 1 echo auto & 1 Alexa in EcoBee thermostat. Also, I do have 4 google home mini. The echo devices have multiple pros compared to google home and is a must in any smart home. I installed this in my guest bathroom. Now when coming from a full-fledged device to this echo flex, definitely there are differences. My 2 cents below: Pros: - Alexa integration to all 3rd party devices works the same as all other echo devices and to set the routine is a cake piece - It Is a modular device with multiple attachments available that can go along with the device, like a clock, motion sensor, night light, etc. All other models miss this modularity - Well built product - Takes only one space on a 2-prong device, I was able to use Air Wick diffuser and Flex on a single board - Very reasonably priced Cons: - Sound is very feeble and meant for small rooms only. Listening to music is not a great experience on this device - Echo flex doesn't have far-field view technology as echo show does so sometimes it fails to trigger the recognition if you face the other side and speak
title: A must have voice assistant device for any smart home !!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: l33tDad
content: First of all, this is our 5th Echo device and have been more than happy with all of them, but as the headline says, it has it's flaws. First of all, don't get this for the sound quality as you will NOT be happy. The speaker is adequate for "general" things like announcements but is very small making music sound about as good as an inexpensive cell phone. However, I have this connected through bluetooth to a small amplifier in a kitchen cabinet which powers a couple of ceiling speakers and for this, it's fantastic. The nice thing about this device is that since it plugs directly into a wall outlet, it takes no table/counter space Why didn't I rate 5 stars? Well, the sensitivity for voice recognition is no where are good as our other devices. It's almost like I need to make it a point to speak loudly and clearly at the device for it to recognize that I'm trying to give it a command while our other Echo's can hear me from across the room looking the other way. If Amazon were able to fix this with maybe a firmware upgrade, it would be 5 stars. Other than that, it works great.
title: Works great, but has it's flaws

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dale Hemphill
content: I bought this echoflex on May 13th 2020. It worked fine until September 4th 2020. For some reason, my Amazon app would not recognize it when I try to change the Wi-Fi on the device. I did everything I new to do, including resetting the flex device itself, resetting my Wi-Fi modem, deleting and reinstalling the Amazon Alexa app, and yet still, it would not recognize the device for whatever reason, considering I had just change the Wi-Fi on it two weeks ago! after several text conversations with support and two phone calls to live support, no one can come up with an answer. The best they could do is offer a trouble ticket and have someone call me after the labor day I bought this device specifically for the labor day holiday to hook with a blue to amp in my backyard! However, now I am not able to accommodate my guests with music in our outdoor affair! I live less than a mile from the Amazon distribution center and I could certainly just go and buy another one for less than $24, but this one I would have thought is still under warranty, or at least I could get a suitable resolve to my problem. However, the best they could offer is that they will put in a trouble ticket and give me a call after the holidays! So, I am not happy with this device, or customer service or the handling of my complaint! I am a blind, Amazon prime participant with more than 18 Amazon or Alexa devices! And yet, I feel very disrespected and really not heard at all with this simple complaint and solution.
title: Sometimes price equals quality!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Anita
content: The device is really convenient. I have it in the bathroom with a nightlight attachment. The sound quality can be compared to a typical smartphone speaker. I mostly use it to listen to NPR (talk radio) or ask about the weather forecast while I'm getting ready and for that the quality is totally fine. It wouldn't be great for listening to music loud enough to hear over running water
title: Perfect for NPR while I get ready in the morning

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: MarkO
content: Two issues with quality. I bought it to mount on an outlet above our kitchen counter (wide open counter area)  between two of my echo devices:  one Dot 20' away - through a open arch and around a corner and an echo plus 18' away in the opposite direction in an open room but behind a wing wall. I can be facing the Flex from 5' away and either of the other echos in the other rooms will respond before the Flex. I bought the flex because sometimes the other echos can't be heard well depending on sound level set for music, and the make mistakes if not elevating my voice when adding items to list, asking for conversions etc. I basically have to really be close to it to have it work or the music playing on the other two will cut out and respond. It's why I freaking bought it. I have to be 6' away facing it directly. Second the speaker sounds just awful. I mean, I don't play any music on it at all, just the response sounds like a toy. I realize it's cheap, but I'm disappointed. I wish I would have bought a Dot 3 or used Dot 2 with a outlet mounted holder like I did for my garage workbench. Try to save a few bucks and you get what you pay for. Lastly, I thought the add on motion sensor was a cool idea until I read how horrible the reviews are for it after I bought the Flex.  At least I saved my money by not buying it as a package. Edit: Apparently my echo flex read my review and decided to be the alpha female on my first floor. Now she will be the responding device if I talk in a normal tone anywhere now on my first floor - even 4' from my other devices when the flex is almost 20' away. Except when I am 5' away from the flex and speaking directly to it, then it ignores me. It has managed to make my wife and I hate it and my two adult children when visiting have told me to get rid of it. Ordered a wall mount for an echo dot 3 that is underutilized on another floor of the house to replace the flex. I'll buy another dot next year on prime day or black Friday. The flex will - I don't know, hide it in the mechanical room in case I want to know what time it is when I change my furnace filter a few times a year.
title: disappointing so far.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Casey
content: So, I am an Echo fanatic.  I have all of them except for the Echo Look (???this product is just weird). That said, I am deeply saddened by this product.  I could only bring myself to provide it a 5 start feedback on Volume Control.  It has the same volume control as any other Echo. Sadly, this is where the usefulness stopped. It is huge, it doesn't really save space over any other product, it just happens to hang on your wall.  What it does do, is look ugly and sound awful.  The speaker on the DOT is infinitely superior to this one.  Even at MAX volume, you can barely hear the responses from this echo even at a couple feet away. I think they halfheartedly  tried to make it NOT useless by adding a USB port to the bottom.  Yes it has an auxiliary port but then why not just get the Amazon Input? (which is about as useful as Amazon Auto (which you don't want to get me started reviewing)). Don't buy it unless you positively have no where to set an Echo Dot.  The DOT is superior in every single way.
title: Yuck...Just Yuck.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Grace
content: I am a bit new to the Alexa scene. I am an apple girl through and through. So I was a bit skeptical that it wouldn't  all connect together like it should. I mean... I want to plug it in.....Basically that's it!!!!  Well that's pretty much what I did. I plugged it in, it then proceeded to tell me what to do. I now have quite a few things connected to Alexa and she is the new queen bitch at my house! I mean Alexa turns on the lights, the tree, the roomba, the music, the lamps, and my husband. She thinks she is freaking amazing!! Get her girls, she will make your like easier :)
title: Works GREAT!! Even for an alexa newbie.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sandy
content: This is awful. I made the mistake of purchasing two. I have complained to Amazon for 3 months now that one of these gets so hot aftet a few minutes of use. All I got was two emails saying someone would be contacting me. Never did. Shame on you Amazon! And I have three other Alexa dots that I got for the purpose of using the everywhere group that never works! Every time I call they say I have to unplug them, remove them from my app and  add them again. I should have listened to my friend and got the Google Home Mini. She loves it! No more Amazon devices for me.
title: Waste of Money!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nobody777
content: What can I say?  It's an Echo device.  It does the job perfectly and I love it...  This is probably one of the easiest Echo devices to setup.  I also like its small form factor and I am currently using it in my garage to control lights and the garage door, and to drop in to chat with my wife in the house on occasion.  The device works flawlessly and I am happy with my purchase and certainly can recommend this device. My only real complaint is with the sound level...  There are no volume controls, just a default setting, which is not very loud.  It's functional and if you're standing close enough in proximity, you can hear it and it gets the job done, but I do wish it was louder.  I never expected this device to be great for anything other than basic Echo functions (which is why I bought it - to control smart devices in the garage), so I wasn't expecting great audio quality...  That having been said, a little bit more volume would have been appreciated.  For that, and that only, I have to knock off a star and give it only one star for volume control because there isn't any.  Sound quality is okay.  I can hear Alexa speaking clearly and she responds perfectly, so the two microphones work well, but since the volume is so quiet, I have to knock off a couple of stars for sound quality.  For the device to be adequately functional, it does need audio... even if it's crappy audio, it should be louder than it is. The one saving grace here is that you can plug in an external speaker (and I presume Bluetooth connections work also) so it's not a total loss here.  There are alternative options that can make the slight negatives here seem unimportant.  I have a decent Bluetooth speaker I use for music when out in the garage, so I'll just pair it up and problem solved. All-in-all, great little device that fits the budget, sets up easily, has a small form factor, and does the job.  Hard to complain about that.
title: Performs well, setup is easy, good price. Not enough volume.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Matthew F.
content: When I first saw this, I thought, what a great idea! A small little "Alexa" to put in the kitchen, so that my Wife doesn't have to yell at the "Alexa" in the living room. I was super excited when this went on sale for $15, so I ordered one. I plugged it in, configured it and figured I was good to go. On first use, I could BARELY hear it. I though... ohhh, the volume must be all the way down. Well.... looking at the app, it was at 70%. So I turned it up to 100%. It really didn't get that much better. I mean, it's a small device, so I wasn't expecting booming sound... but the room has to be completely silent in order to hear it. My phone has a tiny little speaker and it's way louder and clearer than the Flex. In a last ditch effort, we hooked up a bluetooth speaker to it and had to power it off the USB. Having that wire and the speaker sitting next to it completely defeats the purpose of it's small form factor. I might as well just have gotten a dot.
title: The sound quality is horrible.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Raj Chantilly
content: I have reviewed the day I got it and was very much excited and have commented as  " Convenient to move as needed. Still needs improvement". but after 3 months of use and cannot return it with all kind of issue, I felt I need re-review based on my experience. Pros - very much convenient to pull and put into any outlets. Look and shape is perfect. Cons - you will be lucky if you get it work, the first 3 months it was ok without any connection issues, at the same time the sound quality is the first Marconi Radio, so good enough for commands - Alexa turn on a light.  On April 23,2020 they had a software upgrade and after that I was unable to connect to them, I called the customer service almost 5 times and each time they tried the next day it was unable to connect. Finally they refunded me $20.00 but they are not in a mood to understand the root cause, I have been using Echo since the first version came in 2015 and that works perfectly. I have 6 different models of Echo including the auto. I also have request them that if they can downgrade the software so it works, but they were not willing to listen.  I'm trying to get a mesh wifi, may be that can improve the signal as they were asking me to reset all the time.  My final conclusion, pls stay away with this model as both the connectivity and the sound quality are very poor. Rather get a Echo Dot or other Echo models.
title: Lucky if it works....

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KULANI
content: Aloha! We truly like this product immensely. Easy to install. Super quick to connect to other Alexas. Takes up very little room.  The only con is that the volume could be a little higher. Purchased 2 and considering 2 more. Kids enjoy their Flexs in their rooms. Wonderfully affordable so each room that does not have an Echo or Show can use Alexa Flex. 6-yr old absolutely tickled with hers, asks Flex to read her Audible books and to play bedtime lullabies. My next 2 Flexs will come with night lights (sold separately). Highly recommend this product and suggest to purchase more than one. Mahalo.
title: GREAT PRODUCT TO PLACE IN EVERY ROOM OF YOUR HOME

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Mullen
content: I bought this Flex for use in a utility/laundry room, a place where I do not listen to music, etc. As soon as I plugged the Flex into the wall outlet, it connected to my wifi and essentially installed itself. It is definitely the easiest-to-install Echo device in my network, which includes the original Echo, several Dots, and a host of Alexa-enabled devices. The only difficulty I have encountered is that the Flex's microphone seems more sensitive than the other Echo devices', and sometimes it responds to commands intended for a device in another space. Of course, this is not a serious problem, just an observation. I am very, very happy with the Flex, and I plan to obtain another. Also, I have now added the smart night light device (which plugs directly into the Flex), and it was just as easy to install and to use. Very Happy!
title: Easiest Echo Ever

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kitchen Mouse
content: We have too many Echo devices, by some folks’ standards — a Spot in two bedrooms, a Dot in another bedroom and a Dot in the garage, and a Show.  The show was originally in the kitchen. It was used to check calendars, add to shopping and to-dos etc.  I found the allrecipes skill to be useless, which is why I bought it initially. So I replaced it with the Flex. I was immediately dismayed by how frequently it did not respond and misunderstood me. None of the others have this difficulty. So I put the Show back in the kitchen and moved the Flex to my living room and plugged in a long Apple-compatible charging cable. That turned out to be a great idea because I can charge and use my iPad in the morning as I plow through email and read the e-edition of my local paper. I do use it to turn on my TV, but it doesn’t hear clearly enough to do much else, especially with background noise. I had to cover the mic on my hallway-located Ecobee because when ever I talk to any of my Echo devices, the Ecobee would butt in. The Flex seems to be fairly capable other than you need to yell at it. I don’t recommend it unless you like yelling at inanimate objects.
title: This device is hard of hearing!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: B. Castro
content: A little bit of background first. i previously owned a google nest device and it worked great... for 1 day. after i had set it up, i unplugged it to move it, and it never wanted to connect to my wifi or the app ever again. no help from tech support or the actual device. I just got this tiny echo device yesterday, and am very impressed! i was concerned about connectivity because of my previous nest experience. but so far after unplugging it several times and left off over night, it reconnects all on it's own. good start! i was able to connect it to my amazon music, pandora, and i heart music accounts with very little effort. I haven't tried to connect a bluetooth speaker yet, but it seems to not be that difficult. the device is very responsive, alexa surprised me with some lil bits of humor and side comments/conversations and politeness (spooky).  she walked me thru the music app connections, and made helpful suggestions. the google nest never did any of this. the size of this device is really small (2 decks of cards?). so keep in mind, if you plan on using it for listening to really good music, get a really good speaker to go with it. or, connect it to your stereo system. on it's own, the sound is very much like a transistor radio, and probably will not be good in a large room. which is fine if you just need basics. i've been able to listen to music fine without an additional speaker while taking a shower, and Alexa can hear me fine as well. since i can't give half stars (amazon, please fix that), i gave it 4 stars (4.5 stars) because i'd like a male voice called Alex. Also, it seems it will not connect with my google smart tv. i'll assume that's because google is competition. over all, i like it a lot. so much, i bought another the next day - 1 for the bathroom, and one for the bedroom. well worth the $9.99. buy a bunch and give them away as stocking stuffers at that price. enjoy!
title: Alexa, help me write this review!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Gary Fisher
content: I now own two of these incredibly useful Echo / Alexa Flex devices, and will likely add more in the future. Requiring no cable, no adapter, and no hanger, the Flex simply plugs into any available AC outlet and begins to work. Setup, if you don't receive it pre-paired to your Amazon account, is accomplished just as with other Echo devices. The Privacy and Action buttons on the front panel function like those on other Echoes, and the Flex will respond to all the usual Echo commands. While the speaker is far from Hi-Fi quality, it's perfectly adequate for the spoken word and can give you the news, weather, time, notifications, etc. perfectly well, and at least AM Radio-quality music. The Flex can control lights, appliances, etc. by voice command exactly like other Echoes. On the bottom of the Flex you'll find a full-size USB socket. While handy for charging a phone, etc., this connector is particularly intended to be used with Echo Flex accessories, of which there are currently two, a "night light" and a motion sensor. I own neither of these at this time, but Amazon's information indicates the motion sensor could be used, for example, to initiate a "welcome" sequence when someone walks by, or to turn on lights or perform other functions when it senses motion, without impacting other Alexa functions. The "night light" can be remotely set to an of a variety of colors, perhaps for aesthetics or possibly as a color-coded warning or alert scheme. Once again, the accessories are not required, and so far I haven't justified a need for them. But I'm working on it. 😉 I own a fairly large number of Echo devices, most of which could be used interchangeably. My Flex devices are the only ones in the house which are uniquely suited to their task and could not be replaced by one of the others with no additional work (such as mounting) being required.
title: The Handy "Utility" Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: The Photo Guy
content: The speaker is so bad it is almost unusable. Hard to understand even talk radio. All the available adjustments on the Alexa app including the equalizer do not help. The microphone does not sound good when used for announcements. No volume control, you need to use your phone in the Alexa app to change volume or speak a volume number from 1 to 10.  This is so far away from the quality of the Echo Dot it is hard to believe it is made by the same company. If you need to hang an echo on the wall, get a 2nd generation echo dot and one of the available third-party hangers. This is the first Amazon device I am disappointed in.
title: Sounds terrible, returned it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Deebs
content: I bought the flex for my basement. I'm older and the laundry is in the basement.  I'm always afraid some day I'll fall down those steep stairs so I try to remember to take my cell with me.  While this will NOT call 911 for you, I can ask it to call my son or daughter if I'm home alone and fall.  Problem is the sound quality.  The outlet is on a far wall, so while it does recognize my voice nicely, I can't hear the response very well as the speaker is very poor for an older person or if there is any other noise.  Hence the lower rating.  I've ordered a dot to replace it and will move this one elsewhere.  Setup - because it was already linked to my Amazon account I did nothing but plug it in, pull the app up on my phone, selected the device and wow it connected!  Nothing else to do!!!!
title: Poor sound, easiest setup ever!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nicholas H
content: I bought the Flex for my kitchen and I'm very disappointed with it. So straight to the point... 1) Terrible microphone. Unless you're in a quiet room, the device has a lot of trouble understanding me. I have to repeat my commands slower and more loudly, but when I do that, the echo dot in my bedroom upstairs and down the hall responds to me instead. It's basically impossible to use when other people are speaking in the same room. I have to ask everyone to be quiet while I ask Alexa a question. It has come to the point where it's almost a joke if she actually hears me correctly. I don't have this problem with the echo dot. 2) Similarly, unless you're in a quiet room, you can barely hear the response--not just because of its very low max volume, but because the sound quality is terrible--something like a typical kids talking doll toy. 3) This goes for all echo's, getting a Bluetooth speaker connected is painful to say the least. The device name usually doesn't show up so you're guessing at which is the correct device when only the device code is displayed. It also does not reconnect to the Bluetooth speaker automatically and cannot reconnect to a previously connected device through voice command. The idea of telling Alexa to "play music on my Bluetooth speaker" is just a fantasy. You'll have to go through the Alexa app and reconnect manually each time--by which time, you might as well just stream your music from your phone to your Bluetooth speaker instead. 4) When connected to Bluetooth, the volume changes back to level 5 constantly, so you have to keep asking Alexa to go back to volume 10. At level 5, it's barely audible so you might not realize it's connected unless the room is dead silent. Overall, the Flex is virtually useless because it simply doesn't understand me or I can't understand it most of the time (and I mean really MOST of the time) whereas I have no issues with my Dot devices which can understand me in a crowded room even with music playing. In my opinion, the Echo Flex might only be a reasonable solution for a small bathroom although I'd warn you about it still getting your questions wrong if you have the faucet or shower running. Otherwise, I highly recommend getting the Dot instead.
title: Nearly useless unless you're in a very quiet room

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rabid Ron
content: So far this has been one of the best echo products Amazon has produced.  We use in the kitchen to assist in cooking.  Controlling lights etc is a  breeze along with setting the "Guard" feature when leaving home. Having the add on devices is a big plus to expand it's capabilities. What should be added is a way to utilize both the motion detector and nightlight at the same time by plugging the nightlight into the motion detector. It is going to be an interesting expansion capability if more add on devices are developed. I am already considering a few more to cover the basement, among other places.  As purely a voive control device this ranks as number One in my book.
title: Great way to expand voice control to small spaces.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: 🥇Customer
content: I purchased an Echo Flex plus the companion smart night light to replace what I had in a small bathroom and free up a socket.  In the bathroom I had an Echo Dot 3rd gen in an outlet hanger, plus I had a nightlight plugged into an Amazon Smart Plug.  So, both electrical sockets were used and there was a lot of hardware hanging off the electrical outlet (see pics).  The Flex is perfect for my needs.  It’s much more compact even with the night light (smaller is good, Amazon!) and the second outlet is wide open. Comparison: —Sound:  The Flex sound (both quality and volume) is not as good as the Dot’s.  To me, it’s good enough in order to have a more compact dual device.  Plus my Dot’s sound quality was partially muffled by the prongs on the outlet hanger.  I have Dots in most of the bedrooms and would not replace them with a Flex.  But for the bathroom, the Flex is good. —Light:  The Flex night light is not as bright as the one I had.  Both lights allegedly have 6 LED chips, but my old one is definitely way brighter.  However, the Flex light can be dimmed and turned a few different colors.  There are people around here who like asking Alexa to change the color. —Heat:  The Flex definitely runs very warm just sitting in the socket. —Alexa:  Her pickup of your commands is slow.  You need to be facing her for her to pick you up.  If you speak to her from the side, you may have to raise your voice for her to recognize that you’re speaking to her.  I suppose the acoustics of the room play a role, but that is not an issue when using other Echo devices.  In addition, there seems to be a lag in responsiveness.  For instance, if a song is playing and you ask her to stop playing, sometimes the song continues playing a few seconds as it fades out, or it plays in the background as Alexa is answering a question.  I don’t notice that phenomenon on my other Echo devices. —Looks:  It’s not the most attractive looking device.  Though it looks a lot better than what was there. —Set-up:  Fairly easy.  In my case, I used a Fire tablet for the set-up.  Since my router has MAC filtering enabled, once the Flex showed in the Alexa app list of devices, I got the Flex MAC address and went to my PC to add it to my router settings.  Then, on my Fire tablet, I had to switch to the temporary Amazon WiFi for the set-up.  Good to go from there.
title: This is a great device for where being compact counts

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Deandra
content: I don't hate it enough to send it back but I like my echo dot WAY more. I'd buy 400 more echo dots before I buy another echo flex. It's really quiet all the time, even in the middle of the night when everything seems loud, you know? It doesn't listen to me a lot of the time, so I'll be in the kitchen screaming "ALEXA PLAY SPOTIFY!" that the dot will hear me 3 rooms away from where it is. I can't be as cool as I'd like showing off all my Alexas because this one is insubordinate. But it looks really nice and small, so at least there's that.
title: Just get an Echo Dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jamie Lee Sanders
content: I got one of these to put in the outlet outside of my bathroom to activate the lights on the way in because the switch is in a very impractical place. You have to go all the way inside the bathroom and shut the door to reach it which ranges from mildly annoying in the daytime to very frustrating at night when it's too dark for that sort of nonsense. Alexa Flex could not hear us at least half the time. We'd walk into a dark bathroom, step back and tell her again, walk into dark bathroom again, then go back and lean down to yell at her to turn on the bathroom lights and she still didn't do it every time. Luckily, I already have two dots or I wouldn't have had any faith at all in alexa. I put a dot in the living room about ten feet further away from the bathroom than the flex is, and when we tell the flex to turn on the bathroom lights, the dot actually picks it up and gets the light instead. I finally moved the flex to the kitchen where I had the dot and it seems to do a little better since it's now closer to our face instead of by the floor. I bought her to get the bathroom lights but now she gets the kitchen and entrance lights. I would only recommend the flex if it's truly going to be in a small space where it will be sure to hear you. I have one by my bed as well and she doesn't respond as well as I'd like there either. I would suggest getting the dot if you're able.
title: Only for small spaces

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: avgcustomer
content: This is a convenient device to have, it brings Alexa to more areas in the home. I got it with the nightlight attachment which is great because I have it set to turn on and off automatically at my bathroom sink. My issue is not with the tinny sound through the speakers because I don't really use it to listen to audio, the problem is that the lower quality seems to have carried over to the microphones as well. I frequently have issues with the Echo Flex understanding the commands I'm giving it, and I'm constantly having to tell Alexa to cancel or outright ripping it out of the socket while she's going through the incorrect script. It's especially worse at night when I'm repeatedly having to re-issue commands to turn on my bathroom lights at a dimmed setting and she's initializing burglary detection or looking for a nearby restaurant. I've resorted to carrying my smartphone with me more often so I can just issue commands through the Alexa app. This is in contrast to the Echo Dot which I rarely have issues giving commands to, it has twice as many speakers (4 vs 2 in the Flex) and it sounds better so I'm assuming the microphones must be better to. Do I recommend that you purchase an Echo Flex? Possibly if you need it to use Alexa infrequently in an odd location, but for something as frequent as controlling your bathroom lighting you might want to opt for something with better voice recognition.
title: Too much compromise on quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Eric McCann
content: I picked two of these up to mess around with, one with the night light attachment. These were pre-set by Amazon before delivery, so I can't speak to how easy or hard they are to set up - from experience this tends to be quick and painless, though. Brief review on the night light attachment - it's slick and integrates well, and seems to be secure. You can tweak the light color, and yes, it detects low light just fine. It does what it is supposed to and looks like part of the Echo Flex. I see reviews with people complaining about the sound from the speaker.
