content: The Echo Flex is really a perfect device for adding to your system. Small areas where you need to access Alexa make this item a must have. We have put them in the bathroom with the add on light module for emergency purposes, in the upstairs room so you don't have to yell downstairs, you get the idea. We listen to the news and music on them and they do the job. For the price you should not expect audiophile sound anyway and it has more than met the expectations we had for how useful the Flex would be.
title: Perfect for area's where Alexa access is needed.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jean
content: I loved the idea of the quick plug-in Flex and looked forward to having access to Alexa, especially music, weather and news, back in my master bathroom. I do like the simplicity and convenience,  but the sound quality is so hollow an flat sounding that I quickly get annoyed and have to turn it off. If the sound quality were greatly improved, I'd add a  Flex to every room in the house, plus the deck!
title: Flex sound quality falls short

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stephen L. Riggs II
content: Great for Bathrooms or Kitchens where counter space is at a premium. Use the USB to charge a phone, or use the attachments to add an RGB smart light to your room, or the motion sensor to automatically trigger lights or routines you setup in the Alexa app. Sound is hi on treble but in a bathroom that’s what you want to hear over running water. But it has Bluetooth and an 8mm headphone jack so you can easily add a better speaker if needed for your space. This little guy is a great addition to the ecosystem and exceeded my expectations In every way.  Well played Amazon.
title: Exceeded my expectations on every level.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: wanloo
content: When I saw this extra small "Alexa", I knew I had to have it. I already have the Echo in the master bath for listening to music (absolutely love it). I didn't have one in the bedroom because I didn't have the space for it. This tiny little Flex serves the purpose. I specifically use it to turn on/off bedroom light and to get the weather forecast. You can still use it for music, but it doesn't compare to the Echo or the Echo Show - so I don't use it for that. It is small and doesn't take up much space on the plug - you can still access the other outlet (but only of of the two USB ports). It also has an USB port on the top which makes up for loosing one of the ports on the outlet. I highly recommend it.
title: Perfect Place to Hide Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nick
content: Excellent device for small spaces or places where it's more convenient to just plug into a receptical and not have all that extra cable to deal with. I use mine inside of a bathroom vanity cabinet and it's a neat solution. The only downside is that you sacrafice almost all of your audio quality. This device is very quiet and makes streaming music sound tinny. I would buy this only if the form factor makes sense to you and you don't care so much about audio quality (or place to have it stream to another speaker).
title: Great form factor, poor audio

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Vicki
content: We have Amazon Echo devices in every room of our house. I wanted one in the garage so that when I hear my husband go into the garage from the house, I could use the Echo in the family room as an intercom to ask him to bring me something out of the garage freezer, but the Echo Dots have fabric on them which would get dirty if left out there full time. When I discovered the Echo Flex, I knew it was perfect for my garage since it does not have fabric on it. However, when we workout in the garage, we take the Echo (3rd Gen) Smart Speaker from the Sewing room to listen to our favorite radio stations. The music sound quality is so much better than the Echo Dot and Echo Flex.
title: Great for the garage

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Penelope Penworthy
content: Flex, is just as easy as Echo, to install and use.  It takes up very little space and with an extension cord, you are able to move is around the room.  Great for older homes that were built before electricity was installed... afterwards being wired with too few outlets.  The Alexa, voice is loud and clear.  I would like it to be made possible to change the voice yet, I know of no way to do so.  When it goes on sale for $15 or less, grab a few and spread then though out your dwelling.
title: Buying the Flex, device is your money Well Spent.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Becky
content: This thing is garbage. The sound is so weak that it can't be heard over any ambient sound, even at top volume. I've tried to pair three different speakers to it to extend its usability, and it didn't recognize any of them. So I tried a direct connection using a chore and the sound is still terrible. May be marginally useful to send commands to smart devices but don't expect to be able to hear any responses to your questions. It's a total waste of money, even worse than the auto echo.
title: Hot garbage

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Christopher
content: this device is horrible with voice recognition compared to the echo dot. I a flex in the kitchen and a dot 45 feet away in the living room. If I am in the kitchen facing the flex, more than 50% of the time the dot in the living room hears me instead of the flex I am right next to. In theory a great idea but falls short with practical application. I just needed a device for timers and to control whole home audio but if it can't hear me it isn't worth it.
title: falls short when used with other echo devices

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: xstitchgarden
content: Speaker is not loud enough to be heard over the shower noise. I thought this would be a good option for the bathroom to listen to music in the shower but it’s not loud enough
title: Speaker is very low quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: G. Penna
content: I Love this Echo Flex. I have a very small space between the bottom of my plug and my towel rack in my bathroom. This Amazon flex fits perfectly in that spot. I Love all the echo products and have one in almost every room but not in the bathroom. There was really no place to put one till this. Now I could hear the news, music or whatever podcast I listen to in the bathroom in the morning while I am getting ready for work. I love this. It is the perfect size.
title: It’s perfect for small space.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lori3vino
content: This is the perfect addition to my Echo Show device! it connects easily to my account and its so dam good that i ended up buying 4 of them! Each room now has a flex for easier communication and can also play music as a group of speakers! NOW it isn't stereo sounds at all... BUT it has good quality of sound. These are also perfect for my Ring cam as it sends alerts ALL over the place in case i didnt hear it on my phone. So basically this is an echo dot type of device but you NEED a homebase device such as a Echo Show or Dot.
title: more alexa all over the house!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kbebe
content: Voice recognition could be improved as I find myself speaking louder than I should in a small room. Sound is very low which is the one thing that bothers me the most; however at $10 which is what I paid, it is still worth buying to not have a dot with a cord on the floor
title: Could be improved

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Peter Morris
content: A great solution to my problems! I needed another alexa device in my hallway and my previous solution was just to attach my echo dot to the wall (since there is nothing to set it on in this tiny hallway). It was ugly sticking out and the wires had to be hidden. But this thing just plugs in and works great. I got a 3rd party nightlight attachment for the bottom and now it's even more useful! Wouldn't recommend for a primary music player, just because it's so small the sound gets muddled. But as for voice commands, it works just as well as my echo dot.
title: Super useful! I'm buying another!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mai Mai
content: So I actually like the product. I don't love it. it plugged up to the wall. I didn't have to do much because I have other echo dot's. I use this in the bathroom to turn on the lights. It doesn't offer a volume button like the others. The sound quality sucks! I gave the sound one star. So I use the usb bottom for the phone cord rather than the motion light. But over all it seems to work just as good as my other products. The only thing that is off putting is the shabby speaker they put in it. They should have added a better quality speaker.
title: Like it not Love it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Collin Rose
content: After toying with the Echo Flex for a little I conclude that it offers little value with out the motion sensor or night light accessories which I will not be purchasing. The Echo Flex is not any louder than a cell phone and is honestly hard to hear in the kitchen with more than 3 family members around. If purchasing for the assistant or as a speaker, buy a google home or an echo dot. If you want an overpriced nightlight or motion sensor, this is the product for you, you just have to pay an additional $12 on top of the device itself.
title: Average at best

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Karen B. Faulkenberry
content: If you are looking for an echo to just answer questions and not take up room on a table, this is for you. I knew the speaker was smaller, but I didn't expect it to be that bad.  It is not good for playing music.  It's hard to plug in anything else in the socket panel because it takes up a lot of room and may block the other receptacle. but it does have a USB port.  I bought it to go in a room that didn't have a good space for the echo dot.  Wasn't happy with the speaker and have relocated it to a small room.
title: Not the sound quality of an echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Loyal to a fault
content: Absolutely in love with this little gadget.  There are many ways it can be used they all have one thing in common.  That is making life a bit easier.  I purchased this because my husband had a stroke on Christmas Day and is now bedridden.  I put the Echo Flex right next to my bed so when he needs me at night he just drops in.  I LOVE the peace of mind and the fact that it has the same basic features as my bigger devices an absolute bonus.
title: Love it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: B. Schneider
content: For music, no. For calling me 13 yr. old who's room is downstairs, awesome! We use to need to yell for him to come upstairs for lunch, piano practice, etc. Not anymore! What relief. Simply say Alexa, broadcast, then "please come upstairs to practice the piano". Boom, it is done! This has been so great. We really appreciate it. Also, my 9 and 13 yr. old love playing trivia games on it. I hate talking to machines and will still not do it that much, but this i will gladly do! Cheap and not too loud. It is hands free too! Prefect!
title: Great for calling people in other rooms

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: miguel smith
content: This is a great little device, its not expensive and it gives most if not all of Alexa functions. In some instances I even found the echo flex to be more responsive in answering my call for Alexa. Its super easy to use and u can charge other device with the USB port or just add a motion sensor or night light to it...just plug in the wall and ur good to go
title: Great

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brandon K Boone
content: I like that this product integrates with my other Alexa products easy. The nightlight attachment is perfect for my daughters room. The speaker on this thing is only good for Alexa responses, music sounds terrible. We are keeping a smart speaker in her room because of this. I would only buy this product if you want to give voice commands in a particular room.
title: Good integration, terrible speaker

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: VB
content: It is a good addition to the family of Echo devices - compact, convenient, inexpensive, and does what I expect it to do - mostly to control one of our Samsung smart TVs. Also reports weather, and some news. To play music we use Echo Show 5. Echo Flex occasionally showed blinking light for no reason, but still accepted commands. I had to unplug it, and plug in again - to restore its quiet sleeping state.
title: Good to control TV, compact, inexpensive

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: That Guy
content: Oh Alexa how I love thee! It’s a welcome addition to product line. It can fit into places that might not be so convenient for the bulkier Alexa models. The small size combined with that low price tag has got me putting them everywhere in my house. It has all the functionality that you’ve come to expect from Alexa devices. The only con is the small sound. It just doesn’t have the volume of the other devices. I think it’s to be expected for its size. It does have a 3mm port to plug in a auxiliary cord to connect it to other devices as well as Bluetooth support. What I think is neat is that you can purchase two add on accessories to enable this device to have a night light and a motion sensor. All in all I think it’s a great product for the price and the size. It’s a must have. Buy it today!
title: I love it!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Old reader
content: I love my Flex because it saves me from walking all over the house to announce meal times.
title: Easy to use

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: OpenTrackRacer
content: I have a whole mess of third generation Echo Dots plus an Echo Input.  They're great but I needed to add another in a room where I didn't really have place for a Dot (even with a outlet mount) and where sound quality wasn't an issue.  Enter the Echo Flex.  It's WAY smaller than I expected and works great,  Highly recommended for hard to fit locations.
title: Small and convenient

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Steven Davis
content: The speaker is so small you can hardly hear Alexa. I bought an external speaker to plug into it. (Defeating the purpose of it plugging in outlet and staying off the counter in my kitchen)  she is also hard of hearing. I have to yell to get her attention most of the time. I should have bought the dot instead. I will not make the same mistake.
title: Just get the dot

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Hzam
content: I already had an echo show and needed something in the bedroom just to control the smart home devices. This does the job and is easily hidden behind a dresser and can still hear us and do the job. The sound quality is ok for my use case but you can't listen and enjoy songs on it. For the price if your usage is similar to mine I'd highly recommend.
title: Good for smart home device control.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Semmie Neely
content: This product was introduced to the public without completing its testing phase.  There are numerous connectivity and sync issues that could have been resolved before getting customers to pay and give feedback for issues you could have easily resolved.  Yes, this device is a fun toy at this point; however, could be much more functional.  I've purchase three out of curiosity and should have purchased only one since this device does not have a surround sound capability. I'm keeping an eye out and wishing you success.
title: Good idea but need improvements.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: HLH
content: These are not as robust, loud and clear as the echo dot...however, they are perfect in places you do not have room for a dot.  I purchased 2 for my bathrooms...works great to set alarms, add items to a list or for whatever you would use the regular dot for.  As far as playing music, it is pretty decent but the dot excels.
title: New Favorite Alexa Item

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Andy
content: The Echo Flex plugs in anywhere and is easy to set up.  All you need is a wall plug and so it will go into almost any room. I wanted it for an area where there was not enough safe space for a Dot setup. I like the easy portability. My only "dislike" is that it does not always have enough volume when I'm working in the garage.
title: I like it!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael H. Charles
content: I wasn’t sure this would be very useful when I ordered it for the upstairs bathroom.  Now I find I use it everyday.  It’s a great way to get time and temp when you get up in the middle of the night without bothering others.  For the price,  you can’t beat this.  I have Echos in most rooms of my house as well, so this is a great addition.
title: Surprisingly useful

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael Bruchas
content: Bought it for my basement but switched it to my main bathroom. Perfect timer, weather advisor, and reminder unit. It only has some linkage to my Echo Dot though. It is not an intercom, nor can it link to share broadcasts. Very few functions of it will sync with the Dot. Will I buy another 1 or 2? Yes! If on sale again!
title: Love it! But not for music...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LT Brown
content: I don't understand other reviews complaining about the sound quality. Mine sounds perfectly fine. It's smaller than the dot and is not as loud but the sound quality is clear and crisp. Sets up easy. I have it in my bedroom and use it to listen to the weather in the morning and to control the lights and coffee in the other places in my apartment. A great buy!
title: A great addition

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lew Morgante
content: These are great for rooms as they don’t take up room on any flat surfaces. It’s convenient for rooms away from other main Alexa devices so you don’t have to yell across the house. The USB port is convenient for charging devices and the available attachments like the nightlight are greats additions if you are using them in other rooms. The ability to use these as intercom devices makes it convenient for the house. Pairing it with a bluetooth-speaker makes it easy to have entertainment through Alexa connected apps like Spotify, amazon music, podcasts and tune in radio.
title: Great for setting up a smart home.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Proftom
content: This echo flex is really great. Good value for the money. Nice for small places like the bathroom. Sound is good for voice and OK for music. But nobody should expect a Hi-Fidelity music from a 0.6 speaker. If you want better music, then get an echo with a larger speaker or get an expensive  external speaker. - - - Happy Customer
title: All the Alexa capabilities in a small and convenient package. Good buy. I may buy more.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Madeline D
content: We wanted to integrate Alexa into a room that doesn't have a need to listen to music much but so that we could drop in and ask questions or call children to dinner. My kids don't mind the speaker quality for music but it doesn't compare to the larger Echos. It works well and I appreciate that it just plugs into the wall.
title: The perfect small Alexa.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Alfred Beavers
content: Bought this to listen to talk radio while I'm in the shower. With volume set at 100%, it still wasn't loud enough to be heard with the water running. For the reason I bought it, it's worthless.
title: Not loud enough

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Scubadriver
content: I'm not sure why anyone would buy a Ring Doorbell Chime instead of this, considering this is cheaper and more capable, especially when connected to other Ring Devices.  This works as a doorbell chime and announce all of your other Ring sensor notifications for you too.  Have one on each floor and in the garage so I will always hear the doorbell.
title: Perfect for Ring Doorbell Chime

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lori Utoft
content: I have 3 stories in my house (including finished basement) and I really didn't want to have multiple Echo dots, so I purchased this along with a smart plug.  Set up was so easy - basically plugged it in and opened up the app on my phone and it was ready to go.  Same thing with the smart plug.  Now, no matter what floor I'm on doing something, I can ask Alexa a question or have her turn on a light when I'm coming into a room or add something to my shopping list instead of having to wait until I'm within range of my Echo.  Sound quality is better than I was expecting for playing music (other reviews weren't so great on this part, but I think it's just fine)  I highly recommend this device.
title: Absolutely love this option

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Cat1fl914
content: I’m happy with the flex. I also bought the nightlight and put the set in my bathroom. I live in a one bedroom apartment and have an echo dot 3rd gen in the living room, which I love. However, when I’m in the bedroom, I have to raise my voice to turn off the lights. Now I don’t have to :). And, I love all the colors of the nightlight.I got the flex on sale. Now I wish I bought a few more to give to family members, who have the echo dot, as gifts. Hopefully, they go on sale soon. If you want a little extra “boost” for your echo dot or plus, it definitely will do the job. One caveat - the speaker is tinny. Def not for music....
title: It’s great for my needs

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: crb42
content: I had an Echo Dot in my bathroom to listen to the news when I shaved in the morning.  The problem was it took up counter space and was prone to getting splashed.  The Echo Flex plugs directly into the outlet so is off the counter and out of harm's way.  The audio quality is a bit low for music due to the size of the unit, but for my purposes, its fine.
title: Perfect for my purposes

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Chris Caudill
content: This is a great little Echo device and for $20 it's hard to be too critical, but I would love it if the speaker got a little louder (it's a bit hard to hear from across the room) and the voice recognition doesn't seem to be as good as the new echo dots. I would also love it if the device was *slightly* narrower (it almost blocks the light switch next to it) but I really like that I don't have 2 feet of extra power cable sitting on the kitchen counter and the USB port on the bottom is great as well.
title: Almost Perfect

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Trish
content: I thought it would be great to add a speaker to Alexa in different parts of the house.  Unfortunately this speaker must be plugged into an outlet less than 10 feet from Alexa.  And doesn't really work if you're 6-10 feet away and there's a wall between the two items.  Also even within 10 feet of Alexa, you'd think having stereo with multiple speakers, well this little twit has terrible tinny sound, and tiny sound. So simply detracts from the sound of Alexa.  I'd return them but I bought them few months ago and put them back in the box but then forgot about them.  Trying to save you the trouble now.
title: This product has little to no value

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ZoomFROG
content: I guess I should have expected less for my $20. The sound quality is horrible, the max volume is still too low to be heard from a distance. Considering this thing plugs into a wall outlet, placement location is limited. Many home outlets are located behind furniture, TVs, bookcases, desks, etc.  I like the concept but it just isn't as useful as I had expected.  Perhaps the kitchen counter outlets are the best use for this device. Forget about listening to music on the Echo Flex. The sound quality just isn't good enough.
title: Sound quality is disappointing.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Penfield
content: Bought this for my daughter who wanted an Alexa connected device in her downstairs area.  She didn't want additional cords on the floor as her dogs entangle them when playing. Just plug it in, use the, app, and it is up and running. Will buy a couple for my home.  Recommended if you don't need music but need to access Alexa devices.
title: Very Nice and Easy to Use

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Shawn M.
content: I pondered on wether to buy the Echo Flex since I have so many Alexa gadgets already but I thought what’s another one...I have this hooked up in the facing the front door for now. You can set it up to alert you via text message and you can customize the name, and what it says to alert you. You can also have it trigger a light to turn on or off via smart outlet or smart light bulb or anything else in your smart home set up. I have another Echo Flex with the night light attachment in the bathroom.
title: Met my needs

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Eric G.
content: This thing is so ugly my wife made me remove it from the bathroom upon first glance. I probably could have sold her on the ability to play spotify in the bathroom but the sound quality is worse than an iphone. What happened? All the other echo devices are wonderfully designed, this thing looks like a 90’s smoke detector stuck to the wall.
title: Crap sound, ugly looking.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Richard Zeni
content: I use this in my Bathroom to give Alexa instructions in what was formally a dead zone for my other Echo devices. I have the night light attachment which is a great feature for a bathroom. When I am getting ready for work I can listen to the radio, get news and weather while taking my shower, or brushing my teeth. The speaker is really very basic, so if want to listen is music with this device - choose another one. For what I use it for - it is a perfect fit.
title: Good for certain areas of the house

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DNA
content: It is nice to have an alexa in the kitchen and not have cords. Playing music is just ok. Volume 10 sounds a little fuzzy but its ok when im doing dishes or just cooking. It serves its purpose and I got ot for $10 on prime day. It could use some tweaking but over its not bad as a small area device.
title: It serves its purpose

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kristen Forhetz
content: Its very convenient as it acts as a plug AND Alexa. This is good for bedrooms that don’t really need an EchoDot. Connects with smart plugs easily. Operates commands just like my EchoDot does in the living room. I especially like the privacy feature of the Dot and the Flex. We can mute it when we don’t want to be heard. It gives my security conscious husband peace of mind.
title: Great to add to our Alexa family of devices

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: a Very prime Shopper
content: size matter... if you want good sound.  this one, nope!  and the size isn't that small either.  good if you need ALEXA in your bathroom, but not for music or radio play.  hope they can improve it.  well, you can connect to at BT speaker for solution.  Overall, i wish it can be smaller in size for what it can do... need major improvements, will wait for the next Echo Flex.
title: little Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dave
content: The flex is a wonderful add on for the bedroom, I use it to turn the lights off and on also to wake me up in the morning, check the weather etc.
title: great add on

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brit in LA
content: bought this to fill a gap in my bathroom, where I am out of hearing of both my dot and my echo. Sadly it does not really help. sound is tinny at best usually have to repeat commands many times, Alexa often asks did you mean?????? or just does the wrong thing Finally gave up and returned
title: I so wanted this to work

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: bruff53
content: Does what it is designed to do for the most part.  I like the size of the Flex and the fact that it stays on the outlet.  The sound quality is ok for its purpose but the volume is much too low.  I bought mine to use in the garage but had to put the Echo back in the garage and put the Flex in an interior hallway.  At max volume, I could not hear the Flex from across the garage.
title: For the money, go for the Echo Dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: laptopcustomer
content: Great product for smaller rooms with not a lot of tabletop space. Moved it to my bathroom to stream music while in the shower. When streaming music, audio quality is better than expected. It takes 2-3 times for the Flex to recognize the Alexa wake word. However, on the positive side, I can activate Alexa while in the shower with the water running about 10 feet away.
title: Useful little gadget with Alexa recognition issues

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stinaelza
content: This is very easy to use and was a breeze to add to my current system. I do like the fact that I don’t have another cord I have to plug in or a place to put the speaker as it plugs right into the wall. However, I recommend getting the dot if you want something with decent sound quality for listening to music.
title: Sound quality lacks. Still, it’s easy and convenient.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: K. P
content: I am using the echo flex in my garage and one in the bathroom.  Don't buy this size if you are expecting any visuals, great musical quality, and there is a limit on its loudness BUT it works for everything I need, like broadcast, emergency contact, reminders, weather, general alexa info/skills.
title: Portable, Functional echo/alexa package

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: puddingpie247
content: Good for what I needed it for. I needed to have Alex in close proximity to my hottub that has Bluetooth speakers. I am able to keep this device outside inside the covered wall outlet box near my hottub. This is a lot more convenient than the using the echo dot I was using previously that didn’t fit in the box.
title: Perfect for my application

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: G C
content: I should've purchased more of these. This was link to my account before I received it and right out of the box and plugged it in, it connected to my system and was working that fast. I'm getting  more! 👍🏼💯
title: Best purchase made!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Vanessa
content: I’m extremely disappointed in the sound quality.  My iPhone is louder then this speaker.  Not at all like I expected.  I have it in the bathroom and if you have the water on you can not hear the music at all. Big let down
title: Poor soubd

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: veronica smith
content: I placed the alexa flex in my garage....but frankly I would've been better off just putting a echo device in its place the speaker on the device is terrible disappointed with the product could've been alot better
title: Terrible speaker...just purchase a echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Alan
content: I use it in kitchen while cooking. I like the idea that it has USB charging port for my phone and that I can connect it to a much bigger speaker via Bluetooth.
title: Always ready

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Retwahine
content: I can't stop it.  For example, I ask it to play iHeart.  It plays it.  But when I want it to stop it won't.  I have to unplug it.  I have two other "Alexa" and they stop when I say "Alexa Stop".
title: The sound is not as good as the more expensive ones but that's a given.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rick Lattimer
content: Very fun little thing!  I get a kick out of being “welcomed home” by this thing. (I have the motion sensor plugged in). Not very good sound quality when playing music, but it’s not really for music, it’s voice quality is good tho.
title: Easy to set up and use.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dizzy Fizzles
content: I really didn't expect it to be that good.  I am so surprised!  Way better than expected.  I thought the sound would be horrible but it is good.  For the price you can't beat this.  Now I just need a robot dog etc. etc.
title: Amazed!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ged
content: Small form factor is great. If it could rotate, it would be better. Sounds pretty bad but it is not supposed to be a speaker anyways. We paired it with our bluetooth speaker and problem solved.
title: Good for the price

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa

title: For most a Dot with a mount is the way to go. Heres why...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ella Belle
content: I just got my Echo Flex - Plug-in smart speaker with Alexa this morning and I'm already totally in LOVE with it! With it I also bought that "Made for Amazon" THIRDREALITY Smart Night-Light for Echo Flex, and I love it too! I had been wanting to put an Echo Dot in a very tiny bathroom, but I was trying to figure out how, since I have no counter space and didn't want to use up my last outlet. Then, along comes this Echo-Flex thingy, so I decided to give it a try. I've been super delighted with it all morning long! I love how it just plugs right into an outlet and is totally out of my way but still basically does most of what the echo Dots do. I had a regular nightlight in the room that took up an outlet socket, so this new Smart Nigh-Light was a great solution because it plugs right into the bottom of the Echo Flex, so just the Echo-Flex is using that 1 outlet now. It's so cool too because I can ask Alexa to change the lights colors! I've bought 4 of the Echo Dots for my home and I am in love with all of them. This Echo-Flex is just a smaller version that is so perfect for small bathrooms, laundry rooms and basically anywhere else where you just don't have counter or table space for an Echo Dot. I also love how easy it is to set these devices up! Just be sure the little box below the "Add to Cart" and "Buy Now" buttons is checked "Link to my Amazon account to simplify setup"! It really does simplify the set-up wonderfully! Anyway, I am totally loving this new Echo-Flex so much and I already have ideas of getting some more of them for other tiny places around my home that I had not considered before. These things are just so helpful AND so fun! UPDATE 08/16/2020: I've now bought 4 of these echo Flexes with the nightlights. One for the laundry room, one for my Kitchen and 2 for my small bathrooms. I use these every day and they have become indispensable!  Sure, the sound is not super great for music, but the fact that these are not stealing any counter space is paramount for me. I have other Echo's in other rooms for music anyway. I love these things! UPDATE 10/13/2020: I am STILL in love with these cool little Echo Flex gadgets!  I use them many times daily! A great size for small rooms like Bathrooms, laundry rooms, store rooms, mud rooms, garage, even out in our woodshed! I happily got more today on Prime Day! Thank you Amazon!
title: Awesome Alexa Solution For Small Rooms!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Carmchocolate2
content: Nice addition to the Echo family.  Perfect size for the bathroom without having to deal with cords.  You can't expect big sound from this small device, but it serves its purpose.  I am able to set reminders,  timers, alarms,  and add things to my shopping lists while getting ready.
title: Perfect size for small places

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mr Huskey
content: It is very bulky robbing room from other items you might want to plug in.  The speaker quality sucks.  No where near as good as the Echo plus speaker.  Playing music on the Flex's built in speaker sounds like listening to an old transistor pocket radio.  It does pair easily to my blue tooth speakers which sound really good. Motion detection works, but is almost useless until the Amazon Alexa app matures a bit more.  Settings in the app are too cumbersome to want to use at the moment.  Controlling a light seems easy enough, but I wanted it to turn on a Wyze switched outlet.  I had to create a new group... assign the Wyze switch to it... create a routine to turn on the group.  There was no skill that let me just turn on/off the switch without creating the group first.  Seemed like way more hassle than it should have been. The night light seems nice, but I haven't spent much time playing with it yet.  I just picked the first color that was bright enough to fill the room.  Too bad you can't have motion sensing and the night light in one module.  I really only want the night light to turn on when I step out of bed in the middle of the night.
title: A very minimalistic  Echo device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Tech Gospel
content: I wasn't expecting it to be as loud as the Dot 3 or anything... but I was hoping at least as loud as the 2nd gen Dot. It was barely audible plugged next to the bathroom sink standing 2 feet away... even less so in the shower. Although you can plug an external speaker to it, it defeats the purpose of it. It could work if you prefer using an external speaker (3.5mm will support drop-in, bluetooth will not) and just want to plug something in the wall and not worry about cables. But overall, I was disappointed and just swapped it for another Dot.
title: Barely audible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. Coral
content: I set up this cute little Echo Flex + Motion Sensor in the garage.  It was easy to add Routines in the Alexa app to turn On and Off the WeMo light switch for the garage light.  I had this automation ready to go in about 5 minutes.  It’s real nice to have the garage light come on automatically whenever I open the garage door.  I also set it to turn off the light after no motion is detected for 1 hour (choose any time period). You can also have the motion sensor activate an Echo device to speak a custom phrase, give a news flash briefing, traffic report, play music, etc. There is a setting to specify the time when the motion sensor should perform the Routine (anytime, or between a certain time period) and to suppress a repeat of the Routine for a configurable time period so it won’t keep doing the same thing every time there is motion, if you don’t want it to.  For example you can have it give you the traffic report or news briefing when you enter the bathroom in the morning but only if the motion happens between 6-8am. This is super useful — after trying out the first one, I’m going to buy a few more to play with around the house.
title: Motion Sensor is Handy!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Spyder2014
content: If you are looking for a quality speaker to listen to music while you are in the bathroom or kitchen... pay a little extra and get an echo dot. The flex is perfect if you want to add another echo device for the sake of controlling smart home devices, taking advantage of the guardian functionality or for the occasional drop in. You also get the added functionality of either a motion sensor or night light with the available accessories. We replaced our bathroom night light with the flex and it is great! The light accessory gives off more light than our old night light and my wife loves the different colors you can choose due to the built in rgb LEDs. I tested the drop in feature as well and it was loud and clear while talking to my wife in the next room. I highly recommend the flex if you want an additional echo device in a bathroom, kitchen or spare room and don't want the hassle of hiding the cables, or if you want to add motion sensor triggers or a night light to a room.
title: Perfect... for what it is!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Debra T
content: I am in the midst of setting up an Alexa eco-system in my home. I have a Fire TV, first generation Echo, Fire Tablet, Echo Show 5, and several smart plugs. I wanted an Alexa-enabled device in my bedroom to do the "basics" ... respond to my voice commands ... and to turn the smart plugs on my bedroom lamps on and off. So I got an Echo Flex. I set it up in less than a minute, and soon it was turning my lamps on and off, telling me the time, answering my silly questions and telling me jokes! People, this is how technology should work. The world would be a much techno-friendly place if all technology was this easy to set up. I didn't get this for the sound quality of an Echo or for the screen time of an Echo Show. If I had wanted those features in my bedroom, I would have spent more more money to get them. I can never figure out why people buy an entry level product here on Amazon that does "the basics" and then give it a bad review when it doesn't do everything the "cadillac version" does. Sheesh. What I love about this product: --It's a great price. --It does what it's intended to do. --It can be enhanced with a bluetooth speaker, a nightlight or a motion detector. --It's out of the way. --It only takes up one outlet. The other one is still available for use. --You can plug in a USB device to it, like a smartphone, to charge it. What I dislike about this product: --Nothing. Because it does what I bought it to do. In my book, Amazon gets big kudos for giving buyers options for different features and price points of their Alexa product line.
title: Works great for its intended purpose!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amodeus1971
content: Besides the speaker being small and sounding like garbage the Flex has gotten better over time. The motion sensor I have come to like now that I have adapted to it and they have seemed to iron out some of the problems. My main problem now is they limited the use of it because they are only allowing you to own two of these with the motion sensor per Amazon account unless you have a business account. No other explanation besides they tried to get me to sign up for an Amazon business account. I have one in my bathroom and wanted to put two in my kitchen are because there are two entrances and I wanted to make my lights fully motion-controlled in my kitchen. I can do this to a point with Wyze Sense but I don't want any more cameras inside my living space than I need to have, which are the two on my rear windows as the other security cameras are all outside. This imitation severely limits the usefulness of this product.
title: Rewritten review

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael
content: The worst Amazon Echo Product to date. Would never recommend. Really wanted to have this, but sound quality is terrible, microphone is horrible
title: Horrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Drumlord29
content: I added another echo device to my collection! I've got every single kind of echo in the market. For obvious reasons, the speaker isn't the best. It is surprisingly smaller than I thought. I use it in my garage for when I close the garage using Alexa. I have the MyQ garage opener which i can open or close with my echo auto in my car. But after I turn off my engine, so does my echo auto. So I have to pull out my phone or manually push the garage opener on the wall. So I plugged it underneath my garage door opener so I can tell Alexa to close or open the garage door from anywhere in my garage without my phone or pushing a button. I don't really intend to use this for playing music. It's really for doing simple Alexa tasks in my garage. It is an echo device that is not meant to look and sound pretty. It's Alexa at its most basic form. Small, no cables, small speaker, and works like any echo device. I believe it's meant for a garage bathroom or hallway if uppity have the night light or motion detector accessory. If you want to play music with it, a bluetooth or wired speaker is highly recommended. Although I had very little expectations with this being that I meant to use it to just open and close my garage, I did notice one negative thing on it. I tried adjusting thre volume from the Alexa app but it switches back to 70% everytime. No idea why. Perhaps there built in speaker is best heard at 70% and if connected to a better speaker, it will allow for a louder volume. I'm going yo have to try that someday. But for now, it's perfect for what I wanted to use it for. If you know what you need it for, don't expect it to be more than that. If you want a better sound, get a dot or something bigger. For simple uses, this will do fine for all your Alexa needs. I may use it for my echo microwave which is currently paired with my echo input connected to a speaker. Don't blame the equipment if you want it to do more than what the hardware can achieve. Be fair to the gadget on what it is capable of doing.
title: Small, not for music, great for basic Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: BD
content: I love the idea of the echo flex! We have Sonos throughout our house, and don't need to play music on our echo devices. So the echo dot has worked very nicely. However it was bulky and unattractive plugged in to the walls. The flex seemed like the perfect solution, so I bought one... and was disappointed. The size was great! Exactly what I thought it would be. But then I tried using it... It is very quiet! I have 4 small children at home and so there's always some noise happening... This echo would not work well in any kind of main room in my house because of how quiet it is. So, I moved it to the baby's room, but was still disappointed... I can be sitting right next to it and it won't wake to Alexa... I'll have to repeat to get it to respond. I'll bet they make some improvements and the next generation will be better.
title: Meh... Wait for the next generation

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Megan Campbell
content: I’m not sure why there are so many negatives regarding sound on this thing. I feel this is a niche product that is meant to be a filler for home automation. I have a small apartment with 2 dots: one in my sons room, another in my main room. Our morning routine has me going to the Alexa app and turning off his alarm and turning on his music and lights for his wake up routine. I’ve wanted a voice activated device that wasn’t a full blown dot to help me automate our morning routine. I already have a nice Yamaha speaker in my room so I wasn’t wanting an echo. Also, I prefer some privacy in my bedroom (my other dots tend to pick up at random times). This will work perfectly for that purpose. I can update this review after I’ve had this for a bit. Yes the sound is smaller and a bit distorted but this isn’t meant to be a true speaker. I see it as an intercom to help automate my household. I plan on testing it bright and early tomorrow.
title: So far so good

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: K. Gagliano
content: I am thrilled that I can have another layer of safety in my home. Super simple to set up...plug and go pretty much. No wires yay! Speaker is so so but I didn't purchase for listening to music, I have my Echo and Dot for that.  I'm a big fan of the  "Ask my buddy" app. and now god forbid I should fall while in the shower I can call for help. Already tested with my family/neighbors with shower running and worked like a charm. Love the added dawn to dusk nightlight.  So extremely happy to have found this product. Worth every penny!  Tks Alexa lol!!!
title: "Flex" great addition to Echo's!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: TexasDude
content: This shouldn’t be an issue but it actually is and is why I took away a star. These pick up voice and respond much faster than my normal echos and echo dots (latest generations). This is a problem because I bought these for the times when I’m not really close enough to the main echos and wanted to not have to yell (What I call “filler” echos). BUT when I’m trying to talk to a closer Regular echo these pick me up too fast and from far away so they sometimes get what I’m saying wrong or they are not the specific device I was trying to control (for like music etc) USB port is pretty sweet. I have one in my bathroom that I use for a phone charge. One in the hallway that I have the motion hooked up to. And one in another hallway with the light on it for a night light and notification light. The accessory attachments respond quite fast and consistently. People comment on music sounding bad... well duh! The product specifically says these are not meant for music. I’ve actually found them useful in hallways when I have multi room music going and then the flex has low volume for vocals while passing through hallways to the next room. It’s quite pleasant.
title: It’s actually a problem that these can hear and respond better than normal echos

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Moore Family
content: I got the Echo Flex to go along with weatherproof Bluetooth speakers on our covered deck. I Love that there are no external cables, and it's easy to unplug and take inside. The Bluetooth connection has been rock-solid so far. Things stay pretty dry on the deck, but rain does come in from the side during heavy thunderstorms, so I designed and 3D-printed a simple cover for the Echo Flex to keep it dry. So far it has stayed totally dry. If you're interested, search thingiverse dot com for "Echo Flex Splash Guard" and you'll find it. As far as the Echo Flex itself: I'm very happy with it as a way to play music and podcasts over Bluetooth speakers. Previously, I tried using a Google Home Mini (in a zip-lock bag) and it kept disconnecting constantly. While it's great to ask for the news, weather, etc without needing a mobile device, the voice interface can be very awkward for getting certain specific content (podcasts, albums, etc). Most of the time, you end up hearing something similar to, but not quite, what you asked for. For that reason, it's nice that you can cast to the EF from the Amazon music app. Regarding voice recognition:  we do have to yell at it a bit more than the Echo Dots inside the house. This may be due to the rain cover blocking some of the sound and/or sound dispersing more outside than it does inside. Still, not a big issue. We're in a pretty secluded area, so I'm not that worried about security, but I get that this would be an issue for folks in more crowded areas. As is well documented, anyone expecting much out of the internal speaker would be very disappointed. OTOH, it's nice that Amazon chose to release a low-cost/high-function product and still make it easy to connect to external speakers with the 3.5mm or Bluetooth interfaces. Overall, given the price, size, quality and the way I'm using it with external speakers, I'm extremely happy with the Echo Flex.
title: Works great with external Bluetooth speakers. 3D Printed cover makes it more weather resistant.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amazon Customer
content: This is by far the worst echo device I have ever used, and I have four other various models. The Echo Flex consistently drops out of multi room audio groups and has to be unplugged and plugged back in to resync. The built in speaker is terrible and useless if you are more than a few inches away from it. It also has by far the worst microphone and struggles to hear me even when I'm in the same room. The 3rd generation echo dot in the other room reliably hears me better than the flex that is 20 closer.
title: By far the worst echo ever

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Scott Andrews
content: I bought this to replace my first generation echo do hanging in the outlet in my bathroom. I mainly use this unit for morning news while getting reading in the morning.  The sound quality, in regards to volume, is terrible. With the sound turned all the way up and standing within 2 feet of the Flex, I can barely hear Alexa. I can only imagine how useless the Flex is in a larger room.
title: Sound sucks

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Planet PuertoRico
content: Its very small, alexa sounds like a chipmunk, the attachments are nice but the audio should have been a priority as its the main way of interaction and the first thing you notice, any chance of using the usb port for a better internal speaker attachment? it comes with an aux output for an audio system and bluetooth connectivity for expanded audio options. It's sold as a smart speaker but it just sounds really, really cheep.
title: Small / the audio quality sounds terrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. Newton
content: REVISED TO 5 stars: One of the latest updates established connectivity and functionality, and it now works exactly as expected. It’s a small speaker, and thus won’t provide anything but minimal sound, nor is it designed to. Understand this beforehand and you won’t be disappointed like so many others who didn’t think through what it was designed for. If you need great sound/music quality, then other Echos are designed for that. So far, the Alexa app hasn’t been able to see/recognize/connect to the Flex, no matter what I do. I’ll box it up and wait a couple of months for an update to fix this issue. I have 14 other Alexa units in total, so this was just a purchase out of curiosity, not necessity.
title: Understand the niche for this, and why the speaker is small, and you will be happy.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Hall
content: I'm so surprised Amazon brought this to market. I have almost every echo device and this one does not live up to the others The sound quality was that of a bad transistor radio. I get the idea of the thing but if it doesn't have good sound quality,  I'm not interested.
title: Save your money!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rafael
content: UPDATE: After having it for almost a year I been having problems where it disconnects often and sometimes won't respond all the time I can tell it to turn off the light but then tell it to do something else like ask the time and it seems confused, won't answer, but then the next day it does. I lked it for the motion thing but just going to get a regular dot for the garage. I have this in my garage and works perfectly when I'm working there and want to turn on lights I have connected to a smart plug. Also if I want to know the weather or if I have a question in general works great. I can play music on it but it's not great for sound, but I don't think that was the intent for this. If your buying it for higher quality sound get a Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa. Or pair it up with a Bluetooth speaker or use the 3.5 mm audio jack and hook it to your stereo. I did the drop in with an echo dot in the house and it worked great. I could hear them clearly and they could hear me, which is nice if someone needs me they can drop in on the garage. I also have a camera in the garage so I can also see and now talk to whoever is there. Overall I'm happy with it. Oh and if the LED is flashing a yellowish color it's the way it notifies you you have a notification. Found that out when The one I have in the house was also flashing indicating I have a notification.
title: UPDATE:..... Nice little Device, works perfectly as intended.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: kreardon
content: I bought four of these so I could communicate with my family throughout the house. The speaker is so terrible everyone keeps repeating "what?" Sending them back
title: Horrible sound

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Valag
content: The Flex is a great option if you don't like having cords dragging across surfaces. It does everything a regular Echo or Echo Dot can do. and It's actually smaller than I expected. Only occupies the lower plug without blocking the top one. Great for kitchen and bathroom, or anywhere that has above-counter-level plugs. Produces enough sound that I can hear it while in the shower, but, the speaker quality leaves a lot to be desired. I wasn't expecting top-notch, Bose-quality sound from this small of a device, but Alexa sounds like she's talking to me through a Solo cup. So I guess this won't replace any of my other Echo devices for playing music, but it's certainly good enough for listening to the news and weather while getting ready for work.
title: The Echo device that won't Flex your wallet.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KT - Six Eight Tall
content: We are here to pump up this review! Amazon Flex? More like Amazon Flabby... Ya! This device is so puny that it must go back to the gym to earn it's name! Here is our loser friend to explain why such a flabby device can only lift one star.... <clears throat> Mmmm k. As avid Amazon smart product users, we purchased the Flex based on it's small design form (in that it would occupy the least amount of space and be a perfect kitchen addition to keep our counters open). On this front it is perfect. Speaking in the kitchen, the Echo Dot Second Generation in our living room was actually picking up our voices better than the Flex which was in the same room. To Echo* what other reviewers have said, the sound on this device is tinny and distracting. Considering most smart phones can generate, the small footprint of the Flex isn't a great excuse in 2020 for skimping on sound to this extent. With commands and recipes is was displeasing but with music it was downright distracting. Imagine an old building doorway intercom speaker as an upgrade to this and you get what I mean. I'm guessing the positive reviews are mainly concerned with the small footprint which again, is excellent but even at a discount we had to return this and the accompanying motion sensor in favor of mounting another Echo speaker in our kitchen. Here's hoping Amazon invests just a tiny bit more on the quality of the speaker and microphone array though for future generations of this product because this first gen Flex was an absolute miss for our household. * puns provided free of charge for this unbiased loser review
title: Did someone say Flex?

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Barbara Black
content: I have an Echo and an Echo Show, both of which are great. I ordered this for my kitchen because you can plug it in and not waste counter space. Unfortunately the sound quality is terrible-sounds like a cheap AM radio
title: Sound quality is terrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Deebs
content: I bought the flex for my basement. I'm older and the laundry is in the basement.  I'm always afraid some day I'll fall down those steep stairs so I try to remember to take my cell with me.  While this will NOT call 911 for you, I can ask it to call my son or daughter if I'm home alone and fall.  Problem is the sound quality.  The outlet is on a far wall, so while it does recognize my voice nicely, I can't hear the response very well as the speaker is very poor for an older person or if there is any other noise.  Hence the lower rating.  I've ordered a dot to replace it and will move this one elsewhere.  Setup - because it was already linked to my Amazon account I did nothing but plug it in, pull the app up on my phone, selected the device and wow it connected!  Nothing else to do!!!!
title: Poor sound, easiest setup ever!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nicholas H
content: I bought the Flex for my kitchen and I'm very disappointed with it. So straight to the point... 1) Terrible microphone. Unless you're in a quiet room, the device has a lot of trouble understanding me. I have to repeat my commands slower and more loudly, but when I do that, the echo dot in my bedroom upstairs and down the hall responds to me instead. It's basically impossible to use when other people are speaking in the same room. I have to ask everyone to be quiet while I ask Alexa a question. It has come to the point where it's almost a joke if she actually hears me correctly. I don't have this problem with the echo dot. 2) Similarly, unless you're in a quiet room, you can barely hear the response--not just because of its very low max volume, but because the sound quality is terrible--something like a typical kids talking doll toy. 3) This goes for all echo's, getting a Bluetooth speaker connected is painful to say the least. The device name usually doesn't show up so you're guessing at which is the correct device when only the device code is displayed. It also does not reconnect to the Bluetooth speaker automatically and cannot reconnect to a previously connected device through voice command. The idea of telling Alexa to "play music on my Bluetooth speaker" is just a fantasy. You'll have to go through the Alexa app and reconnect manually each time--by which time, you might as well just stream your music from your phone to your Bluetooth speaker instead. 4) When connected to Bluetooth, the volume changes back to level 5 constantly, so you have to keep asking Alexa to go back to volume 10. At level 5, it's barely audible so you might not realize it's connected unless the room is dead silent. Overall, the Flex is virtually useless because it simply doesn't understand me or I can't understand it most of the time (and I mean really MOST of the time) whereas I have no issues with my Dot devices which can understand me in a crowded room even with music playing. In my opinion, the Echo Flex might only be a reasonable solution for a small bathroom although I'd warn you about it still getting your questions wrong if you have the faucet or shower running. Otherwise, I highly recommend getting the Dot instead.
title: Nearly useless unless you're in a very quiet room

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rabid Ron
content: So far this has been one of the best echo products Amazon has produced.  We use in the kitchen to assist in cooking.  Controlling lights etc is a  breeze along with setting the "Guard" feature when leaving home. Having the add on devices is a big plus to expand it's capabilities. What should be added is a way to utilize both the motion detector and nightlight at the same time by plugging the nightlight into the motion detector. It is going to be an interesting expansion capability if more add on devices are developed. I am already considering a few more to cover the basement, among other places.  As purely a voive control device this ranks as number One in my book.
title: Great way to expand voice control to small spaces.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: 🥇Customer
content: I purchased an Echo Flex plus the companion smart night light to replace what I had in a small bathroom and free up a socket.  In the bathroom I had an Echo Dot 3rd gen in an outlet hanger, plus I had a nightlight plugged into an Amazon Smart Plug.  So, both electrical sockets were used and there was a lot of hardware hanging off the electrical outlet (see pics).  The Flex is perfect for my needs.  It’s much more compact even with the night light (smaller is good, Amazon!) and the second outlet is wide open. Comparison: —Sound:  The Flex sound (both quality and volume) is not as good as the Dot’s.  To me, it’s good enough in order to have a more compact dual device.  Plus my Dot’s sound quality was partially muffled by the prongs on the outlet hanger.  I have Dots in most of the bedrooms and would not replace them with a Flex.  But for the bathroom, the Flex is good. —Light:  The Flex night light is not as bright as the one I had.  Both lights allegedly have 6 LED chips, but my old one is definitely way brighter.  However, the Flex light can be dimmed and turned a few different colors.  There are people around here who like asking Alexa to change the color. —Heat:  The Flex definitely runs very warm just sitting in the socket. —Alexa:  Her pickup of your commands is slow.  You need to be facing her for her to pick you up.  If you speak to her from the side, you may have to raise your voice for her to recognize that you’re speaking to her.  I suppose the acoustics of the room play a role, but that is not an issue when using other Echo devices.  In addition, there seems to be a lag in responsiveness.  For instance, if a song is playing and you ask her to stop playing, sometimes the song continues playing a few seconds as it fades out, or it plays in the background as Alexa is answering a question.  I don’t notice that phenomenon on my other Echo devices. —Looks:  It’s not the most attractive looking device.  Though it looks a lot better than what was there. —Set-up:  Fairly easy.  In my case, I used a Fire tablet for the set-up.  Since my router has MAC filtering enabled, once the Flex showed in the Alexa app list of devices, I got the Flex MAC address and went to my PC to add it to my router settings.  Then, on my Fire tablet, I had to switch to the temporary Amazon WiFi for the set-up.  Good to go from there.
title: This is a great device for where being compact counts

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Deandra
content: I don't hate it enough to send it back but I like my echo dot WAY more. I'd buy 400 more echo dots before I buy another echo flex. It's really quiet all the time, even in the middle of the night when everything seems loud, you know? It doesn't listen to me a lot of the time, so I'll be in the kitchen screaming "ALEXA PLAY SPOTIFY!" that the dot will hear me 3 rooms away from where it is. I can't be as cool as I'd like showing off all my Alexas because this one is insubordinate. But it looks really nice and small, so at least there's that.
title: Just get an Echo Dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jamie Lee Sanders
content: I got one of these to put in the outlet outside of my bathroom to activate the lights on the way in because the switch is in a very impractical place. You have to go all the way inside the bathroom and shut the door to reach it which ranges from mildly annoying in the daytime to very frustrating at night when it's too dark for that sort of nonsense. Alexa Flex could not hear us at least half the time. We'd walk into a dark bathroom, step back and tell her again, walk into dark bathroom again, then go back and lean down to yell at her to turn on the bathroom lights and she still didn't do it every time. Luckily, I already have two dots or I wouldn't have had any faith at all in alexa. I put a dot in the living room about ten feet further away from the bathroom than the flex is, and when we tell the flex to turn on the bathroom lights, the dot actually picks it up and gets the light instead. I finally moved the flex to the kitchen where I had the dot and it seems to do a little better since it's now closer to our face instead of by the floor. I bought her to get the bathroom lights but now she gets the kitchen and entrance lights. I would only recommend the flex if it's truly going to be in a small space where it will be sure to hear you. I have one by my bed as well and she doesn't respond as well as I'd like there either. I would suggest getting the dot if you're able.
title: Only for small spaces

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: avgcustomer
content: This is a convenient device to have, it brings Alexa to more areas in the home. I got it with the nightlight attachment which is great because I have it set to turn on and off automatically at my bathroom sink. My issue is not with the tinny sound through the speakers because I don't really use it to listen to audio, the problem is that the lower quality seems to have carried over to the microphones as well. I frequently have issues with the Echo Flex understanding the commands I'm giving it, and I'm constantly having to tell Alexa to cancel or outright ripping it out of the socket while she's going through the incorrect script. It's especially worse at night when I'm repeatedly having to re-issue commands to turn on my bathroom lights at a dimmed setting and she's initializing burglary detection or looking for a nearby restaurant. I've resorted to carrying my smartphone with me more often so I can just issue commands through the Alexa app. This is in contrast to the Echo Dot which I rarely have issues giving commands to, it has twice as many speakers (4 vs 2 in the Flex) and it sounds better so I'm assuming the microphones must be better to. Do I recommend that you purchase an Echo Flex? Possibly if you need it to use Alexa infrequently in an odd location, but for something as frequent as controlling your bathroom lighting you might want to opt for something with better voice recognition.
title: Too much compromise on quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Eric McCann
content: I picked two of these up to mess around with, one with the night light attachment. These were pre-set by Amazon before delivery, so I can't speak to how easy or hard they are to set up - from experience this tends to be quick and painless, though. Brief review on the night light attachment - it's slick and integrates well, and seems to be secure. You can tweak the light color, and yes, it detects low light just fine. It does what it is supposed to and looks like part of the Echo Flex. I see reviews with people complaining about the sound from the speaker. If you're expecting awesome sound from a tiny little speaker, be realistic - this is fine for telling you what the weather's like if you ask, or if you see a notification or other basic information. Playing music... maybe if you want to recreate the early days of radio. It does not do most music justice on its own - but I'm not knocking it for that because (a) that's not what I bought it for and (b) it would be ridiculous to expect it to. If you want to put this somewhere and play music, it *can* pair with a bluetooth speaker (and does come with a speaker out.) Use those, or look into something like an Echo Dot. I am being realistic with the sound quality rating at three stars, though. Fine for notifications or voice. Awful for music. This does take up one of your plugs. It's low enough the other is free (assuming, obviously, you put it on the lower outlet.) This is one thing I'd like to see adjusted - having an outlet passthrough would be nice, though not strictly needed. Perhaps even turning it into a smartplug as well. I'd like to see more accessories for this. The only ones I can see are the night light and motion sensor. Something as simple as a clock to hang off the bottom. A speaker, for those wanting something slightly better without a second device (or someplace to mount a dot.) Maybe a small camera for helping do things like baby monitoring. I think there's potential in this device that's not being used.
title: Works for what it's designed for, could use a tweak or two.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: TnT
content: Only been using it for a few days but so far it's been working great for my application, I'm extremely happy with the product!  In my house I have a central audio system that has built in speakers in the ceiling of all the rooms which is hardwired to a single Echo Dot. So adding these Flex units to rooms that are out of earshot of the main Echo Dot, for example the garage or upstairs bathroom, it's something like adding additional microphones.  I can speak a command and everything plays normal out of the central system as if I'm speaking to the main Echo Dot. People that are complaining about the internal speaker sounding lousy, it says in the description over and over these aren't intended alone for music. After set up the internal speaker is not really used. It will give acknowledgement tones from it but everything else plays to the "preferred speaker"  which you designate within the Alexa app. Adding additional Echo dots with probably accomplish the same thing but this does it in a super compact clean simple plug in module with no loose wires. I haven't tried the motion or the night light optional devices for this but I plan to pick them up
title: It's like adding "extra ears" to Alexa 👍

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: thornhillatthemovies.com
content: I'm not thrilled with the Echo Flex. I have an Echo and love that, I have a bunch of plugs connected to it, and control the lights throughout our small apartment with it. I have had some difficulty getting other smart plugs to communicate and connect with Alexa and our Echo. So, when I saw the Echo Flex on Amazon, I initially thought it was a smart plug with Alexa built in. It isn't. And that's my mistake. Our apartment is very small, so I plugged the Echo Flex into the wall (it really looks like a multi-plug you plug into a regular outlet) and connected it. A few days before, I got a wall clock made by Citizen and connected it to the Echo. With the Echo Flex plugged in, and connected, all of the voice recognition was going through the Flex and the Smart Clock no longer did the countdown with a timer, as it did with the Echo. I unplugged the Echo Flex. The smart clock worked fine. I think if you have a bigger house and more rooms to cover, using the Echo Flex is a good way to get more coverage. But in our small apartment, it isn't necessary. I can control the Echo in our living room, from our bedroom. When the Echo Flex was plugged in, it seemed to recognize my voice well. But the speaker on it reminds me of playing something through a small speaker on a cheap cassette player. Remember those? It is hollow and tinny and would not be a good vehicle for music or other audio. If Amazon could come up with a smart plug directly tied into the Alexa range, I would buy that.
title: Possibly Good For Some Situations... But There Are Problems

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lenny
content: I have this in my garage, where it's more useful than I expected. I originally got this so that I can turn on the garage light when I come in from the side door (the light switch is at the other side of the garage, near the kitchen entrance). I set up an Alexa routine so that it will turn on the light for a minute, giving me enough time to walk to the other end of the garage to enter the house without tripping over things, before turning itself off. So far that has worked very well. The USB port also turned out to be more useful than I expected. With so many things that recharge from USB these days, such as my bicycle headlights, it's nice to have another charger in the garage. I measured the charging current at 1.6A, I'm not sure if that's the maximum current, or just how much my light draws when recharging, but it is more than I expected. Finally, having it as a plug in form factor saves me the hassle and expense of getting a separate mount for it. Downsides, the speaker is not as good. It specifically says it's not suitable for playing music, but within a few days of using this, Alexa said that I haven't asked it to play music and if I would like to do so. I guess someone didn't program it properly. Finally, the microphone isn't as good as the other Echo devices I have. Even the 1st generation Echo Dot does a better job of recognizing my commands when there's extra noise in the background. Overall, for the price and utility, it deserves 5 stars.
title: Inexpensive device for where you don't need to play music

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Discriminating Buyer
content: I've been putting in echo dots and shows around the house, really to be used as an intercom/announcement system and for control of some smart items.  My parents are elderly and my Mom had a stroke a few years ago so I prefer to have some sort of communication system around that is voice activated (as long as they can speak) in an emergency.  It's also proved handy for them to control lights, view some cctv cams, fans, the air conditioning, etc. I bought the flex used based on the poor reviews that it got, I figured that if they didn't work at least I wasn't out the cost of a new one.  I wanted these for areas where I don't have dots.  Setup was probably easier than any other Echo device I've had.  It apparently uses bluetooth so that has to be turned on on the phone.  I did a test speaking close into the dot and it transmitted to all the other echo devices.  The sound from it isn't that bad, I was expecting some really tinny sound but Alexa sounds much the same as on the other devices.  I haven't tried music on it to see how that sounds but I did make Alexa sing the 20 second wash your hands song and it sounded okay. UPDATE I tried music on it and while it wasn't terrific it wasn't all that bad. I decided to put this in the carport instead up near the ceiling and it definitely is tinny sounding there and not very loud.  I maxed the volume through the app and it still wasn't very loud.  It seems to hear okay though.
title: Better than I expected!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sharon Clark
content: I bought this for the basement as I am terrified of falling down my cement steps and being unable to get help.  I placed it in the center of the basement in the only available outlet.  Volume goes up to 10, which, unfortunately, is very low for my slightly impaired hearing.  I need to be within a few feet to hear it at all and ideally within a few inches to understand.  I have an echo plus and a couple of dots and have them about halfway because they can be loud.  The flex at full is way too quiet, would never buy another and wouldn't recommend for that reason.  That being said, I really only need it if I fall down the steps and need to call for help.
