title: Echo Flex Is the Basis for a Great Little Internet Radio

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mark Kantrowitz
content: I have many echo dots throughout my home to make it easy to turn lights on and off with my voice. But, in some locations I don't have a place to put the echo dot near an outlet, so I have to buy an echo mount to hang it from the outlet. The echo flex eliminates the need for a mount. In addition, one can get a motion sensor for the echo flex. It is easy to program it to turn on the lights or take other actions when you enter a room. For example, you could program it to turn off your robot vacuum or send it to another room when you enter a room. Sure, the speakers aren't has high quality as the echo, but I don't listen to music in every room. The main limitation is the echo flex (and its accessories) come in only one color, white.  Amazon should consider offering it in black, which will be less inconspicuous in some locations.
title: Eliminates the need for an echo mount

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Barbara A. Daugherty
content: Bought this for my husband to have in his bathroom (mostly for morning talk radio).  Plugged it in, synched it up and off we go!  Is the sound a little tinny?  Sure.  But come on ... it's a teeny tiny speaker.  It's great for our purposes, but probably wouldn't use it to listen to music.  So great to be able to just plug it in; no taking up counter space, no cords, etc.  Great product for a great price.  The only issue I've had is in trying to adjust the volume; since there are no + or - buttons, I have tried to use Alexa to adjust the volume up or down a bit (mostly down as it seems "loud" is its default mode) but haven't had much luck.  If I say "Alexa, lower volume by 2", the volume lowers then goes right back up again.  Minor inconvenience and could very well be operator error.
title: Little but Mighty

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kluksza
content: Bought this to use in my daughters room, and was pleasantly surprised that it an do everything my Show can do, just without the video! What I liked is that it just plugs into the wall, which is great because her bed side table is filled with a million other things. The volume adjusts just fine. She plays music from here. From what I understand you can enable other things like reading bedtime stories and such, but we haven’t ventured that far. It also came with a free smart bulb, which we easily hooked up in her room. My daughter loves asking Alexa to turn on her lights! We are working on connecting it to some of her other devices, but honestly, I got this for under ten dollars on prime day WITH a free smart bulb and it was hands down my favorite and best purchase!
title: Alexa does everything you need her to from this!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: HeatherB
content: This was a nice little device to add to our already expansive collection of an Echo and an Dot. We got this to use in my sons nursery to command Alexa without screaming or walking into the other room. The speaker on it is pretty decent, we’ve used it for white noise once or twice. Currently it’s on a lower outlet, would probably work better at a higher outlet (such as in a kitchen or a bathroom/counter level), but a only means you may have to repeat something, not a big deal.  Setup was super easy and took less than 5 minutes. I can definitely see us buying more of these when we have a larger home and don’t need the Echo or Dot in the actual room. They are great for commanding Alexa to do lights or actions for the living room while your in the kitchen for example.
title: Great to tie with other devices.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: loretha knight johnson
content: We have 9 other Alexa devices in our home. I bought this one for my dressing room (very small bedroom) to not disturb my husband when I am getting dressed for work. It does not disturb him because the sound is so low it is impossible. The sound quality is not what you would expect from an Alexa device. It is great for the news and my schedule for the work day. But if I am getting dressed for the evening and want to hear music it is not so good. I was surprised by the sound quality even after reading other reviews. Right now it works because it plugs directly into the wall out of the way which is what I needed and the price was perfect. But the sound surprises me every time I ask a question or give a command. I personally would not recommend this device to anyone.
title: I guess you get what you pay for.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Orlando_B
content: - You have to really talk straight to it for it to hear you. - Poor speaker (which is fine and expected) This is our 8th echo device for our house. We have moved the Echo Flex all over the house and not found a place for it. Nobody likes it. It has a hard time understanding you and we feel like you have to walk right up and talk right to it. We paired it with a motion sensor, and, while that won't affect this review score, it is another thing that didn't work well.
title: Not great, even for what it intends to do

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jason R
content: The Echo Flex is a nice, tidy way to have Alexa in our kitchen without taking up much space. It’s great for the usual random info for cooking, weather and arming/disarming our camera system. My only criticism is that the speaker output is much weaker than I had anticipated. I knew it wouldn’t be as good as the Echo dot we have (which is actually a pretty impressive speaker) but if I try to play music on it I have to Max the volume on both devices just to hear it clearly. I wasn’t expecting any bass, and there isn’t any, but I expected it to be able to get as loud as my phone speaker at least. Again, it’s a tiny unit so I was perhaps expecting too much. The third party nightlight is a nice touch also. I only run it on about 40% intensity because it’s quite bright. You can also change it to all sorts of colors if you like This also is compatible with Alexa Gaurd, so it’s another mic listening for fire/CO alarms or glass breakage while you’re out. Overall I’m happy with it. If you intend to use it for music or phone calls regularly you might want to stick with a gen three dot, as it has much greater output. With that and the outlet hanging mount you still wouldn’t take up any counter space, however it wouldn’t be as sleek.
title: Handy for several tasks. Volume somewhat limited.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Butchboy
content: Update:  After a couple of months, this device started disconnecting from Wifi almost on a daily basis.  I have GB speed in my house, so that isn't the problem.  Additionally, the connection to my Bluetooth speaker is shaky at best.  I would not recommend this device anymore. I wanted an Echo for the bathroom because I like to listen to the radio while showering.  However, I didn't want a cord and didn't want to take up counter space for the dot itself.  The Echo flex helps fit that bill.  It works well in the small room, but the one thing I do not like is the tinny sound that comes out of it.  Actually, the sound is quite bad compared to the dot.... more like a transistor radio (for those who are old enough to remember those). The convenience is great though and I will continue to use it until one with better sound comes out.
title: Dud

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Joseph
content: I bought this only because I have a dedicated Bluetooth speaker in my kitchen. If I didn't have this, it would have been a waste of money. It does work like every other Alexa device, just more compact and perfect for an area where you cannot lay the Echo on a surface. ***UPDATE*** This device randomly turns on and does actions/requests no one requested. When I turn on multi room music, this device will not play any of the music even though it is included in the music group. The music from Pandora also cuts in and out a lot, making you miss a few seconds of each song multiple times during each song. No other Echo device I have does this. It also cannot hear too well; I have to push the listen button for it to receive commands, almost as if it is ignoring its activation word.
title: Horrible device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: AmazonJunkie
content: I like that it is compact and out of the way. Fits nicely behind our sofa and uses up 1 bottom outlet space leaving the top outlet open for use. Easily installed with our other alexa electronics. The only cons so far is that the audio is not good quality. When playing music you dont feel the base. The music sounds very flat. You can easily hear the difference when playing all the alexa electronics at the same time. When you walk into the room with the flex its as if you suddenly went underwater. The other drawback is that I have an echo show in my dining room, 2 rooms away.  When I speak to the flex sometimes the echo show answers. I dont notice this as much with the echo dots, which are normally very receptive and has better speakers.
title: Eh, wish it had the same quality as an echo dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Robert O.
content: I use the Echo Flex as a fill-in device at a good price point. It's convenient and just plugs into an available wall socket. By fill-in I mean that it fills gaps in my Alexa home coverage. I have 9 Echo devices, 2 of which are Flex.  Good for hallways etc. I have each equipped with the motion sensor. One is in my entry hall and turns on lights when we come in through the front door. of course it also turns on flights when we leave which isn't so useful. Alexa needs more conditions for Routines so for example the hall Flex shouldn't turn on lights if lights are already on.  Sound quality is poor from the Flex but this doesn't matter to me because I just use it to issue home automation voice commands. Overall a great addition and good value for money.
title: Great 'fill in' device at a good price point.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stew
content: The speaker is weak.  So, don't expect much for music.  We hear Alexa's voice responses just fine in our bathroom.  I use a blutooth speaker to play music from this Echo Flex.  My review includes the Smart Motion Sensor kit.  I set up routines so when anyone walks into the bathroom, the lights turn on, Alexa says the time, etc.  This is neat as after there is no motion detected, the lights turn off in 5 minutes according to the routine I setup.  The sensor sensitivity is fine...as soon as anyone enters the bathroom (it is plugged into the socket by the light switch) it activates (even for the little dog)
title: Very Nice for Alexa in my bathroom.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jordan
content: This little box is very convenient and doesn’t take up a lot of space.  This is was placed in the bathroom.  Alexa usually will hear you just find except when in the shower.  You will need to yell.  The sound quality isn’t that great.  No bass at all.  There is an option to hook up a speaker, which I did making it sound a lot better. However, now there’s extra cords laying around.  I think you can hook up a Bluetooth speaker, but I don’t have one laying around.  Anyways,  this is a good buy, but you’ll need an extra speaker.
title: Works like Alexa should, but the sound isn’t that great.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Duane C. Stanton
content: I wanted a back porch voice (Alexa) control system.  I made a water proof Receptacle box that can handle size of the flex and the nightlight.  I have several “Alexa” driven devices in my yard, and having a fill in unit on the patio and in the backyard to activate the various devices...  like bistro lights, stereo system, fill in lighting etc. At the price and flexible use of this device it just great.  Forget it for audio use for music, but it’s great asking it questions and time.  And I’m looking at using them for security uses too. I enjoy having them in my shop area too.  My lights and main power tools are controlled with Alexa.  I have power vacuum system I can have turn on and off remote by voice.  Secure outlets for safety from grand kids too.
title: Very useful for fill in areas and security uses

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: akapoison
content: I needed something to put outside to pair with my outdoor wireless bluetooth patio speakers, and to provide the Alexa functionality I wanted and needed. This Echo Flex worked perfectly! It plugs in to the outlet on my patio (is rather unnoticeable, which is a plus so that I can leave it outside), set up immediately with my Alexa app, paired effortlessly with my bluetooth speakers; and, gave me the functions I desired (just like my Echo Dots). The price point (on sale) was also unbeatable! The only thing I notice is that you have to be within fairly close range (about 10 feet) and directly facing it for it to hear your voice commands in an outdoor setting; in an enclosed space, I am sure it would have further range. I am very happy with my purchase, and would purchase it again.
title: Perfect plug-in Alexa mini smart speaker for Outdoor Use

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: S. Goldstein
content: I like to listen to the morning news and weather while I shave, brush my teeth, etc.  At that point, I usually have not yet inserted my hearing aids, and I have hearing loss in the high frequencies.  I used to have an Echo Dot in the bathroom, but without hearing aids, the sound seemed muffled and muddy no matter how I adjusted the sound to emphasize the treble.  The sound from the Flex is much like the pocket-size transistor radios back in the '50s...sort of tinny.  But, that's what I like about the Flex because its sound is much easier for me to understand.  I guess that I have a spare Dot on my hands, but the tradeoff was well worth it for me.  I rated the sound quality as three stars, but for my needs, it is more like five stars.
title: Perfect for news and weather...and that's what I use it for

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: T. S. Crider
content: This is not a top-tier speaker. It's very tinny and I wouldn't attempt to listen to music on it. But that's not why you purchase an Echo Flex. What you can do is plug in a good speaker set using the jack, connect a good speaker via Bluetooth, and save yourself some space compared to any other Echo device. Or, if you know you're not going to have music in a certain room but would like the convenience of having Alexa available, say the garage, a bathroom, or college dorm, for instance, then this is a killer option. The USB port for attachments is a great feature. It makes me wonder why none of my other Echo devices have a USB port, if nothing else then at least for charging phones or tablets. This is a very capable, versatile and cheap Echo solution.
title: The Most Flexible Echo Device Yet...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Author at Home
content: I bought this for the utility room in our home. It plugs in directly above the washer. And I love it dearly. The reason I chose this option was I did not feel like putting a full-blown echo of any kind right next to the washing machine. Down there sound Fidelity really is not an issue. There is a tool room, a drafting room, the furnace, some storage... It's not a place where people will hang out. However, one of the best things about this is it is small, inconspicuous and you still have full Alexa availability. I will use mine to listen to news, ask about traffic in Metro, make sure that I add things to list, turn lights on and off... The same basic things that are not music related but I use my other echos for. This would be a perfect addition to a utility room, a garage or any like-minded space in your home. I tend to think this thing was made for workshops. It's great.
title: Perfect for a tool room / laundry room

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Frank O’Connor
content: Well I guess I am not terribly smart. Ordered this as a "deal of the day" and the price was excellent - included a discount webcam/security cam - but while I knew the audio would be low quality, I somehow managed to completely miss the fact that it is not actually a smart plug - in the sense that it has no AC pass through - so I can't for example use it to control a lamp... Yes, that's me being an idiot and not thinking, or even looking at it properly. Audio is tinny and small - yet four stars for being slightly better than I'd expect from this sort of terminal device, and the USB port on the edge means I might be able to salvage this as a controller for a USB powered gadget, just not a lamp! Also makes sense in  a garage or bathroom.
title: When is a Plug not a Plug? When the buyer is a maroon.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kim Kremer Elliott
content: The Echo Flex does bring Alexa to small spaces or to spaces you don't want to potentially dunk a corded object in your bath. For this, it's great. However, to get the voice recognition to work, I need to basically scream at the unit for it to pick up my voice. The sound quality is also tinny, and is worse than the speaker on my phone. I also notice that the Echo Flex seems to drop playback more frequently than my other Alexa-enabled devices. If these hadn't been a steal in the two-pack, I would have returned them already. (The issues are the same for both devices, so it's not a faulty single unit.) Hope this design improves over time, I might be willing in a couple of y ears to give it another shot when the bugs are worked out.
title: Does what it's supposed to - sort of...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: David Johnson
content: I really liked the direct plug in aspect of this product (i.e. no power cord) and then the available night light made it an easy choice to replace the Echo Dot that I have in a bathroom.  However the audio quality is nowhere near as good as even the Echo Dot.  I have it in the bathroom to listen to music while in the bath or shower, and it is definitely not loud enough and the quality of the audio is mediocre at best. For basic issuing of commands to tell devices what to do and asking for the weather and other simple things it's ok, but I would not recommend this for anyone wanting to listen to music.  Also, if you are buying the nightlight attachment, be sure to measure the amount of space you have under the outlet.  I had to flip the unit over so the light was on top, as once installed the night light hit the bathroom counter under the outlet.
title: Nice design, but lower audio quality than other Echo devices

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: SC
content: bought this because it was on sale, and i liked the idea that it wouldn't take up any space and could just sit in the outlet. already have an echo dot, which has surprisingly rich sound for its size - this little guy, not so much. i knew it was smaller and wouldn't be quite the same, but the sound out of this thing is downright crappy - so tinny, it's actually annoying to listen to (not that i would listen to music out of something so small, but even the voice response is far less pleasant to interact with than the echo dot). the space-saving aspect is nice, but honestly, if i knew how much quality was sacrificed, i would have sprung the extra few dollars and just made a few inches of room on the dresser for another echo dot.
title: really crappy sound

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: SK
content: I have a 2nd generation Echo dot in a wall mount above my kitchen counter and use it daily for a timer, reminders, weather report, etc. The dot does the job great, but it's a little bulky and awkward looking. I liked the sleeker, inobtrusive look of the Flex, but I just couldn't stand the sound. It sounds not only like a robot, but a robot in a box. Very robotic and echoey. Also, the sound it makes when the timer goes off is higher pitched than the dot and I found it annoying. The Flex would be ideal for putting in a hallway or somewhere where you just need it for voice control of lights, heat, etc. I would not plan to use this for music or even for flash briefings unless you absolutely have to have the small footprint.
title: Love the look, hate the sound!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Clinton Murray
content: On sale for $9.99 made it a good value for me. I got it to use with the $5.85 smart plug I bought at ebay. It was convenient for turning light off after under the covers and on before I got up. But, when I asked it for the time in the night I couldn't hear it over my sound machine. I also couldn't hear it from bathroom when playing NPR's Morning Edition. I solved those problems by switching it with the downstairs Echo Dot. It takes up less room plugged into wall socket beside my recliner, and no problem hearing it from there. And the Echo Dot works much better in bedroom. The volume can be turned up much higher and easy to hear the radio from bathroom. At the present prices the 3rd Gen Dot is a better buy for bedroom, but the Flex is convenient where the size fits better.
title: Small footprint

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JVAN
content: I don't care about the audio quality of these. One is just for setting timers, asking questions and adding to shopping lists. The other is plugged into a sound system. It's small, and has no cords, which is also great. We have two of these, one in the garage and one on the back screened-in porch. We also have a 4 dots from all three generations, an original Echo and a Google mini. The flex is by far the very worst in hearing you speak! I find myself talking very loud, verging on a shout unless I'm within 3 feet. Once when trying to set a timer in the garage, the Echo, which is inside the house in our dining room responded while the Flex did not. The doors were open, but still. The Flex microphone is horrible.
title: Hard of hearing

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Scott
content: I have echo devices all over. I bought this specifically because I wanted the motion detector. The motion detector works great, but the Echo Flex speakers are terrible. Having two Echo devices in one room is silly, so I had to make a choice of the motion detection or a better echo device. Why not have a motion detector that can hook up to the other echo devices?
title: It's an echo with horrible speakers

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dane R. Fisher
content: I've had it for a week now.  Love the concept and idea.  It does exactly what an alexa would do, however, it is a bit bulky and ugly.  Not the supreme quality that you're used to with these types of things (alexa, dot) as it looks and feels like a prototype and not a finished product.  That being said I think that in a few months they would really benefit in slimming it down, improving sound quality, and some color options. I don't know why a digital clock add-on should be as big as it is.... and why not just include it to the actual product itself... or have the digital clock double as a motion sensor light?  Again: great idea... needs some fine-tuning and improvements.  Looking forward to the upgraded generations.
title: Great idea... needs fine-tuning

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: hobbitchick
content: I love all my Echo products and needed something to use in the bathroom as a speaker for showers, morning routine etc.  The Echo Flex is very compact, plugs into a single outlet and has 1 USB port on the bottom.  We use our USB outlet to charge our phones, but there's only one to use at a time. I think my biggest issue though is that the sound quality is not great.  It sounds like an old fashion radio.  Not a problem for a small space like a bathroom, but after using the Dot devices for some time it throws you off. I also don't like that there is no manual button(s) for volume control. You have to use voice activation, or the app to change volume, which can be tricky if there is enough noise to cancel it out.
title: Great in small spaces, poor audio quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KR1SIS
content: I purchased the echo flex with the motion sensor as a 'doorbell' for the back porch.  Our back porch is enclosed with a light switch and now added smart light.  I replaced the switch with a switch and outlet combination.  After adding a small routine, the Flex starts out by turning the smart light on, then announcing to all echo devices in the house that there is a person at the porch, then after a delay of 3 minutes, turns the light off.  This is exactly when I need.  I already have a cheap WIFI camera with 2 way communications, but it doesn't alert me, nor it is capable of turning the light on.  Our porch gets pretty dark at night and I now have some light for unlocking the door.  If people actually came to the front porch, I would do that one too.  No need for a doorbell.  Oh, since the announcement goes to all echo's, it also goes to the person at the door, so they know we know.  No need for them to yell or knock that they are there.  We have an older house and actually didn't have a doorbell.
title: Fantastic Item

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: G
content: First this Alexa app/device does nothing useful and after using it for quite a while and spending way too much money on stupid devices I can tell you this Alexa thing is stupid and a waste of time and money. Do yourself a favor and just shoot yourself in the head before buying these devices. I can turn lights on and off much better and easier without Alexa. I can search better I can select music better in fact I can do everything better than Alexa.  My life was better before Alexa and I was not angry before Alexa. She hardly ever understands what you ask her for and buy the time you repeat yourself over and over you should of just did it yourself. These AI devices are junk and have no useful purpose currently.
title: Do not waste  your energy, time, money on these crappy AI devices there is no "I" in these devices

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nancy
content: I purchased one recently and love it.  I have it in my lanai (yes, I live in Florida).  I love it because now I don't need to use a cord like I did with the other Alexa.  It was a perfect price since it was a new item, so I purchased another one which I will find a place for this one also.  I have a lot of the Amazon Alexa's but they are so great it is fun to have new ones.  I will probably give away one or two of my older ones to friends.  Seriously, I love how easy it was to hook up and now that they have a USB on the bottom, you can plug in a cell phone or a speaker for better sound.  The sound is find for us.  Love it and will keep on getting the new items as they come out.  Get it while it is on sale.
title: It is a new item and I love it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Katy R.
content: I bought it to add to my exterior garage - and got the motion sensor with it, so we know if someone is in the garage. It fits the bill for what I wanted - small, unobtrusive, but still "smart" so I can drop in on anyone out there, The speaker is everything they say it is, which is not great, but it works for what I need it for. I may add a blue-tooth speaker later, so we can stream music out there. Overall I am pleased, and would purchase another one. The set up was super easy, it connected right in to my house, communicating with my 2 Gen 2 dots, 2 gen 3 dots and all my smart bulbs & plugs. I wouldn't start my smart home with one, but I recommend it for expanding your Alexa reach.
title: It is a nice addition to my Smart family.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Captav1
content: Tried the flex to replace my original dot to free up space on the table. The setup was identical to the Echo Dot . Some of the critiques about sound pickup are true but I think that is because of the new location on the wall plug while the Echo was on the table. My biggest complaint is the bluetooth pickup. I continually lose bluetooth reception with my bluetooth speaker, an issue I never had with the Echo Dot. This might be due to the placement of the Echo Flex on a wall plug lower in line of sight with the speaker. The distances are identical within 2 feet, far below the 30 foot threshold bluetooth provides. The idea is great (allowing you to free up table space). I will probably before too long replace the flex with a Echo Dot.  We currently have an Echo Dot in all of our habituated rooms and garage (6 total) I'll probably stick this extra flex on my patio
title: It's Ok

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kersplat
content: Setup works with the wireless settings in my house when I first plugged in an echo flex.  However when that same echo flex went to work with me it would not accept the new wireless settings at work.  After about 6 hours of trying I had to remove the echo flex from my amazon account and then it would run setup at my workplace and accept the new wifi settings. Volume is not very loud at maximum and the alexa app and "set volume" command to work well.
title: Changing wifi networks is not always effortless

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: jack canon
content: Ok, for real. Amazon, this is just like when you designed the Echo Show, 1 and 2.  Terrible, ugly design.  Looks like you are using product design from 2007.  Please, go smaller, thinner, follow industrial design concepts which are widely accepted in 2020.  USB A.  Really? 5 to 10 years ago, we would have praised you.  Why are you so slow to adopt to USB C adapters Amazon? This should have been a future proofed product.  But since you didn't want to be to heavily on this product you went ahead with a 30 year old technology and ensured that we would need to be making upgrades soon if this product ever takes off.  I have mine in the bathroom, it's ok. I like that it plugs directly into the power outlet, helps me keep it up off of the table top.  I wish they would provide an option like this for the Echo Dots.
title: This product is fugly and tinny. some people like it. not me.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mike F
content: Great little addition speaker and not much more...if you have a very small spare room, use it as a surround sound style device and group it with a larger echo device, or you are putting it in somewhere that is not usually occupied (garages/sheds/hallways/desks, depending on your life) this is a great device especially for the price.... The speaker in this device is weaker than my Galaxy S10+ which is rather disappointing considering I've had bluetooth speakers smaller than this that are much louder. I know you have to sacrifice some for the size of device and the hardware to run it but if the 2mm speaker in my phone is louder than this device you can do much better than what you've given us in this product... The Alexa voice recognition is spotty sometimes and immaculate at other times so I'm not sure what it is with it that does this...I have one in in the back of my garage, it heard me and completed my command from the driveway, WITH THE DOOR CLOSED. Then other times it kept hearing the wake up word but immediately closing off without a command, had to wake word several times before it fo ally stayed open and listened to me... Would I buy this again? Maybe. Once they update it and fix these issues, but as of now I have enough of these...
title: Eh... Weak speaker, spotty recognition, worth about $10

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rex D Renfro
content: Added this to my garage with the motion sensor option. It works exactly like I wanted it to. I have a routine that has my garage lifts come on when it senses motion, and turns the lights out when there's no movement for ten minutes. The Flex itself works just fine, like any other Alexa device. I have it connected to a Bluetooth speaker and have zero complaints. If you want to use this for music, trust all the reviews and the product description. The sounds quality is exactly as it's been described. Update : The flex lacks tremendously, in a noisy environment. Has serious trouble hearing us with a fan on and in some cases, doesn't hear us when it's quiet either. I still airboat the convenience of the flex, but not real happy about having to yell at it to get its attention.
title: Very helpful device.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: David Prentice
content: I am genuinely impressed! I got three of these. One for my office, one for the kitchen, and one for the garage. I keep them connected on the 2.4Ghz band since for me it is more reliable. I've got two motion sensors, and one set up as a night light, and these really do allow you to do things you never thought possible before. I automate the lighting in my office. If no movement after 30 minutes the lights turn off. I got the same setup in my garage. The night light in the kitchen comes on if it gets dark, and since I can set timers it helps with cooking. The speakers aren't much to boast about but the microphone does a great job of picking your voice up. When combined with a speaker group these little guys do add that extra little razzle-dazzle to make the music really kick!
title: Impressed!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Norman Oro UCLA 93
content: I just got my Echo Flex today. This is my first Echo device, so of course, I think it's awesome. Others have complained about the sound, but the speaker is perfect for my purposes (I live in a small apartment that's ~160 sq ft large and I never play music loud). The Echo Flex was easy to set up; and accessing information, the day's news, music, setting reminders, using the timer, etc are really intuitive. This is a very cool device, especially for the price. Update September 13, 2020: It was nice while it lasted, but my Echo Flex no longer connects to the wifi network in my apartment. Amazon tweeted me some suggestions on how to fix the problem, but unfortunately it still won't connect. Other devices do (eg, my phone), but my Echo Flex won't. It was nice while it lasted (I got my Echo Flex in December 2019), but that's it for now in terms of Echo devices for me.
title: Though it be small...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bao
content: The only reason I got this flex was so I can use Alexa for my bedroom’s light.  The set up was very easy as expected from an amazon device.  It pretty much was plug and play.  Just hook it up to your wifi and let Alexa guide you the rest of the way. I took off 2 star because of the price and sound.  I definitely think something like this should be under $15 (amazon prime day they were on sale for $9 ish), so I suggest waiting for another sales to purchase one of these.  The build quality is meh and the sound is horrid.  I made sure to turned that feature off. Overall it’s a decent addition to the Alexa family tree.  However the echo dot would be the better choice IMO.
title: It’s ok

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: R. Labanca
content: Update: recently trying the line out, not good. It has an ac hum that makes it not usable for good speakers. That stinks! The obvious missing element here is not having a controllable outlet. I almost assumed it did. That way it would be even more useful, but even if it had a dumb outlet, it would not have to consume the outlet you plug it into. The other odd thing is you use one usb device or another. It would have been nice if you could stack them! Otherwise, it's tinny but it is meant for utility not music, and it seems to work as well as a dot. I got it because of a sale, I think the price is a little high, but if it had a controllable outlet $25 would be just right.
title: not bad for what it is, but could have been better

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kay
content: I have a few echo devices in my home and of course with each generation it seems like the sound quality gets better and better. However with this being a newer product the sound quality is horrendous! Now granted this happens to be plugged into my bathroom but I like to sing while I'm doing my hair or makeup or in the shower and you can barely hear anything over the shower so now I have to go and buy a shower speaker just to be able to get some type of volume there is no volume button so you cannot control the volume which is probably my biggest issue with this device. Honestly I'm thinking about returning the device. The only good thing is that my phone could be plugged in another room charging or something and I'm still able to make calls from the bathroom. If they are going to sell this device you should probably only be $15 which is what I paid because I believe I caught it on sale but that's about the worth of the device it should not be any higher than $15 PERIOD!
title: Not worth more than $15

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JamesTN865
content: This is a terrific idea for adding Echo to those areas of the home where there is nowhere to place a standard Echo, but good grief the sound is awful. I have a dozen of the various Echo devices throughout my house, for excellent coverage, but the laundry closet needed an Echo, so that while I am stuck folding clothes I can add things to my shopping or project list that come to mind,  or listen to the news or a podcast to make the chore more pleasant. I thought that this product would be a  perfect solution because it plugged neatly into the outlet above the laundry  counter, leaving the counter unobstructed for folding clothes, but I am so disappointed because I realized immediately during setup that the sound quality would make this unusable for anything but smart home command input.  It is definitely not something that would be tolerable for music or podcast streaming.  The Alexa voice itself is so tinny and distorted that I don't see myself even being able to use it.  I might try putting in a remote area where I would rarely need it but it might be handy for something like controlling a light. As one reviewer stated, with current speaker technology, there is really no excuse for such poor sound quality, even at that price point.  Amazon has had a few missteps with first generation Echo-tech, hopefully they will improve this device in subsequent generations.  It really is a great idea for any kitchen/bathroom/laundry/garage counter with a wall outlet.
title: Great Concept - Poor Execution

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: RC
content: Or works as I had hoped it would. As many have said, the sound quality in not why you get a flex. You get one of these if you want to add a night light or a motion detector of which I have one of each. Was extremely easy to setup and use. One issue I had is that I had to use the voice command to change the wake word as it never allowed me to change it via the device configuration. I have also noticed that it has a harder time understand some commands. I have a Kevo lock and told it to unlock the door and it said, Ok, locking front door. I suspect this is due to the fact it only has two mics. So far I have dots, echos, Fire cubes, dash and echo auto. They all have their pros and cons. This new flex is another echo that fits in the echo line and has a place. I use several routines and look forward to the continued growth of the ecosystem.
title: Simple Setup and works nicely. Don’t buy it for listening to music.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ken Y
content: I use a sound bar so I didn't really need a speaker of any kind in the echo device. I connect via Bluetooth. This is compact and offers a USB port which helps to keep the outlet useful. Physically very satisfied with it. However, it's "hearing" was supbar. And I'm comparing this to Echo Dots (2nd and 3rd Gen) which I have and wanted to replace with this. It seemed to need everything repeated twice, almost like the first time to wake it and the second time to execute something. I had to speak louder as well. It really was enough of a step down to be aggravating. I sent the two that I purchased back and am using the Gen 2 dot that I already had and upgraded one to a Gen 3.  Both are far superior in function It's too bad, I really liked the idea of these when I saw them.
title: Perfect device but poor results

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ring
content: This is great for small rooms such as bathrooms, laundry rooms, a butlers pantry, etc.  I like the small direct plug-in factor and leaves the other duplex outlet available for additional plug.  I purchased the night light to go in a guest bathroom and it's a great addition!  Love that the night light can change colors by just telling Alexa to change it!  Also able to tell the unit when to turn on and off the night light.  The unit gives all the benefits of the larger Echo or big brother Dot.  The sound quality is lacking in comparison to the larger units but that just makes sense since it's a very compact unit.  I plan to buy additional units for the other bathrooms in the house.
title: Great for bathroom, laundry room, etc....

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Terrance Leverette, Sr
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. This little thing is pretty good. I have every echo released thus far, starting with being a beta purchaser for the original echo, so I had to have this little guy for my collection. I placed this in my guest bathroom and it's perfect for quick responses, listening to music, news, etc while using the facilities! The sound coming from this is probably compared to the original echo Dot or less. It definitely can be heard easily but don't be expect to be blown away if you are a audiophile. The Alexa response needs some work but it eventually responds while the music is playing. I originally made this purchase during the holidays for one of the upcoming parties. We had music playing through out the house with the connected echoes and so this was available in the restroom to continue hearing the festive music. Needless to say, it was a big hit with the guest and several purchased one afterward to use likewise. I love it for what I use it for daily because it's just as convenient but out of sight. Great addition to the family of Amazon products.
title: Nice little addition

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nícko
content: This is super cool but you need to definitely by the nightlight adapter it is a nice feature. Also if you thinking about putting an outlet and using the outlet above it, you may want to think about adding a TP link extension ac plug. The thing is is that it sets off the wall and if you’re gonna plug it into the bottom part of your plug if you wanted to plug-in perhaps a blow dryer in the bathroom you won’t be able to without the extension.. Something to think about. The cool thing is that the nightlight can be set up on the Alexa to be turned on and off. My GF does not like light at night but it is motion sensitive so it’ll turn on if you walk in the room. Worth a 10 or 15 bucks it was as an add on to the new version of an Alexa Dot
title: It’s cool but buy the nightlight

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Duane A. Priest
content: I found this device at a significantly reduced introductory price during the holidays and thought I'd give it a try.  I'm very pleased that I did... I'm using this in my bedroom to add additional voice control.  First, the device plugs directly into the wall, meaning it's out of the way with no troublesome wires or power adapters to deal with.  The device has the ability to connect to Bluetooth speakers, or can attach directly to a speaker input using an audio cable.  In addition, the device has a built-in speaker that's more than adequate for voice response.  I previously purchased a couple of the Echo Input devices, which I've been quite happy with, but actually this device is much more capable, more responsive and even easier to set up and use.  I will likely buy more of these in the future.
title: Perfect, unobtrusive and easy to implement Echo add-on

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: C'est Moi
content: These devices are great but I found them to have very unique use in my home. They're deployed in the kitchen and garage. For use anywhere else, one has to be aware that neither the microphones not the speaker is any good. Yes you can connect via Bluetooth or 3.5mm to external speakers but the mic problem remains. Because of the speakers I can't deploy them in the bathroom as I love to listen to music in the bathroom and these sound terrible for that.
title: Great but..

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: sean
content: Has a very hard time hearing the wake word if there is any kind of background noise such as a running shower or bath fan. I could scream as load as I can and it doesn't respond. The echo devices in the other rooms through multiple doors do though. Had to change wake word to echo so my other devices don't respond. Turn off the shower and it works better. Still not good but, better. Also have been having problems with it dropping the wifi. I have to unplug and plug back in the get it to reconnect. Has potential but the wake word problem is frustrating. Don't recommend if you plan to use while taking a shower.
title: Voice recognition no good with background noise

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Vance
content: I bought this to supplement my echo dot in the living room that had a tough time hearing me if it was a noisy kitchen or if we were in the other rooms. Nice idea, all in one unit so it get plugged in and that's it. The speaker is underwhelming though. When you max it out, you feel like it'll blow the speaker because you get that "buzz" during speech or music bass. So much that thankfully I already had a bluetooth speaker wall mounted so I paired it with that, otherwise I would have returned it if I paid full price. I tried this out during the lightning deal (thank goodness). This also doesn't hear as well as the echo dots. I find it misunderstanding my command more and I again rely on the paired speaker. Maybe the placement could be better but the avg house has outlets that aren't above waist level or in a predominantly silent room so I would imagine the everyday practicality of this is not great. Biggest plus for me is the all in one plug into the outlet and that's it. No wires. Would I buy it again? Not at full price. Half price? Maybe but hesitant.
title: speaker quality and loudness is lacking

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: RichandFamous
content: Obviously the sound quality is low on the flex. It isn't large enough for a decent speaker. If that is important, get a regular echo. I knew that going in and expected to connect it with a bluetooth speaker. What I didn't expect is how bad the microphone is - nowhere near the sensitivity or usefulness of a dot, even. If music is playing on the external speaker (which works fine, by the way), the flex doesn't register its wakeup word, so you end up shouting Alexa over and over again. You have to be right up on it before it registers that you are calling it.  Very annoying, especially when it is the kids in the pool screaming it repeatedly. They won't even use the flex for that reason and they loved the echo that was outside before it died. I may keep it for something else, but it is a let down and I wouldn't recommend...
title: Alexa. Alexa! Aaallleexxaaa!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Neil
content: We have 5+ Echo devices scattered around the house. We didn't have one in the foyer and were shutting off lights on the way out the door by yelling into the kitchen. It worked, but for $12 on sale, I figured I'd give this little guy a try in a nearby outlet. It's small and relatively unobtrusive. There are two issues we are having. 1) Its tiny speaker is very tinny and not very good. Loud enough, but underwhelming it all other ways. Asking Alexa for the weather is audible but honestly grading on the ears. Compared to the Dots we have, this is inferior sounding. In one of our bathrooms we just used 3M Command Strips to attach a Dot next to an outlet. This works very well and sounds way better. 2) The mic must be way more sensitive on this unit because when we're in the kitchen where we have an Echo Show 8, half the time we ask Alexa for something, she responds from the foyer 15' away. This messes with kitchen timers, alarms and in general, just makes the setup a bit frustrating. I gave up and unplugged the unit. I'll likely put it in the garage instead where audio quality (for us) isn't a priority. Again, for the price, especially when it's not on sale, I'd recommend the Dot and a 3rd party outlet mount or some Command Strips.
title: Spend just a bit more and get an Echo Dot

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Mallinson
content: This is pretty much what we hoped for. Living in a two-story house with an office in the basement, I wanted to get Echoes on each floor to take advantage of the drop-in feature to save me from yelling up or down the stairs.  My daughter already had a Kids Echo Dot in her room, and I bought a regular Dot for when my wife is in the office, and with this in the kitchen on the main floor, they all work great together. As for music, yeah, the audio quality on the Flex is pretty crummy, but it easily paired with my JBL Flip Bluetooth speaker. I like not having to fiddle with my phone to turn on music in the kitchen now, especially with wet hands while washing dishes, and the Flex has enough range to allow me to take the speaker into the backyard. Not to mention that the USB port is useful for charging the speaker.
title: Good value for small spaces

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Vickie
content: Bought the Flex to put in my bathroom.. As I have Echo's everywhere else... I love the fact that if I were to fall I can simply ask Echo to call my chosen people to get help... this is a great feature but the room that I could most likely fall in for me is my bathroom and when I seen the flex I thought this could solve my concern.. I did not wish to buy a dot or tower within this steamy atmosphere for worry it would damage it ... but the flex is perfect.. It is not very loud and does not stream music..it does enough to please this gal..And if you wish a speaker can solve the loudness.. when it can stream music that will be a consideration.. but for 9.99 and a smart plug ..this gal got a two for one great deal.. Feel that I solved my safety concerns and hey who can use one more smart plug... There like potato chips ...can have just one!!!! lolol
title: Great little addition!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Chicken
content: Was really looking forward to these, as I thought the fact that they could plug straight in, AND run a USB, were great ideas. Wrong. Good idea, terrible execution. The mics, and speakers on these things, just. Plain. Suck. You have to tell at them over and over and over, to get the simplest things done. Often times, I'll ask for something from our new units, and get nothing, while my old ones hear, and do what I want, from 1 to 2 rooms away. Wished I'd saved the packaging, they'd be headed back.
title: Total garbage.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Steve Lawrence
content: I bought this to accompany my 'dot' - which sits in the living room. I had originally thought I'd put it in the bathroom and have it play radio or stuff while I was in the shower. Sadly - but in all fairness it *does* say on the description.... but slyly in the 'small print at the bottom' - this isn't a very good speaker. It's not. The speaker is awful. Tinny, lacking volume.. entirely unsuitable for plugging into and putting in the bathroom to listen to while showering. Oh well! I got it with the 'night light' attachment too. Fabulous! Now I can put it somewhere else. Maybe in the corridor? Maybe in the kitchen. Maybe in the basement? I tried all three of these. But it wasn't until I had put it in the basement and was demonstrating to the wife how the 'drop-in' function works that I discovered its true power. This thing picks up voices *exceptionally* well. I mean, it can year you say stuff from one side of the basement to the other! The 'voice recognition' is awesome. So awesome that it even picked up the 'guy who owned my house before me..'. THROUGH THE BASEMENT WALLS. See, little did I know, but he'd built a 'nuclear bunker' thing UNDER the house. And had an entrance / exit to it from like 300' away at the end of the property, under some power lines. Dude has been living there for three years! Just occasionally coming out at night and making trips to the nearby costco to bulk by 'stew in a can' and a stash of ramen noodles. Flex picked up him talking to himself through the walls... going on about lack of toilet paper, and plotting to sneak into my house to get 'the new password for the wifi' since I upgraded it recently! Well... great. 2020 just got better. Who picked 'basement dwelling hobo's' for their 2020 bingo? 10/10 uncovers critters / hobos / ghosts - would buy again. ( Just not for the bathroom, 'kay )
title: Discovered basement dwelling hobo...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stephen
content: I have many Echo dots in my home and they are all invaluable, but one thing I don't like is when I'm  in the Master Bathroom and my Echo dot is way on the other side of the room and it's playing music,  I'll have to scream "ALEXA" to get it  stop, pause, ask for the time etc... This little Echo Flex fits the bill perfect!  Just plugged it in the Master Bathroom, set it up once and that's it.  I even created a music speaker group called "Master Bedroom" so now I can say:  "Alexa, play Pandora in the Master Bedroom" and both the Master Bedroom Echo dot and the Master Bathroom Echo Flex will start playing music simultaneously (music does not sound as good as on the dot but that's not why I purchased it).  The best thing is I no longer have to scream at Alexa in the Master Bedroom to follow my commands, the Flex listens and follows my commands exactly.
title: Just what I wanted.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Palmeri
content: The Echo Flex is great for adding Alexa support to your garage, workshop, or other areas where you simply want the ability to interact with Alexa.  Of course, it also works great for streaming music if you pair it with an external speaker, which is what I did in my garage workshop.  I gave it a 5-star rating for sound quality because the audio matches the quality as described by Amazon (actually it sounds a little better than I expected).  Also, because of it's small plug-in module design, it makes it very convenient to add Alexa support to a location in your home where placing an Echo Dot would be difficult since all you need is access to an outlet and no table, shelf, or mounting bracket is required. Overall, this is a great addition to the Echo product family.
title: Great echo device for secondary areas

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Irish I Was Tan
content: It was easy to connect. I have the digital clock attachment on order to do double duty as a clock and a nightlight. The sound is clear, but not great for music. It’s tinny sounding like an old handheld transistor radio, but I didn’t get it for the music.  I replaced an Echo with this unit. The Echo was moved to a room I’d prefer decent music quality sound in, and this took its place primarily for weather check, time check, and shopping list sort of assistance... also, to drop in on my husband in another room to request a TP roll. <oops> My husband is annoyed by all the Alexa’s I’ve placed around the house despite him still using them. I’m the tech savvy one, so when he expresses his annoyance with one I ask it to do something and then look at him smugly. LOL
title: Works great for my needs

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lisa Bee
content: I use the flex as a secondary device - I have a dot in the main living/kitchen area of my home where I listen to music and use Alexa the most. The flex is in my bedroom right next to my bed and I mostly use it as an alarm, to add things to my grocery list, to check the weather and news before I get up in the morning, and for ambient sounds when I'm preparing for sleep. For these purposes it works well, and that's all I need it to do. If you're looking for more the flex is not for you - it doesn't work well in a large room or in a noisy room, and the sound is clear but not high quality- but for basic functionality close at hand in a small out-of-the-way package it is perfect!
title: Good secondary device for Alexa network

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mysteri
content: I have had a bad run with electronics I've ordered lately and this one fell into that category. I couldn't get it to work.  I wanted it to work!  I may repurchase when my bad luck streak has ended. Stay tuned! UPDATE:  I found out after I returned this that there was something wrong with my wireless router.  It was not very old, but apparently it was failing and shortly after I wrote this review it failed completely, which alerted me to the fact that there was a problem. Therefore, I will be reordering this, since I do still want it. I have updated my overall rating since 2 stars was not fair when it was my equipment that failed and not the Echo Flex.
title: Didn't Work - SEE UPDATE

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lori
content: Works just like any other echo device. This device is great for places you don't want a dot or other larger device. We have ours in the bathroom and it works great. I'm not sure why people give it a bad rating because of the sound. You don't buy this particular device for the sound. Yes the sound works just fine for asking questions but it doesn't sound that great for music. Still works fine for music just don't expect big deep sound. If you want something that sounds better get a dot or 2nd gen echo. I most definitely wouldn't give this a bad rating based off sound because ITS NOT SUPPOSED TO SOUND GREAT SMH. The attachments for it are great also. I have the clock and night light and both work awesome. One complaint I have is that the accessories don't have a female USB on them so you can plug in the motion then the night light into it. That would be awesome.
title: Works great for tight small places

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Gi
content: Want Alexa in your bathroom, hallways, or other low profile places? Perhaps looking to extend Alexa coverage for home automation? This is perfect and at a reasonable price point. It works just like my Echo dots and so far so good. I don't own any of the attachments but I may buy a couple of light accessories for the hallways. One problem I do have is the voice spacial recognition within my Alexa mesh. Sometimes, the Flex would respond to my commands even though I'm closer to the Echo Dot (3rd Gen). I know this has to do with sound projection and proximity to walls, but this definitely introduced an unwanted quirk within my home.
title: Perfect for those niche places.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: AyinOhr
content: This is trash. I -really- want to return it, but my husband likes the convenience of not having cords attached, so it stays. The trouble is, I purchased this to plug into the kitchen wall next to my sink, so that I could use it while cooking/washing dishes, etc. without taking up counter space, or having cords in my way. That has been a problem with other Echo devices we have. It works okay when I'm not running water, but once water is running, I can't hear anything coming from the speaker but rubbish, even at volume 10, nor can the Echo detect my voice over the sound of the water. Furthermore, without running water, voice detection is random at best, and frequently our other Echo devices respond from other rooms well before this will with us standing right in front of it. It's trash. Seriously. Don't do it. I would much rather have spent $17 to buy a wall mount for one of our 3rd Gen Echo Dots, or just bought another Echo Show. Total waste.
title: Terrible Volume | Terrible Mic | Trash

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Desiree Lopez
content: I just got this Echo Flex today... my husband got it for me as a Christmas gift.  We already own 5 Echo Dots but have a couple spots they cant hear us saying commands, so I wanted one (maybe more of these) to put in those spots.  I ended up putting this one in our hall bathroom and I already love it for more than just hearing my in between my other Echos.  I used it today to play music while showering.  Yes I know it says it's not ideal for playing music because the speakers are so small...and yes. they ate small... BUT I was using a shower radio before that rarely got good reception and also had small speakers. our bathroom is small so it works fine. Thanks for making such a great smaller echo at a more affordable price.
title: Economical, small, compact and works great.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Joshua Roney
content: I bought this to hook up to a speaker system that I have in my garage and also use the motion sensor adapter that is available for it in order to control the lights in my garage. For the most part, the Echo Flex itself does what I need it to do. I wasn't expecting any good sound quality (hence why I connected it to another speaker system) but the microphone is very lackluster as well. It would have been nice to have that sorted since I do use that feature quite often. One has to speak directly at the Echo Flex for it to register the voice input. Even then though, I would have given this a 3 star rating because it does what I expect, but the 2 star is due to the motion sensor add on. Beware the motion sensor adapter is terrible. I have to jump around in front of it for it to register movement. I've tried moving it around the room, different lighting methods, etc., to no avail. Very disappointing.
title: Meh

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Alxys
content: We LOVE the flex!! The night light add on is totally worth the money. We have them in the bathrooms. I can listen to the news while I brush my teeth, plenty loud enough for me. My son uses it as a toothbrush timer and nightlight. He also uses it to listen to music while he takes a bath. If he's low on toothpaste he asks it to remind me to buy some. I also use it to talk with him while he gets ready for bed and I am at work. We have one in the laundry room. I really like the motion sensor in there! My BF has it programmed to detect movement and turn on the lights for me. Again setting reminders for laundry detergent is great or using it to drop into the upstairs and summon a child/help keeps us from yelling through the house. I also have them linked with my calendar which means I get conference call alerts no matter what room I am in. Only complaint would be a apeaker update. Could be a little louder.
title: A lot more useful than I initially thought!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JPuleo1
content: I really love this thing! I put it in my master bathroom, which is on another level and the opposite side of my home than my wifi router and it connected perfectly. It works just like any other Alexa device. I use it for news briefs, weather reports, drop in's to other devices when I need to communicate with others in the house and listening to my favorite Sirius/XM stations. The sound really isn't bad for a little plug in device that only costs $25. I am really impressed with how well it functions. I just ordered the USB nightlight attachment for it. The only negative thing I can say about it is you can't turn the volume down. Sometimes it's to loud early in the morning.
title: The best value of all Amazon hardware!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Britain
content: Loved it so much I bought two more. The kids leave them alone more than the echo dot, which is nice, and they’re cheaper so it’s easier to put them in every room. I don’t think the sound quality is too bad, max volume isn’t that loud, but songs don’t sound worse than maybe my car radio or something. I know it says it’s “not optimized for music.” But it’s a pretty good system, and when it’s on sale it’s a super deal.
title: A houseful of Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Waltswife
content: Horrible!  I missed my window to return it because of dealing with some serious health issues and I thought that I just needed to “dial it in” which I thought would take a while.  When I try to use it the drop-in feature, neither of us can tell what the other is saying...the sound quality is terrible!  When we try to use it to do anything else, such as what’s the weather...play music, read book, etc. the sound is awful!  I truly wish that I could return it and put the money toward one of the other Echo devices.  My husband hates it and wants me to send them ALL back, because of what a pain in the butt this one has been!  But because I am mostly bedridden the drop-in feature, if it would work, would be extremely helpful!  Someone from AMAZON, PLEASE HELP!
title: Some one from AMAZON PLEASE HELP!!!  Do NOT recommend!  Pay the extra and get the Echo Dot!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: SZ
content: It’s true, the speaker sucks. Imagine blasting music from your cellphone speaker and the quality being bad. You don’t buy this to play music on, you buy this for the convenience of having an “Alexa” nearby to control other devices. I have two echos, 1 dot, and multiple lightbulbs across the home. I like using this device (echo flex) to turn on / off lights, and play music from other devices. It’s a small compact device that has all abilities of a regular Alexa, just you know with poor speaker quality. It is nice that it has a built in USB port, so you’re able connect your charger and charge from there. I’d recommend this for someone who already has more than one echo devices and other compatible devices.
title: Don’t Buy this for Sound Quality, Buy this for the Convenience

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Edward D. Reagan
content: I bought this to put in my garage and pair to a bluetooth speaker since it would hang on the wall and not be on my workbench like the Echo Dot (2nd gen) that is currently there that I was going to move to another part of the house. The Echo Dot had no issue picking up my voice over the music playing and the other noises in my garage, the Echo flex microphones struggle to hear what I am asking Alexa in a large space like a garage.  This may have to do with it only having 2 microphones and the Echo Dot having 6 microphones.  This seems like a device designed to be used in a bathroom, kitchen or some other small space where a 2 microphone array would not struggle to hear me.
title: Second worst Echo device after the Echo Auto

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: S PK
content: I have 2 of these and use them for music and nightlights.  I bought the USP light, it is really fun, you can tell it to be any color you like.  I mostly like them because I have one in my garage and one in the den.  Whenever you turn on a Bluetooth speaker that is paired with it, it connects automatically and you have amazon music at your command.  The integrated speaker isn't qualified to play music, but it does work well for the voice commands.  The range of the Bluetooth signal is good, I can take my Bluetooth speakers quite a ways into my backyard with no loss of signal from the flex in my garage.  The night light can be programmed with a schedule but it defaults to  on at dusk off at dawn when you first plug it in.
title: does exactly what it is supposed to, no fuss

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jake W.
content: As I got more smart home products, I wanted to make sure that users could control those products from every room. Many other smart speakers really weren't good for this, as they're either too big, too expensive, or add more annoying wires to trip over. This form factor is great, since it just takes a little space around the outlet, with no wires. If you can get it at discount, it might even be cheaper than installing new smart switches in every room. My only complaint is that sometimes, the microphone is *too* sensitive. It will hear me say "alexa" from a few rooms down, but it's so far away, that the rest of my sentence will be too faint for it, and it will misunderstand me.
title: Great, inexpensive way to make your whole home smart

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DRE
content: So I mainly bought these to be able to use the intercom function to be able to talk to my kids in their room. The setup was super easy and the echo flex hears me fairly well although not the best out of all echos. The problem is the volume is soo low. I can barely hear them and they can barely hear me. If it's super quiet, it's not a problem but if a tv is on or anything then it will be harder to hear. If you are buying these for anything other than intercom they are pretty good. Allows you to have Alexa anywhere in the house especially in dead areas or even out in your patio. Music is even ok on them. I have not used to night light or the sensor so I cannot comment on those. Overall they are great and inexpensive. I just wish I could turn up the volume for the intercom higher. Hope this helps
title: Not my favorite echo product but works

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: jmully
content: This is the perfect addition to our house of Echos and echo dots. I needed something with a small footprint for my dinning room, to call up to the kids when dinner is ready, and to hear our ring doorbell. We currently have a 1st generation in our living room, and an echo dot in each bedroom. It was not intended to have great music quality, so i wont go there, I was impressed that it is loud enough to hear in our dinning room over normal voices. It has the same standard set up with the app. I also got the light attachment, which took a few minutes for me to figure out, but a nice addition. I have not tried pairing to a speaker yet, but i can see that it would be easy.
title: Great for what it was intended.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: aundy
content: First of all , this was misleading as ever it makes it sound like you can operate your lights and so forth that so isn’t truth you have to have smart lights and smart WiFi hookup for this to operate anything . I was under the impression that it would just work without smart stuff , so anyways I received product after I found out you had to have smart WiFi bulb I went and purchased one at my local hardware store and came back home and put bulb in on my lamp and I loved it , the bulb was 20.00 bucks , the echo flex had hard time hooking up to bulb it say on bulb it only supports 2.4GHz but I got to hookup to 5g so anyways the echo flex sound quality sucks , it’s really low , I’m used to echo dot , but it does work light bulb really well and that’s all we use it for is our smart WiFi stuff
title: Ok

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bigstuff
content: I was originally looking for a simple bluetooth receiver to allow me to stream to an old set of speakers that I like but aren't bluetooth.  There are options from Logitech and others, but reading the reviews there were a lot of complaints about the reliability and the ease of connecting/disconnecting when needed.  These items are $22-$25.  So I looked at a Dot which is more expensive but also more useful at $39 (but currently on sale as a 2-for).  Then I saw the Flex, which I didn't even know existed.  Only $25, and also on a 2-for deal (2 for $35 when I got them).  I read the reviews and the main complaint was that the speaker quality was poor.  Amazon clearly states (now) on the Flex item page that it is not intended as music speaker, and if that's what you want plug better speakers in via 3.5mm jack.  That's what I was going to do anyway.  And it works great!  Pairing with my iPhone took about 5 seconds, and I was streaming to the speakers immediately.  With the deal and a sale on a refurb, I got 3 of these to enable me to stream to the older receivers and powered speakers that are not wi-fi or bluetooth enabled.  It's great.  Oh and that it's an Alexa device is just icing on the cake.
title: Works excellent as a bluetooth receiver to non-bluetooth enabled speakers/receviers

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: bookpoodah
content: I use this mainly as a news radio beside my bed. I rated the sound quality 3 stars, but, for me, it's 5 stars. For music lovers, it's not so great. But the narrow frequency range makes voices much more understandable (I can even understand BBC News now!), and it doesn't bother my wife as a more full-bodied speaker does. A minor downside is that the voice recognition is not as good as that of my Echo Dot. Occasionally I have to tell it twice what I want. I guess that's because of a smaller and less efficient microphone. I wrote a sleep timer routine for it that gradually lowers the volume before turning off. That way, there is no abrupt shut-off to wake me up. If all you want in a given area is control, the Flex is a better price than the Dot.
title: Perfect for the job.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Axel L.
content: I like this economy model of the Echo, Echo Dot.... I put it in a room that I don't spend much time in so I just needed a way to yell at Alexa and I'm not going to listen to music or anything. She heard me fine and the sound is great for talking. I'm not sure about how it would work in a noisy room but it's pretty quiet where I put it. Installation was real quick and easy. It does everything I need for pretty cheap.
title: Cool little 'remote' to my other Alexa devices.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Joseph Z.
content: I have three of these as well as Echo's and Spot's.  I have a full smart home and wanted these low profile Alexa's to add coverage for my voice commands in rooms that did not have them.  The plug in wall with no chord was appealing.  I didn't care about sound or speakers, I just wanted it to understand my "turn on outside lights" commands and similar.  After 6 months or so, I gave up and replaced them with the traditional puck style Echo's.  They just had a hard time understand my voice commands. Always asking me for some type of clarification.  Took me three tries on average. Sure only $17 bucks now, but utterly frustrating.  Spend the extra money until they make a better flex.  I am sure they will.
title: Internal mic not as good as other Alexa's

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: A.L.Y
content: I read other people's reviews and expected this to be a horrible sounding Alexa/echo speaker. To be honest, it's so small, the sound quality isn't terrible. This takes up no counter space and was super easy to program. Perfect for the bathroom when I need to get the weather for the day, or turn on lights to start my day. I've shouted to it across the bedroom and it still answers /'hears' her voice. Great.
title: Nice!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jennifer
content: I  just got these today. I bought two of them. My sole purpose in buying them was to extend my voice command capabilities throughout the house. Having already downloaded the Alexa app to use my other devices, the Flex units were immediately recognized. When you buy them here, there is an option to add them to your account and I did. So, when I plugged them in, my app picked them up and added them. It took less than 2minutes to be up and going.  They work well for what I need them for, voice commands to power light, cameras, etc. You can ask her questions, like "How many quarts in a gallon" and she will answer. However, if you plan to use it for playing music, such as on Spotify, Amazon, Pandora, etc, you may want to go ahead and purchase an echo. It almost sounds like an old portable FM radio when you play music. But, I don't think they were made for streaming music.  They are small and fit nicely in one outlet leaving the other one open to use. There is a convenient USB port on the unit to make up fo the outlet you are using. I have one of mine in a power strip behind my coffee maker.  I am very pleased with these little units. I have found them to be exactly what I needed them for.
title: Really handy little guys!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ctoffer
content: This has a far field mic which means Alexa can hear you from across the room. We have this in several areas of our house and is great for vocally turning lights on and off, sending announcements, etc. The speaker isn't great for music playback, but for vocal announcements, it works fine. If you want to use this for music, there is a "line out" plug that allows you to connect to external speakers.  For the price, this worked way better than expected. One thing, you can use these devices to call other devices in another room. The mic picks up really well, so you'll get feedback if the other Echo Flex is within mic range. Otherwise, this is pretty awesme.
title: No need to yell at Alexa to get her attention

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Tanya
content: I am in the process of automating my home and wanted to turn my bathrooms into motion sensor light since the kids will walk out and just leave the light on. This was perfect for that, without the need to hack into the electrical system and change switches. This is great, it does exactly what I need for it to do and creating a routine that allows it to turn on when someone walks in the bathroom and turn off after 3 minutes of no motion was so easy.
