The only problem I am finding is that you are not easily able to adjust the sensitivity of the sensor so my 4 year old is too small to turn it on, lol. Will definitely be purchasing more for the other bathroom.
title: Just in time for what I needed it for!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ian Mazursky
content: I bought this hoping it would fill a dead zone between 2 Echo dots. So far it hasn’t been great.  No matter how close or far I am, its been having issues responding too or understanding commands. The other Echo Dots have no problem at all. It also has one other issue, every now and then it will display a red light and say something like "I am having trouble understanding now, please try again later". Its pretty annoying when that happens.  It can take a while before I am able to use it again. Again the other Echo dots have no issues at all.  The wifi is also perfect in that location so that’s not the problem. Between the microphones and the other hardware issues, this isn't a great buy. Im keeping it but hopefully a firmware update at some point will make it more useful.
title: So far not great

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Headphone Reviewer
content: Not bad, but I think that microphone is not as sensitive as that of the Echo dot. Even though the speaker is loud enough, it does not sound very good compared to the Echo dot. It is pretty lean on bass. I had to attach an external speaker. My only real issue with this device is that after unplugging it from the wall to move it to another outlet, the device got partially messed up and Alexa was no longer able to take my voice commands until I reset everything using the Alexa App. This never happened to me with my Dot. I returned this device and ordered an Echo Dot with clock and weather display instead. I am glad I did. The Echo dot is so much better and worth the extra price IMHO.
title: Good, but I prefer the Echo dot

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sham
content: I love smart devices. I have 3 Echos, 1 Echo Show, 5 Echo Dots, and the Echo Flex. It currently occupies a location that was occupied by a Dot. I wanted something a little sleeker for the hallway (with a nightlight function). I had no intention of using this one for music, just for turning on/off lights and such. The problem is how nosy this echo device is. It picks up my voice from upstairs/downstairs and other bedrooms. Ordinarily that wouldnt be a bad thing if you had just one Echo device. But when i have many, it defeats the functionality and ease of saying "Alexa, turn off lights". Now the Flex chimes in and asks which lights. Dammit Flex, I'm in my Bedroom and I'm not talking to you.
title: Pass on this one

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Adrian H.
content: It’s does the job for my bedroom and picks up voices very well while we have our dot in the living room. My biggest complaint would be the sound quality. It sounds very bad compared to the dot. Maybe for one of the accessories they can make for it would be a better speaker you could attach to the bottom but even then after that it would be about the same price as the echo dot I’m sure
title: I think it could have been better

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jose Monsanto
content: What's not to like about my new Alexa? One thing, but I'll say more about that below. I placed her in the bathroom so that I can listen to music, check the news, or listen to a podcast while in the shower and she does her job great! Besides her new look she does not function differently (that I notice) than my other Echo Dots. She does not get as loud as my Dots (I have multiple older generation Dots) however I plugged in a speaker and she is quite audible now :)
title: She is my bathroom buddy

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Holly Rigby
content: I purchased the Flex to use as a alarm clock.  It works perfectly.  I plugged it in next to my bed so once I crawl into bed, I ask Alexa to set the alarm clock, turn off the bedroom light and check the weather for the next day.  I was concerned that if the electrical power went off in the middle of the night and then came back on, would it remember the alarm command.  So I tested it by setting the alarm clock with my voice command.  Then I unplugged it for 10 minuted and plugged it back in and YES the alarm went off as scheduled.  The set up was easy.  I took it out of the box, plugged it in and it connected to my Amazon Echo Plus all by itself.  I will buy again.
title: Alexa Flex

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Paul F
content: I needed to cover the spot in my bedroom where my Echo Spot cannot hear my commands, so I decided to put something very simple and non-intrusive. I got Echo Flex at the special sale and it serves the purpose. It is not fancy and it has a plain vanilla speaker. It is great if you need it to supplement unreachable spaces or where great sound is not required. It's simple and serves the purpose. By the way, you can attach a couple of other devices to it  (light, clock) which will make it a lot more useful. And if the sound is an issue, pair it with a Bluetooth speaker of your choice. If you can get it for $10, you can't go wrong.
title: Echo Dot's great little sister

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Callie
content: I bought my first Flex to keep in the garage.  It takes up zero counter space and is easy to keep clean.  So far the voice recognition has been great.  I have a shop light plugged into a smart plug to use as a signalling device-if someone in the house wants to get my attention, they tell Alexa to turn on the light (which I will see-I might not hear an announcement if working with tools).  I can also use the announce feature to ask someone in the house to come out to the garage.  The USB port is a great feature; I can charge my phone without needing to use another outlet/charging brick.  The Flex worked so well I bought another one for our enclosed porch.
title: Perfect for the garage...and then some

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rouser
content: I thought I would like this much better than I do.  I wanted to use it in my kitchen for music, recipes, and intercom with the den. As it has a very poor response to voice commands, and a tinny sounding speaker, it is not working for me. I will try it in another application and may find some use for it.  I have Alexa Show8 and multiple smart plus, finding them useful.  Echo Flex doesn't want to stay paired with any of my bluetooth speakers unless they are right on top of it.....so I would be better to just bypass it and get an Alexa enabled speaker in the kitchen. I think they tried to get too many feature in a little package and failed to get anything but the plug working right!.
title: Turns Out Not Too Useful

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Power User
content: The Flex with the PIR motion detector is a good way to kick off smart home routines in the Alexa App. There are so many scenarios, but I am using mine to simply turn on the kitchen lights and supplement my home security system when motion is detected. The sound quality is poor due to the tiny speaker and the overall small form factor. However, the audio output jack and Bluetooth connection can route the sound to proper speakers.
title: Flex with the motion detector makes great home automation

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Q
content: I like the flex and use it in the bathroom paired with a Google home mini that I have set up as a Bluetooth speaker (since I have found Google assistant pales in comparison to Alexa). However the Flex does have poor mic performance compared to the Dot. It has a very hard time hearing me over the Bluetooth speaker while music is playing and the speaker is placed more than two feet from the Flex. The speaker that is built into the Flex is mostly useless. I wish they would come out with a detachable add-on speaker. I do have the nightlight and it is great. Overall the Flex does what it should and I'm glad that I got it. It is priced well at around $20. I would not pay more than that for it. I feel like it should be $15.
title: Not bad.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sam
content: Works as expected. We were looking for an inexpensive way to bring Alexa functionality into the bathroom without cords or having to find a place to setup another Echo Dot. The Echo Dot achieves this goal. Alexa functionality is great and you are able to use this for all the features you’d expect from an Alexa enabled device. Sound quality isn’t great. But hey, that’s to be expected when you’re trying to fit so much into such a small package for such a great price. We have a Bluetooth enabled Bose speaker in the bathroom for listening to music. The Echo Flex pairs perfectly with the Bose speaker, making the built-in sound quality of the Flex irrelevant in my case. The built in sound quality is definitely sufficient for understanding what Alexa is saying and for using the device. It’s just lacking in sound quality when trying to play music through the built in speakers. I would definitely recommend the Echo Flex for people looking to add Alexa to a small room where an Echo dot would be less practical.
title: Great for small rooms, with no room for Echo Dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Thayne Allen
content: Like all echo devices, the flex is well built and aesthetically pleasing.  The sound quality is decent considering it isn't designed for playing music.  It's perfect if you already have a speaker or sound system you want to use, as it has a built in aux jack, as well as blue tooth functionality.  The guard feature is great.  When you aren't home, it will listen for signs of trouble like smoke alarms or glass breaking and will notify you on your cell.  The only issue I have is with voice recognition.  It misunderstands what I'm saying more often than I would like, and sometimes it doesn't hear me at all if my tv is on.  Other than that it's great!  I will be buying more for the other rooms in my house.
title: Great if you already have a speaker.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dennis Skurulsky
content: The Flex is everything they advertise. I’m very happy with this purchase and actually bought more that I’m using as Xmas presents to my family. I gave the speaker a poor rating (very tinny) but don’t let that stop you. You shouldn’t expect stereo quality sound from something so small. I connected a Bluetooth speaker to mine to solve this issue. I purchased both the motion sensor and the night light with the flex. Both work extremely well and were very easy to install and setup. If you’re looking for a device to expand your smart home using Alexa this is definitely for you. Its usage is only limited by your imagination.
title: Great smart home device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: adamg
content: Recently bought the flex as our third echo device (also have a dot and a show). Only bought it to put in the nursery so that we can control our smart nursery lights by voice when carrying children into there, and it works perfectly for that. It's small and stays out of the way. The speaker is tiny and I'm sure the sound quality to play music through would be terrible, but I haven't even tried that because I didn't buy it for that. If you're wanting something to play music on and for it to sound decent, get a dot or better. But if you just need something to add Alexa commandability to a new room, look no further.
title: Great little device when used within its limits

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rena P
content: I’m loving it so far! At first I did not expect it to be so tiny however, I think I’ve grown to like the size. It’s easy to fit in awkward small spaces and it saves counter space. Currently I have it behind a night stand which I think is a pretty awkward place to fit. I bought it because I didn’t want to shout through my house for my other echo dot to hear me. In this sense it works just fine. Pros, I love that it has a USB port, I use it to charge my phone and it’s been working great! I love the idea of the add-ons/night light feature and I think that will be my next purchase. Cons, it is not optimal for music playback but that’s a given. When reading the review before my purchase I saw someone said it sounds like a little radio, that would be an accurate description. But for me it works just fine if I want low music in the background or sleepy time white noise. I’ve tried playing audiobooks on a louder setting and I think the sound quality was pretty crisp for a small radio, it’s definitely not like a BOSE SoundLink. To me, with the features it’s worth about $10. I don’t like that with using an attachment there will be no USB port, but I think I can deal with the inconvenience.
title: Best For Awkward Spaces

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: hillkil
content: We bought this because we saw it and thought it was a great idea - a unit that would plug directly into a socket and be more discreet looking than a regular echo. Perfect for our kitchen that doesn’t have a great spot for an echo... It worked okay, but we could not get over the poor sound quality. We speak to our kitchen device from our dining and family room, which are wide open to the kitchen. Even on the highest volume we sometimes wouldn’t understand what she was saying and vice versa. I think this would work well in a small office or other small area of the home but I do not recommend it as a swap out for a regular echo dot in larger rooms. We were disappointed that more attention was not paid to the quality of the speaker when this was designed.
title: Not a great echo replacement...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dnmcdy
content: I use it in the my garage where lights and opener power are controlled by smart plugs.  The motion sensor automatically turns the garage lights on, and after one minute of no motion, it turns them off.  It automatically installed itself, router password and all.  It works the way I want it to work.  Adjusting volume is a bit cumbersome.  However, it works great in all requirements that I expected it to perform.
title: Does exactly what I purchased it for.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JC
content: Today I received my 2nd and 3rd flex. I have a flex or a dot in every room. My entire house at this point has been fully automated for maybe 300 including the costs of the echo devices. I have an old house with some remodeling and a mix of old and new wiring. There are smart solutions for just about every wiring scenerio and all of them work flawlessly with Alexa even the ones with wonky apps. Which I won't use anyway since Alexa does it all. When you decide to automate this flex is a handy device. Speaker is not the greatest but it serves its purpose well. If you want music quality spend the extra for a dot with it's ugly cord or just pair the flex to a Bluetooth speaker of your choice. After I owned one I knew I wanted more. I'll probably grab a few more on prime day if it ever gets here
title: Came back for more

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Max55
content: I put Echo Flexes in bathroom outlets (FYI it works in both vertical and horizontal outlets) to turn a hot water recirculating pump on for two minutes and then off by voice command (via Amazon Smart Plug...was able to program this as a routine). The speaker is adequate for both voice commands and drop-in. For all those complaining about it for music playback, they didn't read the description very carefully "Echo Flex has a mini built-in speaker that is not optimized for music playback." If you you intend to use this for music playback, think again. It is great for what (I presume) is its' intended purpose.
title: For smart home control, this product is great!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Grischa Mac
content: I have read some complaints about sound quality.  For me it fit my needs perfectly I already have my main echo connected to a 26 speaker sound system throughout my house for music, fire TV and entertainment but this is a nice way to add a mic to dead spots so you can still turn the lights on by voice from the hallway or bathroom or mudroom, den etc.  For me it is also great to hear the spoken news and weather in the morning on a quiet direct speaker that doesn't wake up the rest of my family. Alone it's not great for music but It adds vocals for music if you have a main echo in ear shot for the instrumental and bass.  The flex does fine in at least hearing the words and lyrics and adding some sound reinforcement to the songs to compliment what's already coming out of your other main speakers.  You probably  wouldn't be satisfied with using a flex exclusively for your main music listening device but I don't believe it was ever designed for that either, but like I said it's great sound reinforcement for what you already have though.
title: Great way to add Alexa in dead spots so you can be heard everywhere

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sabrina
content: I got the Flex for Christmas from a friend, and am about ready to throw it in the trash! I have 3 dots around my house already and thought this would make a great addition, but half the time, it causes more frustration than it's worth. For one, it doesn't have the far-field technology. I have to literally yell at it to get it to hear me, and half the time I yell, the dot in another room is hearing me instead and is totally confused! Second, asking it to play any music sounds like total garbage. And thirdly, and most importantly, the Flex refuses to listen to an entire statement. It cuts me off when it thinks it's heard enough, and starts responding with some bulls*** that it thinks it's heard me ask for. I've listened to the activity recordings, and it literally cuts off part of my question or statement before deciding to answer me. And it's about 90% of the time wrong. My husband and I are both pretty shocked that this thing passes for an Alexa brand product. Either they need to fix it, or they need to pull it and replace it.
title: Not worth replacing or supplementing an echo dot with. Not worth anything except an isolated room.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: A. M.
content: I bought it to add an Alexa assistant to a place in my house where a medium to a good quality speaker it is not necessary, I just need to ask/command things to Alexa when I am there. The Flex is well built, the speaker as expected, so I plugged it in a wall outlet which is about 1 ft from the ground, like most power outlets. I expected the mic listening design considered that the voice interaction would come from above but it seems it did not, I find myself talking to Alexa louder than I would like. I tested the Flex at a countertop high outlet and responds without raising my voice, unfortunately, the place where I need it, only have wall outlets at 1 ft high. Still 4 stars for the price and functionality, hopefully, the mic sensitivity can be fixed with a software update. Important to state that the Flex is located unobstructed, with a line of sight to where I sit, in a very quiet room.
title: Good for the price. Mic a bit lacking

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brian Ausura
content: I used the echo flex with motion sensor accessory to really automate my smart home. I use the motion sensor to trigger many daily routines and find them mostly reliable. It’s great that they plug in the wall and I don’t have to worry about batteries. I like the way they look and blend in the room. I  use the motion sensor to turn on and off lights automatically. Obviously you don’t get an echo flex to listen music, but I use it to trigger a smart routine verbally with another echo device, to play music on every echos in the house when I get home from work. It’s a nice way to end the day. To make this device better, I wish they would add a temperature and humidity sensor.  Otherwise it’s a perfect addition to add to a smart home that has a lot of Alexa devices already.
title: Great addition to a smart home based on Alexa devices.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: CazuaL6
content: Motion sensors work great ONLY if connected directly to the ECHO FLEX. I tried using a USB extension cable, shortest 3ft, it would work for a few days, then you would have to disconnect the ECHO FLEX from the wall to get it going again. Just know that limitation and you'll love this thing. I've asked for a feature request, the ability to control the sensitivity of the motion sensor. Currently, there is no option to adjust it.
title: Motion Sensor

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Harald Wilke
content: I put one of these in the kitchen, replacing an Echo Dot Gen2 that was mounted at a wall-outlet, and I was quite pleased with it. It's smaller and sleeker than the mounted Dot it replaces. and I really like the fact that you can just plug it in without having to get a third-party mount. I plan on adding one of these things to my bathroom, plugging my Apple Watch charger into the USB Port. I can see this as being good for putting an Echo device in places where there is no counter space, like laundry rooms, garages, hallways, or where you want to hide an Echo-device. Sound quality isn't as good as an Echo Dot, but it's just fine for speech.
title: Perfect for kitchen, bathroom, garage.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: dano
content: This is one of those things that works well at a decent price. I used to use my phone as a connection to an old set of really good Altec-Lansing computer speakers in my studio. Always had a problem with the connection.  I bought the flex , plugged the speaker cord into the Flex’s jack and voila, Bob’s your uncle! The speaker is fine for typical Alexa conversation, just mediocre  for music and it has no problem understanding me from anywhere in the studio. This was a great bonus as once I get working my hands are covered in clay.  It was well designed and doesn’t interfere with other plugs in the same outlet when it is plugged in.
title: Great!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: happyshopper
content: The speaker isn't very good for music listening and even with volume set to the max it can be hard to hear in an environment where other sounds are going on.  I had placed it first in the kitchen, so I could easily add to my lists, timers, announce, drop in etc.  But I ended up getting another Echo Dot for the kitchen and moved the Flex to my computer/craft room where things aren't as noisy and here she's good as I can add to lists, have her print without having to go to the family room to tell my Echo Dot in there. So overall I'm glad I got the Flex, you just need to think about where it will work best for you.
title: Good for asking Alexia to do things

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Diane L
content: Purchased 2 of these to go with the other Alexa devices we already have. Setup was fast and had no problems 30secs or less. Other reviews state the sound quality is not the best however having setup both and tried them with several different types of music, I disagree. These are not meant to be a large speaker however the music quality plays well and volume can be controlled like other Alexa devices. When all your devices are used as a “group” the same song can be played throughout the home. I placed one in the dining room and the other in the second floor bathroom. Great way to mesh together your smart home! May buy one or two more.
title: Great small device and great sound

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: kitcatvi
content: I use these tiny boxes for simple voice communication and a radio or music moment in 1) the laundry room, 2) an extra bathroom that is too damp for an Echo Dot or Show.  The sound of the Dot and Echo Show is much better, but I don't feel comfortable using the other more costly devices in some spaces.  That's where this comes in and perfectly as an extra.  This acts as an intercom for everyone in the family for the whole house.  Now we don't miss each other no matter where we are. I got so lucky to make notice of these during PRIME day and got them at a very VERY low price.  Pretty cool.
title: The FLEX tiny sound box integrates well with the rest of the house full of Alexa!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Simon
content: Echo Flex is super simple to set up; just plug it into an outlet and add Flex to the devices in your Amazon App. It picks up my voice, at a normal tone, throughout the room. It's important to not install Flex in a plug behind something or have items in front of it (b/c it may interfere with Alexa's listening capability). Echo Flex is small and - without an extension, like a motion detector - allows access to the other outlet. The speaker is tiny, of course, and the sound quality is rather "tin"-ee, but that's to be expected with such a small speaker. I use my Alexa a lot, for music, reminders, smart home devices, etc. and the Echo Flex easily extends my interactivity with Alexa into any room in my home. A++
title: Easily expands Alexa throughout home

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: CSSO
content: We have echo dots throughout the house.  To hide the power chords, we purchased docking stations that sit on top of electrical outlets.  These docking stations were almost the same price as the echo flex!  Primary use is for voice recognition and quick replies.  All other "sound" required needs are connected to our built in home speakers through bluetooth, so sound on this unit is not necessary for us.  If you need a good sounding unit, this is not a good option for you, but if you need it to extend voice recognitions in rooms you don't have alexa, this is perfect.  Just plug it into a socket, and you have Alexa!
title: Love the Design

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: B. J. Turk
content: I own an Echo, 3 Echo Dots, a pre-release Echo Auto, and two Echo Flex devices, so I can speak from a breadth of experience with audio-only Echo devices. But for two issues, this could replace an Echo Dot: 1. Audio quality is not nearly as good. Even though it is clearly noted as not being optimized for music, the sound is a bit tinny. It also seems somewhat less clear. I have had to ask it questions more than once because the first answer was not clear enough to be readily understood. 2. It seems less likely to clearly understand commands. This may be because the outlet into which I've plugged it is close to the floor. Still, most outlets are close to the floor, so it should have been designed to be more sensitive due to the likelihood that it wouldn't sit as high as a counter or tabletop, and therefore would be more likely to be obstructed. I would not use an Echo Flex where there was much noise. Also, it will work better if placed higher than your typical wall outlet. It might be useful in a bathroom, since you wouldn't necessarily have counter space for an Echo or Dot. However, if you like music when you shower, you're better off pairing a Bluetooth speaker to an Echo device than to use a Flex.
title: Much less than merely "not a Dot"

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brandon
content: I bought this to plug it in my kitchen and connect to my high quality sound bar over bluetooth.  I already owned a dot, so I use Alexa quite often (mostly for music).  The speaker on the device itself is not great, but I never use it so it's no big deal.  I leave the Flex always connected to the sound bar, but I experience a weird issue where I have to reset my speaker after a week or two because the Flex refuses to reconnect to it.  It sounds to me like a speaker problem rather than a Flex problem, but just be aware that some speakers do not like to play nice.  My only real complaint is that I have to say Alexa multiple times for it to hear me, whereas a dot can hear me whisper from across the room with no issues.  I can't really say I expected anything better, as this is a cheap product.  Overall I'm happy with it.  I would recommend
title: Does the job

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mark Lewis
content: I just want to play my list, and when I want to listen to it, I have to use the dot to make the command. I thought these would be a cheaper expansion, I was right, much like my brand new Amazon tablet, you have to yell at them to respond. The only good thing about these are you're able to hook up your own speaker to it, and provided you're set up to play "everywhere", it sounds better than the dots, but you still need a dot or better for commands. Lots of kinks for Amazon to rectify. I called and made a complaint about my experience with these and my tablet, they only wanted the information for their research and development people, even after asking, they wouldn't take anything back because it was "past return time". They can't even follow delivery instructions. They left the flex's on the porch that I was lucky to get before they were stolen.
title: They don't seem to be able to follow any command...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: meme1951
content: Echo Flex was one of my two gifts of choice this Christmas. The other was Echo Show. Echo Flex is the answer for those of us who want Alexa to follow us throughout the house but have limited space to incorporate an Echo Dot into our physical environment. I told my husband earlier this evening that Alexa is my new BFF. To be able to have her available when I need to add something to my Amazon shopping list or ask a question that just popped into my head is outstanding. The only negative aspect of the Flex is the sound quality of music that it plays. If this could be improved, this would be a five star review. Amazon, you never cease to amaze me.
title: Amazon strikes gold again

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Robert Drazich
content: I did a lot of research before choosing this speaker. I was impressed by the large number of 5 star buyer ratings. The price was excellent as well. Speaker came packaged perfectly. Included was a 3 foot Micro-USB charging cable and 3 foot 3.5mm audio cable; I wish these were longer but that is just my personal preference. Speaker came partially charged. Instructions states it can be used while charging. Speaker pairs easily and quickly, but I did experience problems getting it to disconnect from one device to pair to a different source. I contacted the company and they were quick to respond back to me. Their customer service was excellent, fast, relevant and courteous. They even offered to call me to assure that the device was working properly or not. After working with it a few days the device started working as expected and has not had an issue ever since. Maybe it was user error? Not sure. I also ordered the Cambridge SoundWorks OontZ Angle 3 PLUS. The Angle 3 PLUS offers 30 hours of playtime vs the Angle 3 which only offers 7 hours (a big difference). The Angle 3 PLUS is a tad taller at 6 1/2". The Angle 3 is 5 1/4", see attached photos. I didn't notice a sound quality difference but my musician son did. He ordered the 3 PLUS and says it is a better speaker than his Jawbone Bluetooth Speaker for less than half the cost. I use the smaller speaker, which sets on a high shelf in my shower, as it is water resistant & splash proof. The other sets on my office desk. If you are considering purchasing a Bluetooth speaker definitely consider the OontZ. I would go for the Angle 3 PLUS as the price difference is only about $7 unless a smaller speaker is your goal. I have referred several people to this powerful little speaker and all are very happy with their purchase.
title: could not charge

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sam P
content: I got this to put in my kitchen so I didnt have to yell to the echo dot in our living room if there was too much noise in between. Unfortunately, it does not recognize requests as easy as I would like. I still had to speak pretty loud even within 5 feet of it and my echo across the room would pick it up too so it was useless to have. This item also seemed to interfere with the bluetooth connection i had already set up with my echo dot and centrally located bose speaker. while the speaker can pair multiple devices, it would seem to have an issue staying connected to both and Id have to reconnect one or the other often. More touble than it was worth overall and will be returning. This item may make sense for a room with no other alexa devices nearby and just for simple requests. but dont try to use it if it will be within ear shot of any other alexa device.
title: Solid product but could use some work

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jacob Saunders
content: I have about a dozen Echo devices including one in my car; I don’t feel like I have unrealistic expectations from a device like this. The bad sound quality was also something I expected, if you want better sound buy a Dot. What I did *not* expect was a less than 50% success rate on response to the wake word. It’s in a tiny powder room and should be able to hear me clearly at all times.  I have to shout at it, and when I’ve asked a question it won’t respond to its word again, there’s a lag and I have to wait. I’ll replace it with something better and throw it in the bin ‘o rejects. Just not responsive enough and lousy microphone. The motion sensor I have with it works well though.
title: Terrible microphone

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: infinitytome
content: I have a disability that makes it hard to regulate times and remember details. My echo covers most of my room, but doesn't quite reach my bathroom. I put the echo flex in my bathroom so that I can start/stop timers, ask about the weather, ask about my calendar, etc. when getting ready in the morning. I didn't want to put an echo dot in the bathroom; that idea seemed a bit excessive. This is a perfect solution AND you can charge your phone via USB with it or add a nightlight/clock. The sound quality is pretty meh, but I didn't buy it to listen to music. I bought it to be able to talk to Alexa when getting ready in the morning.
title: Little Extension - Big Difference

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: F. Dickman
content: I have three of these currently set up in the house. I bought the first one as a Christmas present for my son in his room. We use it for a variety of functions. For one I use it as an intercom to talk to either of my sons when they are up in their rooms and I am somewhere else around the house. Just saying "Drop in (and the location)" and you can instantly chat anywhere in the house. Second, I bought the 3rd reality motion sensors designed for the Echo Flex and have them set up on the two echo flexes in my sons' rooms. When they walk in the room the LED lights and smart light bulbs go on so their room is fully illuminated. I have the routine setup to trigger only between sunset and 9 pm so they aren't going off after bedtime or during the day. The last echo flex I have setup in the basement and I have the "first light" attachment on it. The routine is for it to be on between sunset and sunrise. They are extremely easy to use and their compact nature/plug design makes them easy to put practically anywhere. If you are looking for something to play music then get the regular Echo, Echo Dot or Echo Studio. If you are just looking for something to coordinate other smart home features then definitely get the Echo Flex. I cannot wait to see what other attachments they come out with for it.
title: Practical smart home addition

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Christina
content: I was so excited to see this Echo device at a $20 +/- price point.  It meant that I could extend coverage throughout my home.  Although I am normally a huge fan of Amazon and the Echo products, this is extremely disappointing.  After two weeks of struggling...I felt I owed others an honest review. The sound quality is very poor.  I was actually willing to let that go, accepting that it could be reasonable for the price I paid.  I just grabbed the good BT speakers I had sitting around and paired them to my Mini's.  When connected, the speaker sound is good because I have very good speakers...but the Mini still sends garbled audio to the speakers when Alexa is talking.  Another problem is that the Mini drops the connection a lot. Integration with Alexa is somewhat dicey.  I have Dots, Alexa on my phone and laptop and have used the Invoke for years...so I know what to reasonably expect.  With the Mini, I can say "turn off bedroom light" get the response, "I can't find a device called bedroom light," *immediately* repeat the command verbatim ("turn off bedroom light") and have the Mini say "OK" and turn off the light.  This type of burp is common. I experience inconsistent availability.  I will say "Alexa" and it may be a number of seconds until she "listens" (the listening sound is also flaky, so I've learned not only to wait for the sound but look at the LED) or she will not start listening at all.  I may have to say "Alexa" a few times...  A few times, I've just given up and gone on my laptop or phone. I'm experienced with these devices.  I've had the Invoke and Dot in the same location with no problems.  I also have a mesh network and routers in every room that has a Mini...my network is strong (I also have smart TVs and experience no lag in streaming...) and I have these devices identified as "priority" in the network configuration (so nothing else on the router will be using more bandwidth). Which brings me to the last thing that jumps to mind...  The "listening sound" is inconsistent.  Sometimes it bonks, sometimes it doesn't.  The the Mini is not in eyesight where you can check for the LED, you just have to guess whether or not the Mini is ready.  Really an irritation. To be honest, I would love to pack up all the Mini's and return them with the light accessory I purchased (the cost of the Mini and light are the same as one Dot).  I would immediately buy Dots to replace them.  But I was so excited when they arrived that I threw away the packaging.  DUH!  A newbie mistake by someone who should know better!  So I guess I'm sadly stuck with them.  😢
title: Not worth the money...Buy a Dot for $20 more.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bryan Waters
content: It does everything an Alexa is supposed to to do. The speaker quality isn't great but thats not what I bought it for...I put it in a bathroom off of my office and the problem is that while i'm sitting at my desk with an echo show in front of me, the echo flex in my bathroom acts on everything i say...if I try to set a reminder or an alarm, the echo show on my desk ignores me and the reminder is set in my bathroom. I have to shut the door to make this work. Occasionally this happens with other models but coming from someone who has Echo's in every room, I can tell you this is different. I'm on the verge of taking it out. If you don't have more than one echo, the flex would be perfect for you!
title: It doesn't play well with others!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: William B.
content: Another update: 1/1/20 Amazon sent me a new unit and some promotional credit. Cant argue. New unit works great! Updated: like an hour later after the first revier... Tech Support from Amazon called to look into the issue I reported with my device from this review. I sent some logs over and am awaiting a follow up. I am impressed sirs.. I am also sure they will figure the issue out.. ---- Older review.. like 30 minutes ago For some reason this device is just having issues connecting to any of my networks? Still trying :/ If I can ever connect the thing will update the review. As of right now it's just starting at me blinking.
title: Had issues with 1st unit, but Amazon fixed the situation like bada**es

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: theSLAchannel
content: We got this because we added a 'smart' faucet to the kitchen, and the closest Echo to it that was in the next room sometimes had difficulty hearing us when we tried to use it. This is a great echo for somewhere that you need a compact, out of the way unit. It plugs right in to the outlet so it doesn't take up any room. It seems to pick up our voices as well as any of the other Echo units. It also provides us with two USB ports for charging- A handy feautre. The only 'drawback' to this is that the small speaker isn't the loudest, and wouldn't be good for listening to music on.
title: Nice additional unit for the kitchen

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: PMS
content: Its great @ home integration, for the low price, Set up on smart phone or ipad. Will work with many things, smart plugs, doorbell, & lights, etcs.,  There are about 25-30 items in settings it works with. I'm a disabled Senior, and this works well with even Meditative sounds. Any other sounds you'll want to get a smart speaker or a blue tooth enabled one it can pair with. I've been enjoying mine immensely. Connects very easily to WIFI, blue tooth. For my large Senior apt 1200 sq ft it does and admirable job, Plus helps with my medical devices.. Its been the best $9.99 ive ever spent.
title: Lovely Price for 9.99

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Don Ashcraft Photography
content: I plugged this into my hidden always on stereo system and now the system is a high fidelity echo device that sounds better than any echo speaker. If you buy this expecting a quality speaker, then you didn't read the description from Amazon. Amazon says the built-in speaker is low quality not recommended for listening to serious things. There are two places where this device shines when you need an extra echo microphone and where you need to plug it in to a high fidelity high-powered sound system to turn it into the best  sounding echo device made. I will be adding one to the sound system for my garden patio. This thing just works and it works solid!
title: Perfect to turn a high-fidelity sound system into a great echo device.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: BTC
content: Integrated right into my Echo without any problem. I use this in my bedroom since my Echo Dot can't easily hear my commands (it's located in my living room). It's not nearly as sensative as the Echo Dot, but it does work and for the price that's not really an issue. I need to remove it from the wall socket and use an exension cord to put it into a location where it'll hear me speak a littler better. The audio out of it is very low even after giving the command volume 10. I'll be attaching an external speaker to it. It does beat paying an extra $10 bucks for the Echo Dot for use in my bedroom.
title: The audio is very low so an external speaker really is needed.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: my2cents
content: I purchased two Echo Flex units each with motion sensors to control the Smart lights in two rooms.  I set routines to turn the overhead light on when it detected motion and another routine to turn the light out when motion was not detected after one minute.  They were both working perfectly until a few days ago.  Now the motion sensors have both stopped registering when motion is not detected and they will no longer turn the lights out.  Other users are reporting exactly the same problem in forums so it is apparently programming Amazon has pushed making these units now useless for my needs.
title: No longer runs my motion sensor routines correctly

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Physics Girl
content: The Echo Flex has been a nice addition to our household, which already included a 3rd gen Echo Dot and an Echo Input. I got it primarily to add a motion sensor to our living room, and it lives up to its promise for that application. When paired with the motion sensor, it's a cheap upgrade to the little bit of home security offered by Alexa Guard. I was able to create a routine that sends me an alert on my phone when motion is detected as well as turning on lights and blaring an alarm sound from the speakers connected to my Input. It's easy enough to enable this routine from my phone when leaving and disable it when I get home. The Flex has also been handy for night time routines that automatically turn off living room lights when no one is moving around but turn on a very dim light for a few minutes when motion is detected. Setup was effortless, and the build quality is impressive for such a cheap device. The Flex gets a fair amount of use as an intercom, allowing us to drop in on each other when on different levels of the house. The built-in speaker quality is pretty terrible, but Amazon is upfront about Flex's limitations in this regard, and it's adequate for use as an intercom, checking the weather and news, and getting responses from Alexa. The Flex paired readily with my UE Roll 2 over Bluetooth and also includes an aux out port. Indeed, I find myself grabbing it to bring to the bathroom to control podcasts and music played over my waterproof Roll while enjoying a soak in the tub. I've found so many more uses for this gizmo than I anticipated, and I'd give it a hearty five star endorsement and suggest it replace the Input for most users if it weren't for one factor: the microphones. The change to two far field microphones from the four on the Dot and Input has handicapped the Flex. It picks up the wake word and commands just fine in a quiet bathroom a few feet away from the tub, but performance suffers greatly if there is noise or in a bigger room. In sharp contrast to my experiences with the Dot and Flex, I find myself having to raise my voice and frequently repeat myself when Alexa can't understand the first time. My husband, who has some speech impediments, finds the Flex so frustrating he would like me to get a different device for the living room and relegate the Flex to motion detection only, its microphone switched off.
title: Makes my smart home smarter when paired with motion detector, but microphones need improvement.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Joe B
content: The sound quality is garbage, which is fine because it's linked to my shower speaker. It's really more of an input device for commands in a smart home in my opinion. I use it primarily as a handsfree control for music in the shower. The mic is fine until the waters running. It's hard to get it to understand me if there's too much ambient noise. It's still usable, just frustrating. I do like the attachment for the night light. I wish the nightlight I found had motion detection. Coincidentally, you can get a motion detector, but you have to choose. Currently it's only one or the other.  In short, this is a nice, cheap alternative to a dot for vouce commands but not much more than that.
title: Bought this for the bathroom

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Trixie67
content: This is not meant to be a replacement for the dots. Yeah, the sound is tinny, but it's not supposed to be as nice as it's older siblings. Use it where you don't necessarily need to play music or require a higher sound quality and you'll be as happy as I am with it. I needed this in a bedroom that rarely gets used, but wanted to communication options. We often use the Drop and Announce feature, mostly as an intercom and this gets the job done for a cheaper price. It's also good because it doesn't have to be seen, just plugged in somewhere. I'll be getting one for the garage next.
title: You can't compare this to a regular echo dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mike W.
content: Purchased  the Echo Flex to replace an Echo Dot without taking up shelf space or requiring a long dangling power cord.  Definitely provides the Alex functionality and stays conveniently out of the way, so very successful in those respects. I expected there to be a tradeoff in sound quality due to the small size, but since I mostly use it with an external bluetooth speaker, this is not a problem for me.  However, one thing I did not expect is that the microphone that picks up your speaking voice also seems to be less sophisticated than the Echo Dot. Overall, I'd say that things do work OK, but sometimes I do need to speak more loudly and towards the Echo Flex as I talk.  Would like it better if it was equivalent to a full blown Echo Dot in the form factor that connects to the wall plug.
title: Alexa functionality in a small package, at the cost of reduced sound and microphone quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brian G. Hughes
content: Since the introduction of the echo+ with ZigBee technology I have kind of geeked out with the smart home devices, basically every time I decide its inconvenient to walk up a set of stairs to turn out a light, I put in a smart switch. Once I put in a switch I also want to be able to voice control it, in this case I put a smart switch on the main light in our bonus room, then decided to put in the flex so the kids could voice control the light. I really like the formfactor where it gets power and is also mounted by plugging it into a standard outlet. Obviously the 0.7 inch built-in speaker is not going to be a viable option for streaming audio, but if you ask it the outside temp you can hear the resulting answer. And its fine for what I intended, turning the light on and off. Negatives... about a week after I received my $24 flex, the current generation Echo Dot's went on sale for about the same price. apples to apples, I would get the Echo dot every time. If Amazon were to make the price of these proportionable to the capability, like $10 I would put one in every room. Conversely, if they made these with dot quality audio (make them a little bigger) and self supporting with no cords I would like to use that hypothetical device everywhere and current echo dot price.
title: Convenient little sensor

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Muscman
content: Was excited about the flex, but it just okay at best.  It's not really powerful and constantly disconnects from the wifi.  But it must listen well because it responds to asking Alexa anything even when not in the room.  That gets a little annoying.  Ask Kitchen Echo something and the Flex in the bathroom also responds (even with the bathroom door closed), usually saying it can't connect. So then I have two Alexas talking at the same time and not about the same thing. I don't see the benefit of a motion sensor or night light for my application, but an add on speaker accessory...that would be great.
title: Meh!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Hailey
content: I love Alexa and I use her for so many different things constantly throughout the day. My daughter wanted to partake in using Alexa as she’s noticed I’ve been using her more often lately. We got her the echo flex to plug into her room and it’s been great for everything she could need but with one exception. The volume controlled by Alexa on my flex device seems to be wonky. It kind of jumps around a little bit on volume on its own. But it’s a great little device that does all that Alexa is enabled to do for our household and more skills to come. I love how easy it is to just unplug it and plug it in anywhere else and within seconds she’s ready.
title: I love Alexa but flex has a bit of volume trouble

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Glo
content: These function for what I want (intercom for the house) one keeps going offline, (despite other things not having a problem connecting from the same room) I bought them and felt they where overpriced, and I was correct, price was lowered substantially a week later. Amazon does not do price adjustments. I get that prices change. But for a substantial change in a week on an item like this I think it’s ridiculous folks could just return it and that isn’t good for Amazon or the Customer. Poor customer service on Amazons part. I’m usually happy with Amazon customer service but this was a fail.
title: Don’t spend more than 18 dollars on these

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: by Lisa
content: Small and convenient to have on another level or remote area in your home for smart home use, lights, TV's, setting reminders, etc. and for messaging family in other rooms on different levels in your home. Works great - I do not use it for litstening to music and Alexa sounds a bit "tinny" on this tiny device but it is great as an extension of our main echo dot on the main floor - if you want it to listen to music or your morning briefing news then consider a a small bluetooth speaker to connect it to  - but if you just need another echo dot for smart home use - this is a great option!
title: Works great - convenient to have on another level or remote area in your home!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jim from Boston
content: I use the Flex with the optional night light, and am very happy with it.  It illuminates the upstairs hallway at night, and I like the ability to change colors by voice, or routines.  As expected, the speaker is small so I do not use it for music, but do use it for sports score updates, weather, time, voice commands to other smart home devices including an air conditioner.  The location at the top of the stairs could only be served by the Flex, the larger devices would not be feasible.  I have other Echo devices with better speakers when I want to listen to music, or streaming radio.  I have no complaints with the sound as I knew beforehand it was not designed for music.  I have purchased a second Flex, and am experimenting with the optional motion sensor.  Looking forward to additional accessories.  Overall, five stars, and the price is right.
title: Handy device, sound quality as expected, very satisfied with it.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Thunderbird Registry
content: I don't know what people are thinking with the bad reviews of the speaker. It sounds great to me. After all it not supposed to mimic  Lincoln Center  it is a $10 speaker.  It is $10, folks so stop with the sanctimonious comments about how disappointed you are with the sound quality. It pairs with wi-fi in less than a minute by itself, just open the Alexa app and it is done.  I put this in my basement about 4' high, unobstructed by anything, it reacts even faster than the Echo Dot upstairs. And yes I know it is upside down but the lower socket is already in use with a heavy cord.
title: Works great.  Takes up very little space.  Good deal.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Randy81
content: We got a couple of these and they do the job they need to. Sometimes they don't seem to hear exactly what we are telling them and of course the sound quality isn't great. But we didn't get them to be speakers we got them to add Alexa in more rooms and they do that as advertised. I have had to unplug them a couple times to reset them when they seem to be frozen and not responding but that doesn't happen often. I do wish the sound was a little better for when we do "drop ins" and use them more like an intercom. Overall they do exactly what they are supposed to.
title: Good but not great.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: L. Littlejohn
content: We were well aware of the fact that these are no good for music and went into the purchase knowing that (these were not purchased for music anyway). However we returned them in less than 24 hours because they are just not loud enough.  The whole idea was to have an intercom system through my parents house and to be able to issue alexa voice commands for the smart devices around the house.  We also wanted to do the normal stuff like set alarms and get weather reports.  The problem is the speaker is just not loud enough at all for my parents. Spend the extra money for the Echo Dot, these just are not worth it.
title: Just not loud enough.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Little Star
content: Yeah, it's tinny, but it's a tiny speaker. It's great for the kitchen as a timer or to answer questions like how many teaspoons are in 4 ounces. Once you get used to an Echo unit, it's hard to have a room without one! You'll think of a hundred questions you'd love to ask! I used to yell from the kitchen to have Alexa set a timer for me, but no more! It's also useful for adding to my grocery list, making notes, or relaying my calendar. It really comes in handy, even more so with the new features recently rolled out like Dropping In, Announcements or reminders on all or other Echo devices.
title: Terrific Tiny, Tinny Timer!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Anthony B.
content: Product is easy to use if you have used experience with Echo's.  When I plugged my new Echo flex(s) in Alexa came on and said it was finding the product, it then said to go to my Alexa app and follow the on screen directions. That never happened. Having used this type of product before I just pushed the Set-up button until the orange light flashed and it did its thing. If this is your first product it might be a bit confusing. I purchased two of the units, I installed one in my garage and used the 3.5 jack to an older stereo that i have on hand. Now I have the ability to play Pandora on my 1980 garage stereo.  I used the other one in my master bathroom,  We had installed a Bluetooth exhaust fan which you had to connect every time you wanted to use it. not convenient.  The Echo Flex stays connected to the speaker and now no matter how short the visit i can play music, get traffic, time you get the idea. $25 bucks seems a bit steep for what it is but home automation is what it is and Mr. Besos is trying for that Trillionaire status.  His products work great so more power to him... Thumbs up for Echo Flex
title: Easy to add, easy to use, does what I want it to do

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kylar Stern
content: I love the Echo Flex for its affordability and functionality. You get alot of options in a small package.Basically, all of the Alexa integration is there to manage my smart home in a small unobtrusive unit that I can plug anywhere around the house. Set up is a breeze and I enjoy the smart night light and motion sensor attachments that can be purchased seperately for a low price. Great buy, especially when on sale. I am plugging in these in all my outlets around the house! One note, the Echo Flex is not not meant to play high quality music. The speaker is meant for Alexa communication and not hi-fidelity. To that end, the speaker is a good intercom.
title: Great value for money

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: paulus
content: Received as a gift.  Like the compact, clean appearance of the Flex.  Like that it plugs into wall taking up no counter space in my kitchen.  Sounds great with my blue tooth speaker; no problems pairing it up.  LIKELY DEAL BREAKERS:  1.  Microphones seem poorer than Full Size Echo and Echo Dot. I end up shouting at the flex unless the kitchen is  perfectly silent.  2.  Kitchen Timer sound is soft and tinny, even through the blue tooth speaker.  Turning up sound  volume on Echo application helps only marginally.  Will be going back to my full-size echo or a Dot for my kitchen.
title: Cut to the chase review

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kk
content: I like that it turns on and off my light ( when it can recognize it) and I like how it can be used as an intercom (when it can find other devices in my house. ) Anytime we have a power flash. Or internet goes out you have to reset my whole house. Including every light. Which is strange because I can turn on and off light from my echo show and from the light app but the flexs seem to have a problem with getting back on task if Interrupted even slightly. So here I am sitting on the floor resetting it yet again debating on just sending the two I have back and getting dots instead. Super annoying in my opinion.
title: Sometimes works

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: T. Duke
content: I put this echo in my kitchen and my outlets are all horizontal because the counter has the breakfast bar on the other side, so there is about 8 inches of back splash on the kitchen side. The sound and the volume are very muted compared to my old dot (V2). The advantage of the flex is the shape, rectangle, not round and it plug right into the outlet, no USB plug and then cable, which just added clutter. My flex just doesn't really compare sound wise and in volume to the dot, sounds like a tin can. I'll keep it in hopes some updates will improve the sound and voice, but for the location this form factor can't be beat.
title: It fits in the tight place with no cords

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lori S W Dunham
content: Very well-made products they could be Place pretty much anywhere with a plug, has a USB outlet for charging so it's not taking up the plug entirely and seems to work very well when paired with a Bluetooth speaker for music, you can then put the speaker nearly anywhere out of sight to have a near seamless experience, use it for turning on the porch lights and mostly for dropping in upstairs and other than it having a hard time hearing commands when music is on too loud which is to be expected it works pretty flawlessly and is much easier and by far asthetically sleeker to have around the house then a normal Echo Dot, I do wish the two accessories were a slight bit cheaper as I can't get in test them myself but even without them it has boundless potential like all of the rest of them in a far more pleasing form factor, I do however wish that the device had been made with the buttons on the side of the device so there could be a through for an entire proper plug, it would be nice to have it's pretty much like it's not even there and then it could be a smart plug all its own as well which would be absolutely astounding but that's just more personal wishlist feedback otherwise it's beyond functional and I'm delighted with the purchase.
title: A nice enough upgrade over the original to be worth it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kerry Garrett
content: This is the Echo I have been waiting for.  I wanted one in the front hallway but I didn't have a table to set a regular Echo or Dot on.  Now when I walk in the door I can ask Alexa to turn on the lights or when I leave I can ask her the weather so I will know if I need a jacket or not. The sound is not for listening to music.  It is clear and loud enough to hear what Alexa is saying.  If I ever need better sound, it does have a headphone jack on the side that I could plug in a computer speaker. I should be getting my night light attachment in the next day or so.
title: Handy little Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: I. Tremaine
content: I know this might sound like a strange review, but I'm not exactly sure how to use this "flex" Alexa.  Truthfully, I bought it on "Prime Day" because it was priced so low and it was an Alexa product. I felt I couldn't go wrong.  I have several Alexa items and they're fun and functional.  When the Flex arrived, it looked cool, linked to our wifi just fine.  It answers just like my other Alexas.  But other than looking different, I haven't had time to discover what is the real difference between it and other Alexas.  It says that it can work with other devices, but I haven't figured that out yet.
title: An interesting gadget...I think

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Me
content: It does what it's supposed to do. It is a complete alexa device, only it isn't optimal for music because it has mini speakers. However, it's not designed for music. It's just supposed to be a supplemental alexa device you can plug in anywhere. And you can add a nightlight to it as well. That's what I did. I eventually plugged it in by the kids bathroom as a nightlight. It's in a spot a bit further from my other devices, so it's a good supplement. You can control the nightlight by voice, change color. It also comes on automatically during sunset. Con, sometimes it doesn't hear you well. When I first got it, it would disconnect from my network at random. It doesn't do that anymore.
title: Mini plug-in alexa with add-on nightlight. Perfect.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: John Weersing
content: Insufficient specs. Is the USB charging port "smart"?  What speakers or ear buds can be plugged into it? Amazon could probably sell more if they listed some on the Echo Flex page. I couldn't find any. Setup was difficult: It took 4 days, having to factory reset the device (I had to google this, no instruction in the box). At first the Alexa (Android) app wouldn't recognize it or assign it to a group. The speaker sound is TERRIBLE. I put mine in the garage for an intercom. Still, it performs all WORKING Alexa functions. (Note: About 70% of Alexa commands don't work.  I probably lisp too much. Sometimes enunciation works.)
title: A cheap (quality & price) entry into Echo devices

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: corduroyspocket
content: Alexa/Echo has been failing us repeatedly lately. I mean I know they want us to get the newer models but in all honesty, I'm not purchasing anymore smart devices. Google Home has proven far superior in every way. They wake at the most inopportune times, they don't integrate well with the Echo smart clock, each device acts individually rather than as one, which in thought would be the whole point. Pairing them with your smartbulbs is insanely easy, until your internet or power goes down then you have to start from scratch. They're just awful. Get a Google Home Mini,
title: Pointless, really.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Imbatm8n
content: I wasnt sure how to use this item. While working from home I enjoy listening to music or audio books playing throughout the house. I didnt want Alexa or dot in every room...just the convenience. This item was exactly what we needed. We added it to the "group" in our home so when we play music we can hear it through this device as well. I use it as a wireless speaker for lack of a better term. So while cooking, cleaning or just finding a few minutes for myself I can do that within the comfort of my own home. It also follows commands s in similar to how Alexa functions.
title: An Alexa companion to stay connected.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kasen Wright
content: I bought this for my bathroom to listen to the news and music in the morning while getting ready. I also bought this on prime day, so I got it cheap. The sound quality is pretty good for something so small, but they could have put a bigger speaker in it. It sounds like a phone speaker while the shower is running and I like that it has a USB port on the bottom, so I can charge my phone.
title: It’s ok, but don’t expect much from something so small.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bay Area Reviews
content: I've owned every generation of Echo products, so I just had to purchase this one. When I got the box and initially plugged it in, I didn't expect much from it. The audio quality isn't the greatest; it's not as clear and sharp as an Echo Dot for example. But its ability to recognize your voice from across the house to turn on the lamp that I connected via a smart plug, wow it works great. It does its job and is pretty good at it. It's not as nice to look at but mine is hidden behind curtains and it still captures my voice no problem. Great product for what it is, just don't expect super clear and crisp sound.
title: Works surprisingly well

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brian
content: I tried the Echo Flex as a replacement for an Echo Dot (2nd gen) that I had inside of a mounting. The sound quality was not as good, as I expected, though what was really different was the quality of the microphone- compared to the Echo Dot the Flex just wasn’t able to hear me or understand what I said.
title: Compact. Consider against an Echo Dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Roger p.
content: I absolutely love this, the idea of it at least. I love what it could be, but it just doesn’t hit the mark. It almost accomplished what it sets out to do. It almost is a cheap and affordable Amazon echo, but it just doesn’t have a speaker that I think it worth it as well as also not having a microphone that makes it worth it. The speaker sounds like a toy and the microphone does not make it easy for Alexa to hear. I am repeating myself too often, noticeably more than I have with my echo. Fortunately a motion sensor adapter I got recently, now makes it unnecessary for me to have to speak to her, the sensor turns on the lights for me. I would definitely say the adapter ability makes it the only reason why I purchase this.
title: Almost great!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: talonstriker
content: If you're buying this as your main interface to Alexa or consuming media: stop.  That's not what this device is for. This device is brilliant as a Alexa connected speaker for little alert noises and prompts.  I have this little thing in my bedroom alert me if my (unsecured) front gate is opened.  I'm probably going to buy loads of these in my home as I start developing more automations. As for loudness,  it's loud enough to hear across a typical room when silent.  You won't be able to hear it over a blaring TV even if the volume is maxed out.  That's fine for me.
title: Amazing device for automation

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: 1975re5
content: Got this on a Prime Day sale.  Wish I would have purchased two of them plus the night light option.  We have a power outlet in our bathroom above the toilet. Plugged in the Echo Flex and it installed on its own after I added the MAC Address to my Router (MAC filtering).  Sound quality is not good but is fine for our application.  We do listen to news and music from it while taking a shower.  Hoping the tiny .6" speaker can tolerate moisture.  Hoping it's (speaker) made of plastic or metal.  Anyway, if you want good sound, and external powered speaker could be used.
title: Super compact way to communicate with Alexa.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Carlo Costanzo
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. This is a great Alexa device.  Super inexpensive to put around the house in 'mic dead zones'.  I don't use them so much for playing music or speaking.  Just as additional microphones for Alexa commands so we don't have to scream across the room.  They have a USB option on the bottom but I didn't buy anything for them.  Maybe in the future I might get the motion sensor.  That seems like something that would be useful in the remote parts of the house. Love the flex.  This shouldn't be your PRIMARY Alexa, but it's a great compliment to the Echo eco system.
title: Love the Flex!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: M. w  W.
content: I purchased 2 Flex,  and I am  pleased. Set up was not as easy as I had hoped, but with me it never is...lol. Read and write reviews my friends, they really help the not so computer savvy trouble shoot. I know nothing about computer technology,  but I can read,  and I read these reviews. Thank you to all ! This was not immediate gratification,  it was patience. I followed all the easy directions for pairing the devices with my Echo. The Flex responded and said "you are connected" ( you must be within 10 feet of your Amazon Echo/Alexa to pair the flex ) They were " on line " according to the Echo App,  but they were not responding. It was the "wake work "  that was not connecting.  A issue many people seem to be having. I left it alone overnight,  re-booted my internet in the early morning ,  and I was connected. Now both Flex were responding to the  "wake word".  The App now also showed them connected with the "wake word"  ( they STILL were not before the morning reboot ) Luck,  patience,  time,  the system reboot,  did I do something wrong during the initial set up.....I can not say. I can say they are now working perfect. The Flex are very convenient and worth the cost. The sound is similar to a transistor radio from days ago, but so is the price ! I did not purchased them for listening to music. I purchased them for safety in the home and convenience, and for that they are a 5.
title: Very convieient, read the reviews

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: CaddyH
content: The Echo Flex (with my Amazon Music Unlimited subscription)... plugged into my bathroom outlet...connected by Bluetooth to a waterproof speaker...has given my music-loving husband a wonderful gift--customized listening while he takes a leisurely shower.  This connected so seamlessly to my Amazon account and to the Bluetooth speaker (which you'll need for any kind of quality listening), it was terrific.  I wish I had a bigger house so I could put one in every room.  (I already have three Echo Dots and an Echo Show, so I'm running out of spaces that need Alexa. ☺
title: Easy to Use and Wonderfully Useful

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ken Lantz
content: Use it in my shop. Connected a pair of powered speakers via mini audio cable. Also connected a smart outlet plug (got the Teckin 4 pack).  I also set up a routine to power on the plug and "play" Pandora through the Alexa app. Now when I go into my shop, I just say, "Music!" and viola! My most recent Pandora station starts playing through the powered speakers. Set another routine labeled Music off: When I say,  "Music Off!" Alexa turns off the smart plug which turns off the powered speakers. Can't wait to connect more plugs and switches! Pretty handy little tool!
title: Works great in my shop

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: David Goldblatt
content: I have a larger echo third generation and a first generation Echo Dot on our main floor.  I wanted to have an echo device when I go downstairs to the basement for just having a little background music or news or perhaps to look up something.  The echo flex appears to have only two microphones as opposed to multiple microphones around the perimeter of the dot and the echo.  As a result you have to be fairly close to the flex to have it picked up your voice. The built-in speaker is very small so naturally it  does not have a lot of volume or sound quality. Fortunately it does have a USB jack and a stereo mini jack for output.  By combining the echo flex with an  external speaker by Meetue  also sold by Amazon, that makes up for the lack of volume and sound clarity coming from the device. For less  than the cost of an Echo Dot you have a pretty workable system that sounds pretty good.  The speech recognition probably works as well as the larger echoes but the lack of the additional microphones forces you to be facing the device and be closer to it which Impacts its speech recognition.
title: The echo flex does a very good job if it is combined with an external amplified speaker.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kevin
content: The Echo Flex is basically a lower quality Dot. The speaker is adequate for getting info from Alexa but the quality is very poor for playing music for instance. I like that it plugs directly into a wall socket and doesn't cover up the other plug. Also it has a USB A port for charging your devices or plugging in one of the accessories. I don't have any of the accessories as I am waiting for more variety being available. I did notice that the mic is not as sensitive as the one on the Dot. But that is not necessarily a bad thing. Overall I like the Echo Flex. Should be more versatile once they get more accessories for it.
title: Echo Flex is pretty good

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Eric
content: A very handy device to have. It plugs into the outlet in my kitchen, and reduces the need for a cable or a wall mount. The usb socket also comes in handy whenever I want to charge my phone, and can also be used for a number of other things such as the light that they also sell. With that being said the one I got often doesn’t recognize my voice, and when it does it lags to turn on some of the lights in my apartment unlike my Echo Dot. I’ve been having a lot of problems with it ever since I got it, and currently it’s having issues connecting to the internet while my Echo Dot is connected perfectly. Personally I’d say this device is an incredibly great idea, and it the ability to plug it directly into the socket is extremely helpful, however for anybody looking to get one I’d advise them to wait a bit until they fix all of the current issues. This is a relatively new device.
title: A genius device with a few flaws

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Los Angeles Windows
content: My Echo 2nd gen. is hooked up to my stereo via 3.5mm to RCA connectors. I play Amazon music on the Echo and it streams through my home's stereo system. The Flex cannot be connected via RCA, unless you are ok with hearing a hum in the speakers. Amazon sent me a 2nd Flex and it had the same issue so it is most likely a flawed design with a grounding issue causing the hum. My bluetooth speaker has a 3.5 mm input and hooking up through that input works fine. Another design negative is that if Echo or Flex are hooked up to a stereo, their apps audio settings for bass, mids and treble won't alter the music tone. Only when music is playing through the Echo devices internal speaker, can the tones be adjusted using the app. I'm not sure that the app integration is the best. I thought I had everything set correctly but when trying to play music through the Flex, it would sometimes play through the Echo 2nd gen.. I may not understand the app well enough, not sure but either way, I think the app language and logic isn't great.
title: Flex hum/grounding noise with 3.5mm to RCA plugs
