You can ask Alexa the usual stuff from these plugin units. Very simple.
title: Good adjunct to main Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Noah
content: I just started using echo devices for about a month now and I must say I love them a lot they are very useful for things like turning lights on and off, Playing music, etc My first echo device was the dot and the audio quality on that was pretty good so when I saw the flex and the line on the product page saying that its not optimized for music I wasn't expecting much for music I just wanted to be able to have one to use in the bathroom when I wake up in the morning, However when I did play music on it, it worked pretty good, now it wasn't nearly as good as the sound on a plus or dot but its still good! I would say the audio quality is about the same as a modern smartphone speaker now as far as voice recognition goes its a bit lacking, When I'm talking to my Plus or dots they normally hear me pretty well and respond right away when I say "Alexa" However with the flex I find myself shouting at it to hear me when other people are in the same room talking, overall I'd say its a great value for the money if you don't have anywhere to set a dot and want to spend a little less
title: The sound quality is actually pretty decent despite what other reviews say

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stephanie K.
content: We were looking for (something) that would help with our son's bedtime routine as sneaking out of his room after being put to bed was obviously more exciting than actually going to sleep at a decent hour... We opted away from the Dot/Kids Dot as we didn't want the unit within reach for even more distraction (out of sight out of mind mentality) and the Flex direct plug was able to be perfectly hidden in a corner plug behind the bed. For the most part, the voice recognition works just as well as our other devices ... besides the times our son is using his silly voice so totally his fault. As some other reviews mentioned, the speaker isn't as great as other devices, but also wouldn't expect it to be. We do play sleep stories/sounds at a low volume as part of our bedtime routine and haven't had any issues with the sound. Would recommend for small spaces (or in areas you don't want the unit out in the open) Connected devices within the room: Smart Plug (controlling lamp) and Echo Glow
title: Great for Small Kids Room

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jacey
content: I bought this for my kitchen.  I already have 1 echo and 2 dots in my house.  Bought this to plug in for kitchen use so I didn't need anything sitting on the counter. Now when I need a cooking timer on or the coffee started, I don't have to compete with the TV or etc for my echo to hear me.  I read the reviews and knew the sound quality was not on the same level as my echo and dots (and that's very true if you are wondering)...but that is ok with me for what I wanted to use it for.
title: Works exactly as I needed it too.....

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jessica Strickland
content: The volume is too quiet and can't increase it. It is nice to have another microphone. I paid $15 for the flex, but I have often wondered if should have bought another Dot for $22 that was on sale at the time. The only positive for the flex I've seen is the ability to attach a low cost motion sensor. Eventually I plan to purchase it, so I can make a routine to shut off lights when no one is in the kitchen. If the motion sensor works like I hope it will, I'll be happier with the flex.
title: Worth the $15 I paid.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mo Brown
content: Based on a few reviews, I was skeptical about buying the Echo Flex plugins. But I couldn’t resist the price and bought 3 to place around my home. The reviews that mentioned the volume not being loud were correct but it was functional for me and my listening experience. The sound doesn’t have a lot of bass but it is okay. I like the Echo plug-ins and I would recommend them if you want to begin your Alexa experience on a small budget.
title: I was skeptical but it was Prime Day!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Andrea Hunter-McIntosh
content: I purchased both of my echo flex’s on prime day as my little gift to the house and I love it. I have one in the half bath and in my (small) kitchen. Perfect for timers, making announcements to my other devices, asking the weather and other small tasks. Sound isn’t very great for music or radio, sounds super hollow. It is pretty small and discreet so I didn’t imagine the speakers would be too great. Sound is pretty loud though. I wish it were louder with better sound is only complaint.
title: Perfect for small spaces

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LuAnne Berlin
content: I needed a device that would coordinate with my main Echo Show - this is just perfect.  I have it in the exercise room and can add things to my grocery list, set a reminder, or anything else that I would normally handle through my larger Echo products.  Granted, the sound quality isn't great, but I didn't get it for music or audio, particularly, just for quick contact with my main account while I'm walking on the treadmill.  And, the price is perfect.  Thanks, Echo and Amazon, for always having just what I need.
title: Great little product

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Benchracer
content: Nice addition Alexa's reach. Our first Flex is in the pantry for quick updates to shopping lists. The next will be for the garage to help with parts ordering and conversion tables. Volume is quite limited with sound quality reminiscent of a vintage Talking Barbie. Overall good value for money.
title: Alexa's handy little helper.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jon
content: For the price this little Echo will bring the features to your room and stay out of the way, it's even better when connected to the nightlight accessory in the bathroom.  They have added a detail in the description that the speaker is not meant to play music, so please don't buy this and expect to be impressed with the sound.  It's worse than your phone speaker.  But if you just want to just use Alexa in a room or you have a bluetooth (or Aux) speaker to connect it to, you can have Alexa capabilities at a great price and a tiny package.
title: A great way to get your Echo off of the counter, just don't buy this for the speaker.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Scott Goodhart
content: connected immediately to the network.  does everything that my echo spots do without needing the power cords.  speaker is weak, but I understood that going into it.  It's not meant for intense sound playback, as far as I'm concerned (but still could be because you can pair it to bluetooth or connect to aux jack).  Works Great! Seeing how this was a PrimeDay deal, I also received a LIFX WiFi bulb with my echo flex but have requested a refund and am returning the bulb, because it will not stay connected to WiFi.  I will not be getting any additional LIFX products as it was horrible.  I got it to connect, it worked once, then, didn't. deleted it, re-added...same thing.
title: nice to add Alexa anywhere.  returned the LIFX Bulb

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Gladari
content: I love this little Alexa device! Put it in my bathroom. Had some trouble pairing it to a larger speaker, but my partner figured it out and now I have wonderful sound, can play my Amazon music which I shower! Would definitely recommend it and buy it again! The sound quality got 4 stars because is tiny and I didn't expect excellent speaker quality. One note, we have 5 Echo devices, 2 Dots, 1 Tap, 1 Fire tablet with Show dock, and the new Flex. However, Amazon only gives you 4 names to use for the wake word. I really wish I could customize the wake word!
title: Great Alexa device for unusual places

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rennie T. Riggs
content: The flex is a great choice for humid locations or places where a counter space is a premium. I  have used this item in a kitchen, bathroom, and in a basement storage shed (pictured). When plugged into the top plug it covers the lower and makes the outlet almost disappear, when it is plugged into the lower plug it still allows use of the top plug with any number of smart plugs. Pictured is the flex with the lights plugged into the smart plug on, then the flex being told to turn the plug off, finally the flex with the light accessory lit when the light sensor on the side sees the lights plugged in turn off. The item is great and works like a champ.
title: Great for humid locations.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael Henry
content: I bought this to use as a smart speaker in the toddler room, so I don't care as much about sound quality as others. My issues are with the 'activated' light: it can't be turned off. Brightness can be adjusted down, but it never turns off if music is playing from it, and it will blink. Distracting when you're trying to get a child to sleep. Sound programming might be an issue with Alexa Routines. This worked fine for the first week, then programmed music would start turn off, restart, or stop early. Not sure if this is unique to the Flex or not (I don't have other devices other than a Fire stick).
title: As a smart speaker, it works.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: planedriver
content: I wanted to extend Alexa to the garage, but I didn't want to find a place to mount or place a DOT.  Tried this Flex out in the kitchen first, and really is is out of the way, but listening, when plugged into a wall socket.  Sound quality is lacking, (but it id on the DOT as well-this is just a little worse), but I didn't buy it it to play music lists, but it does support Bluetooth if I change my mind on that.  This worked out to be a great and inexpensive way to coltrol lights and garage doors.
title: Easy Install..Works well

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: jeffery a ransom
content: Many would think it crazy that I give the sound quality five stars. That is because it is very good sound quality for such a small speaker. This unit is primarily meant as an extension to your home system, a way to add voice recognition in an area where awesome sound is not as imperative. If that is what you are looking for then this unit will likely be perfect for you. If you are looking to rock out to your favorite music look at an Echo Dot or better unit instead.
title: Understand what you are buying

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: who's your Daddy
content: After the last few weeks using the flex, and our other 2 around the house are the new generation dots, I don't have why myself or anyone else would be considering the dots rather for additional devises, or just a first  time shopper ready to start out. I am not sure why it doesn't just serve as the new version or replacement for the dots. More user friendly, and more practical for the flush outlet design, and I personally think it sounds better than the dot. May be replacing the dots and passing down the dots to the kids or grandkids because they are so new
title: Better than the 2 other echo devises

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lisa
content: If I could send it back I would, but I live in a rural area with no UPS or FedEx store to send it back, so I'm stuck with it. It never hears me say "Alexa" unless I YELL, and even then it usually misunderstands me. I don't have this problem with my echo or echo dot. Alexa herself doesn't sound the same as she does on other devices, and the sound quality for music is awful. The only thing I like about this is how small it is. If you want to be happy with your purchase, get an echo dot instead. Roughly the same price, but so much better.
title: I hate it so much!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Andy
content: Got this for very cheap on prime day, used it in the bathroom to listen to music while bathing, works like a charm. But voice recognition is not great while the water is running in the shower. And the sound quality is not the best speaker out there, for serious music enjoyment, get the echo dot or echo. But for my use in the bathroom, it's great for this price. I am happy with it, if another sale during black Friday, will likely order one for my second bath or in the kitchen.
title: Great Price on Prime Day

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DurbanGirl
content: We needed an Echo in our bedroom for checking the weather in the morning, and turning off all the Alexa-controlled lights last thing before bed. We have Echo Dots all over the house, but I really didn’t one more thing cluttering up my nightstand.  The Echo Flex was the perfect solution.  We have it plugged in to an unused outlet. Keep your expectations in check regarding the speaker quality. Alexa sounds perfectly fine, but I wouldn’t play music on this. All in all, highly recommended if you don’t need stellar speaker quality.
title: A Handy Addition to the Echo Lineup.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ryan
content: Overall 5 stars - For the Motion Sensor, I wish it could be aimed slightly though in my case. Overall I like the Echo Flex... sound quality is far from a regular echo but it does work well.  One perfect place to put this with a motion sensor would be a laundry room or garage with a light so it can turn on when you enter the room and as a double benefit, you get an Alexa also.  If you want to play music on it though I would not get this since it just has a small speaker.
title: Overall 5 stars

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Shark Marius
content: I love this little thing because it serve the EXACT purpose I want it for, a cheap a voice activated virtual assistant. It turns on my lights, television, alarm system, and even tells the occasional joke when prompted. It also lets me know when packages arrives. And that's only the tip of the iceberg. We already have an Echo Dot and the even larger full size Echo, so the Flex is a way of cheaply adding Alexa to other rooms. I don't think it's realistic to expect this thing to have the sound quality needed for music, news/podcast, or any other form of extended listening to audio content. However, if you want to listen to a podcast or Apple Music (or I suppose Prime Music), it provides an audio jack that allows you to attach it to higher quality speakers. So all is all, it does everything I want it to do!
title: Love it!! - Best use as a virtual assistant (Alexa), not a listening device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rubblemuss
content: I have less interference, lost signal, and syncing issues with the amazon echo flex than I did with another brand of plug-in speaker. However, the speaker quality and volume are not as good. I use this in my bathroom, and since switching out my plug-in units, I have switched back to using a separate Bluetooth connect speaker for when I am in the shower... the flex speaker doesn’t get loud enough to be heard clearly from 5 feet away while  The water is running.
title: Better connectivity, low max volume

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JohnE
content: Like all Echo products, set-up is super fast and easy. I use this unit in my bathroom and my garage. For obtaining quick information, using commands for other devices, or adding to a list or note; this device is perfect. As others have mentioned, the sound is a bit "tinny", but I expected that from this size speaker (and from reading reviews). It clearly isn't the best choice for listening to music, but for the types of things that I mentioned, this fits my needs just fine.
title: Excellent addition to system for it's purpose.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: RoxBooLu
content: Seriously dissatisfied with my Echo Flex. Mine seems to be hard of hearing. I can be as close as 1 foot from it and I still have to talk louder than normal. Audible interaction...Alexa is one chapter behind. I tell her to go to chapter 65 and she goes to chapter 64. Alexa in general is no where near as useful as I had hoped but the Flex is the worst. About the only thing it's good for is to ask what the weather is, temperature, play music (very poor audio).
title: Echo Flex: Seriously Disappointed! I expect better quality products from Amazon.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Adam Brooks
content: I wanted this to work. I'm not sure if it's this device or something about Amazon software that's buggy. Like some other people have mentioned, the timing in routines doesn't work. I have a 5 minute timer, but it turns off after 2. I haven't continued to troubleshoot, but that's a pretty basic function they should be able to get right.  I bought this to act as a microphone and a motion sensor. I have two different dots mounted in a remote space that feed speakers by where I placed the flex. As is well understood, the speaker on the flex sucks. No problem, except that I want to turn it off. Doesn't seem possible, so now I have to listen to this tinny sounding POS. The form factor seems bigger than it needs to be, this should be 50% smaller.
title: Good in theory, Amazon has things to work out.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Phast Phil
content: In comparison to my other ECHO devices, this one certainly lacks in sound quality.  It's fine for 'some' voice only use, like listening to news casts or requesting ALEXA responses, such as "what is weather for today?". I like the form factor...it has a built in power supply which plugs directly into an outlet....unlike the other ECHO devices that require an outboard PSU. I plan on using it in my Media Room to control lighting, window shades, so for that application - it will be fine.
title: Works great, but sound quality is poor

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rita Gebert
content: I got 2 of these for Christmas. We already have the Echo and Echo Dot. The Echo Flex is plugged in right by the bed so we can ask her to turn off lights and turn on fans, be an alarm, etc. She has a really hard time hearing us when we yell at her. Sometimes her little blue light comes on like she's listening after you say "Alexa" but then it immediately turns off. Over and over before she finally actually stays on and listens. I definitely like the Echo Dot better. That one can hear me from another room and the sound quality is better, not that that matters much to me for the purpose it serves.
title: I'd recommend the Echo Dot, not this device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Friend-1
content: I use this device to bluetooth to a speaker in the shower and it works well.  I have the motion detect attachment, and I didn't want bright lights coming on all night, so I simply have the Alexa in the living room say "bathroom"  when someone is up and moving around in the bathroom.  I'm disappointed that Alexa has difficulty responding to my voice in the echo environment of the bathroom, when water is running.  We have to repeat request several times because the white noise seems to be difficult for her to distinguish noise from my voice.
title: Works okay

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: RF
content: I needed an echo device in my bathroom to control ceiling speakers streaming from an echo input in the AV closet connected to the amplifier.  I simply plugged this in, set the room location, and set the echo input as the default speaker for the room.  Now if I request something on the Echo Flex, it plays on the much better sounding ceiling speakers.  Fantastic little device for certain applications.  It does sound horrible on its own, but what can you expect from a tiny little cube.
title: Great little device!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Antoinette
content: My son loves that it plugs in the wall. My son is autistic with ADHD. We used the flex has a way to monitor and keep him track when doing task. To keep his thoughts from distracting him, let's say while getting ready for bed, the flex allows him to add thoughts he is thinking about to his "talk about list", so we can discuss what he was thinking about when he is done getting ready for bed. It may seem odd to others, but his thoughts can completely distract him from a task. And our son loves to listen to music with the flex.
title: Helps our son

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stagetechie
content: I have had had an Echo Dot held by an "outlet clip" for a year or more. Worked great, sounded fine (NOT used for music - my house has 6 SONOS zones).  Figured the Flex was a cleaner alternative. The FLEX Audio sensitivity was incredibly poor compared with the DOT in the exact same place -- we had to repeat "Alexa" prompts for most uses. Sound quality was not even close. At Max volume, in a busy kitchen, it was hard to hear anything from the Flex/was easy with the DOT. Sent mine back after a day of frustrationing performance issues.
title: Sent this back because sound performance was awful.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Craig
content: Nice way to get Alexa in a variety of places. I added the light kit. Sort of pricey when used mostly as night light, but it works well It is also another access point for commands/responses to your smart home. Speaker is poor (that and price reasons for 4 stars). I know it's small, but my phone has better sound and it's small too. Given prices for unit plus add-ons, not sure that it's a great value, but it does provide another distribution option.
title: Convenient

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Writersblock
content: I’m sorry but this is the worst piece of electronics I’ve ever purchased.  It works ok as far as giving you info and such but the voice is just above a whisper.  No volume control.  I can’t imagine any room you would put it in where you could hear the response.  It’s on its way back......ordered the Echo Dot and hope it’s better than this......can’t be worse!
title: AWFUL!!!!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DosManDan
content: This is a great little device for adding Alexa to places where you don't want to spend the money on a more expensive version. I have mine in the garage, and another one behind the couch in the front room. Since I didn't have a table there, and I really just wanted to turn lights on while sitting there, this was perfect. Both work very well and extend new functionality where it was lacking. Definitely recommend these, they work great.
title: Awesome way to extend Alexa to areas where you don't need a full size version

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mhilez74
content: I love this product and made my life less stressful! I have a 4 bedrooms and a basement for a house and I placed one of each in a bedroom and the basement too, so whenever I get home or a meal is ready, this little thing helps me! I don't have to scream or go to the basement to call on my boys, I would just make an announcement, couple of minutes later, I would hear the whole house shaking because my boys were running to the kitchen or respond to whatever I announce! I mainly use this as an intercom but it gives me more than that so this little thing is my best friend!
title: Best little thing

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: AMP
content: After having an echo dot mounted in a box attached to the outlet this appeared to be a much more elegant way to get an echo device off of my counter. The concept is great but the sound output of this thing is abysmal. I don't expect it to sound great as its not for music but you simply cannot hear the thing from even four feet away unless the room is dead silent. Would be nice if Amazon made a plug in speaker for this thing to make it useful.
title: Great Size, Hard to Hear

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: T. M 916
content: Got this for my 12yr Daughter, I walk in her room and she’s Listening to Music and she Says Pause and music stops and I’m thinking that little thing isn’t so little I want one , My Wife says out the Blue I want one of those things you got Hunter lol . I walk in her Room again u can hear The Ocean bouncing off of Cliffs  and then she says as I’m walking out Alexa Wake me up a 6:30 am and I Said IM GETTING ONE !!!! Lol no I don’t work for Alexa SHES GONNA WORK FIR ME IN ABOUT 2 Days lol yes she is records my favorite shows Reminds me to watch my favorite shows ....
title: That Dads are Cool!!! I bought the Alexa haha

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jen L.
content: Okay so if you want an ALEXA for your bathroom like I did then this is perfect! If you’re looking for ALEXA for a large room then skip this one. The sound quality is like a cheap shower radio. It’s not loud and it can be muffled. But it does what I need it to do. I like listening to music softly while in the bath and it’s perfect for that. I also highly recommend the night light attachement! It can be dimmed or bright and changes to any color you can think of. I love this product so much!
title: Perfect for relaxing in the bath

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lois F
content: Remember that Amazon has a microwave that works with Alexa? Yeah. We have that. This little guy plugs in right next to the microwave plug in and works perfect for Alexa commands. No hollering to another room. Music sound is bad but we literally only use this to voice control the microwave. Who needs it? People with disabilities that can’t stand long. Yes, it’s a bit over the top BUT...it’s inexpensive. Both the microwave and the Flex.
title: Not for music but great for Amazon microwave

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Donna
content: I am using the Echo Flex  as a safety device to call for help if needed when my cell phone isn't close by. Mine is in the bathroom. If I fall or have a health emergency, it gives a lot of peace of mind to know I can call someone by using Alexa. I have been suggesting these to all of my friends after a  neighbor fell and wasn't found for several days.  Her phone broke when she fell. I never planned to use it for music, but the speaker isn't too bad if you want to sing in the shower. Easy set up. Inexpensive. Doesn't take up counter space. You could have several around the house instead of wearing a panic button around your neck. I bought the nightlight accessory and am pleased with it, too.
title: Great for seniors

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: M. Smith
content: We have an open concept floor plan, with an Echo show 10 in the living room, and a dot connected to the bose in the foyer.  We have found when the tv is on and we are in the kitchen cooking that we have to raise our voice to get over the other noises.  We wanted to try the flex to plug in the kitchen.  This is working out perfect!  No more yelling to get her to set a timer, or to add something to the shopping list.  Thinking about placing one in my laundry room next!
title: We have Alexa devices everywhere, but needed a more compact device.  This is perfect!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Christopher
content: this device is horrible with voice recognition compared to the echo dot. I a flex in the kitchen and a dot 45 feet away in the living room. If I am in the kitchen facing the flex, more than 50% of the time the dot in the living room hears me instead of the flex I am right next to. In theory a great idea but falls short with practical application. I just needed a device for timers and to control whole home audio but if it can't hear me it isn't worth it.
title: falls short when used with other echo devices

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DD
content: This thing is a total and complete piece of garbage. DO NOT BUY THIS VERSION OF ALEXA. Not all alexa’s are bad. Just this one. I’ve got two other alexa’s including the echo and echo dot. Honestly, I love both of them. I have a fairly smart home. And do plan on continuing the upgrades. But this flex is AWFUL. I got the flex just to have in my kitchen. I didn’t want or need much sound from it, and for that I connected a Bluetooth speaker, (from which it is constantly disconnecting). I just wanted it to start music around the house and turn on lights and eventually lock my front door. But it never hears me even when I’m right next to it and it’s  constantly disconnecting from the internet for no apparent reason. Not even kidding. I will yell at this thing in the kitchen. I’ll be standing right next to it, it won’t hear me and my dot will pick up my voice 3 rooms away through closed doors but this stupid flex won’t hear me at all. I hate this thing so much. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. just get the dot. Or the echo.
title: Get an echo dot and don’t waste your money on this

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DC
content: I purchased the Echo Flex and plugged it in my bathroom where counter space is at a premium.  It took a few minutes to set up and I was good to go.  I love being able to quickly ask for the weather, news, and music as I get ready.  It is great since I don't need to hold a phone to get this information.  I also use it at night to note my reminders for the next day.  I tell it the time I want to hear my reminders and it also send the reminders to my phone.  Very convenient and easy to use.
title: Great Alexa type device for areas with limited space

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: P Hernandez
content: It is really small and convenient to use. Just plug into an outlet. I bought one for my husbands backyard office so I could use as an intercom but since the plug is low he sometimes has to bend down and talk loudly for Alexa to hear him...so I will be swapping it out with my Echo and put that one in the bathroom to listen to my music while I soak. You can't expect for the speaker to be great for that price and size....but for a small room like my bathroom it makes sense.
title: This is clearly for small areas

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jasmine
content: A little confusing for me to set up but it might just be my age.  My 16 y/o was able to set one of these up in every room to make mornings easier for me.  I no longer need to go to the downstairs bedrooms to wake the teens up for school and I am actually the morning dj playing there music of choice in each bedroom to wake them up.  Also good for announcing dinner to the entire house.  Does just exactly what I was hoping it would.  I’d just like to figure out how to automatically set the alarms with the songs they’ve asked me to wake them up to.  I’m doing it manually because I haven’t figured that part out yet. Overall I’m satisfied.
title: Super helpful in my household

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dianna
content: I got this in sale for $12.89 . It’s terrible I purchased it to speak to my love one from a different room. Either this item is defective or it’s a bad product. It have trouble with the wake word always searching ,but never finding it. I sound so bad I decided to plug it in my bathroom and listening while taken a nice bath. I play music on it and listen to the news. I can plug my phone in usb and charge my phone. I will keep it one of the best features about this device is it can pick up my voice no matter where I’m at. I love it. It hears better then my other ones. Hilarious!
title: Not the best. But for the price well!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: SWPDX
content: We already had a echo spot and echo show and purchased the flex for two other rooms.  I agree the speaker in the device is like AM radio but we are using in rooms that already had a nice speaker systems. One is in our basement and we connected the flex to our surround sound speakers through bluetooth. The other is in my son's room and he hooked up his speaker using the headphone jack on the flex and also connected bluetooth headphones. Set up is super easy - plug and play for the most part with the Alexa app.
title: Nice simple addition to my smart devices.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Joseph T. Masarone
content: I use the flex in my bedroom, so I can get weather and the time from bed. Works great. Sound is very tinny when compared to the full sized Alexa. I thought about buying the add on light fixture. BUT The add-on motion sensored night light not useful with dogs. I would rather like to have a attachable light source that works only on command. I had another thought. Why not replace the proprietary plug on the bottom of the Flex and make it an A/C smart plug!
title: Portable mini Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Patrick L Ball
content: So I bought four echo flex to create a in home intercom system so my wife didn't have to shout at the top of her lungs to get myself or our home care assistant attention. I created a series of routines for her to say "Alexa, I need help" for the system to announce "____ needs assistance" or if she asks for to contact me in my study. I created another routine for her to contact my phone but haven't really test drive that one very much. Otherwise the units are great for setting reminders, checking time, setting timers, alarms, checking the weather, playing poor sound quality music, listening to NPR. I have no need to order stuff so that feature is ignored. In addition, it alerts me on Amazon apps updates and deliveries. The "drop in" feature is a bit muggy but that has to do with sound levels of the units needing to be lower than usually to accommodate our home needs. I opted not use that feature for the com and instead having Alexa say the need for assistance. Most of this stuff like adjusting volume and setting routines required some research from users rather than Amazon itself. One feature I would like is for Alexa to acknowledge when I say thank you. Me and my wife are just that polite so say it often and I just like to show appreciation to my little AI. Naturally if the internet or wifi is out, she doesn't work but in those cases I would be more vigilant on what was going on in the home by that time.
title: Ad hoc Intercom cheaper than an intercom and loving routines

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: UsedJeans
content: There are a lot of reviews regarding the sound quality, but this device is as advertised...  The sound quality was never supposed to be its appeal.  The Flex is small, takes less space than either Echo Dots (with the special outlet mounts), and pairs easily with Bluetooth speakers.  I installed one Flex in my children's bathroom which has very limited space.  The outlet is right next to a 2nd-gang light switch and provides plenty of clearance.  I also paired it with Sengled light bulb Bluetooth speakers and now they have quality sound without needing to take up limited counter space.  The only problem I've noticed is that the Mic is not as sensitive and is not able to pickup commands as easily as the Echo dots it replaced.  When showering especially, the Flex has a hard time hearing commands when music is already playing.  I'm hoping Amazon can fix this in future firmware updates.
title: Echo Device as Advertised but Mic not as Sensitive

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. Wilson
content: We have a dot and I wanted something in the living room without a cord laying on the floor. Flex does everything the dot does - Except - You can hardly hear it. NO volume control like the dot and asking Alexa to put at level 10, nope. She just wont. It is seriously like having my dot on level one, all the time. That is as loud as she goes.
title: Disappointing

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Matthew Kilburn
content: Delivered as expected. Easily set up. Just took a few moments to get connected to Wi-Fi and to set up itself. Including changing the Wake word. Sound is expected as it is compact. Not as well-rounded as the main echo or the echo Dot. But it works clearly. I have yet to look into any of the add on items such as a night light. But I will update my review when I do get that. But this also controls the wireless lighting I have in my home from Philips Hue bulbs. And it is working excellently as advertised.
title: Excellent addition to the echo family.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amitava Ghosh
content: This device worked for a few days and then stopped working. It would not connect to the wifi, always complaining that the device is not registered. But it is registered. With Amazon tech representative, we de-registered and then re-registered it. It does not connect to the wifi. I rebooted the wifi router twice without any change. Other Amazon devices work very well, like Echo and Ring alarm system. Amazon tech representative wanted me to go on rebooting my router and follow her script again and disconnect all other devices from the wifi. I thought there should be limit of patience with a device. At some point, people needs to think whether it is worth the time to go on troubleshooting the device. I passed it after an hour. I have better things to do.
title: Probably a bad unit

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Chan
content: Hi I am using Echo Flex  to take advantage of Alexa and have connected to my Bose SR1 Soundbar using 3.5mm to RCA Audio cable. Now I can play all kind of music on Amazon prime, Pandora, etc without keeping my Phone busy. There will be lot of other use of this small economical device but even with one use I am SO Happy! :) Streamed music Sound clarity is also detailed and dynamic, and that's the BIG Plus. Highly recommend it. I will buy more for other rooms. All other Echo products also seems well made.
title: Audio Out to external speaker and Sound quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sue Chang
content: I recently purchased this to plug into my bathroom since I thought having a very small echo flush to the wall would be perfect and not take up any valuable bathroom counter space. I actually don't have prime or use Amazon services very much so an echo's purpose personally are glorified radios (news), alarm clocks, weather reporters, speakers, among a few other purposes. I received an echo show and a regular echo as gifts so I got used to using echos for the purposes listed heretofore. I think one thing that would greatly improve this device is having volume buttons on the side or something. Otherwise, best feature about this to me is that it is flush against the wall and I was able to plug it even upside down. Sound quality- leaves something to be desired but this thing is tiny and I didn't expect it to be great. I linked my phone to it to play music in the shower and it's the sound quality of a relatively cheap speaker. Same goes for when I listen to the radio for news. Voice recognition- also not fantastic. Doesn't pick up I would say 3/10 times I say the wake word and will have to repeat myself a few times. I also don't need to shout or anything since I am generally always in very close proximity to this particular device when using it. Alexa integration- fine. Again, this particular device is tiny and doesn't have as very many features as regular echos.
title: A very very basic echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rick Sanchez C-137
content: It is a great echo idea just based on it has such a small footprint in your home for smart home control. And with the accessories it has real practical uses. I could see them making temperature sensors or a usb speaker with clock if you wanted the sound better with a clock which would be awesome in a garage. Another practical use would be to use it in hotels so you can bring a assistant with you and you even charge your phone up with it. I got my echo flex for 13 bucks and it was definitely worth it at that price, cant wait to try the light attachment.
title: I get why this exists

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: home mom
content: Got this to add to my Alexa in the home. So helpful it's in the kitchen and is great. I already have the dot and show so I added this to communicate with everyone while I'm cooking and no need to yell. And it's quick help to set a timer and streaming music in the kitchen it is great. And the cherry of it is the ring doorbell too all hands free in the kitchen.Its voice recognition works better than when I ask the kids to do things to help. I wish my mom had this when I was growing up.
title: Stop running room to room

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mark T
content: This is a great way to add Alexa almost anywhere in the house.  I've started to use them with the motion detector to experiment with a cheap security solution, but as of now the alerts you can do are not that great.  The sound quality is pretty poor when comparing to some of the later generation echo dots, but I wasn't expecting much.  The device hears my voice well and responds as expected.  Getting another one so my daughter can set a timer when she brushers her teeth.
title: Handy and easy way to add Alexa at any outlet

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KM24
content: This is a great device if you just want a simple and basic Alexa access in another room of your house! It is not so much for playing music (although it does play that too) but it is definitely great for use like in your bathroom or when you want to do the drop in feature to another device in another part of the house. I put mine in our upstairs Master bathroom. It has worked great to add things to my shopping list (especially bathroom items when I am thinking of it right then) or if I need to ask my husband a question by doing the drop in to our Echo Show that is all the way downstairs on the other end of the house. It is also a great price if you just want the basic usage! Less than the Echo Dot. It has all the same abilities as an Echo Dot, just not with the same stereo sound. But it can also be connected via bluetooth to a separate speaker if you want stereo sound. I am going to buy another one of these for my daughter's room to use as an intercom or to add things to shopping list.
title: Great and simple Alexa device!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: M. Nichols
content: One can find a spot to plug in this little device just about anywhere.  Living in a small home, space is at a premium.  However the Echo Flex fit inconspicuously into an electrical outlet just inside the front door.  This is wonderful - especially when one's hands are full - as one can simply ask Alexa to turn on lights.  However, if the device has a shortfall it would be its very "tinny" speaker.  Updating the Echo Flex with a slightly more robust speaker would definitely improve the sound quality score assigned to this product.
title: Convenient addition to the Alexa family

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: nerd glasses
content: I bought this to put in a long hallway to capture voice commands that were missed by Echos on either side of the house. Works exactly as i had hoped. Speaker quality is not great, but it's not meant to play music, so I'm OK with that. It's also much smaller than I expected, which is great; and the add-ons available for it are pretty cool! I highly recommend this if you're looking to fill a gap between Echos so you no longer have to yell to another room!
title: Does exactly what it was designed for.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: xstitchgarden
content: Speaker is not loud enough to be heard over the shower noise. I thought this would be a good option for the bathroom to listen to music in the shower but it’s not loud enough
title: Speaker is very low quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: G. Penna
content: I Love this Echo Flex. I have a very small space between the bottom of my plug and my towel rack in my bathroom. This Amazon flex fits perfectly in that spot. I Love all the echo products and have one in almost every room but not in the bathroom. There was really no place to put one till this. Now I could hear the news, music or whatever podcast I listen to in the bathroom in the morning while I am getting ready for work. I love this. It is the perfect size.
title: It’s perfect for small space.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lori3vino
content: This is the perfect addition to my Echo Show device! it connects easily to my account and its so dam good that i ended up buying 4 of them! Each room now has a flex for easier communication and can also play music as a group of speakers! NOW it isn't stereo sounds at all... BUT it has good quality of sound. These are also perfect for my Ring cam as it sends alerts ALL over the place in case i didnt hear it on my phone. So basically this is an echo dot type of device but you NEED a homebase device such as a Echo Show or Dot.
title: more alexa all over the house!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kbebe
content: Voice recognition could be improved as I find myself speaking louder than I should in a small room. Sound is very low which is the one thing that bothers me the most; however at $10 which is what I paid, it is still worth buying to not have a dot with a cord on the floor
title: Could be improved

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Peter Morris
content: A great solution to my problems! I needed another alexa device in my hallway and my previous solution was just to attach my echo dot to the wall (since there is nothing to set it on in this tiny hallway). It was ugly sticking out and the wires had to be hidden. But this thing just plugs in and works great. I got a 3rd party nightlight attachment for the bottom and now it's even more useful! Wouldn't recommend for a primary music player, just because it's so small the sound gets muddled. But as for voice commands, it works just as well as my echo dot.
title: Super useful! I'm buying another!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mai Mai
content: So I actually like the product. I don't love it. it plugged up to the wall. I didn't have to do much because I have other echo dot's. I use this in the bathroom to turn on the lights. It doesn't offer a volume button like the others. The sound quality sucks! I gave the sound one star. So I use the usb bottom for the phone cord rather than the motion light. But over all it seems to work just as good as my other products. The only thing that is off putting is the shabby speaker they put in it. They should have added a better quality speaker.
title: Like it not Love it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Collin Rose
content: After toying with the Echo Flex for a little I conclude that it offers little value with out the motion sensor or night light accessories which I will not be purchasing. The Echo Flex is not any louder than a cell phone and is honestly hard to hear in the kitchen with more than 3 family members around. If purchasing for the assistant or as a speaker, buy a google home or an echo dot. If you want an overpriced nightlight or motion sensor, this is the product for you, you just have to pay an additional $12 on top of the device itself.
title: Average at best

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Karen B. Faulkenberry
content: If you are looking for an echo to just answer questions and not take up room on a table, this is for you. I knew the speaker was smaller, but I didn't expect it to be that bad.  It is not good for playing music.  It's hard to plug in anything else in the socket panel because it takes up a lot of room and may block the other receptacle. but it does have a USB port.  I bought it to go in a room that didn't have a good space for the echo dot.  Wasn't happy with the speaker and have relocated it to a small room.
title: Not the sound quality of an echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Loyal to a fault
content: Absolutely in love with this little gadget.  There are many ways it can be used they all have one thing in common.  That is making life a bit easier.  I purchased this because my husband had a stroke on Christmas Day and is now bedridden.  I put the Echo Flex right next to my bed so when he needs me at night he just drops in.  I LOVE the peace of mind and the fact that it has the same basic features as my bigger devices an absolute bonus.
title: Love it

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sedef P.
content: UPDATE: increased from 1 star to 2 just because of amazon customer service. They contacted me after the review to help troubleshoot and then exchanged my flex for a new one. However, after setup and trying different locations in the house, including right next to the wifi router, the new flex is also non-responsive. It goes offline and doesn't come back all of the time and is basically useless. I love all my echo products, but this one just isn't worth it. It is barely responsive even when shouting "Alexa" at it, and I end up having to reset it several times a day, and even then it isn't always responsive. Might just be a flawed flex that I got, but it's really not as great as the show or dot.
title: Not responsive most of the time

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bob
content: This is a great little Echo. For us, perfect for the bathroom. Worked perfectly out of the box.  Plug in and your ready to go, no setup required if you already have other Echo's, otherwise I assume you have to do some Wi-Fi set up. The sound is a bit tinnier but more than adequate for our purposes. We attached a smart night-light to it that is a perfect addition for this device. If you need an Echo for voice and not a video display, this is the way to go.
title: Great little Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Douglas Bickel
content: I live alone in a 1BR apartment and have my main Echo in the livingroom. I use it for a bluetooth speaker mainly, although I have gotten kind of hooked on the voice command thing. I didn't want to buy a second Echo for the bedroom, as they are kind of pricey, and I already have a Bluetooth speaker. But this little guy allows me to give it voice commands, and I can get my morning news before I get out of bed. It's not bad. The speaker is quite wimpy, however. For $12.99 on sale, it was an OK purchase.
title: This is good for what I got it for

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: lovemy2pooches
content: Let me start by saying, for sound nothing beats an Echo, and I own two (one in the living room and one in the bedroom). I bought the Echo Flex for my kitchen so that I could ask it to start my appliances plugged in to smart plugs without having to yell out into the living room (I know, it sounds lazy LOL). This little guy does everything the Echo does, and the speaker is fine, but don't depend on it for a rich music sound like the Echo.
title: A handy item in the kitchen

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: John G.
content: Great little device with a lot of potential.  The built-in speaker is good enough for voice responses, not so much for listening to music.  The size is nice.  What this thing really needs is a built-in motion sensor!  I would pay $10 more for the Flex with that functionality and then still get the nightlight attachment.  Sacrificing one for the other is an unfortunate design flaw IMO.
title: Just get it already.  You already know you want one.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: TRadio30
content: Was thinking about buying a Ring Chime to help hear our doorbell inside in a location where we didn't have another echo device already. The Echo flex (on sale) was a MUCH better price than a Ring Chime, and with Alexa, has many more features. Sound quality is poor, but the product description didn't claim to have great sound. Small profile, like the plug-in option and the ability to add add-ons to it. Pleased so far (1 week in).
title: Smaller Alexa device with less speaker (but much better than Ring Chime)

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Hilldawg
content: The motion detection is slower then smart things it's about 120 degrees.  The flex does not understand me as well as the echo.  The sound is as expected.  I wish you could point the motion while attached to the base.  I had to use a usb extension and a mount so the device could be pointed at both doors.  I love the ide of a echo that plugs in directly and I plan to keep using the 2 flex we have until a better alternative is available
title: Didnt meet my expectation but still worth buying.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Shadowfax
content: I like to be able to access Alexa I the morning without waking everybody up. I place the Echo Flex in my bathroom next to my sink (where you usually plug the electric shaver) so I can liste to news, turn on the coffee machine, lights, time, weather etc while preparing to go out to work. Nice little helper. I also bought the light that you can plug o the flex so I can go to the bathroom at night without turning the bathroom lights on.
title: Accessing Alexa o those remote places

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: G. Finn
content: This was just what I wanted, a convenient connection to check out my morning news brief while preparing for the day in the bathroom and bedroom.  The sound quality was fine for this purpose, and it virtually out of the way plugged on to an open wall plug.  This is not for music, and it said that in the description, if that is what you want, get a dot, otherwise this is a good solution for keeping Alexa closer to you wherever you roam at home.
title: Echo Flex great for extension of Dot, but not for music

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KAEAM
content: The microphone is absolutely terrible.  I completely get the poor quality speaker and don’t have any issue with it as I use Bluetooth speaker anyway.  With that said, I am maybe able to get it to understand me 1/10 times I try.  The echo dot microphones can hear me whisper from across the house, I can literally be a foot away from this thing talking loudly and it doesn’t do a thing...  waste of money unfortunately.
title: Worthless

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ThomBodi
content: Didn’t buy it for The WIMPY Speaker. It serves simply as a “link” to connect Sirius-XM to our intercom.  Not reliable though as it is constantly dropping off the Wi-Fi requiring that it be unplugged and plugged back in to resync - no fun as it is in very tight quarters!  Of all our Amazon/Echo/Alexa products, Echo Flex IS THE WEAKEST LINK! The speaker is terrible and the microphone is suspect.
title: Functionally, it is what it is and at best it’s mediocre

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jonathan H.
content: I bought three. They work great to be an extra chime throughout the house. They are great for announcements in the kid's room, the kitchen and the garage. It's like having Alexa in any room you put one in. I also have 2 Echo Dots. The sound quality of music isn't as great in the Flex as it is in the Dots but all of them can connect to a Bluetooth speaker. So if you want to listen to music and have some base, just tell it to connect to your Bluetooth speaker. They are well worth the money.
title: Great and well worth the money. They are a very cheap way to have Alexa anywhere and everywhere.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: BeRock
content: It’s small, compact and works with all my devices. No the sound quality isn’t comparable to the echos But that’s not what it’s for. Goes great in the kitchen or garage for interacting with automated devices or communicating to others. I actually think it listens or understands faster and better than the full size echos (maybe it’s just me). For what I got it for it’s great. I like it’s small size in the hallway and kitchen.
title: Listens better than my Echos

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: CanAmSteve
content: Happy to see the tech "trickle down". The cheaper speaker in this unit actually reproduces talk radio better, Not so great for music, obviously. I also got the nightlight. Would be neat if the accessories allowed you to piggyback - so that the nightlight could have the motion sensor plugged in as well. As for now it is one or the other
title: Just like the bigger ones but tinny sound

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sandra E. Bauer
content: Love this little device that plugs directly into the wall. I added the nightlight and now can tell Alexa to turn off the nightlight when I want to sleep or have it on so I can get up during the night.  Great addtition to my collection of Alexa enabled devices. I started with Echo Dot, then added Echo Plus and then added Echo Spot and then added Echo Show and now the Echo Flex.  Very happy with all the devices.
title: Great having another Echo device in my home

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Paul L.
content: I added echo Flex Alexa to my office.  Added so that my lamps could be switched on without going to each. also, wanted to listen to the news, music, weather,jokes... Nice to have an office assistant. I connected a set of pc speakers that came with my desktop. They were stored away cause I was not using them. anyway, they sound real nice and gives echo a stronger voice. I'm planning on getting the USB night light or sensor. Flex is good company in the office.
title: FaLexa controls my office

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Chris O.
content: Set up easy and works just fine. Has no problem with the wifi connection. Just a little on the chunky side, but acceptable considering the USB ports. The speaker, though, is shockingly bad. Volume is OK for a bedroom, but the sound quality is just awful. Not just music either - even Alexa sounds a bit harsh, like she's shouting over an old payphone in a cafeteria.  Makes my Echo Dot sound positively symphonic by comparison.
title: Compact and Convenient, but sound quality is quite bad

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: moka0504
content: This was a great price when I bought it so I couldn’t pass it up. I plugged it in downstairs by my oldest sons room in the living room. I love being able to call down there from the app or my dot, which I have upstairs. I can drop in or announce it’s time for dinner or ask him a question if I’m not home. I don’t have to yell down there haha. The sound quality isn’t as good as the dot but it works. My son can ask it what the temp is, for example when he’s getting dressed the in the morning. Great little gadget!
title: No more yelling downstairs that it’s time for dinner!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Steven H.
content: I really like the aesthetic of this to replace the echo dot on my kitchen counter so that I don't have the power wire just curled up.  However the speaker volume on this thing leaves a lot to be desired.  It is extremely quiet even at max volume.  It is difficult to hear alarms from this thing in a different room in the house. The mic does appear to pick up fairly well though at least.
title: Very low volume

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DP
content: Works great for bathrooms, odd spaces and things like hallways (for when you don’t wanna yell to Alexa). Obviously not meant for playing music or doing anything other than hearing commands but that’s what Bluetooth is for. It’s great because you can connect it to any Bluetooth speaker. I have in-ceiling Bluetooth speakers in my bathroom so this device was the perfect low key addition!
title: Solid performance in a small package w/ Bluetooth!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bill
content: We have multiple units (and a replacement unit) and the motion sensor accessory (that we have not used yet because the FLEX devices continue to have connection problems . Continually experiencing connection problems, stating  "I'm having trouble conecting to the internet".  Unplug and plug in and they will work for a day or 2...and then have connection problems again. NO WAY you can hope to have them work while out of town for a period of time.  Changed install locations, changed config from 2.4 to 5g.  EVEN plugged into an electrical outlet by the WIFI signal origination.  Extremely good WIFI signal but same connection interruption problem with FLEX again and again.  Echo Show 5 works fine.  All other WIFI devices work fine.  Echo FLEX does not work reliably.  Sound not very good either.  Difficulty understanding what someone communicating via the device is saying...and they have difficulty understanding what you are saying as well.
title: NOT RELIABLE!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ann B.
content: I bought this to use with a smart plug in my office... still waiting on the smart plug to arrive... so can’t tell about that. Will say sound quality SUCKS, if there is any other noise (I’m talking anything, printer printing, or tv on low) you can’t hear it... there is no volume adjustment I can find. And it doesn’t always hear me right... we will see how the thing works with the smart speaker if it ever gets here.
title: Only for a quiet room.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Spike
content: This is a great idea.  Spaces where you don't really need a visual or high quality speakers, like the garage, smaller spaces, etc.  Connection was simple... not ready for prime time though.  The sound quality isn't expected to be stellar- but it is less than good.  The volume options are almost minimal.  Wait for the next generation!  Amazon will likely delete my review - they called too complain about the review - sorry, it's just not ready for distribution.
title: Not ready for Prime Time!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sowana
content: I bought two of these and they work great with my household Echo devices. However, the audio volume is best left below max so the tiny speaker doesn't sound shrill and 'tinny' or 'metallic'. Also, when audio is playing through the Echo Flex and I try calling it to switch to another song, sometimes it is not able to pick my voice over the audio. But that is a minor inconvenience. Great device to add to the existing Echo devices.
title: Echo Flex - great add-on with a 'metallic' sound!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Evan Donaldson
content: I got my Alexa Flex at a discount (part of a package). It works well for my daughter - she just needs an alarm, and to be able to be notified of family announcements. The challenge is that the connectivity seems a bit spotty. We have tons of Amazon AND Apple devices in our home, and this one seems to lose the network a bit more frequently than the rest. Definitely worth looking at if you don't need to use it as a primary speaker.
title: Alexa Flex is good - at a discount

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Passion4Diving
content: Until now, if I wanted to command the Alexa infrastructure in my home from several room, I had to purchase more DOTs (not an inexpensive solution).  Now, that issue is solved with the introduction of of the Flex.  Currently, at half the price of the DOT, I can have inexpensive tools to control Alexa. So far, the only negative is that I cannot change the "awake" name from Alexa to one of the other three, such as Echo.
title: Perfect extension to the Alexa concept

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lisa Knecht
content: I purchased the Echo Flex because my original Alexa tower didn't voice recognize when I was in the bathroom.  This little Flex is great because I have voice recognition all over the house now.  A lot of people noted that the sound is not the best, but I have found that I can hear my music in the shower just fine.  It's not loud, but it fine.  I also purchased the nightlight attachment and love it.  I highly recommend the Echo Flex.
title: Alexa Flex

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Hate to shop in stores.
content: Arrived on time and had no trouble setting it up. I have seen some complaints about the speaker quality, but they need to read the description completely. It states that it will not play music. It is designed for areas that just need to access Alexa for voice commands. I have it in my kitchen close to the sink so I can turn on the lights because the one near by in the living room will not respond if the TV is on very loud. Overall, works great for the price.
title: Works as stated. Small speaker, don't expect too much.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kelsey Davis
content: I'm returning this product because the volume is too quiet. I don't need it to play music but I like to use Alexa for the weather, news, etc, and the volume isn't loud enough to hear unless I'm sitting right next to it. Also, some of my Alexa skills don't work with the flex (which might get solved over time but for now they don't seem compatible). I do like that it plugs directly into the wall.
title: Too quiet for normal Alexa functions.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Captain Paul
content: I wish the night light was included.  I wanted to put this in the bathroom to replace the nightlight But I could not bring myself to pay for the one that fits this.  I ended up putting it in the basement and it works great.  It's in a outlet that is close to the floor and it still picks up voice commands very well.  This is a good option for getting Alexa in parts of the house that don't need great sound just voice commands.
title: I wish the night light was included.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Gerardo Mendoza
content: The responding to the commands is kind of slow although the internet connection is working fine, sometimes it is necessary to repeat several times the commands. My Google assistant works better on my cellphone which is connected to the same wifi network., It responses way much quicker. On the other hand, it's small, discreet, not complicated to install and setup, the speaker is not the best but enough to hear it. I paired it by Bluetooth to my soundbar then I have a great sound quality when I require it. It's ok for those who want to try the Echo virtual assistant as an entry level.
title: It's ok for those who want to try the Echo virtual assistant as an entry level.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lake Life 2018
content: Main use for us is in the bathroom connected to waterproof Bluetooth speaker.  I had constant problems with older V2 Dot dropping audio requiring frequent reboots.  This flex takes up much less space and directly plugs into the outlet without requiring plugs all over the sink.  I have not had to reboot it ever.  I miss volume up/down.  It is hard of hearing as others have noted which limits its use to close up small spaces.
title: A little hard of hearing but a good fit for small spaces

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Pgh Fan
content: It works as well as the other 8 other Echos and Echo Dots we have.  We’re all in on the Echo for better or for worse, so how good the Flex is will depend on how you feel about Big Brother Amazon. The Flex is in my garage and works fine so far.  Yes, the sound quality is meh, but it’s not meant to be a speaker. The  sound seemed perfectly fine for “What’s the weather?” I have it connected to and old Bose Soundlink speaker and part of a speaker group. Works perfectly fine for this purpose.
title: Great for the garage

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: cm
content: I should have trusted the reviews I had read here about the poor sound quality before I purchased the flex. I thought I’d give it a try because it seemed to be convenient to have this directly plugged near the kitchen counter so that I could listen while cooking and cleaning. I thought slightly worse sound quality should still be bearable. Well, I was totally wrong. I couldn’t stand the sound even  for a few minutes and had to remove it almost immediately. I switched it with an old echo mini and use the mini in the kitchen for listening purpose, and put the flex somewhere else just to give commands to control smart devices. Even for that purpose it seems to be inferior to echo mini. I put the flex at exactly the same spot where I used to put my echo mini, but somehow it doesn’t catch my commands as easily as my echo mini, and I had to talk louder sometimes. If I have to find something positive about the Flex, at least it was easy to set up, as easy as the echo mini.
title: Poor sound quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Abhishek
content: I've been using echo dots gen 2 and 3 for a while and decided to give this a shot, I like the neatness of plug and play form factor, as I use it in my kitchen, overall it doesn't disappoint for my use cases at least. The only downside is if you intend to play music through this Echo, then the sound isn't that great or rich, which I suspect is due to the form factor and speakers used, but that is to be expected.
title: Great Alex form factor

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Adam
content: I love the fact that it plugs right in to the wall and I don’t have to worry about cords. The sound is not good at all for playing music when there is background noise like running water when doing the dishes.I got 2 of them them one in my kitchen and I put one in my kids Room and they use it  it is still a great addition to my smart home and can move it around if needed easily would still recommend just be mindful about the sound quality.
title: My thoughts on the eco flex

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stacy
content: I have four dots throughout the house and the flex allows me to turn on smart devices but it's not good for "dropping in" on other dots or for listening to anything. I am somewhat unhappy with the purchase and should have ordered another dot
title: Not good. Get a dot

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lorrie V
content: I really love this device but yes as the other reviews indicate, the speaker stinks. This being said, I use the USB feature with the night light add-on at home, and it senses light changes well. I love that I can change the color of the light and dim it when I get up in the middle of the night. When I'm on the road, I take it to have Ms Alexa with me and to charge my USB devices. The hotspot configuration works perfectly and when I return home, it remembers the Wifi automatically.
title: Good Job Amazon... nice little device!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stephen Schwartz
content: great, minimalistic access to Alexa and Amazon. great for the out of the way places that don't require a screen or where you prefer something out of the way. you need an open electrical wall plug (preferred in my opinion) or extension cord plug. really simple to install and set up  function is just like having a larger Alexa unit for a less expensive price. very good sound quality for such a compact size.
title: great smaller Alexa unit

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: S. Willis
content: I’m disappointed with this product. I currently own three echo dots which seem more responsive to my voice. Also, I have it in my hallway upstairs, so that I don’t have to shout, I can just “drop in”. Unfortunately, my son has an Echo Dot in his room, which is too close of proximity for the Flex (even though the Dot is in s separate room). I really want to use the Flex, but right now I am still in the trouble shooting stage. As a note, there is also no bass when playing music, which makes the music sound hollow.
title: Too Close of Proximity?

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Stephen S
content: This works really well. This was the first one I got before the echo.. it is now relegated to the bedroom. Where it works very well. I wish you would go a little quieter when I play night time music. Keeping down at 3% is a little loud. And you lower and it just goes off the sound. That needs a little work I think. But other than that voice recognition is very good and it does what it's programmed to do.
title: Small compact and works

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Skitzie
content: It works fine, just like my echo dots and my echo. It plugs right into an outlet. Because of the size of the speakers, the sound isn't as full as the others but does not sound unpleasant, just kinda' tinny in comparison. Perfect for an out of the way area. Mine is in a hallway between the bedrooms & baths. It would be perfect had I gotten the light for it because this location needs a nightlight. I have zero complaints with this unit.  Small and inexpensive.
title: Small and not at all obtrusive

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: UrAverageReviewer
content: What a good product! I love the ease of use this device offers. The speaker is not so great, but for the $9.99 I got it for on Prime Day, it’s understandable. I really recommend tying in an Echo Glow with the Echo Flex, as it has a USB port at the bottom that the Echo Glow can plug into. I personally bought both, and I love the Echo Glow as well! Amazon makes very good products. I will be buying more!
title: Good product, not a surprise! Amazon products are stellar!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Colleen
content: This is a handy little amazon wall plug in device especially for smalls rooms without much space. The design was better looking than expected and I did get the extra nightlight which I recommend. Set up for all was super easy. The sound quality is not as good as the regular echo devices, but sufficient. So far it’s been a great extra device for a small room where I needed one that plugged into a wall.
title: Great plug in option for a wall device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Icemann
content: Compared with other Alexa devices such as FireStick, Dot, Show, the microphone is not as sensitive. Typically you have to be within 6-10 feet where as the other devices work across the room. The built in speaker is also too small for most rooms & it’s better if you connect to a Bluetooth speaker. The idea of a small plugin device is great but it needs to function better. The USB outlet is a good point.
title: Not as good as other Echo devices.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mountain bum
content: I bought this for my dad for Christmas.  He ended up having emergency surgery and having a hard time moving around.  I gave him this early along with some smart plugs.  Not he does not have to reach over to turn on a lamp, he can check on the weather, and can do the drop ins to talk to us. I think the drop in is great bc if he would happen to fall he could have Alexa to call us and we’d be right there.
title: A great Alexa gift!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: David Irwin
content: The voice recognition and this unit it’s not great at all also it’s had a hard time connecting even though my router is just One room away with no distinguishable obstacles. On the bright side, they are a really good routines you can set up and the extra peripherals seem decent.I have a motion sensor and also ordered the nightlight so all in all it is a multi functional unit for the price it’s not bad.
title: Flex is NOT a dot.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: JD
content: I'm very upset with the way discriminatory that Amazon treat customers like me from Puerto Rico. On where we aren't allowed to buy any Alexa products. I already have this one from "EBAY". I feel so bad that I'm will not going to renewal my Prime. This act represent a loss of many customers because the internet is very helpful to keep everyone a knowledgeable. Why in the Black Friday and Christmas time on where all Alexa products have special price we were banned.
title: Poor and discriminatory Puerto Rico customer treat

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mr. Phil
content: Great for harsher environment.  So far I have three.  One in the garage (announce I'm home, turn on lights).  One in the utility room (play music while folding laundry, Bluetooth connected to stereo that drives eight outdoor speakers by the pool).  One in the patio/three season room (connected to old PC subwoofer and speakers and synced with utility room flex for indoor/outdoor music).  Full Alexa features in a small box.  The Flex internal speaker isn't great for listening to music, but connected to an extetnal speaker you get superior sound quality.  It's interesting to note the one in the utility room does a great job recognizing my voice over the background noise of the washer/dryer/furnace blower.
title: Great for harsher environment.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Catherine Scholl
content: This is an excellent LITTLE device to plug straight into the bathroom or any place where you don’t have a lot of space. While, understandably, the sound quality is not great — in a small space it fits, connects with all my other echo dots, and is programmed to do five things in the morning for me when I rise and am brushing teeth for work. I love the ROUTINES and “she” turns on my coffee, reads me the weather, updates me with a snapshot of world news etc., all while putting on my makeup. I like it. :)
title: Small with small sound but awesome!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: P. Swarthout
