content: I like having an inexpensive Alexa device. But the speaker quality is lousy! The sound is really tinny. If you're looking for whole house sound, skip the Flex and buy an Echo or an Echo Dot. If you're looking for whole house connectivity to Alexa, then this device might be worth the money. But eventually, you'll want to upgrade to something with better sound quality. So you might as well buy a better device from the start.
title: Works. Integrated easily. Crappy speaker quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Frank Del Vero
content: Find this to be a nice addition, still some word needed on sound and voice recogniztion. But, it but to use,play with and nice to call another person in a different room with out having to yell or walk to that area. It is basically an Alexa tool but the sound quality is my only concern. We did need to contact Amazon for some minor set up issues, not the units fault, just someting to do with connection set up. Its a keeper.
title: Nice tool

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: G. Michael Hughes
content: This Flex is my seventh Amazon Echo device, and it is perfect for the area I am using it for. Needed a small, unobtrusive unit to control smart home devices is remote part of house. This is perfect for that. I use all my other echoes for sound throughout house, but I did not need this unit for the music, so it works great. The sound is less than the others, but I do not play music through it. Good addition to Echo family!
title: Good addition to smart home!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Chris Butner
content: Great intro into the Alexa world. Does everything the others do. However, the sound quality just pales in comparison to other Echo products. If they could put a better quality speaker in these guys, then the value would be unbearable. I'm using my flexes in the garage and guest bathroom where the audio doesn't have to be as solid. Which is what this product seems to be designed for: bringing Alexa to every room on the cheap.
title: Good product. Could be better.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Shelby
content: This works perfectly to control smart plugs when I’m downstairs away from my main Echo. I get ready for work in the downstairs bathroom, also great for asking the weather, etc. one note: this states it’s not suited for music playback...while this is true that it’s not a loud speaker or a party speaker, it’s perfectly acceptable to play music while I’m getting ready in the morning. It’s just as good as playing music on your phone with no speaker. So that it’s not too loud and I wake up people upstairs, but I can hear fine in my bathroom while putting on makeup etc.
title: Great

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Janet
content: This one is in my bathroom because that is where I need to add shampoo and all the other grooming essentials to my shopping list.  Walking out of the room somehow erases my memory of what I just realized I need, so this solves that problem.  It's also nice to hear the weather report and other info while getting ready for my day.  I liked it so much I bought several more to give as Christmas gifts and everyone loved them.
title: Love this!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Leonora Curtis
content: I have an Alexa in every room of my house.  The flex seems to be hard of hearning.  I have to speak loudly into it to wake it up.  The audio is low quality, which doesn't bother me because I was told that in advance and I really just use in my kitchen to set timers, ask cooking questions and add to my shopping list, but not being able to wake up the devise without repeating my self a few time, really is not a good thing.
title: Hard of Hearing

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: AyaPapaya
content: This product is so well rounded, it is so worth the buy! I purchased this Flex with a night light attachment. The speaker is decent. Honestly, it could be better, but it does the job. It gets decently loud, but I have to say it's not as loud as a Echo Spot or anything. We use this for the family in the kitchen, where there are Spanish-only speakers and English speakers.  The Alexa portion is very helpful in that way. We are really happy with how the product looks and performs! It's the perfect addition to our Alexa crew.
title: Love the Flex, get the attachments with it!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: ADantzMan
content: This would be good maybe for a very small place with no rooms for cords... otherwise, just stick with a normal Echo Dot. The sound quality on the Flex isn’t good. It sounds like it is in a can and the volume doesn’t get as loud as I’d expect. I purchased this to have in the bathroom where we have limited counter space. It works ok, but I do not think I’d purchase another... unless a v2 is released with a better sounding, louder speaker.
title: Compact Echo with Poor Sound Quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lily Sue
content: I am not impressed with this device. The sound is like my transistor radio in the 60s. I also can’t get it to work with my other Alexa devices. In the bathroom, it is an outlet hog so if you have 4 outlets together, this thing is just too big. I love my Echo, Echo Dot and Echo Show but this thing is not of the same quality. I got it on Prime Day so it was only $9.99 so will keep but if you have a choice, get the Echo Dot.
title: Not very good

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: D. Slattery
content: Great for a basic Alexa device in a place like a  garage or there like. I found the audio quality to be per poor even with the very low expectations I had though. When dropping in, it was pretty difficult to have a conversation because the audio on the flex was too low. Anyone expecting any kind of decent sound quality for music should turn back now. It’s not that kind of device. As an echo device it’s worth the money.
title: Decent for the price and to integrate Alexa in an odd place.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Justin Y
content: I need Alexa in my home office and this thing just popped up on Amazon.  It plugs on the wall so no power adapter needed. I use it to play light music so it does the job.  I don't listen to the heavy metal or anything in high volumn anyway.  For now it is helping me turn on/off lights, intercom to my family in other room, listening to the music, set a timer/reminder, etc.  In the future I will add optional modules and also integrate more Alexa skills.  This is fun.
title: small but mighty

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: K. V. Harris
content: I've bought about 6 or more of these. They're great for playing music/sound from various apps including Amazon Prime Music and Spotify. A great feature is the line-out 3.5mm jack. I use it to connect to larger self-powered speakers or sound systems. The grouping feature is helpful too since I can set up zones and send music to many Echo Flexes at the same time. The built-in speaker is too small to enjoy music through but is handy for listening to talk content.
title: Great For Getting Sound Distributed Around the Property

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brian B.
content: I was really excited to use this and even bought the nightlight add-on for added utility.  The microphones do not seem to pick up my voice nearly as well as the Dots I have around the house.  I tried talking to the Flex from 2 feet away and the Dot more than 20 feet away activated, which is kind of a testament of the mics in the Dot, but not great for the Flex.  I had to get closer to it and speak more quietly for it to work.  It continually frustrates my wife because it will not respond.  The integrated speaker is just too quiet and I have to leave it at max volume to hear it at a normal volume.  Concept is great but in reality it left me wanting more. I do like the form factor though and ease of placement.  I will say though that the night light has been great and I love the ability to change colors.
title: Great form factor but needs improvement!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: lylli
content: Excellent design concept and brilliant idea but execution is disappointing. I have amazing hearing but I can not hear this over the faucet or shower or even my ceiling fan (admitted a rather loud one). I’d hate to try multiple noises such as kids goofing off or a vent fan. Terribly disappointed. One can not simply quit an excellent audiobook at a crucial plot point...nerds everywhere will surely understand. It is not designed to offer excellent music playback (this I knew) but I had expected better voice capability/quality. It would, however, make an excellent night light and story playback device for a child’s bedroom or perhaps dedicated voice chat device for people working from home but is largely useless outside of this sort of niche.
title: Dreadful disappointment sadly

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Amanda
content: I was pleasantly surprised by the integration of this Echo Flex. The speaker's not the greatest but it is certainly good. The only complaint I have is that it's VERY bulky. Also, I would have loved to see a plug integrated into this product instead of having to buy an accessory as an add-on. It does have a USB plug outlet tho, so that's a bonus. Worth the spend if you catch a sale 👍
title: Great integration

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: stilltrying
content: To have a little plug in Alexa in the bathroom is so nice. The bathroom actually has good acoustics, I guess, because this little thing does not sound bad at all. I need louder speakers, and get cell phones and extra speakers for my TVs, to get clear speech, and honestly, this thing is pretty nice. Efficient, she hears me, the sound is just fine, and the convenience of having one in, say, the laundry room, the bathroom, etc., is pretty great.
title: Perfect

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DMH
content: I purchased to use as a media pass thru to my stereo. Tried two separate flexes and the audio feedback over the auxiliary cable is too noticeable to not ignore.  If you are like me don’t bother until they figure that out. By the way the feedback does not exist on the echo show when plugged into the stereo. Perhaps by itself the flex is a fine device as it was quickly incorporated into the Alexa app.  It just performed poorly for me.  A Bluetooth speaker would probably work too.  Next time don’t release it with an aux jack if it cannot be used to provide clean sound and music. Sending both Flex back.
title: 2 flexes - 2 fails

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: a reader from Los Angeles
content: I got it for the bathroom to avoid shouting to my other Alexas and not being able to hear them. It was a good price point during prime ($10) and it is handy to ask the time or the weather. It was ridiculously easy to plug into the system — literally just plug it in and she’s online. The only thing that bugs me is the speaker sounds like Alexa is talking through a tin can at the bottom of a well.
title: Great potential, using two tin cans and a string

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sean
content: You used to be able to say "Alexa, What time is it?" and then you would get a "The time is..." Now you get a "The time is... and by the way....shopping related message" NOT OK. User:  "Alexa, Go take a bath" Alexa: "My electric circuits prefer to stay dry" User:  "Alexa, too bad" Alexa: "playing music by..." User: "Alexa, cant you do anything right" Alexa: "How to do anything by wikipedia..."
title: Getting bombarded with advertisements now

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DJ Thomas
content: Let's start by saying the sound quality is terrible but let's also be honest and say no one is (or should be) purchasing this product for the quality of the speaker; I don't believe that was ever the intention of this product. It provides a whole new level of convenience for your Alexa/smart home experience by allowing you to extend to rooms that don't necessarily need anything as loud as even an echo dot (ie bathroom). Mine is setup in my bathroom so I can still ask alexa to do things from a room where no other device would normally be able to hear me and with the addition of the motion detector I setup a routine to turn on the bathroom lights when I walk in (not a terrible perc for those bathroom trips in the middle of the night when you wake up).
title: Absolutely Perfect with the Right Expectations

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Gary R Pultz
content: I'll start with the bad, the sound quality is terrible. Getting voice feedback and answers are as far as you will want to go with this unit. Listening to music is painful at best. I also found that this unit runs pretty hot compare to the dot and echo's. So the positives, its a convenient package by being a direct plug in. The ability of adding on a motion sensor is fantastic. This was the main reason I picked this unit up and it works great. The routines you can do on motion is endless and functions well.
title: Works with flaws

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jill
content: Doesn’t work at all. Wont sync to Internet tried every troubleshooting step possible. I have multiple dots and they’re fine. This is utter trash only reason I’m not sending it back is bc I got it on prime day with a free plug smh otherwise it’s junk. Speaker is trash too
title: Doesn’t work at all

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dennis Keane
content: I regularly call into our house to check on the kids using the Drop In feature.  On our previous Echo Dot, the kids could talk relatively normal and I would be able to hear them.  With the Flex, they have to be a bit closer and shout a bit for it to pick up what they are saying. It is all or none too, if they are too far away or not talking loud enough - you hear nothing - not muffled or too soft.  So the microphones are a bit less sensitive than our old Dot.  Other than that,  works fine.
title: Drop In Calls are Tough

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mr. B
content: It's pretty good. But it has its down side. The speaker isn't that loud but works adequately. The voice recognition has issues a little. This is the smallest of the echos it would work well for a kitchen or bedroom, maybe bathroom depending on a person's needs. If is not as satisfying to use as the normal echo but does it's job just fine. It connects to wifi easy,easy to setup and learn to use.
title: Basic of the echos,small and compact

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Duane E. Neal
content: I bought 4 total! 1 for my Master Bathroom, 1 for my Sunroom, 1 for my Guest Bathroom and 1 for my Front Porch and they all work as if they were an Echo Dot!! The only major difference is that the speaker is nowhere near as good. Other than that, they can do the same things that the dot can do,but they save you space on your counter top because they plug directly into an outlet! This is especially great in the Bathrooms.
title: Space saver!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: soc
content: The Flex works well for all AI functions (takes your instructions) - exactly as you'd expect from any Alexa device. The plug in format is helpful in some cases ... but the sound quality and severe volume limit make it limited as a speaker.  Since a DOT is roughly the same size, with hugely better sound quality ...  plug-in vs powercord management + $10 is the only reason to go w a Flex vs a DOT.  If you want it to "play" something vs simply take your instructions, I'd go with a DOT.
title: Nice format and great for taking instructions like "lights off/on"

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mike D.
content: I already have a version of every Alexa produced by Amazon, so I know what each is capable of doing. I installed the Flex behind my workbench in the garage. It seemed to install itself as I didn't even have to use my Alexa app on my iPhone. The sound quality is much better than I expected and it does everything my "non-video" Alexas do. I don't know how they produce it for the price they charge, although I would guess Amazon is counting on me buying more from them.
title: A great value

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Beckman
content: Great idea for places like garage, bathrooms, shop, etc. Having coverage with Alexa throughout the house allows for drop in and announcements. I suggested to our elderly parents to have these in bathrooms in case of emergency. They could notify of trouble with announcements or drop in. Also testing the add on motion detector. When it works, 75% of the time, it's great. Once again the motion detector could be used to turn on lights on the way to the restroom at night. I'm using it in the garage to turn on lights when walking into garage or upon entry into garage. Overall, lots of potential, especially with add on motion detector.
title: Nice addition to Alexa service.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: cp
content: I looked so forward to being able to plug-in my Echo product without the cord. I was expecting the Echo dot in a more convenient form factor. Perhaps my expectations were too ambitious.  While I love the form factor, I'm extremely disappointed with the execution.  I have to speak louder for the Echo Flex to hear commands and the sound is as horrible as that of a transistor radio.  I purchased two with the night light accessory, but I certainly won't purchase another until the sound quality is improved... assuming this is an upgrade consideration.
title: Disappointed - Sounds like a transitor radio.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kirk
content: It seems a little redundant to add one more rave review for this product, but I just have to. With this "two-fer" deal, there is no reason not to have one everywhere within reach of your voice. I've had an Echo Dot for several years, and use it constantly. But now the Flex puts her wherever I happen to be, and allows instant communication with anyone in my house or on my contact list, as well as answering questions, adding to lists, controlling smart devices and all the other wonderful things she can do.
title: Everyone in the universe should have at least one!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jim
content: Having both the dot and the flex is easy to compare. If you are looking for a cheaper alternative to the Dot, the flex qualifies. It will pretty much do the same thing. It’s one drawback is it’s sound quality. It is very tinny. It does allow you to hook up speakers but adding the cost of speakers takes away any savings. Since I use the flex to turn on lights (with the use of smart plugs) the flex works fine. If I wanted to listen to music (I.e Pandora, Sirius, I heart, etc)?the tinny sounding flex would be painful. Hope that helps anyone interest in buying one.
title: Flex uses a cheap tinny sounding speaker. But all else functions, it does fine

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Judy
content: Amazing!  I recently fell down some  stairs in my home recently and was unable to access my phone to call for help.  My neighbor suggested an Amazon device that would enable me to contact her in case of a future emergency. I purchased two Flex units that would allow access from my front yard and my upstairs laundry room. I am now able to contact my neighbor via the Flex for any future emergencies. I am very pleased with these units and would highly recommend!
title: Purchased for safety

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Lisa Vincent
content: I like it! A lot of ppl complaining about the sound.  It's not as loud as the other echos, but to be fair amazon does state that, so I knew that before I bought it. You can adjust the base and volume on the app. I use it in the bathroom and I can hear just fine. It's not a Bose speaker but it's good enough for me. Plus it has all the functions as my other echo devices plus I got the nightlight and it's awesome.  I recommend!
title: Glad I bought it.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Da1Bubba
content: My echo dot is in my bedroom because I use it to control my Phillips Hue lightbulb and I use it as my alarm.  I also use the same lightbulb for my living room. I plugged  the echo flex in my kitchen which is next to my living room so that when I come home from work or as I’m leaving for work I don’t have to run to the bedroom to yell, ‘living room off’ . I can just state it as I’m walking in or out of the house and the echo flex works.
title: Echo dot extension

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: M. Spiegel
content: I would give it 5 stars except the sound isn't very good out of the built-in speaker itself. You do actually need to either plug in a USB speaker or use a Bluetooth speaker with it. But everything else seems to work well for me.
title: The built-in speaker isn't very good quality

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: James
content: I really liked how easy this was to setup.  I also loved the features of plugging it straight into the wall and being able to easily add a motion sensor.  However, the speaker is way to soft compared to the other echos.  They shouldn't have spared the cost of the speaker. Even when the volume is turned up it only gets worse.  It's obviously the speaker they are using that is my only complaint.
title: Great Size and Features but the sound quality is too soft and unclear.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Blessed Rain
content: Love how easy it was to setup... it automatically connects to my wifi along with my other echo devices! Added the night light and pleasantly surprised that I can control night lights via Alexa voice command.  I can control dimming of nightlight too!  Love it! Can’t wait until better speaker plug for flex... With Echo Flex, I can truly play music everywhere in my home... almost gives a surround sound effect!
title: Auto setup with Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: s.pauley
content: I like that this speaker is priced reasonable but I was expecting it to continue what I was listening to on my other Alexa. Its as you say a mini Alexa but my plugs are so low that I have to use an expension cord to get it up on my desk(near computer)  No volume button  so you have to speak to increase the volume okay if you don't have a problem speaking. The low price is the best feature!
title: having Alexa in another room

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: M. D.
content: I love this little Alexa friend, different from the bigger Alexa devices, affordable, always there in case of an emergency and fun in many ways.  The weather, the NPR news, an alarm, so much fun!  And so convenient, no cords. Plugs right in to the wall socket.  Remarkable safety for any potential fall, or other need to phone for help. Seniors love them.  Family members feel more secure their loved ones have one. No monthly fee.
title: A Necessity for Elders

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Matthew
content: This little guy is awesome. I have them in bathrooms, the kitchen, and the babies room. Motion detection tied to hue lights in all those room turn on and off lights perfectly. I also I have a motion detection statement written to tell the echo show in our bedroom if it detects motion in the babies room by simply saying “the babies are moving”. Gives us a heads up to check the camera we have in there.
title: Teamed up with Hue Lights it’s a must have for motion lighting!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: decora
content: This small basic plugin Alexa is perfect for small spaces, or in rooms you want the ease of a smart device without effecting the Aesthetics of the space or without having a device out in plain sight. Easy to use and set up
title: Aesthetically pleasant

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jill H.
content: The compact shape and plug-in option make this conceptually an awesome product. I didn't buy it to play music so I figured the sound quality would be acceptable, but sadly, Alexa's voice is annoyingly grating on the Flex.
title: Almost good

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: S Dot
content: We have echos all over the house but sometimes when I use the intercom my son can't hear because he's in his bathroom. This little guy solved that problem. Thanks to the routines I'm now able to say a quick command to Alexa and the flex will either get my son off the toilet or get him out of the shower. Volume isn't adjustable but my son can hear me through it when the shower is running.
title: Perfect for my needs

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Alexaida A.
content: the echo flex is just like the echo dot. its capable of doing the exact same thing except it's tiny and u can plug a USB cord into it. I realized it's not exactly to my liking but the product works just like it's supposed to. so 5/5. the sound quality sounds muffled. it's definitely not as loud as the echo dot itself but more of a 3/10 sound setting on it. it's not loud whatsoever. the echo flex is perfect for bedrooms. I didn't feel like I needed a whole echo dot in my room.
title: smaller than expected BUT gets job done

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Vic C.
content: I use is this in the bathroom for when I have guests over. I usually play elevator or holiday music. The sound is just enough as to have a little background noise when your washing your hand, make up, brushng your teeth etc.
title: Great for the bathroom.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mike Connors
content: Set-up was a piece of cake. Just launch the Alexa app, plug it in, and Alexa takes over. It does take a few minutes for the AP to recognize the unit and prompt you to start the set-up, depending on the WiFi strength in the area you plug it in to. I bought 3 for several rooms in the house, and I only had to set up voice recognition on only one of them. The music is a little tinny. But, in all fairness, Amazon does tell you that music quality is not the best without an additional speaker plugged into the 35mm Jack, and I didn't buy them strictly to expand listening to music throughout the house. The size of the unit is non-obtrusive and it has a convenient USB port underneath for charging a phone, adding a speaker or one of the optional accessories available for the Flex. Privacy is not an issue as it provides you with a conveniently-located Mic button to prevent accidental drop-ins.
title: All in all, a very powerful addition to your Smart Home.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LoveaDeal
content: This flex is perfect for what it is supposed to do. The price was fantastic too. Would I use it to listen to music? No. The speakers aren't good enough for that, but they tell you that in the description. It works perfectly for turning on lights in my entryway where I don't have a place to set a dot however, which is exactly why I purchased it. It has a pretty small footprint and it hears my voice and responds immediately.
title: Perfect for what it is supposed to do

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Glenn Connery
content: I've seen complaints about the speaker quality.  Not sure what people expect.  Its a tiny speaker.  Works fine though.  I have ours plugged into an outlet by the sink in the bathroom, just to answer questions that come up--what's the weather today?  Not to play music or do much else.  Cheap, seems to work fine.  Easy to set up.  Doesn't take a lot of space.  Fine product for what it is.
title: Economy voice assistant works just fine.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dr. Keebler
content: The echo flex does a pretty decent job with voice recognition and compliance. It comes wrapped in a compact white plug in module, that is easily hidden in plain sight. Pros Easy to train Add new skill and all devices learn. Easy learning curve Good range for "listening" Cons Terrible speaker Useless with out high speed internet. >3mbs.
title: Good beginning smart device, lousy speaker

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: HiRisk
content: Audio for this little Echo device is good and perfect for use in a hallway or bathroom. It serves its purpose as a small Echo speaker for those little areas. However, the device I received from Amazon constantly drops connection even when it's 10 feet away from an access point. Most of the time when I ask to do things (eg. turn on yard or bedroom lights) the device says it doesn't have an internet connection and that I would have to check the Alexa app for further troubleshooting. Once I find the original packaging for this product, it's going straight back to Amazon.
title: Weak Wi-Fi Connection

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: agirlbeingfrugal
content: I loved the idea of having an Echo device in my bathroom. I love music and wanted to enjoy my Music Unlimited subscription while showering. The problem is it's simply not loud enough to be heard over the running water. I mean, you can hear it, but can't make out the words. Wish it was just a bit louder. At least the price was decent. I'm sure I'll find somewhere else to use it. Just a shame that I pre-ordered this and was so excited and it doesn't do what I need it to.
title: A Good Idea But...

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: K. English
content: I have an Echo and a variety of Dots around the house but when I saw this little Flex, I had to have it. I put it in a room that doesn't have a Dot and it works perfectly. OK, the sound isn't nearly as good as the Echo but to turn the lights on and off or to set an alarm, its perfect. And with the discount coupon, it was so reasonably priced--I probably should have bought another one!
title: Another great Alexa product!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Harvonium
content: The more Echoes, the better. That's what we have found as we incorporate more and more home automation. You need Alexa wherever you are. This is our first Flex. My wife's studio bath was a little too far away from the studio's high end Echo.  The Flex is that perfect mix of function and economy. It does absolutely everything that it's big sisters can do, and the sound is not bad in the smaller space.
title: Flex fills the bill of full functionality and excellent pricing.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dave B
content: Sound is horrible.  Original position was 6' from an Echo hub and it kept going offline.  2nd location was about 10' from the wireless router, and still kept going offline.  Item appears to be too small to maintain a connection.  Added the nightlight.  Was a good idea, but it would never shut off, even when placed near a window. Item should've been tested more before it was released.
title: Released too early, needs more work.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Penny
content: I have a few of these, that way I don't have to go around the house yelling for stuff to turn on/off. I love them. I also have the dots and a show. The flex just plug into an outlet, it's out of the way. This Is Not for music playback. (The sound is worst than speaker on a phone from 2005). My flex in the kitchen I have paired with a bluetooth speaker, I do enjoy listening to music or news on Sirius XM while washing dishes and/or cleaning.
title: Great for all rooms in your house

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Garrett
content: I replaced an Echo Dot in my Kitchen with this Echo Flex. It was in a location where the outlet is about chest level - and having the Echo Dot unit with it's exposed power cable made it look a little unsightly. Having Just the Flex there is much more minimalistic. I will say that the sound quality is not the best - but I have a speaker I keep in a drawer to plugin when I want to listen to music. A great little device.
title: Awesome Kitchen Alexa

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Trialanderror
content: I love this! Great for spots where you need an Echo but you can’t spare table top or counter space. The quality of the sound is less full and rich than the other echoes, sounds a teeny bit tinny, but if all you’re using it for is info (e.g. timer, alarm, reminders) it really doesn’t matter. If you want to use it to stream music sync with a small speaker.  A snap to set up too. Just plug in and it’s ready to go. All in all, a great little addition to the Echo lineup!
title: Space saving clutter free Echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Canute B.
content: Love it.. I wanted alexa in the bathroom without the wires and I did so with this product.  Plug it in and go.  It IS NOT waterproof but majority of all plugs in bathrooms are protected.  I can still play music which is very low since its not designed for that but like elevator  music  if you want to listen to a low volume tune while you drop a deuce then you can. You can also control all your items that are alexa capable.  it keeps a clean look and you can make calls as well as play games like jeopardy while you are on the john..
title: Music should NOT be played on it but used to do everything else Alexa can do.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dahtah
content: When you make your home a Smart House, you realize that there are dead spaces where your Alexa devices can’t hear/understand your commands.  The Flex is perfect to cheaply fill those dead zones.  It takes voice inputs as well as the larger devices.  It wasn’t quite as smooth to set up as the others, but I worked it out.  It pairs easily with Bluetooth speakers if you want to listen to music.  Really small footprint.
title: Fills a niche in the Alexa system

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael F
content: Doesn’t always pick up my voice when I am near it.  They larger echo show often responds from the other room which is 20 feet away. Hard to understand the responses when it does pickup my voice. Don’t even think of playing music through it. A mediocre solution if you need a cheap echo in a quiet location to do some voice control home automation or light voice questions.
title: Tiny speaker with low quality sound. Doesn’t hear me often when right next to it.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kelly B.
content: I got this for the kitchen, along with a clock display to plug into it.  The clock was backordered, so haven't tried that out. The sound quality on this was just OK and I had trouble getting it to play music along with our echo dot in the living room - it skipped or just stopped playing half the time. Voice recognition is also not nearly as good as the Echo Dot - if there's any background noise, it doesn't pick up nearly as well. I cancelled the clock order and bought a mount for an Echo Dot and I'll just hang that under one of the cabinets in the kitchen. Might use this in the bathroom or something, but wouldn't buy another one.
title: OK, but not great.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: AlabamaDad
content: You will enjoy the Echo Flex with the correct expectations. It is not for high fidelity music listening. I placed it in the bathroom to check the time and weather while getting ready for work. Kids use it for a toothbrush timer and to listen to jokes. Sound quality is more than adequate for these uses. I like that it plugs directly into the wall with no cords. Might try the night light or clock add on later.
title: Works well for intended purpose

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Katie Schuchert
content: I have a cat who chews/eats (read: ruins) all electrical cords.  She already ate through two of my echo cords, which was $12/piece to replace.. The placement of my electrical outlet plugs in my bedroom weren’t compatible For hiding cords, so I thought this was PERFECT! It was easy to set up and gets the job done. Sometimes I notice that I have to speak a little louder for the device to hear me, and when I play music, the quality isn’t as great as my echo dot (which was expected), but overall I am very pleased and thankful for a cordless solution!!
title: Great for eliminating cords!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Almost Satisfied
content: We got this to use in our sunroom. It is pretty slow to respond to voice commands and the sound quality through the built in speaker is terrible, but that was expected. If we are going to be listening to music, we connect to our Bluetooth speaker and all is well. All in all, not a bad device, but for frequent use or not using an external speaker, you may want to consider a different device.
title: Its ok

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: otis finklestein
content: I misunderstood it’s abilities. I thought this was a smart outlet with Alexa capabilities. I sadly realized that was not possible when I tried to plug something into it. It only has a USB outlet, not a power outlet. This does allow me to control all of my Alexa enabled devices, but it does not have an outlet that allows me to utilize the Echo Flex as a smart outlet. The sound quality is pretty bad, as well.
title: I misunderstood!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Christopher J Bahls
content: Okay, knowing that the speaker quality wouldn’t be the best this seemed like a good solution for smart speaker in the bathroom. You know, listen to the news or check the traffic while getting ready. Triggering the “Good night” routine while brushing my teeth. However the MICROPHONE on this thing is so aggressive that it answers before any other Echo device in the house. Notification comes in? From the office I ask the Echo Dot that’s 5feet away and I can just barely hear it announced from the bathroom that’s through the living room, down the hall, around the corner- easily 45feet away. Ask the Dot “What did you hear?” and it replies “I heard my name on another device and answered there” Hey the accessories could be great, but pick ONE because they don’t work together. Seems kinda obvious that I’d want the motion sensor and the night light at the same time. Nope.
title: Aggressively disappointed

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: LadyRiv
content: Bought this for my bathroom so my kitten wouldn't have any cords to chew on when I leave him in there during the day. It works great and I got the amazing night light attachment by thirdreality. The sounds quality is lacking but that was expected when I bought it as it says on the detail page it's not optimized for music playback I still use it for that when I'm getting ready for work in the morning.
title: Awesome! Exactly what I needed!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Penny
content: I added one of these with the night light in the kitchen and will probably add another with the nightlight for a bathroom soon. It's nice to free up counter top space and not have wires running around. Music with this is pointless- it sounds as bad as a phone. Speech is perfectly fine. I listen to news on tune in while I'm cooking and can hear well. Microphone works well. This device is able to understand my kids mumbling from several feet away.
title: Works well in the kitchen

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: John the Retired Man
content: I realized from the description that this is not a music speaker. With that understanding, all I wanted was a way to communicate with Alexa while in my workshop. For that purpose, this works great! The sound quality is enough for me to easily understand her voice. If I want to listen to music, I BT link with one of my speakers and the quality is perfect. This does exactly what I was hoping it would do.
title: Does exactly what I needed and hoped for.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sheryl L. Jensen
content: This flex plug is fantastic! I have several plugs that allow me to turn on lights and my coffee maker so having this Echo plug upstairs is great. Before I head downstairs I can turn on the lights, start my coffee maker, and ask about the weather and traffic all before I head out the door. I love it! Very happy I made the purchase. It enables me to get things done before I ever go downstairs. Great idea!!
title: Highly convenient!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Chadz
content: Well the Flex does what it is advertised for. Small, easy to plug , unplug and move around. Has full Eco voice capabilities and integration. The limitation is only with its mini speaker. So for me it’s ideal for patio at night. Listen to some news, check the weather, turn on/off patio light. Communicate with other rooms, play some chill-out music. Over all it serves a purpose.
title: Mini and compact that does the job

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Dustin Taylor
content: Night light attachment available, speaker with wireless alexa smart app installation. Instructions and box pretty much gives you the human capability. Bluetooth also allows you to channel they alexa hub and communication without having to get up. Accessible by phone. The color your seeing is a echo night light for the flex, the flex itself is just a square device.
title: Amazing for small rooms

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kollan K.
content: We plugged these in almost immediately when they came in the mail. We live in an apartment  with other echo devices so we had to see where placing them made sense. After some trial and error, we are very happy with them. The sound quality is not as great as the other echo devices but we use them mainly to control the lights in the house. We have used them to play music all over the house and so we are highly happy with them.
title: Another amazing product from Amazon!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Eric D Vincent
content: I absolutely love this. Granted it doesnt have the sound quality as other echo devices which I knew when I purchased. Loved it so much, I bought mom one. She loves it too. We both strongly agree that the "Flex"  can hear us better, (less having to repeat ourselves, which can be extremely irritating at times with my Echo Dot.) but also seems to understand better. I'm planning on at least one more. Actually I've started saving for another one. Im on disability so any purchases big or small get budgeted and saved for. Mom on the other hand, used hers to "Drop In" on me earlier to tell me that she added two more to her cart.
title: Love; love, love  Nothing but love for "Flex".

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: rhinman
content: Everything we pretty much needed. It's for a bedroom - basically to chat with other rooms and act as an alarm. The audio quality is "fine". We don't need much more. Don't buy this if you want a richer music experience. But for what it does, it's great. We've had a few glitches with it recognizing other devices, but it seemed to be fleeting. The USB plug is a bonus also.
title: Works great

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Eric J. Simila
content: I dislike the fact that as a person with a hearing disability, my echo is louder. I do not use this outdoors, or in a garage, but still even in my home it's sort of disappointing. It's fine if I'm in the room that it's in, except in the bathroom. I got it as a gift to extend my vocal range around the house. There are just some rooms in which my echo can't hear me. It can hear me long distance. Better than my echo can, but I need to have it near me in order to hear it.
title: Excellent Echo integration, Lower volume then echo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ian & Alicia
content: Great little device that brings Alexa to places that I had been using 3D printed holders for normal echos. Add the fact that this has a usb socket and it becomes a nice little phone charger that has a side benefit of being an echo. The speaker on it is terrible, but I didn’t buy it for that function. Overall I have two and plans for 3 more, they make great hallway devices to make sure alexa has whole home coverage.
title: Pretty good, as a fill between other echos.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: AO
content: I thought I could go the cheap route and use this device as an additional speaker in my home. Nope. The sound quality is poor, at best - like a transistor radio, as many have commented. Voice recognition is fine, so if you want to use this device just for drop-in, or asking Alexa questions, you'll be fine. If you want to use it as a speaker, not so much. Sending it back to grab another Dot 3. You get what you pay for has always been my motto. Thought I could squeak one by this time. Nope.
title: (Stereo) sound quality is POOR

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: nejpski
content: If you like the Amazon Echos but really need to have one with no chords and wall mountable, this is probably the model you need.  BUT you do give up sound quality for the convenience.  In my case, I elected to put on in the bathroom with plug in under the towel bar.  It works perfectly in that location.  No cords, just plug and play.  Sometiemes their just isnt room for a full sized echo and the plug in and power cord...and where to set It?  This one solves that problem  I would purchase again for the same application.
title: Echo to a tiny level automatic wall mount

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Consumer
content: I really like the echo flex.  I put it on my garage ceiling so that I can either turn on a group of lights inside my home when I come in through the garage or I can turn lights on an off inside the garage by voice.  It works great, and although the speaker is not designed to play music it is clear and easily understood.  In fact, I just purchased a second flex for my shop.
title: I love my new echo flex.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: William F Taylor
content: I have numerous Amazon devices around my home, and I put a Flex in a bathroom and in the garage. The bathroom Flex does not play well with other devices in the system. It will continuously tell me to check my user manual, for reasons I cannot imagine, since the devices that overlap with it work fine. The one in the garage, which shares space with a 3rd Generation Dot, works flawlessly.
title: Has Problems.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: user15684
content: It has an AUX port and you can use any compatible bluetooth speaker with it, which eliminates the subpar audio quality! I gave 4 stars for voice recognition because sometimes the other rooms will hear me when I'm right in front of a speaker, but I just set it up. Also it is tiny and has pretty much the full functionality of a regular Echo. It just doesn't sound as good.
title: You can hook it up to speakers via bluetooth OR AUX cord!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: J. Patel
content: Imagine you have a corner and a small desk and space where you do most important things of your life. You like the corner because you can concentrate the most. You will need Echo Flex. Great little helper. You can get more done with your digital assistant. You want more punchy noise, more strength and distance from where you hear or talk with Alexa, then you need to go level up. Amazon has created more specific products according to your needs. Echo Flex. Great for 10'x10' work space. All stars for Echo Flex.
title: Highly Useful Unit

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: SunRah
content: I love my Echo Flex with motion sensor. It automates my entryway lighting and helps Alexa hear my commands better; from turning the lights on when I arrive to engaging guard mode upon my departure I love the convenience this little device brings. I'd highly recommend picking one up for those quiet corners or, better yet, for an entrance like me. I will say that the speaker is only ok and that it is more to hear an Alexa response than to listen to music on.
title: Great little device for hallways

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Scottchandler
content: Love these. Have been waiting for some type of echo device that was a wall unit. Best voice pick up of all of my devices. I have several echo dots, and echo shows. Sound quality is bad for music, but I knew that would be the case with the small speaker. So still 5 stars overall. Works seamlessly with an external Bluetooth speaker/ soundbar/ sound system. Problem solved.
title: Yes!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Chidhambaram
content: I have an Alexa Echo before, and I recently purchased two Alex Echo Flex devices. My wife and I both are loving it! Pros: It has reduced my efforts. It helps me set the alarm, weather report, latest news, add action items to my to-do list, and play my favorite song, Switch-off/on the connected devices; it can work as an intercom. Cons: I am a native Tamil Language Speaker. Tamil is one of the oldest languages of this world, still spoken globally, and there are 75 million people in various countries speaking this language. So, I am curious when Alexa would start speaking in Tamil. I do see Alexa has issues with recognizing the audiobook titles (audible) in the Tamil language. Alexa has acquired a lot of new skills now since when it was released. I can easily perform simple actions now, and I feel that it might take some years for Alexa to answer more intelligently.
title: Alex has more skills now, but I am curious about when it will start speaking in Tamil?

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Annia A.
content: Me gustó pq puedo conectar varios equipos a la vez y ya no tengo que levantarme para encender o apagar la luz. Además de que se que no corro riesgos de que haya algún tipo de problema en la corriente pq Alexa hace todo el trabajo. Gracias
title: Sin esfuerzo, pq Alexa lo hace todo

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jay G
content: Perfectly fine but likely has a rather limited use cases.  Would likely be more attractive if the plugin module allowed both a nightlight and motion detector.  It continues an annoying trend where you can’t rely on the closest device to respond which is aggravating when setting timers or reminders.  Amazon really needs better sensitivity control than simply on or off.
title: Fine if you have a specific need

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: AC
content: I purchased this small echo device to work in either my walk-in closet, to help automate the lights. But my mai. Concern was the size. Would it fit the socket, which was located a few inches from the lightbulb itself? It did. This device was small Enough to squeeze above the smart bulb! It quickly, and effortlessly, connected to my existing Alexa system and works like a charm. Voice recognition is excellent. The sound is lacking, but For a tiny device hanging in a closet ceiling, It’s perfect.
title: Great for small spaces that may require automation!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jessica Churchill
content: You really can’t beat the price and flexibility of these. Perfect for small spaces like apartments. I’ve got one in my galley kitchen and one in my bathroom where I don’t have much counter space. For a small space the sound quality is great and if I link them all up, it’s even louder. I plan on getting a couple more to supplement where my main Echo Dot doesn’t reach.
title: Perfect for Apartments with Lack of counter space

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Connie Erickson
content: I set up Flex with the motion detector in our kitchen. It turns on a light in the foyer, announces, “ visitor” in the bedroom and  kitchen plus sends me a notification on my phone. I thought I could use this to check on and/or deter anyone in our house while we are gone at night. I‘m not really expecting anyone but it was fun discovering some of the things it can do.
title: Flex Can Help Protect Our House with Multiple Actions when it Detects Motion

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Utah M.
content: Works exactly as advertised by Amazon. Absolutely no complaints. I gave the speaker only a 2-star rating but that's exactly what Amazon advertises. It's a tiny speaker and it does the job. Good for everything but music. I give this a 5-star rating. It's tiny, compact, with full Alexa functionality. Works perfectly. I've got mine in the bathroom to listen to the news, weather, messaging, etc.
title: Does the job!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jc
content: don't buy the "4.5" star reviews... really kinda crappy. You have to nearly scream at the device, for it to work. The built in speaker reminds me of a smaller version of a crappy walmart tv. Even to use it, you have to pair a bluetooth speaker... and even with that tjere is a delay so you don't hear the first half second of any response. Truely the worst alexa yet.
title: Not very good at anything.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Rudy Wilkinson Jr.
content: We have a large bedroom where the light switches near the entry door do not control the lamps on the other side of the room.  I used this Echo Flex with Motion Control to briefly turn on the light in the room during early night hours when motion is triggered.  We no longer have to stumble 10 feet into the room before we can turn on a light.  Works like a charm.  Love the flexibility offered within the Alexa App to control exactly how it works.
title: Bought for Motion Sensor

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mary McKercher
content: I wanted a small Alexa for my bathroom.an dot would take up counter space and I didn't want that. This connects to the plug. Pretty seamless install. Sound quality isn't great but look at the size if it., The speakers can't be all that big.  But if someone is stuck with no paper or without a towel you can announce to every Alexa speaker in the house for someone to bring you it.
title: Great for kitchen or bathroom

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Daniel Paiva
content: This thing is deaf. I have a hard time making the device to activate alexa to hear me. And even when i do, sometimes it would just stop listening. This is installed in my bathroom close to the mirror (wall corner). Even the echo dot 2nd gen is a little bit deaf compared to the 1st gen. It’s frustrating. I am just using the press to talk button on the echo flex now.
title: The device is deaf most of the time. Won’t hear me.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Bigbriggs
content: Love them.... I didnt need the bigger brothers in my upstairs hallway and downstairs hallway so I decided on these they great I added the night light to both and it works great!  Dont usually have any issues with controling household items easy to set up and tons of skills to teach alexa. Give it a shot cant hurt. I have them set to use other bluetooth speakers in the house for music etc. Lots and lots of options and customizations
title: Great product! Easy setup! Just works!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Nancy P
content: So now we have an echo in the garage.  Works just like our Echo Dot.  Gives us an intercom out there as well. We've got a convoluted wi-fi system, so if you have more than one access point in your house and you're putting it in the garage, make sure to set it up in the garage.  I had to do a reset, but that wouldn't have been necessary if I had started out there to begin with. I'm thinking one of these would be great and unobtrusive in the kitchen as well.
title: Perfect addition to the garage.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: DPerry
content: This is the echo custom built for the bathroom but it suffers from more faults than useful features. We’ve had our echo flex for about two weeks and would not recommend this device to friends or family. It’s a bit ironic that a device with the word echo in the name is severely limited in reliability due to the bouncy, echo-y sound environment of a typical bathroom. We have to shout or constantly repeat commands for the flex to hear and obey. Without a doubt the speaker is so weak that it can only be classified as barely functional. On the positive side of things, the nightlight attachment is fantastic. Also, setup of the flex is the fastest and easiest process of any of the multiple echo products we have owned. Final word: Spend five more bucks for an echo gen 3 and you won’t regret it.
title: Weak product but great idea

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Professor Ty Sanders, Esq.
content: So I'm not sure why someone would buy this. It is convenient to plug right into a socket, also seems like there will be more add-on type hardware in the future. However the speaker is horrible. Which leads me to ask why wouldn't you buy either an Echo Input ($10-$20) which does the same thing without the crumby speaker or spend $10 more and buy a dot with a great speaker.
title: Bad speaker, other Echos are a better choice

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ame
content: We bought this because we have some echo dots in the house and use the corresponding smart plugs. We have a room where we have two lamps and wanted to use the plugs without getting another dot. This works okay, the voice recognition is not as good as a dot and we often have to say our command to turn on a light 2 or 3 times. The volume for music is not recommended unless you want very quiet background music for reading. The set up was very easy.
title: Prefer the dot

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: reviewer33
content: Sound quality is terrible.  The microphone works fine but the speaker isn’t good for anything more than basic Alex’s responses.  It is only good for giving commands to rather than getting any sort of feedback or audio.
title: It hears much better than it sounds

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: VnzJunk
content: The sound was surprisingly loud at Max volume and much clearer than expected. It picks up voice commands much better than an earlier Dot that I have a couple of. Also the bluetooth works excellently. I attached a bluetooth speaker to it wirelessly and carried it around the house with no dropouts. My early dots do not have this range. The house is 50 feet long BTW.
title: Nice little unit you can move around without dragging a power supply along

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Brent D
content: I have it in my garage so that I can use it as an intercom to the family room.  I set up a small amplifier and drive separate speakers, for music in my garage. It works great.  Everything I have is hard wired, so I don't know how the bluetooth works.
title: Perfect to use as an intercom

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Another Cindy too
content: I am not all that technical.  I plugged it in. Turned on my lap top and looked for Alexa products to turn on or connect -- thinking it would ADD to my list. Have NO IDEA if it was compatible with my existing Alexa or what the issue was -- and did not want to deal with it. I think Amazon should sell SETS OF PRODUCTS that all work together in a KIT -- rather than piece meal.
title: I have an echo dot but don't know which version -- unable to set this up

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Henry D. Miller
content: I don't have the motion detector device I don't think I need that I didn't buy it for the sound but for controlling my devices this thing is wonderful it's only one problem I got with it I wish some of the developers I could find a way to add the name flex for a wake word but like I said this thing is perfect getting ready to get another one to go in my bathroom
title: One of the best product out

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: jean
content: I placed this next to my Alexa so it can activate the door on my echo show but doesn't always activate good thing you can add a 3.5mm jack speaker so you can place the speaker right next to the show. Really should integrate in Alexa routines to activate the door for viewing I know bandwidth concerns but at least take a 5 second video to display who is at the door come on.
title: Sound is not loud enough to always activate my Alexa that is 4ft away

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Tisha Patterson
content: A friend bought this for me for my birthday to keep on my patio.  I already have the full sized Echo and love it so I thought this would be a great little addition for my patio.  It was easy to set up as are all of the Echo products, however, the sound quality is missing as compared to the regular Echo and the Echo Dot.  I ended up giving this product to my boys to put in their bedroom to use as their own.  If you are looking for something for the kitchen/bathroom, this might be a good fit, but if you are wanting it for a great musical experience, go with the full size or the Dot!  :)
title: Quiet Little Device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Shawn K-SKI
content: First off all f your looking for sound quality look elsewhere cause this little guy is isn’t the best. With that being said I knew it wasn’t the best and I’m using the Bluetooth feature and have it connected to a much better speaker. I have this plugged into the ceiling of my garage and it picks up my voice perfectly and when I drop in or announce anything it’s really clear compared to my show8s that I have
title: Nice little addition

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Tracy L McCord
content: well mine if you have the sound too high it has static but also keep in mind i have 3 alexa devices might be in close proximity  other.. over all it works well mostly just plugged it in and it synced itself to the rest of the amazon products i have, I got it and I recommend if you have children especially I connected the amazon kids and they can listen to audio books play games call Nana and papa all without having a smart phone.  Great little gadget for them
title: sound

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jbog1883
content: This is a decent product.  The sound quality is a little to be desired.  As to using it as regular as it questions, play games or other skills it is great.  Plug it in sync it to the app and there you go.  But if you are looking for it as speaker for music then i would make sure you are connecting it to a speaker as the music has that phone quality tinny sound.
title: Meh

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ashlee
content: I purchased this product for the singular purpose of putting it in my kids room because you can attach a night light to it. She goes to sleep to Mooshie Twilight & Ambient Rain sounds (We live in an apartment and need to cancel the noises) Overall set up was fairly easy. It responds well to her voice (6yr old) and myself. The only complaint is that the sound is "harsher" than on the echo dots we have around the house. Would drive me crazy but, my daughter seems undisturbed.
title: Harsh Speaker

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Norma J. Rahn
content: This device connected with my older Echo Show with absolutely no effort on my part.  The sound quality is incredible for such a tiny thing..I have a craft room that now has my echo and Alexa content available hete.
title: Mighty for Tiny!!!!!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Su3
content: Try something else. Totally not worth the price. I thought I could jamm to my music while in the bathroom either doing makeup or hair. Or while showering. The sound quality is horrible, tinny, and not very loud at all - can’t hear it with shower running. Just bought the echo dot to use in the bathroom instead. Going to get a wireless battery base for it.
title: Don’t waste your money unless it’s under 10

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: B. Mazer
content: Love it. Sound quality from just itself 👎🏼 for music. 👍🏼 for questions. However connect it to Bluetooth speakers and it’s awesome. Like a dot but less expensive. Honestly. My dots are connected to my speakers so they do exactly what this does. Thomases Rachel Mazer hey are no better than this. Amazon is going to lose money on dots with this little guy/gal
title: Awesome supplemental device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: OldTxAggie
content: I like the Echo Flex for having another Echo device in another room for convenience. It is nice and small; as well as, very easy to setup.  Complete functionality as the full Echo or the Echo Dot and is completely integrated with other Echo devices in the home. The speaker and sound quality are average compared to the full Echo or the Echo Dot.  It does have a jack in the side for an external speaker to provide better quality sound.  It also has a USB port on the side which is nice for charging devices.
title: Nice compact Echo device to add Alexa to any room.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jessica
content: The price is great and I love that it can be used where a dot is less than ideal. I have it in my bathroom and am enjoying it there, HOWEVER the speaker quality is awful. I would almost compare it to that of a child’s toy- where it seems a piece of plastic is covering the voice and has an awkward echo. I also dislike that there are no volume buttons. Constantly having to ask Alexa to turn it up or down is a little annoying.
title: Just...ok.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: favour
content: This amazing!. I do wish it had more features but it is not bad. I got it for my husband for valentines because his echo dot he didn’t like the hassle of plugging with the cord and not whenever he wanted it near him. So this was an option and now it wakes us up in the morning. Not the best sound for music but if you don’t care about stereo sound then this is for you. For what it’s work great to have gotten it. Would definitely recommend.
title: Great buy!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Joel E.
content: I couldn't have asked for an easier experience. From setup to execution it was up and running in under a minute. I plugged in the Flex and it auto recognized my account and then got itself online. Seconds later I was asking it for the weather and interacting with my skills. Its small footprint allows it to effortlessly hook to an outlet and just hang there, like a power adapter, allowing you to literally put Alexa anywhere there's a power outlet.
title: Put Alexa anywhere with the Echo Flex

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Barbara
content: The other reviews are correct...the sound is not a good quality at all.  but we knew that...we just needed it to balance the sound in the kitchen where running water and lots of noise keeps us from hearing the Show on the other side of the room.  We don't even know the sound is bad until we hear it speak without any other devices.  It's great for talk radio.
title: great for balance

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Adrian Merrington
content: I have an original Echo and a Dot against which I’ll compare this unit. The Flex is by far the weakest addition. The microphone is relatively unresponsive and the speaker is very weak compared to the other units I have. My Echo in the next room picks up commands that the Flex does not hear. I would not recommend buying this. Amazon sells better alternatives.
title: A dot is much better.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: lawrence
content: It’s a fantastic add on to your smart home. We have one in our kitchen. Works great for timers. And we connected it to our Bose Wave radio through the 3.5mm aux Jack. Great sound. We listen to amazon unlimited through it every evening. And can still set timers while listening. Also put one in my garage. Wife can “drop in” to tell me when dinner is ready and such. Makes it simple and easy to communicate throughout the house without yelling. Definitely worth the money.
title: Great add on for the price. Gives convince as well.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jay Dee
content: Nice little thing, saved me from having to buy the larger Alexa Echo. All I needed was a small thing like this to turn on the light for me, in a room that only has a ceiling fan, no light! So I had to put a standing desk lamp in the room, on the far side, and it's just easier to say "Alexa, turn on the light" instead of fumbling around in the dark.
title: Nice little gadget

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ray Lovern
content: I purchased the Flex to extend the range of my Echo Dot devices coverage. I only needed this device to command Alexa to turn on/of lights in my living room. For what I'm using it for it works very well. It's not designed to be as loud as Echo devices with larger speakers or play music. However, for basic commands and control of connected smart devices it's great.
title: Basic device that works effectively.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Jon Guidry
content: Saw this for sale and figured I would give it a try - we only have an Echo Show in our kitchen on our main level, and by the time we get to the stairs to go to the second floor, we have to yell “Alexa, turn downstairs off.”  So, I figured that we could put this by the stairs.  So far, it’s working great. I haven’t bought any of the accessories that go on the bottom, because we already have night lights, etc.
title: Good Alexa stopgap so I don’t have to yell to the Kitchen Echo!

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: nUSA
content: In my apartment living room at volume 10 it can be heard across the room. I did not get it to be part of a sound system, but rather an assistant. It does in fact play music on par of a standard car radio. After reading the bad reviews on the sound I was quite pleasantly surprised and the voice on it is more understandable than on the Echo Dot I bought. Who knew?
title: Just Great

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ashley M.
content: It is definitely a convenient way to add Alexa to small spaces. I wouldnt recommend for a large room or a room that you would use Alexa frequently. It has a tendency of being a bit quiet when Alexa is speaking. Music plays a decent volume. I have it in my kitchen for now. I have a Dot that I use in my bedroom because I spend most of my time in there and it is much louder than the Flex. But it is worth the price you pay!!
title: Great Little Speaker

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: rich
content: I got the flex on sale and it was a deal to good to pass up! I like it, works just like my dot but find my self wishing it had better sound to play music, but that’s just not what this was made for. It’s nice for what it is and has some add ons you can buy for it that could be useful. If you found this review helpful please hit the like button! Thanks.
title: Just like the dot without the great speaker.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Mitch S
content: I was sick of settling down for the night with a snack and then realizing that I had forgotten to turn off my kitchen lights. To solve the problem I installed a smart switch so I could tell Alexa to shut them off. But now I have this speaker along with the motion sensor attachment and it does all the work for me. I love that I’m able to set the sensor so it’s only active between 6PM-7AM and I’m not wasting energy the rest of the day when I walk into my kitchen. Unfortunately my cats set off the sensor, but that’s to be expected. The only thing that I’d like to see change is the time increments for the motion sensor. I’d like it to shut the lights off after 10 seconds of inactivity, but the lowest increment available is 1 minute. Overall it’s a great device, but I wouldn’t plan on streaming audio with it. Your phone will sound better.
title: Great Device

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: C. Works
content: I got this because I wanted Alexa in my kitchen and I didn't want a dot or echo cluttering up the counter top.  So I got the flex and I like it.  Its out of the way, does all the alexa sruff, etc.  The one thing I knocked it down on is the sound quality.  Even at 100% volume its sometimes hard to hear.  I know its small and all that, but its still disappointing.
title: I put it in the kitchen but it needs to be a little louder

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: S. Gardner
content: Alexa makes life a little easier when your life is a bit complexes. Alexa is there for you by giving you quick, clear, n to the point answers. She's a smart little device who's there to help you out when you haven't got the time to go search for answers in general. I'm teaching her to know more about me as I work with her app~ She's fun to have around!~ She makes learning fun!~
title: A Fun, Yet Helpful Little Device!~

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Sir Shu Wourn
content: While my echo spot didn't connect to the bluetooth system in my upstairs bathroom, this one does, so speaker is irrelevant. I actually just keep it muted, and use my echo spot for voice commands which then gets relayed to this.  price point was low enough to be worth it for the additional echo device.  The real disappointment is that the echo spot can't connect to external bluetooth speakers, what's going on with that one?
title: It connects to my bluetooth speaker

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Deanna
content: I bought this because the sale seemed too good and I wanted to add Alexa to our kitchen to set timers, play music and control lights. Although it does do those things, it often takes 2 or 3 times repeating myself with commands. We have an Echo Dot and that just works so much better in comparison to this. But it does all the basic Alexa commands so I can't complain that much.
title: Not As Great As The Dot

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: KarenFL
content: Just like previous reviews, Amazon didn't put much effort into the speaker.  It sounds like old school Bluetooth speakers from back in the day, but not good to listen to music.  Other than the poor quality speaker, everything else works well (integration and voice response).  Perhaps I should have waited for new generations to come out before purchasing.
title: Works well, but speaker quality is terrible

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Kirsten T. Hechler
content: I like that is small and love the night light, especially that it can change colors. My only dislike is the sound quality. It is terrible. It is not good for playing music. I’m sure I’m expecting too much for this compact flex. Still worth owning though. I use it for alarm and to read me the news.
title: Sound quality lacking

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Roxy1268
content: Great item but purchase a small speaker to pair with it. I got a small shower speaker ( $16) it has a suction cup and can be placed anywhere in the bathroom( mines on my mirror) it makes the volume so much louder and better.. you won’t be able to hear the music in the shower without a small speaker attached to it. I love it and it’s so perfect for the bathroom
title: Great little device but....

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: David Esq.
content: I use this in my boy’s bathroom. He likes to play a song while he brushes his teeth or takes a bath. The nightlight is great because he doesn’t have to turn on the lights to use the bathroom in the middle of the night. The sound quality is fine. It isn’t quite as pure sounding as the Dot, but it gets the job done for the time we need it.
title: Nice Alexa extension for a small room.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Michael B
content: It's purpose is a cheap Alexa satellite and it does OK at best. I have one set up to control an Amazon Smart Outlet, and I have to shouts and constantly repeat myself to get the flex to recognize my commands properly. If I get down on the floor next to it I can use it normally. It seems like the flex are missing the far-field microphone technology.
title: Not very responsive, but does work.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: an
content: I haven’t bought a new Alexa voice product recently, so I was really surprised at how easily this was set up. It was almost just plug and play. I wish both this and the Dot could go higher with the volume. I listen to books or music while in the bath- not loud enough to hear in the shower. It was a great deal for a smart little piece of technology.
title: Sooo much easier

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Cu Mor Glas
content: At 15 dollars this was a steal.  At 20 an ok deal.  It is what it claims to be.  An echo that hangs in an outlet directly and has mediocre sound.  It it perfect for my kitchen where I would not be listening to music anyway.  It does just fine at what I need it to do in the kitchen.  Which is set timers, convert measurements, and control the lights.
title: Perfect kitchen Alexa.

product: Echo Flex - Plug-in mini smart speaker with Alexa
author: Ken
